title: Fabulous hotel
text: We had an amazing stay here over the Christmas.  Our suite was just perfect for our stay. Loved the hotel facilities including the use of the full gym each morning. Great location and so accessible to everything NYC has to offer. Will definitely be back

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC!
text: The best hotel in New York! I travel to NYC at least once a year and I have had the opportunity to stay in several hotels and none like The Mark. Without a doubt the largest rooms I have ever seen. Excellent service and staff, they make you feel at home. Ideal location, top restaurants and gastronomy and a very cozy atmosphere. Many hotels in the city feel old and tired while The Mark is a hotel with fresh and modern design rooms.

title: Gorgeous bar, ok rooms
text: I stayed here with my husband who regularly stays with work . Unfortunately they had given him a small room which he was not happy with and so he was upgraded to a suite which was lovely. The bar is stunning and you feel like you are in sex and the city, plus the location is excellent and there are a lot of high end shops and the park close by.

title: Finally back at The Mark
text:
When we are in NYC, we always stay at our favourite hotel, The Mark.
We just had some unforgettable days with the wonderful team of this lovingly run hotel. From A-Z everything is perfect - the rooms with their beautiful interior, the super friendly staff wherever you go, the very knowledgeable concierge desk with Maria and Suzana, we felt so welcome and at home every second of our stay.
We cannot wait to return.

title: Simply outstanding!
text:
Over the years we have stayed in a number of 5* hotels in NYC. Finally we have found what we were looking for. 

1. Extremely friendly staff from the moment you step out of your car. 

2. Concierge team that went out of their way to arrange private guides, transport, wheelchairs, dinner reservations, airport transport and the like. 

3. Lively bar and a nice restaurant. 

4. Comfortable room and a twin basin bathroom with the best hotel shower I ever had! Luxury towels. Bed was perfect and the bar well stocked with drinks and snacks. 

5. The hotel's hotdog stand outside the entrance is a treat. 

6. Excellent turndown service. 

Lastly, this hotel feels like home and is highly recommended.

title: Amazing hospitality
text:
We had a remarkable experience at The Mark Hotel. The location is incredible with a lot of great spots nearby to eat and fun things to do. The concierge also gave us some amazing restaurant reccomendations. The room was beautiful, modern, spacious and very comfortable.
The staff was extremely kind and always ready to help.  At the end of our stay the doorman made sure we were taken care of untill our cab arrived. Special thanks to Michel Heredia who made our time there really special and unforgettable.

title: Our go-to choice on the upper east side
text: Another superb stay at the Mark. The hotel staff are pro-active, gracious and consistently seeking to anticipate and exceed guest needs. The result is a luxury hotel experience that is accomplished but not stuffy, stylish but not bling.  This time around we needed to make a room switch (our fault). Front office manager Dawa Naktsangdha took care of this with grace and care, turning stress into thanks. Nicely done and congratulations. We will be back again soon.

title: Un gran hotel para hospedarse en NYC
text: Es difícil escribir qué es lo mejor en The Mark porque todo es espectacular: los cuartos son amplios y confortables, la comida deliciosa, la ubicación lo más si te gusta quedarte por el Upper East y cerca de Central Park. Pero lo que más me gusta de este hotel es el trato de todo el staff, no sólo son eficientes y serviciales sino que te hacen sentir como en casa en todo momento.

title: A NY dream
text: Unforgettable experience. Extremely friendly and polite staff. Rooms are a dream. The location is exceptional, just a few steps from Central Park. Lovely. I was there for pleasure and work combined and in every moment i felt like at home. The team was always helpful and beyond kind. Couldn't be more thankful.

title: Wonderful gem on the UES
text: The Mark is the perfect place to stay on the Upper East Side! The entire staff was so friendly, rooms are beautifully designed, beds are comfortable, relaxing atmosphere and close proximity to Central Park is fantastic. Thank you all!

title: So happy to be back
text: After a bit of time away from manhattan we finally got a chance to go back to our favorite upper east side hotel, The Mark. Things have changed but all for the positive.  The service is the only thing that hasn’t as it has always been amazing. They really treat you like a local and feels like everyone is very happy working there. The rooms make you know you are in NYC and are spacious. The restaurants are delicious and has something for everyone. They even have an in room dining menu for dogs!  The piece I always loved about the hotel was the location. Right by Central Park, great shopping and all the museums. I can’t wait to return and next time with our dog!  Thank you everyone for a fantastic night in the city.

title: Amazing as Always
text:
This is my favorite boutique hotel in NYC and we have been staying there for years.  The service is always fantastic.  The employees know your name and everyone seems to recognize you from the moment you arrive until you leave.

The rooms are comfortable and spacious, the beds and the bed linens are some of the best I have ever slept on in a hotel.

The room service is also delicious, from breakfast to dinner, and never disappoints.  The coconut chicken soup is a must have.

My only critique of the hotel is the bar.  It is incredibly small and always impossible to get any room for a drink, standing or sitting.  They need to figure out a better way to accommodate hotel guests who want to have a drink before or after dinner.  Other than that, hotel is perfect.

title: Our favorite in NYC
text: Generally, I have found NYC hotels underwhelming.  Small rooms, lukewarm staff, etc.  The Mark was completely different. Our suite was absolutely amazing. We were upgraded upon arrival since our room was not ready at check-in time. We had a full kitchen, two restrooms and a spectacular bedroom and bathroom. By far the best that we have experienced in the city. The location was also perfect for our purposes (lounge around, dinner, park, shopping). The bed was divine.  The kitchen was well stocked with mini-bar essentials. All in all a great experience. We will return.

title: Less than I expected and service was not outstanding. Quite shocking
text: It was chaotic on arrival. I had asked for Coffee and tea on arrival and was not provided with it. Told there’s a machine in the room. Ordered room service and not very gracious. Asked to make a mix of vegetables and told there would be a  charge for a plate of each. Are u kidding? For the cost of my suite I expect far better service. Supplies in the bathroom was meager. I have stayed at many five star hotels and this was surprising given the hype

title: Fantastic stay at the Mark thanks to Michel !
text:
My stay was top , thanks to Michel Heredia. Escaping a troubled situation in Tel Aviv , Michele made sure to greet me as Family as I arrived. The stay from thus far , was on point , to the room and all the attentive and friendly staff . 
I said it before i go where Michel goes. 

Ely Latner Assaraf

title: Great hotel- skip the restaurant!
text: The hotel is wonderful- we had an issue with our rooms initially and they fixed it and upgraded us to a one spacious suite with two bathrooms.  The amenities, the wonderful bed linens and decor is top-notch.  Our only complaint is the restaurant service.  We had problems with our order, with waiting long periods of time to get served (including coffee!) .  Breakfast is included in our package but the service was so bad the manager comped our breakfast two mornings in a row, which considering it was included was irrelevant compensation.  We did not eat dinner or lunch so perhaps the service is better but at breakfast, simply awful.  If it wasn’t  included we would go to a diner.  Besides that- wonderful hotel and great location.  Will stay again, but skip having breakfast included.

title: Family time at The Mark
text: Our family stayed at The Mark over Labor Day weekend. It was a perfect experience in every way. I can’t say enough about the staff. They were attentive, friendly, and helpful, and we felt well taken care of. We will definitely visit again. Can’t imagine staying anywhere else!

title: So comfortable!!
text: We stayed at the Mark for a week for vacation. The bed and bedding was outstandingly comfortable, the room temp was very comfortable, the bathroom was large. We stayed in their regular King bedroom room. The amenities at the hotel were great! Room service was delicious and prompt. The bar was popular but not crowded. The gym is small but it was nice. The hotel maids were fabulous. Some mornings we left the do not disturb sign on until noon, but then as soon as we left the room and removed the sign they would come clean no matter what time it was. Waters were always provided and the mini bar restocked. The location is great! Beautiful neighborhood near Central Park, shopping and dining. It would be hard for us to choose anywhere else to stay when we come to NYC, mainly because of the great nights sleep/overall comfortable stay we had.

title: Loved it
text:
There are times you pay for a 5 stars hotel and jt is not worth it… but this one is worth every penny of it. 
It is clean, staff is friendly. I was not a big fan of their breakfast … too expensive for what they had…but loved the staff, the room and all the room amenities. 
Too bad they did not have a coffee machine in the room.
The hotel is in the vicinity of Central Park and Madison Ave, they are some cute boutiques and a nice coffee shop close by. It is a safe area to walk.
At night the hotel has a nice bar to get a drink.

title: Fantastic hotel on the Upper East Side.
text: Love The Mark.  This is the second time I have visited in six months. This time with my teenage kids.  The staff are super professional, respectful and kind.  Love the neighbourhood and location of this hotel and the fact that it is in a pretty peaceful spot in a very frenetic city.  So many great museums are sites are close by which makes it super convenient.

title: Perfect!
text:
I went with my family to The Mark hotel in July 2023 and we had a perfect stay.
The staff was really nice with us and made the difference. I would like to thank all and specially Suzana from the Concierge and Patrick who were always very helpful and nice with us and the kids!

title: Best hotel we have ever stayed at
text:
We stayed in a “Junior Suite 77”, room 306.  When we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by several staff members.  No lineup at reception.  The room was awesome.  It overlooked 77 Street.  We had no problem with street noise; there were two blinds as well as drapes on the bedroom window.  Water pressure was excellent.  Everything worked well.  Bathrooms were a good size.  
Excellent location, just half a block from Central Park on Upper East Side.   We had a complimentary hotel pedicab tour of Central Park:  this was most enjoyable, and the driver Bobby was very interesting and pleasant.
The service was phenomenal!  Staff quickly learned our names, and everyone was so friendly and helpful.  Patrick at the front desk was so enthusiastic.  We liked that the concierge desk was open later than most hotels.
Overall, this is the best hotel we have ever stayed at.  Each time we approached the main entrance, we felt like we were coming home.

title: Still fabulous but needs a service tweaking…
text:
This is my fourth stay at the Mark. This time I was upgraded to an absolutely fabulous Garden Suite, which I very much appreciate. The shower was great, room truly beautiful. One caveat is that there is no air conditioning vent in the master bath, so we had to leave the door open to shower. 
But the service isn’t as good this time around. When we arrived, my husband and I had to drive around the block a few times as a catering  van blocked the entrance, and there were no attendants outside to help. The van finally inched up a bit, but there was minimal help at our arrival, no offer of a beverage at check in. We traveled light, so we brought our bags to the room ourselves, which is fine. A few sour green apples were left for us with a nice note, some small cookies were dropped off a bit later.
When we left and then returned to the hotel that evening, the hotel attendants were too busy socializing to greet us or to help us open a car door, which I am perfectly capable of on my own. We were the only guests outside each time. 
It’s just not 5 star service this time around. No bottles of water are offered each time you leave the hotel. It’s very hot and humid outside.
Again, we are so appreciative of our lavish upgrade! We would definitely come again.

title: Location and excellence
text: Terrific experience!  The hotel is in a great location, a block away from Central Park and a quiet street.  The bar and restaurant scene is fun and lively, with the food living up to the Jean Georges name.  Even something as seemingly straightforward as avocado toast was the best my wife has ever had.  The service from the staff was exceptional as were the rooms.  I asked if they could make a special accommodation to help with an injury, unsure of how they would respond.  But Jessica, Akeem and the rest of her housekeeping staff immediately responded with a “can-do” approach, went out of their way to create a solution and were so pleasant in going about it. They truly went above and beyond the service I have experienced at other hotels of this caliber.  We have actually switched our default hotel in NYC to The Mark based solely on the service. We have stayed several more times from the initial visit and Jessica proactively made a note in our profile of the accommodation so it would be made pre-arrival, as it was on our most recent stay. Just outstanding service and so pleasant to interact with every stay!

title: Excellent staff and hotel.
text:
We have enjoyed our almost monthly stays at The Mark. The staff are incredible and the hotel amenities and location are superb. It feels like home each time we come back.

The concierge service was top notch as we were late due to a flight on our arrival and they changed our reservation for lunch with ease.

title: Hits the mark.
text:
It had been a few years since I had stayed at the Mark, and I am delighted to have returned!  I found it as gracious and elegant as ever.  The thing about the Mark is that it feels like a home. What could be better than your very own apartment on the UES?  Each room is created with lots of built in storage, drawers, closets, places to unpack and really feel at ease. The home touches like letter openers and a yoga mat.  And it has a design sensibility that invigorates while being arty and sophisticated. The most comfy bed ever, plush towels and great water pressure are always a huge plus. 

I had a special request for my room - this was actioned in seconds and I was told they would add it to my guest profile and I would not need to ask again.  They hit the mark!

title: Chic Boutique Hotel on the Upper East Side
text: The Mark is flawless. From the sophisticated lobby to the spacious luxurious rooms with heavenly bedding no detail is overlooked. The design is elegant yet understated with no pretention. The staff is  friendly and accomodating. The location is perfection. I was there for four nights and wish I could have stayed a month!

title: Alejandro Arboleda Matiz
text:
Alejandro Arboleda Matiz
Quiero viajar con mi esposa pero quisiera saber si este hotel está cercano a puntos de interés y poder tener claro si existe un menú de alimentación adecuado para una mujer en gestación. Me gustaría saber opiniones de personas que hayan estado en este hermoso hotel. Gracias

title: The best choice on the UES
text: Stayed for a long weekend in a 77th street room. Booked through our brilliant Virtuoso agent (Ourisman Travel).  Upgrade at the time of booking and excellent benefits. This was a first class experience. Requested a quiet room on a high floor and the hotel delivered. Had a wonderful dinner at the Jean George restaurant and breakfast through room service. Friendly and genuine attitude of the staff was evident at every turn. We have stayed at many of the excellent hotels in NY and the Mark is the best so far. Well done and thank you.

title: Great place to stay in NYC!
text: We are always so happy at The Mark! Everyone at the hotel always goes above and beyond for the guests. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed with amenities! The dining and bar atmosphere is great for any time of day. The location is perfect for strolling around the park and neighborhood. We will always choose to stay here because it’s the best experience!

title: Great bar
text: Best bar, bartender Don is super efficient,  informed about all the drink and food choices,  and guides you perfectly. A pleasure to deal with. The best chicken samosas. There's a lot of good bar food, but these are the best

title: Quite nice and I hope to return
text: The Mark is quite nice - the rooms are comfortable and well appointed and it is in a great location. The front desk is nice but slightly awkward. Had a good lunch at the restaurant but found egg shells in my breakfast and had poor service for breakfast. I would return to the hotel and hope for a better dining experience.

title: Feel like you live on the Upper East Side
text: Highest end hotel; book a suite here and you will feel like you are living with the uber-wealthy of the Upper East Side.  The staff quickly learns your name and strives to make the hotel a personal experience for you.  According to the concierge, when the hotel was remodeled just a few years ago, the intent was to sell apartments.   The suites were built as apartments, and we definitely felt that we could live in that suite.   Central Park is a block away, and the Met is a 10-minute walk.  There are many fine restaurants within a few blocks, and lower prices can be found by walking over to Lexington Ave.  The hotel offers a free limo that will take you almost anywhere on the Upper East Side.  The bar scene is wealthy 20-30 somethings with loud music and very little seating, but the hidden bar back in the Jean Georges restaurant is accommodating if you have a party of 4 for appetizers and cocktails or for a late night supper.  We spent nine nights at the hotel with an American Express package that included breakfast, so we became very familiar with the Jean Georges establishment. We also had dinner there on our first night; the experience at breakfast and dinner was always first class.

title: Welcome home
text: Welcome home. That’s how you are greeted when you enter the hotel and it says it all. It is not a word said but a genuine feeling shared by the wonderful staff that make you feel it. The location and facilities are superb but the people working there, all of them, is what makes this hotel truly unique.

title: Adnon to the rescue!
text:
My 165-pound Saint Bernard was saved by a quick-thinking doorman/dog handler extraordinaire by the name of Adnon this morning at The Mark Hotel. Spooked by loud clanging of City noises, my dog bolted away from me down Madison Avenue near traffic. I was screaming for him to no avail.

Buck was adopted by me 3 years ago in Virginia from an abusive home. I trained him to be a pet therapy support dog for military at Walter Reed Hospital in Washington D.C.

As I ran towards him I saw a handsome young man bring him back to me. Adnon was my hero. He told me he could not best to see such a magnificent animal suffer.  I will always recommend the hotel that chose this incredible man.

title: A Perfect Stay
text:
My wife and I just returned from 6 glorious nights at The Mark, and we loved every minute of our stay there.  The hotel is well-located at the corner of 77th and Madison Ave, just a short block from Central Park and an easy walk to many museums, including the Frick and the Metropolitan Museum of Art.  It is also on one of the nicest stretches of Madison Avenue, so the shopping is fantastic.  The Mark is not a huge hotel, with just about 100 rooms (about half the size of the nearby Carlyle), giving it a boutique, intimate feel. 

The defining feature of The Mark is its service.  The hotel makes you feel like family.  Nothing is too much trouble for the amazing doormen (doorpersons?) and concierge staff, who will get you into the city's best restaurants and arrange almost anything you might need during your stay.  (Thank you, Vinmore, for your supreme patience in booking our various dining experiences, and Gabriela, for going above and beyond to arrange the perfect table for my wife's birthday dinner at the hotel's Jean-Georges restaurant.)   The hotel has a complementary black SUV and driver for guests as well on a first-come basis.  

The lobby sports The Mark's characteristic black and white striped marble floors, with a seating area and the gorgeous adjacent bar and the restaurant.  We ate twice at Jean-Georges, and the food was really excellent.  The bar and restaurant are lively and packed (lots of very well-dressed people, many of whom look like they are on their way to or from a gala of one kind or another.)  We had adjoining rooms overlooking quiet 77th, with a central door that, once closed, allowed us to go between the rooms in complete privacy.  The rooms are spacious, with a very comfortable king bed, a club chair, and a round table with two chairs.  Many of the hotel's rooms are suites, which are even more luxe.  The bathrooms are black and white marble, with a separate shower (amazing water pressure) and tub.   

Breakfast at the hotel is also excellent, and we also ate a few breakfasts around the corner at Sant Ambroeus, where one can dine indoors (bustling) or in one of their uber-chic sidewalk tents where each table is in its own glass-enclosed, heated room with its own door, where one can sip espresso and eat breakfast in complete privacy while watching well-heeled upper east siders pass by.  The whole experience at the hotel and places like Sant A give off a distinctly European vibe.   

In short, this is an elegant, warm hotel run seamlessly by consummate professionals who are eager to enhance your NYC experience.  It is not cheap to be sure - but we felt it was worth every penny.  We had a great time there.

title: The very best hotel in NYC, hands down
text: I have stated in a number of high-end hotels all over the world, and I cannot think of a better experience than the Mark. I originally stayed there a few months ago for business, but returned with my family and was equally impressed both times. They are incredibly attentive to every detail, and incredibly attentive at all levels. From the people that greet you at the door (Michael , Peter, Nikola) to the cleaning staff that you run into in the hallway, everyone is genuinely warm and friendly, and willing to extend themselves to make sure you’re comfortable. The decor and appointments are all  amazing, as you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. We tried the restaurant for the first time on this visit and it was by far the best dining experience we had a New York. We will be returning there again and again.

title: Can't Wait to Come Back!
text:
We traveled back to NYC for the first time post-covid, the second of only two trips we've taken as a family since 2019. It was my husband, myself, our teenage son, and tween twins. 

From the moment we arrived, we felt very well cared for. We had an amazing suite where our children could spend time alone or together, a living room where we hung out and played charades, and a full kitchen, which is a truly priceless amenity for a family of five on vacation. 

We were thrilled with the goodies waiting for us in our suite, we appreciated personalized service throughout our stay, and our in-room dining breakfast was phenomenal. 

Our suite was well-appointed, quiet, impeccably clean, the water pressure was perfect, and we loved the luxurious towels and robes.

We were also pleased by the peaceful surrounding neighborhood, where we were greeted by folks walking their dogs, gardening, or out with their children. Another plus was the proximity to Central Park. 

Our one regret was not bringing our dog, a shih-tzu mix. We are looking forward to returning and bringing our pup Emmet with us. Thank you!

title: Amazing Stay!
text:
The hotel was great from before our arrival. The concierge really knows NYC, and made all our (very numerous) bookings.
Rooms were spacious- it more than served it's purpose.
Staff is very friendly, and had a long chat with our room housekeeper. They seem excited about their new General Manager but still under the government of racist human resources director Hampton Chancey, who continues to create an unhealthy work environment. Hope the hotel can resolve this issue in the near future. Staff is great, we will definitely return.

title: wonderful place
text: Amazing place, wonderful service, everything is beautifully done.  The staff is incredibly attentive and polite, from reception to the people cleaning the rooms.  The rooms are beautiful and immaculate. Highly recommended and worth the price.

title: The Mark makes the extra effort
text: This was the second time my wife and I have stayed at The Mark. After an ok experience our first visit, the hotel encouraged us to come back. And what a totally improved experience we had. The hotel absolutely delivered on its reputation. From our greeting and check-in process, to the concierge, to the service throughout the stay - we felt like valued guests at a premier hotel. We stayed in a Manhattan Suite, which was homey, comfortable and clean. The hotel went out of their way to add personal touches - like the welcome note and flowers, and small bites before dinner, among others. The natural service and culture of generosity is what makes the few elite luxury properties stand out from the rest of the pack. The Mark stands out in that regard. Thanks to all of the staff that helped orchestrate the experience we had. Molly, Hardy, Eric, Patrick, Gabriella, and many others behind the scenes. We look forward to recommending the hotel to our friends and going back soon.

title: Don't forget to visit ASSOULINE next to the Lobby
text:
After a splendid luncheon at The Mark, with Sea Scallops by Jean-Georges, what a wonderful delight it was to visit the bookstore ASSOULINE adjacent to the Lobby on the left side as you are leaving. Got one extra Christmas gift in their crimson enamel shopping bag.

I bet ASSOULINE is the smallest bookstore in all of Manhattan. All the handsome luxury gifts books were there, just like at the Plaza, but it was not small in very personal service from a delightful lady named Francesca. 

Frankly, I luncheon at The Mark to reward myself for going to the dentist, but I think I'll go more often, so I can go back to sweet ASSOULINE.

title: The Mark continues to Please!
text: I just returned from 5 nights at the Mark and marvel at how the team there has kept high standards firmly in place, service is still impeccable yet the atmosphere cordial and not stiff. No detail of a past visit or a past request is forgotten, eg this trip I had housekeeping and turn down at the time I had previously requested.

title: The best of the best (I mean it)
text:
It is a challenge to correctly ascribe the feeling I get when visiting this hotel.  Sure, I can use words and phrases such as "luxurious", amazing, customer service oriented, etc...... they area all true; however, in my opinion these words are thrown around way too liberally to describe many hotels and really should be reserved for a handfull of properties worldwide...The Mark hotel belongs in that ultra exclusive category of the finest hotels in the world.  
I have stayed at this property 8 times in the past 2 and a half years, and every single time the service and amenities and the customer experience were phenomenal...talk about consistency (a rare thing in the post COVID world of hospitality services).  The exceptionally friendly Porters (doormen) Peter, Michael, Aslan, Farid and others, as well as  the attentive staff in the front (Maura), and manager Molly all made a thoughtful effort to make our last stay memorable: It was my birthday and a gift, hand written note and a bottle of bubbly was waiting in our room.  I cannot recommend this property enough

title: Anniversary Weekend
text:
We celebrated our one-year wedding anniversary at The Mark this past weekend and it was everything we could have hoped for! We had such fond memories of staying there last year for our wedding and all those memories came flooding back thanks to the wonderful staff at The Mark and the treatment we received. 

They even treated our dog like royalty.  We had to drag him out of there the morning we checked out because he loved the dog bed provided so much- he didn't want to leave! 

Special shoutout to Molly and her team who put a few extra goodies in our room to celebrate the occasion. We can't thank you enough for making us feel extra special on our celebratory weekend. 

We look forward to coming back!

title: Favorite NYC hotel
text: The staff at The Mark is extremely friendly and very accommodating! The attention to detail is in everything.  Not to mention how beautiful and well maintained the hotel is. I feel welcomed and taken care of whenever I’m there. It my favorite!

title: We would stay nowhere else in NYC!
text:
My sisters and I travel from Portland, Oregon, once a year for a week in New York: Broadway plays, Central Park, museums, music, and fantastic food. Staying at The Mark puts it right over the top - in every regard. 

When Farid greets us at the curb, we know we are home! The rooms are tremendous. The staff is unmatched in warmth and helpfulness. The meals are exquisite - whether taken via room service or in the restaurant or on the sidewalk! it is rare to find a place that honors fruits & vegetables the way they do; they showcase these beauties perfectly. (As a vegetarian, this is particularly noticed!)

843 magnificent acres of Central Park at your door!

And each morning the best pot of coffee you'd ever hope for!

All of this makes for heaven. We would stay nowhere else.

title: Luxury at its Finest
text:
We have been here less than 24 hours and so far the amazing staff has far exceeded any other luxury 5 star hotel we have ever stayed at and we are frequent travelers! 

The first reason is that the hotel manager upon meeting my husband gave us his personal cell phone number and told us if we need anything, even a towel, to call him. In the many 5 star hotel (including diamond 💎) this is a first for a manager to do. 

Secondly, we just got in from 🇮🇹 Italy and I am experiencing some jet lag and asked for tums which they did not have on hand but promptly went to CVS and brought them to our door. They also had on hand a European adapter that we needed for a device we purchased abroad. They brought it up in a tiny bag with The Mark’s logo stamped on the front. 

Thirdly, the room service has already gone above and beyond by bringing all kinds of fresh fruit and nuts and cookies that we didn’t order just to be nice and give that extra warmth and welcome. 

The beds are amazingly soft & comfortable. Every amenity here at your fingertips including cordless chargers by the bed, a button to lower blackout shades and heated bathroom floors and towel hangers. 

The staff are all amazing, warm, friendly and go beyond to make you feel welcomed and not a guest but more like a well known VIP. 

Well done to all of the wonderfully warm and kind staff here at The Mark Hotel! Jerrod & I are blown away & will never choose another hotel to stay at in NYC.  🗽 ♥️

title: Maravilloso
text:
Como siempre es una delicia de restaurante! El
Servicio divino y el ambiente muy chic. 
Cenar adentro o en la terraza vale mucho la pena, es un lugar increíble. 
No se permite fumar, se debe uno cruzar la calle.
Mi favorita es la ensalada de sandía

title: Overwhelmingly fabulous
text: My husband and I just had the most fabulous staycation at The Mark. We were honestly wowed by the stellar service at this beautiful jewel box of a hotel on the best block of the Upper East Side. Our gorgeous spacious room, replete with a fabulous Carerra marble bath, was stocked with goodies upon our arrival. Stunning roses, chocolates, fresh fruit, a cookie platter…honestly it was such a lovely surprise and kick off to our stay in the city. The room was so airy and bright, with seemingly endless closet space and a beautiful view of the skyline. Breakfast at Jean Georges was impeccable as well. I want to thank Molly at guest relations for assisting with our lovely stay. She is amazing and left no stone unturned. We can’t wait to go back to the Mark!

title: Everything exceeded expectations - especially the people
text: Hey it's a 5 star hotel - so bed was great, lots of amenities and some witty/fun marketing but what really makes this place special is what really seems to be the genuinely friendly staff - from the door people to the cleaning staff  to the guy who helped my sign my room service ticket with no glasses on - all were just lovely. they remembered names, what you circumstances were and were just happy and helpful. The restaurant is super as well with one of the nicest outdoor seating in the city. my daughter who lives there says it is the cleanest. The robes in the rooms are the best. i bought one.

title: Staycation in the city
text: We had a wonderful week at the Mark. Our dog was treated like royalty and had the time of her life. (If you have a dog do not hesitate to stay here!). All our requests were fulfilled with ease. I would like to commend the great staff—especially Farid (doorman), Dawa (front desk) and Maria/Winmore/Krista (concierges)—for their excellent service. They made it feel more like a home than a hotel.

title: Absolutely beautiful hotel with an exceptionally accommodating staff!
text: We had a lovely stay at The Mark. The staff made sure we had everything we needed at all times. The finishes in our room were stunning and the level of service was remarkable. It was certainly a 5 star experience and we look forward to our next visit!

title: Fantastic stay
text: The location, which was both out of the way of the bustle of mid-town but right in the heart of the upper East Side and Central Park, was fantastic. The service was exquisite, and the room was super comfortable. We loved it.

title: Absolutely Perfect!
text: Wow.  I am jaded, and not easily impressed-but the Mark blew my socks off.  We had dined here many times, but this was our first stay--and it won't be our last! From the front door staff (thank you Michael) to the front desk, the concierge, management, housekeeping--everyone delivers.  This is one of the best hotels in the world, and certainly the best in NYC to me (and we have stayed in many top hotels there).  Everything was seamless (and spotless).  The attention to detail is incredible--and post COVID when many hotels and restaurants cannot attract staff, the Mark has plenty of amazing folks all dedicated to improving your stay. Thanks all-can't wait to return.

title: Exceptional hotel
text:
Great staff ( from bellmen to front desk to concierge )
Gourmet food at restaurant and in-room dining ( and the Hot Dog cart out front)
Rooms are classic, sophisticated, livable.
An exceptional hotel and experience.

title: Impeccable room , excellent service
text:
Besides its prime location , we found the room very spacious , impeccably clean , with superb details , and an extremely friendly staff .
The restaurant is one of the finest in NYC , and the outdoor dining area delightful .

title: Overpriced and underwhelming
text:
I wanted a quick luxury overnight getaway in the city so I chose the Mark due to its reputation and great reviews. Honestly it was a very expensive show about nothing. I have stayed in far more luxurious city hotels around the world with superior EVERYTHING. 
Crowded lines at check in and check out, a tiny rather shabby lobby, dark hall ways, and except for a lovely bathroom, a very small rather depressing room with 2 small armless chairs to sit in, not even close to each other. There isn’t space for that.
I guess I should be blown away by the models in the lobby and rock star looking guests. But I wasn’t. I was thinking I should have stayed somewhere else. 
The area is so lovely, and breakfast outside in the tent was very nice. But I will not return to the Mark. It’s all hype, smoke and mirrors.
However, an extremely nice woman named Carmel helped me check out and buck the long line. She was extremely sweet and personable, a stand out.

title: Amazing as alaways
text:
The Mark never lets me down! This is my second time I stayed there and the service is always amazing. The breakfast was super fast and delicious. Molly the director of Guest Relation made this trip so much better because she was very welcoming and at tentative to everyone's needs. Even during our gathering at the Penthouse, Molly came up and made sure everything was in order and that everyone was having fun. 

Mark never cease to amaze me.

title: Very Special Hotel
text:
A very special hotel in every sense ..
Very rarely do you find a hotel that ticks every box and The Mark really does. The location is fantastic but what sets it apart is the people. The front desk ,concierge, doormen, bar tenders ,cleaning ladies ..they are all AMAZING.
Worth a special mention are Patrick , Sarah ,Maria & Gabriella who went over & above to make it a wonderful and memorable stay and we cannot thank them and the entire team enough.
When we left my wife and 9 year old daughter were crying - this has never happened before!
Whatever purpose of trip , business or pleasure, I honestly cannot recommend it highly enough and we cannot wait to return.

title: Heaven.
text: Don't bother reading my review, just go. Heaven. Amazing rooms - the decor is sublime! The bed is so comfortable. The bathroom is excellent( the bath is divine for soaking, and the shower water pressure is perfect ! ) The staff are so attentive, and helpful.

title: Wonderful hotel experience in NYC!
text:
Just got home from a recent stay at the Mark with my partner and I must say, I was pleasantly surprised. From the attentive staff, to the chic and elegant design of the furnishings and rooms (we stayed in a courtyard Queen), and the wonderful location of the hotel (a block from Central Park)...it was a lovely experience.

The bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was very chic (I particularly love the design of the floors)...oh, and the shower water pressure was awesome, lol. Everything just seemed nice and crisp and clean...was a joy to return to the hotel room after being out and about.

My only gripe is that we weren't able to get an outside table to have brunch at the hotel restaurant Jean Georges. Might be a good idea to give hotel guests a real priority when it comes to eating at the restaurant...but maybe that's just me...small thing really. Otherwise, was a great experience...would definitely stay there again!

title: The Mark is truly remarkable!
text:
From the very first moment we put our foot inside this beautiful hotel we felt at home. The staff was so incredibly friendly and courteous at all times, making us feel so comfortable and cosy. We were addressed with our names every time we came close to reception or the concierge desk - mentioning the concierge, this has been an impeccable experience. Having travelled the world, never has a concierge team impressed me so much as in our recent stay at the Mark.
Especially Suzana and Vinmore were making our stay in New York so special in every way. They arranged tickets for the most wanted venues and came up with the best suggestions and ideas at all times - very genuine and with love.
We will definitely return to the Mark when we come to NYC next.
Thank you for this amazing experience!

title: The Mark hits every Mark!
text: Our teenage son and I just returned from our Spring Break trip to NYC.  We decided to stay at The Mark after reading such favorable reviews.  I'm thrilled to say the favorable reviews are an understatement based on our experience. The exceptional service began long before we arrived to the hotel.  The most wonderful, thoughtful and caring concierge - Suzana M. - looked after every single detail.  She was instrumental in making this the best mom/son trip we could have ever imagined.  Upon check-in we were greeted by the lovely front desk staff and beyond pleased with the seamless process.  The room was well appointed and the bathroom was superb. The water pressure in the shower is so great it felt like a massage. The food at the hotel is delicious and the service is impeccable.  We loved the breakfast each morning and eating a late lunch in the bar/lounge with Vlad who made sure every detail was perfect.  Our son wouldn’t miss the hot dog cart and getting to know the magnificat Harry who operates the cart and made sure we had everything we needed.   We would not stay anywhere else in the city after this experience.  We felt so welcome and taken care of at all times.  The hotel is so well staffed that everything is anticipated before you need to ask.  A few other members of the team we would like to acknowledge are Gabriela and Maria (concierge), David (front desk) and Tony (front desk).  The front desk manager Tony handed us his card on our way out and expressed how much he appreciated our stay and would love to welcome us back.  We will be back!

title: Simply the best
text:
Forward all my mail here, there is no better place to stay in NYC or on the UES. Michael the doorman is fantastic The concierge team is 100% the best, and the restaurant is chic and sophisticated.  This is my go ot place in the big Apple. 

Only complaint is you shouldn't have to ask for a Nespresso to be brought to the room. At this price point and luxury every room should have a Nespresso machine already there. Something to think about for a hotel wide refresh.

title: A New York Gem
text: The Mark Hotel is my favorite place to stay in NYC.  From the outstanding staff, its ideal location, comfortable and well-appointed rooms, all the right little touches, and wonderful dining experience, it is the best hotel in the city. Thank you for another wonderful stay.

title: An amazing boutique hotel in the upper east side
text: The Mark Hotel is the a very special hotel. Everything was fabulous, the service, the amenities and the  the accommodation. We adored staying there and were treated so very well, nothing was too much trouble. A Gem in the Upper East side. To top it all, the hot dog stand outside brought a smile and much pleasure.

title: Fabulous weekend at the Mark Hotel!
text: I had a remarkable time at this wonderful hotel.  Everything from the moment I arrived until my departure was five star!  The staff is professional, the decor amazing and the food was out of this world! I visit New York City at least 5 times a year.  I always stay in fine hotels.  The Mark is on the top of my list!  If you are interested in spending a magical vacation in New York, The Mark is the place to be.  It's home away from home for me.

title: Five Stars with Service
text:
The Room was tastefully decorated with every convenience. and nothing better than a great shower - forceful spray, hot towels.
We had wine at the bar in the afternoon- small pizza - a real delight.
Very happening bar - all kinds of people including a couple of well behaved dogs !
Great service 
The staff at the Hotel was wonderful !!!!!

title: Rude and obnoxious
text: My wife and I visited the Mark bar for a cocktail on a Saturday afternoon around 445pm. We often go to the Mark for a sophisticated and low key time.  We ordered drinks at the bar but noticing the seating was entirely full, we took our drinks to sit quietly in the chairs and couch of the hotel lobby. After about 15 minutes, a hotel employee came over to say we that not only were drinks not allowed there but sitting was not allowed there unless you were a hotel guest. The employee demanded we turn over our half full drinks since there was “no room in the bar for us”. When I indicated that no staff member had alerted us to their bizarre no seating the lobby or drinks, he was unapologetic and further inquired about taking our drinks.  To their credit, they refunded our drinks but proceeded to ask us to leave the lobby area. The whole experience was highly bizarre, rude and obnoxious for any service venue, especially from a supposed five star property. Don’t make patrons feel like they are unwelcome. Needless to say, we will never return.

title: Fabulous Couples Dinner at The Mark
text: This was our first trip back to NYC from CA post-Covid and we could not have been more pleased with our experience at The Mark.  We came in on an extremely busy Friday evening and all of our expectations were well exceeded. The staff was fantastic in accommodating us - Ben the Maitre'd was extremely helpful in getting myself,, my husband, and the couple we were with situated. The manager with an Australian accent (whose name we sadly can't remember) was so attentive and truly made our experience. Once the weather is warmer, we can't wait to return!

title: The Mark a true five star hotel
text: Everything about this hotel exudes five stars. We accidentally discovered this hotel last spring when we decided to take our first trip since Covid to NYC. We had traditionally stayed either at four seasons or the ritz in Central Park. But since neither hotel was open during this time, we decided to venture out with the Amex fine hotels program and decided to try the Mark. Our experience was so amazing we’ve made four subsequent trips in the past nine months to this hotel and it is easily our favorite hotel in the US

title: The Mark gets High Marks!
text: Perfect location for an NYC staycation.  Away from all the hustle and bustle, but near great shopping, the park and accessible to midtown.  The hotel is boutique still with plenty of small touches that make you feel right at home in its residential-style rooms/sutes.  The service was fabulous and everything was in order.  Not sure it was just our room, but the water pressure in the shower was incredible.  Had a wonderful in room breakfast and enjoyed the fitness center before heading back to the kids.  Would highly recommend this hotel./

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Very stylish hotel a stones throw from Central Park. We had a great stay and the service was very good. I’m often underwhelmed by New York hotels and The Mark was the first place I’ve stayed that I would definitely return to. My only disappointment was that each night we stayed we couldn’t have a drink in the bar as the line was so long. Slightly annoying to spend $1000 a night and you can’t have a drink in the bar where you’re staying….

title: Simply the best
text:
This is by far the most elegant and pleasant hotel in NYC. Perfectly located in the best part of the upper east side. 
Excellent service, impeccably clean rooms and extremely kid friendly!
Highly recommend!

title: #1 in New York City
text:
Having not visited the city since the start of the pandemic we were hesitant as to what we would find. The minute we got out of the car we were made to feel so welcome it felt like coming home!
The Mark is even better than before! The service was on point for the duration of our stay, 6 days. Noting was too much to ask, always with a smile and a warm disposition. From the warm welcome of the doorman, to the front desk, concierge, room service servers and housekeeping everyone was outstanding. The room was so comfortable, the bathrooms were perfectly appointed with great amenities, the living room had everything you needed to wind down after a day in the hustle and bustle of the city, even a well curated library of books!
We look forward to our visit in April again! Thank you to all who made us feel so welcome and kudos to the manager for running a top notch operation! Annelies & Jose Da Costa Gomez

title: Fantastic Thanksgiving week @ The Mark!
text:
We stayed at The Mark over Thanksgiving week 2021.  This is our 2nd stay (same time back in 2019).  One of the other reviewers captured it best with "old-fashioned luxury!"  So true.  

We loved our room.  We were in a suite facing 77th Street; we opted for a slightly bigger room then our last stay.  We were traveling with our boys - 9 and 11.  The boys utilized the pull-out sofa that was promptly made and also turned down each morning and night.     The bathroom is the best part.  They are huge.  The water pressure is amazing (we live in CA 😬).  The bedding was  luxurious and everything was incredibly clean - important these days!

The staff was so friendly and welcoming.  The Concierge went above and beyond to help us assemble a toy for my nephew's first birthday.  We used the car service several times, as well.

We loved ordering coffee and pastries each morning.  We booked through AMEX, so breakfast was included.  We had drinks in the bar several times - such a cozy spot.  And my boys loved the hot dog stand.

For us, The Mark is away from all the chaos of Manhattan, next to the park and amazing shopping, and offers a personalized, luxurious stay.  We can't wait for our next visit.

A++

title: Highly personalized, old fashioned luxury!
text: Staying at The Mark is always a treat.  The staff treat you like they know you.  They know if you've stayed with them before and they thank you for coming back.  Front desk, bellmen, concierge and all other staff go out of their way to HELP.   Rooms are beautiful, neighborhood is "old" New York and conveniently located and easy to get around from.  Can't wait to return!

title: great new years weekend at the mark hotel and restaurant
text:
my wife and I and 4 other couples spent the weekend at The Mark. This was a staycation for us and we wanted to be pampered.  the Mark is one of the best hotels in the city. top service, beautiul rooms and lobby. one of the best bar/lounge's to hang out in., located in an upscalle neighborhood. near museums, shopping and Central Park. 
we had dinner Saturday night at their restaurant. also one of the best in the city. the manager came over to the table to check and see if everything was perfect. which it was. we will do this again and again

title: A Worthy Investment
text:
The Mark is an expensive hotel but the ROI on the money spent was returned tenfold in the experience my wife and I enjoyed during our recent stay over the holidays. The pre-arrival communication from the concierge and guest relations teams was superior and indicative of the level of attention we received throughout our stay. The concierge team was able to secure some very last-minute reservations and they were in touch with us via text/phone throughout our time.  

We stayed in a queen room with a courtyard view and, for NYC standards, the room was spacious with plenty of closet space and a bathroom almost as large as the bedroom. The large soaking tub was a welcome respite for my wife after a long day of sightseeing and shopping in the city, and the water pressure in the shower was enough to blast away any stress for me. Having only stayed in Midtown on previous trips, the location of The Mark in the Upper East Side was a quiet escape from the madness of NYC during the holidays. Being within walking distance of Central Park, The Guggenheim, The Met, and Ralph's Coffee made for wonderful morning strolls. 

The Mark is an entire experience and an incredible way to spend time in NYC.

title: Weekend at the Mark in early Dec.2021
text:
We have to travel to NYC several times a year for work and the odd personal event. After the Covid pandemic the hotel I had stayed at for years was closed.  I love the 70's streets in NYC on the E side.  It's close to C Park, the museums, the Explorers Club(my office in NYC) and it's the part of NYC that is quieter, smaller buildings, feels more like home to me.  
So we booked at The Mark not knowing what to expect and it surpassed all of our hopes for the weekend.  Fantastic rooms, ridiculously great service, great food and beverage and an unbelievable location.  
If you are like me, you don't like giant hotels but you want that super hotel service... If that is you The Mark is right on the money..
So thrilled we have found our new home when we visit NYC. 
The Mark takes that massive city and gives you a first class home, with a staff that is there for your every need and it's in the nicest part of town!

title: Concierge Service is THE BEST!
text: I was not the hotel guest, but the assistant/coordinator of several guests staying at the hotel for a long weekend. We had multiple dining reservations requests for different restaurants that were frequently changing - dates/times/#.  Every call/email with request or change was handled efficiently & professionally by Concierge Services.  Kudos to The Mark for having such wonderful employees.  Krista, in particular, was extremely helpful and made my job easier!  THANK YOU, Krista!

title: Best weekend in a long time
text:
This was our first hotel stay since the pandemic started. My husband was running the NYC marathon and I decided to book a room because I didn't want to travel on public transportation with an unvaccinated baby and toddler. The only reason I booked at the Mark was because there was supposed to be a 48 hour vacancy between guests. However, I found out that morning that the policy had changed. I was really upset because I wanted to keep the kids safe. Hardy was so helpful speaking with a manager to upgrade us to the one room that had no guests leading up to our check in. The 2 bedroom allowed us to have the kids nap separately and my husband was able to get ready without disturbing them. The full kitchen was really helpful as was a small table for us to eat at. The only issue was my toddler had a hard time napping in the smaller bedroom because there was so much light. It was also nice having 2.5 bathrooms. The bellhops were really friendly and so helpful. We ordered out for all our meals, and the bellhop would bring it up to our room. I forgot his name (sorry!) but he even brought me a new cup of tea when the deliveryman spilled my entire cup.

The location can't be beat. It's right next to Central Park and made it so easy to rush out the door with 2 little ones to catch my husband running by.

Also, we were on the 11th floor and didn't have long waits for the elevator. It was also very quiet in the bedrooms. I could hear sirens for a minute from the living room but it wasn't bad at all.

Thank you to the Mark for a special weekend. It wouldn't have happened, and we wouldn't have been able to support my husband at his first marathon, without your help.

title: Great!
text: Great hotel. Everything was super clean and the rooms are beautiful. The real differentiator is the amazing concierge staff. They were able to help me with restaurant recommendations and securing reservations. Highly recommended!

title: Great week end
text: Great hotel, awesome new rooms and amazing service! Within walking distance of nice restaurants and speak easy bars. Minutes from downtown. Maria at the reception desk made our stay a smooth transition and was always accessible. Will definitely be staying again. The lift was the only downside, waiting time too long.

title: The Mark Hotel
text: I had THE BEST STAY of my life at The Mark!! We were celebrating my brother’s 60th birthday and the Guest Relations Team (Olivia, Hardy and Molly) went of their way to make this a weekend we would never forget. They recommended we celebrate over The Mark’s Signature Ginger Margarita and Black Truffle Pizza both of which were stellar!! The rooms were spacious and luxe with lots of light. Every staff member we encountered was professional and warm.   We can’t wait to come back!

title: Near perfect stay!
text:
My family and I stayed at the Mark for over two weeks...Despite some issues service wise at the restaurant, the Mark scores high points. The attention to details is always there. The rooms are ample, well appointed and oh so heavenly. The black and white marble bathrooms are divine..

Maria the head concierge is a gem, always ready to jump in any situation! 
We will be back!

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff!!
text: The Hotel is absolute luxury!  The staff caters to your every need and takes care to learn the name of every customer of the hotel.  The service and level of care they provide each hotel guest is exceptional! The GM, Manuel, takes care in making sure each guest has a memorable experience. My new favorite hotel!  We cant wait to come back!

title: Pure Luxury on UES
text:
From before we even arrived at the Mark the service was exceptional. We were there for a weekend in the City  and anniversary celebration. Before we arrived the concierge (Krista) worked on a dinner reservation for our group in the theatre district. We arrived to a beautiful room and special chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate our anniversary.

Service is top notch. Michael the doorman and his colleagues are fantastic.  The front desk is efficient, friendly and all about service. 

We had breakfast twice in the restaurant which is smart and chic. The food was wonderful. 

With so many high end hotels curtailing service, like turn downs and other amenities, it was great to see The Mark well staffed and everything absolutely perfect.  The hotel reminded us of a Paris luxury hotel feeling. 

This is our new place in NYC when we need to be on the UES.

title: Newspapers every morning despite the gap between visits.
text:
We have stayed in more hotels than we remember, all over the world. The Mark is clearly the best! The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. The service is amazing -- whenever we return we can count on our newspapers being delivered in the morning without having to place a new order. The restaurant is probably the best in the city -- try the profiterole.
Add a pleasant and competent staff.

title: 60th Birthday Surprise Weekend
text: I surprised my wife with a weekend in NYC for her sixtieth birthday and unfortunately her favorite Upper East Side hotel closed due to COVID. One block away was The Mark, where I had eaten before but never stayed. Now that we stayed there, we won’t stay anywhere else. While the rooms and lobby are beautiful, what really sets the hotel apart are the people. You somewhat expect in an upper end hotel for the staff to be stiff and snooty. Nothing could be further from reality. The staff couldn’t do more to make our stay amazing, starting with knowing our names as we got out of the Uber from the airport, and immediately wishing my wife a happy birthday. How did they know who we were - we never stayed there before? They obviously do their homework. Every aspect of our stay was like that. I can’t recommend this hotel more strongly. My wife and I already decided we’re making this an annual trip, and we’ll definitely be staying at The Mark.

title: Incredible. Amazing. Home away from Home!
text:
This was THE HOTEL stay of a lifetime for our mother daughter trip. The staff is AMAZING! All of the directors and managers know you by name and everyone bends over backwards to help you. The staff at the front - getting a cab, to getting you in and out of your cab - they go above and beyond. Maria in concierge made my 13 year old daughter feel so loved. Sonam - outdoor staff - so helpful! Tony one of the managers gave a private tour and didn’t not have to. Breakfast and dinner at the restaurant is outstanding. This place was better than any of the Four Seasons I’ve stayed at (and I have many to compare it to). The neighborhood around the hotel - quiet/serene/safe. The rooms are gorgeous, we stayed in a suite and were quite pleased with everything. 

This place is a MUST STAY! Enjoy!

title: UES Luxury
text: Hotel is beautiful and rooms are spacious and airy.  They worked well with COVID-restrictions and it was wonderful to order all of their restaurant food via room service! We did a staycation there and it was definitely a nice escape.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: I stayed here in June 2021 on the spur of the moment while attending a cocktail party at Dolce and Gabbana. The staff were so warm and friendly, the decor was fun and beautiful, and they upgraded me to a larger room, delivering a fresh bouquet of roses to my room. I love a big tub and this hotel has the best! I looked out of my hotel window at 2am when closing the blinds to go to sleep, and saw a little italian convertible with a big white dog sitting in the driver's seat. I felt like I was in a Fellini movie!

title: Anniversary Trip
text:
I stayed at the Mark for one night in a one bedroom suite as part of a business trip combined with wedding anniversary with my wife.  Room was perfect and attention to deail was unmatched.  Amenities were great and service level was impeccable.  We received a bottle of champagne compliments of the hotel as a nice touch.  I always stay here on my trips to NYC and I look forward to the next time.  

JF (Toronto)

title: NYC  Visit
text: I reached out to arrange with The Mark as my daughter was going to stay the night before a visit to Sloan Kettering.  Incredible responsiveness with the utmost respect and concern to help make this a fabulous “stay oasis” for her.   Right from an early check in, to a  room upgrade, and then a plate of warm cookies waiting with roses on the tray accompanied by a welcome note….everyone and every detail was planned with care and understanding.   Great credit to Molly, Director of Guest Relations…and the entire staff that helped make this an over the top stay….add to all this, a fabulous dinner experience!   A true 5 Star+ stay she will always remember.

title: Service beyond the beyond
text:
Had booked this hotel preCovid and was crushed that we had to cancel. But two years without seeing family was depressing so it was important to go all out and celebrate life. ThIs, this hotel is the perfect place! 
Friendly people everywhere, impeccable and immaculate rooms and lovely aesthetic everywhere. Will be back asap!!!!

title: NYC visit
text: We stayed at The Mark hotel this weekend. It was amazing. All the staff were so helpful both before and during our stay. Thank you especially to the phenomenal concierge desk, the front desk, bell staff, in-room dining and housekeeping. They made our stay just wonderful. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation. A luxurious oasis in the city.

title: Extraordinary
text: Our favorite place to stay in Manhattan.  We were repeat guests on this trip and have only wonderful things to say.  We prefer the courtyard side for a quiet respite there, but the staff are what make it so terrific, really.  Discrete, low-key, and observant.  No safer-feeling place in NYC right now.  The bathrooms are the fanciest I've ever seen, and it takes something unusual for me even to notice! The Sant Ambroeus has better coffee (in my opinion) but happy to walk around the corner for that.  We love eating breakfast outside in the new enclosed spaces at the hotel.  Their car service during the day is terrific for a quick drop-off.

title: It's been 15 months but butt he groove was still strong
text: We were last here in January of 2020 - we know hat happened. next. Apparently the Mark did not shut down during the pandemic - remarkably. It was so delightful to encounter our same friends Molly and Isabelle and they did not miss a beat. Nor did the rest of the staff. Just as comfortable as ever and first class all the way!

title: Great place
text: The Mark Bar is a great place to hangout and spend some quality time with friends. Wines and beers are really good and service is the best. It’s a relaxing place and it’s not noisy. I highly recommend this place

title: The Best Of The Best!
text: The Mark is one of those very special and very rare properties that is truly perfect. The wonderful team goes above and beyond to make their guests feel at home and the property itself is spectacular. During the best of times The Mark is always wonderful, but it’s important to note that I have stayed three times during the pandemic, and The Mark didn’t miss a step with their hospitality during this time of heightened challenges. From the flower stand, to the bikes and pedicab to Bergdorfs, to the hotdog stand (which is delicious!), and their exceptional dining options, The Mark has a unique charm which differentiates itself from all other luxury NYC properties.

title: Will not disappoint!
text: Nervous about getting back on the road. So happy our first experience was at The Mark. The staff went out of their way to make everyone feel safe and comfortable. The location is a 10. The hotel is comfortable and well managed. Patrick is a gem! Not only did he make sure everything was perfect for our stay, he is a pleasure to be around. His positive attitude and great energy were perfect for our first trip in over a year. Looking forward to going back this fall.

title: Best Upper Eastside Hotel
text: I never consider staying at a property other than The Mark in NYC.  It's a unique experience that, for me, is synonymous with the city.  The location is perfect: next to Central Park and the best UES shopping and museums.  The service doesn't miss a beat, but is understated and personal in just the right way.  It's the ideal sized boutique property and the rooms are sophisticated, but also very comfortable and  well equipped.  The onsite Jean-Georges restaurant means there are always good dining options available, including exceptional room service and the best hot dog stand in the city.  The hotel cultivates a loyal and international cliental for all of these reasons and more.  Very special.

title: The Perfect Hotel
text: I stayed at The Mark this past weekend to celebrate my engagement.  The hotel was so beautiful and luxurious, and the Guest Relations team went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect!  The Mark had complimentary martinis waiting for us on arrival, and everyone was so nice and excited for us.  We live in New York so we typically don’t stay at hotels, but this was well worth the staycation!  We can’t wait to come back soon for another excellent stay.

title: Sofía
text: The Mark is our favorite hotel in NYC , we love running at Central Park so it’s the best location, the rooms the bathrooms the service everything amazing and the best Gabriela Popeti the concierge, she is the most effective concierge and a very nice person ! She makes your life easy during your stay !

title: Luxury in the City
text: The Mark brings luxury to a new level.  Recently stayed for a special birthday for our daughter.  Accommodations were outstanding and arranged perfectly all while maintaining high standards for safety during the pandemic.  We all felt safe and comfortable with our first trip back to the city in a year.  The hotel's location a block from Central Park provides for easy access to the outdoors.

title: A Jewel in the upper east side of Manhattan
text:
When our usual hotel was not open due to the pandemic we switched to the Mark Hotel
What a wonderful experience it gave us 
Excellent Service, personal attention,
Warm wonderful ambience, fabulous Dinning with Delicious food.
After traveling all over the world I am convinced The Mark has the best shower in the world.
We have stayed there twice since the pandemic and couldn’t have felt safer.
They have every covered.
Even a welcome kit with masks etc.
I could go on and but try it yourself, you won’t be disappointed.
Sandy C

title: Great place for upscale weekend stay in NYC
text: We had a fabulous family stay at the Mark Hotel last weekend.  Excellent customer service and attention to every detail for our son's 21st birthday celebration.  All questions answered with ultimate care and responsiveness.  Highly recommend.

title: The perfect luxury staycation!
text:
My girlfriend wanted to surprise me with a local staycation, and this establishment did not disappoint. I had spent much time at The Mark Bar and Restaurant almost a decade ago and was aching to visit again, especially since international travel has not been possible for some time now. Staying here feels like you've left and gone to Paris after a 20 minute taxi. It's chic, immaculate, and the bathroom is everything. Staff is genuinely happy to greet you and help with your every need, food did not disappoint and being able to bring my little Cavalier King Charles "Asher" was the icing on the cake. And yes, the area is sublime - you are only steps from Central Park.

I would do this again and again!

title: E.C.
text: Outstanding, immaculate hotel with exquisite service!  Loved staying there, as it felt so warm and inviting with the staff and service, & restaurant staff, yet the quality was so very upscale.  It is perfect!!!

title: Luxury birthday staycation
text:
I booked The Mark through Amex Platinum Concierge for a birthday staycation. I was somewhat anxious venturing from home for the first time in a year, but the hotel's COVID precautions eased that tremendously. I coordinated with Molly for some pre-stay requests and each was waiting in the room upon arrival, along with a few surprises.

A special shout out to Gale who went above and beyond with birthday cheer. 

The staff are exemplary, the food is exquisite, and the tubs are legendary. I will absolutely return to The Mark.

title: Get what you pay for.....
text:
In the world of hospitality, I am find it more and more infrequent to get what you pay for.   That is NOT the case at The Mark.  If I need a night or weekend with my wife, or if my Mother is coming to town for an extended stay - The Mark is the only place we know every "i" will be dotted and every "t" will be crossed.   This was a 19 hour stay to celebrate my wife's birthday - which we did not get to do a year earlier.   Molly, Olivia, & Hardy helped me arrange wine, chocolate dipped strawberries, and roses which were waiting in the room - and answered all of my question promptly pre-arrival.  

Without failed, the Mark again delivered everything I could ask for.  I find the beds to be incredibly comfortable.   The water pressure in the shower is amazing.   They are one of the few luxury hotels doing In Room Dining during Covid - and the menu is always fantastic.   The staff is first class.   Even the bathroom products are great.   My daughter always asks for more Mark Shampoo and Conditioner.  

Thanks As Always !!

title: Luxury Stay during COVID
text: We had the pleasure of staying at The Mark for the past 10 days due to needing medical care in NY.  We had three rooms, including a suite in our party.  The hotel could not have been better prepared and respectful of not only COVID restrictions/precautions but also still providing a seamless guest experience.  The front desk staff and the bellmen are so well-versed and so responsive. This is old-style luxury, where they will hail a cab for you, change out your slippers, and yes you can even request a newspaper.  But a special shout out goes to Isabelle, the Mark's concierge.  What a GEM. She is so knowledgeable about the City, and particularly the UES. She sent us to amazing restaurants and handled our last minute changes/reservations needs with elegance and aplomb.  We have always stayed at the Carlyle, but with it basically being at 20% occupancy and no food/beverage options, and with the Surrey being closed for renovation, we tried the Mark instead.  Breakfast, lunch, and dinner available, and again a staff which is truly professional.  The Mark is where we shall return!

title: Great couples staycation!
text: We had been to the Mark for a one night staycation back in October and while we had a nice time, we had a few issues with the stay. Immediately after our stay, I was contacted by a manager to discuss our concerns. The conversation was really helpful, and when we decided to book another one night staycation in March, we gave the Mark another chance. We’re so glad we did. We booked through Amex FHR again and received a great upgrade to a spacious suite which was a nice surprise. We took advantage of all the FHR benefits which were clearly explained at check in, and had massages and lunch reservations booked by the concierge. Room service deliveries were timely (and the food was very good) and everyone at the hotel was eager to help with anything we needed. We love the style of the hotel and given how great the service level was, we look forward to returning soon!

title: The ultimate stay-cation!
text: I stayed at The Mark recently and was so charmed ... and relieved a top NYC hotel was open! Everything was amazing -- services, amenities, room, lobby (I am obsessed with the art and furniture!) and the Jean Georges restaurant. I stayed a Friday and had a terrific room with a great view, comfortable bed, amazing bathroom (that tub!). Enjoyed the Jean Georges burger for lunch and fusilli for dinner -- perfection. Loved the outdoor dining too with the super comfy (and heated!) tents. Got a haircut at Frederic Fekkai, which was super glamorous. And took in the Upper East Side, Madison Ave and Central Park. I was afraid  it might be clinical given all the COVID restrictions, but the hotel has retained its friendly atmosphere and elegance. Staff all wear masks and take your temperature, but they're all personable and helpful.  Staying in a hotel during the pandemic is hit or miss, but The Mark hits the bull's eye. It was just the stay-cation I needed after a year spent indoors.

title: Best service
text: Excellent service, impeccable cleanliness, and delicious food!  I had a wonderful experience at The Mark- Every staff member I encountered, from the front door to the check- in to the housekeeping staff were delightful and eager to help! Thank you! Will recommend to all!

title: The best NYC experience - love The Mark!
text: The Mark Hotel and restaurant by Jean George are both classic and iconic NYC destinations. Despite how the city might feel at the moment, my experience with them was amazing. Their attention to detail and organization allowed me to host a small family birthday celebration while being outside, socially distant and safe. We had an amazing time, incredible food and the best team took care of us. The Mark is my favorite Hotel and I recommend everyone to stay or eat there.

title: A warm experience
text:
This is our second visit to The Mark.  The hotel is a lovely, sophisticated NYC hotel.  The rooms are comfortable and impeccably clean.  The best bathtubs and showers.  Jean Georges is the hotel restaurant and the food is lovely.  Because of NYC restrictions on indoor dining we had our meals in our room.  Room service was prompt and the food was hot and delicious.  Now to the thing that makes The Mark such a wonderful experience.  The Staff.
The two times we have been to The Mark, the staff has been outstanding.  From Molly and her colleagues in the office, to the doormen, bellboys, waiters, room service staff, cleaning staff, everyone.  When you are at The Mark, even on your first visit, you are welcomed as a well known returning guest might be.   Any hotel can have great accommodations.  But, the thing that truly outstanding hotels have, is an efficient, caring, warm and welcoming staff which The Mark the stand out hotel that it is.

title: The Mark!
text:
Such an incredible hotel from start to finish, the service was fantastic and our room (and view from the room) was to die for! 

Location was great, right by the park and close to all of the great museums.

We had such an great weekend stay. Thank you to everyone! Xx

title: Excellent service at every stay
text: I've stayed here twice this year (5 nights and 3 nights) and will be staying there again soon. I've chosen the Madison King room each time and find it to be quiet enough for the city. I traveled with my little dog and we enjoyed every visit. The service here has been excellent from beginning to end. They are prompt in correcting any problems that may arise. The most important thing this year was feeling safe and protected, and I definitely found that here with all the measures they're taking to ensure a safe environment in their hotel—it does mean losing certain service touches but that's a small thing to forego for everyone's safety. Many thanks to Molly who has been wonderfully responsive, taking care of everything, and making me feel so very welcome. It is difficult to travel in the time of Covid and still whenever I have to be in NYC I never think twice about where to stay. Staying here is so worth it.

title: Our stay at the Mark Hotel
text:
Dear Manuel,
Seasons Greetings!
On behalf of myself and our group...
I would like to thank you and all your staff for making our stay at the Mark memorable and enjoyable and we were made very much comfortable and felt welcome and at home...
