Abdelmonim

title: Family trip in November
text:
We stayed 4 nights early November as a family of 5 - my husband, two boys ages 3 and 6, and a baby. I originally booked the Seventy Seven Junior suite due to the pull out sofa bed that I planned to have my boys share. The pull out bed is terrible quality - flimsy mattress on bars. Not good sleep even for small children. This room also has no window in the living space - feels like a cave. The bed in the master bedroom was also terrible. In addition to the poor beds, the room was on a low floor, extremely noisy, and lacking blackout drapes. No one slept well.

We moved to the Garden Suite the following day. What a difference! This room was quiet and spacious. There was a full kitchen that we used often with Covid restrictions and eating in. Still no blackout drapes, but you can ask housekeeping to add an additional liner. There were mini robes and slippers for the boys - which they loved! We will definitely come again - and would book this room. The junior suites were not family friendly, in my opinion.

Expect abbreviated service due to Covid (no turn down service) but the staff were overall very helpful and we had a nice stay

title: Many Great Things Along w Some Disappointments
text:
This is a wonderful hotel with a few disappointments. 

I'll start with the pros:

* Greeting: the smiles and attention from the moment we pulled up were  warm and welcoming. We were announced to the front desk where staff was prepped and ready for our arrival.

* Service is quick and attentive, with a smile -- across the board.

* Room -- we were in a Superior Courtyard King, a very minimal upgrade from the Madison King which we booked:

i. spacious bathroom, including two sinks.
ii. Lots of closets/closet space, including a closet in the bathroom.
iii. Amazing strong water pressure in the shower, really rejuvenating!
iv. Nice large size bathroom amenities (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, body lotion), private label from perfumer La Bottega dell’Albergo. 
v. Premium high performing hair dryer.
vi. Ample Sub-Zero fridge/freezer pullout drawers (stocked w mini bar items, but also plenty of extra room to add your own).
vii. USB ports next to each bedside.
viii. Extra large bath towels.
ix. Ability to link bedroom TV to personal Netflix.
x. Good automatic blackout shades.
xi. Very quiet location.
xii. Heated towel rack.

* Elevator generally ready and open/waiting on ground floor.

* Front desk very quick to answer phone for service requests.

* Generous extra free waters from front desk upon request.

* Cool lobby/posh hotel vibe/ambiance.

* Free bikes (also part of the Cons).

Now for the Cons:

* Mattress: uncomfortable/old w weak edges, should have been replaced a long time ago.

*  Air conditioner: wimpy, ineffective -- they offered portable AC to supplement but main AC should be sufficient...temp was only 50 degrees outside.

* Breakfast nickle and diming: we were on a package that included free breakfasts. Despite this, we were only allowed a $30/person credit towards breakfast which doesn't even meet the hotel's own price of $44 for The "Mark Breakfast" (classic American breakfast comprising two eggs, OJ, Coffee and bacon). But try to order some veggies for your omelette and you're hit with ridiculous surcharges (same for ordering 2 thin slices of tomato and onion for a bagel), adding $6-8 per person to the bill. Just a terrible policy on top of an already over-priced breakfast menu.

* Sheets: personally, I didn't like the sheets. I prefer, smoother, softer sheets. I know the hotel lists the sheets as "fine Italian linens" -- I don't doubt them, just not my preference.

* Free bikes, clumsy, hard to ride, and they don't have adult sized bike helmets available. The public blue bikes are better/easier to ride.

title: Excelent!
text: This is my first choice in Manhattan. I love this place, specially the concierge.  The restaurant and bar are amazing. Location is great for Central Park lovers. Room service and housekeeping are great too.

title: Short Staycation at the Mark
text: I arrived at the Mark for my first hotel stay since the beginning of COVID and was just excited to be out of my apartment. I had booked a superior courtyard queen room for over $800 through Amex FHR. On the hotel website, there were several King courtyard rooms and suites available, so was a bit surprised at check-in that we didn't receive a complimentary upgrade through FHR (or any mention of it). I understand with COVID protocols, logistics around upgrades can be complicated, but the fact there was no mention was odd. The guest rooms themselves are quite small for the price paid, but the rooms were clean and comfortable with modern amenities. Room service breakfast was OK, and for well over $100 for two people, seemed mediocre (the pastry basket didn't taste fresh). We did get a $60 breakfast credit through FHR, but that doesn't even cover the continental breakfast package. Also on the dining front, we tried to get a table outside for lunch (we aren't comfortable inside due to COVID) and there were no tables. We ordered room service instead and the food was good. I think it's worth mentioning though that in situations like that, it would be nice if the large room service fees were waived during this time. All in all it was a pleasant stay, but it didn't feel as 5 star as other nearby hotels in the same price point.

title: The best hotel in NYC!!
text:
I love this hotel!  Everything from the location, staff, restaurant and level of professionalism is exceptional!!  I can't wait to go back.  Many thanks to the entire staff at the Mark hotel for once again making my trip in NY the best ever!!
Best,
Mary Covaci

title: The Best of the Best...Truly
text:
For the past couple of months, I’ve needed to find a safe and comfortable place to stay weekly in the City, as I live upstate. The Mark is exceptional in all regards. From the moment I pull up to valet parking, I know I am in the most friendly, inviting, safe and serious hands. Really, the hotel has become my home away from home during a challenging time, personally. The entire team is the jewel in the crown of a quite majestic place. These ladies and gentlemen provide the highest quality service and attention to detail. Individually, wonderful....and as a team, seamless. I look forward to scheduling the next stay even before I check out! 

For what it’s worth, having lived most of my adult life overseas, for decades, I always stayed at The Carlyle when in NYC. As the hotel was closed over the past months, I needed to find another hotel. Someone above, and across the street, led me home.

title: Hidden Exquisite Gem!
text: I had a hard time finding a hotel to come in for medical tests at Mount Sinai.  A competitor recommended THE MARK which I was not familiar with.  I had an OUTSTANDING stay with them.  Super clean, quiet, Covid protocols, stunning room, and the food was outrageously good.  I cannot wait to come back.  Truly the most quiet and comfortable NYC stay I have ever had.  The Mark made my trip during this difficult time for difficult reasons more comfortable and fun than I could imagine.  An added bonus was the Fekkai salon where I was able to get a blow out!  The Mark definitely hits the mark in excellent service and experience!

title: Incredible experience - Wonderful weekend!!
text:
I'm from Switzerland but lived in Manhattan for 25 years on the upper east side. Having moved away last year, I wanted to celebrate my daughter's 14th birthday in the city and explored many hotel options before settling on the Mark for a number of reasons - but primarily cleanliness: so many of the nicer hotels seem to have fallen apart. The Mark is impeccable and the rooms are large.  But let me go back: the rooms are exquisitely clean. I know you might expect this for the rates we pay but... it is not always so. You'd be surprised! The bathrooms at the Mark are gorgeous and the beds very comfortable. Room service is 100% reliable, prompt and adaptable to picky food requests (thank you!)

But honestly what made. the stay 6 stars (yes, 6!) was Isabelle Hogan in the Concierge. Seek her out. She did everything to make our stay perfect. She gave us a late check out, which meant we were able to thoroughly enjoy our next lazy day. She checked in with me to offer all sorts of extra services (facials, massage...) Had I asked for mango out of season, Isabelle would certainly have found one.

Details such as this, the willingness  to say: ' let me offer you a late check out'  makes you want to return again and again. We didn't have to beg, she OFFERED. That's worth the entire trip right there. She is a star. Thank you the Mark and thank you Isabelle!

title: Espectacular Hotel
text:
The best experience in all NYC !! congrats all staff ! i hope come back next month, best place in town, the food, welcome, staff, service, all the details over experience !.

Tnx 4 all ! 

See you soon !

REGARDS

title: Great Return to NYC and The Mark
text: I just spent ten nights at The Mark after an eight month absence due to Covid. It was magical, same kind faces to open the car door, more kind faces to receive me at Reception. My room was spotless as ever and I never felt doubtful about cleaning procedures or steps taken to keep me safe, healthy and happy. The Mark has made the mandated outdoor dining as pleasant as possible with same tasty food and attentive service. I had my family over for two meals in my room, via Room Service, and that was also wonderful. I am booked already to return early December. It was a lovely experience, feeling alive again in such lovely surroundings as The Mark provides.

title: Weekend at the Mark
text: We loved our stay at The Mark! Isabelle, the concierge, was particularly outstanding. She went far beyond the call of duty and helped to make our stay at The Mark a very special one. We can't wait to go back!

title: THE  MARK
text:

                                                    JACQUIE PAGANO

title: Fabulous
text: This is my NYC home! Superb service, everyone is helpful, kind and happy to be there! This staff highly knowledgeable, delighted to help and ensures your stay is perfect. Room is clean, bathroom is spacious and updated. Restaurant is the perfect relaxing atmosphere to make everything perfect! I have never and will never stay anywhere else when I visit NYC.

title: Home away from home
text: We loved our entire experience.  We needed a last minute place to stay that allowed dogs.  From the moment we checked into the hotel, we felt relaxed and were able to unwind and make our unplanned stay a mini vacation.  Even our dog Niko enjoyed the getaway!!!  Isabelle at the front desk was so warm and gracious.  Our room was so comfortable and immaculate.  The bathroom was gorgeous.  We have already booked another getaway and Molly in reservations was most helpful.  My new favorite hotel!!!!

title: Intuitive service
text: On our recent visit to The Mark hotel  we were very impressed with the extra care that Molly and Jennifer provided.  They helped us with all requests anticipating our requests. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the covid prevention protocols have been implemented consistently without impacting the guest experience.

title: Visiting The Mark Hotel in times of Covid
text: I was so grateful to folks at The Mark Hotel on 77th and Madison for their incredible attention to safety and service during such a difficult and unpredictable time for travelers goin to NYC. My wife and I got safety kits upon registration, our room had sat unoccupied for 48 hours before our arrival, and all services were geared toward earning our trust and peace of mind. We've stayed at the Mark before, and it's always been a highlight of any trip to NY, but this time, it was truly appreciated for other reasons as well. Special thanks to the incredible and always thoughtful concierge, Isabelle. The Mark gets high marks in service and safety in these crazy days!

title: A fantastic place to be in the UES!
text: The hotel makes you feel welcome and very safe during these times in every way.  From reservation to customer service at the hotel I was very impressed.  Large rooms, beautiful amenities, and location that is unparalleled.

title: Quintessential Upper East Side Experience
text: I'm a lifelong New Yorker who now lives in Connecticut.  Whenever I go to NYC for overnight stays, I always choose The Mark.  For those who understand Manhattan and, specifically, the Upper East Side, The Mark provides an experience that closely mirrors that of owning your own, beautiful Carnegie Hill apartment, complete with full service staff and a glorious restaurant.  The rooms are striking, comfortable and thoughtfully designed to provide an environment that lends itself to privacy and self-sufficiency.  Also, they have, hands down, the nicest bathrooms in NY - best shower of my life.  In terms of the neighborhood, you're half a block from Central Park, around the corner from top tier retail on Madison and, if you'd like a taste of a refined, Upper East Side cocktail establishment that is both elegant and fun, the bar is an excellent contrast to its stuffy (and creaky) competitor, Bemelman's, across the street.  Another HUGE plus for The Mark is that they are extraordinarily dog friendly.  Most hotels that claim this have limitations on dog sizes exceeding 35 pounds (come on), but The Mark welcomes, literally, all dogs.  We have an 80 pound Lab and they could not have been more accommodating.  I met a fellow guest with three large dogs on hand.  Amazing.  Lastly, the staff, from the management down to the front of house and back of house personnel are all friendly, attentive and go out of their way to make sure you feel welcome, remembered (I've been several times and they make it clear they know that) and special.  If you want to experience a genuine, uptown Manhattan lifestyle (versus the tourist mirages in midtown and south), you cannot do better than The Mark.  I look forward to my next visit, as should you.

title: Exceptional Service
text:
I was a guest at your hotel from July 21, 2020 to July 26, 2020. Not only am I a high maintenance guest but I was in need of many special accommodations due to surgery. 

I was referred to Molly Deutscher to schedule my reservations. Molly epitomizes the definition of  “incomparable”,  “exceptional” and “extraordinary” and should be praised for her attention to detail, incredible customer service, kindness, exemplary professionalism and overall special ability to make me feel like I was family. Molly checked on me after surgery and tended to my every request. Additionally, Molly’s demeanor and personality were so warm and engaging which is an essential characteristic in the hotel industry. Molly provided exceptional service and exceeded my expectations. Molly should be commended by the Mark Hotel. 

Likewise,  other members of the Hotel staff were amazing. 

Isabelle was a breath of fresh air, lit up the room, had a refreshing positive personality and was so delightful. Isabelle tended to my every need with ease, a huge smile (behind her mask), exemplary professionalism and warmth. Isabelle provided outstanding and exceptional service to me during my stay. This is very rare considering a Hotel has many guests and customer service by a concierge is a more than a full time job. Isabelle should also be commended by the Mark Hotel. 

Ria was especially thoughtful and kind. Alex was wonderful when he installed the new air conditioner and also assisted me with other tasks in my room. Stan and Michael were also very accommodating and very friendly to me during my stay. IAdditionally, I do not have names but all of the members of the housekeeping staff but they were wonderful and made sure my room was clean and filled with necessary supplies.  This was especially important during a pandemic. 

Due to your remarkable staff and the exceptional way I was treated,  I will be returning to the Mark Hotel in the near future.

title: Top Marks for THE MARK HOTEL
text: My wife and I, along with our 2 dogs, were recently forced to leave our home because of widespread power outages in CT, lasting for days. We had stayed at The Mark several times before and, knowing they were pet friendly, called to secure a reservation. I initially spoke with Jennifer, the Director of Revenue, who was working exceedingly hard to accommodate the deluge of reservation requests. She expertly handled all aspects and we were soon checking in. Keep in mind, during this pandemic, most of the top-tier hotels in Manhattan are not even open! (St. Regis, Four Seasons among them). The front door staff were quick to greet us, assisting with not only the luggage but the dogs, as well. They could not have been more pleasant. Once we checked in, we did, however, experience some temperature-related issues with our room and before I could even contact Jennifer about this, she was calling me to see how our room was! Immediately upon hearing our concerns that our AC was not working properly, she quickly connected us with Olivia, a Sales Coordinator, who was simply amazing. She literally worked until 10pm finding us the perfect room, which was not easy considering how busy the hotel was, with so many others like us, affected by this storm that ravaged CT. She personally showed us several rooms and suites, giving her candid assessment on each one. She was simply amazing and in the hospitality business, you don't always get such a gem. Michael, the bellman, transferred our luggage to the new room and could not have been nicer.  Once we got settled in, we realized that not only did they find us the perfect room, but Olivia and Jennifer arranged for some wonderful desserts to be waiting for us, along with a nice note from the GM, Manuel Martinez. That was a very sincere and classy gesture. Between the location, the Jean Georges restaurant (amazing as always) and most of all, the terrific people mentioned above, we could not be more grateful. The entire experience was exceptional.THANK YOU🙏

title: Staycation
text: We decided to stay a few days at The Mark as some work needed to be done to our condo. The stay was excellent and we appreciated all the covid 19 procedures. The rooms was nicely decorated and staff friendly. Although the hotel offered limited services, the experience was still 5 stars.

title: Awful
text:
Our family stayed in two rooms, including one premium suite, at the Mark in July.  There were signs that the hotel was off its game as it struggles to rebound from the dip caused by the COVID crisis.  Occupancy was far from full.  The rooms were 78 degrees when we arrived in the heat of the summer and it was a struggle to get them to a comfortable temperature during our stay,  the bagels served with the expensive room service were stale and the rest of the food was subpar, and housekeeping didn't replenish the coffee cups we had used with the Keurig machine in the room.

Although this was all far less than we would expect from a five star hotel, we tried to overlook these inconveniences with a spirit of understanding.  Until it was time to pay our bill...

The hotel had advertised the fourth night free with a four night stay.  The bill presented indicated no discount at all.  I told the clerk at checkout that the bill was wrong.  I asked that the changes be refunded on my card and I asked for an email with the correct charges.  I was assured that the reservations manager would take care of that, and we left.

We later received an email from the reservations manager stating that we had booked a different promotion (20% off instead of the fourth night free - which was a worse deal for us), and that the bill already reflected a discount, although none was shown on the bill.  The charges matched the full price we had seen advertised at the time we booked our stay.  In short, the hotel gave us no discount, but claimed that they had, by appearing to play a game of "gotcha" instead of providing us with the best available discount.  I complained and have expressed my dissatisfaction to the reservations manager, but have had no response.  

Character is revealed when times are tough.  I am left with the impression that the Mark is trying to recoup lost revenue at the expense of guests like me.  I'd expect better from any hotel, let alone one that charges premium prices and claims to provide a first class experience.  The Mark failed us on all fronts, and worse than that, disrespectfully.  We'll never stay there again.

title: Relax and pamper
text:
I liked the location.
NYC is experiencing the COVID virus, saw a review on Trip Advisor that concerned me. The hotel made m3 feel very safe. 
I arrived to the hotel valet parked my car. Checkin was quick and efficient. Request a 2 hour early check in it was granted.
Got a free room upgrade. The room is amazing!!!!! I had to call for ice, extra pillows and towels arrived very quickly. 

The only thing that was negative was the selection from room service.  My plan was to take a hot bath and splurge on room service.  The menu was very limited maybe because of COVID. I was disappointed.
I can say I will go back for my birthday getaway, hopefully the room service menu will have more options.

title: The best
text: Absolutely loved staying here with my baby and toddler. An easy walk to the playground in Central Park, that the girls loved. Amazing room service and great cocktails from the buzzing bar. We loved the hot dogs and the Bergdorf bike. Will return every time we are in the city.

title: Employee Entered my room Staring at Me while I was sleeping
text: I stayed for 4 nights at the Mark in January 2020.  I had dinner at their restaurant with my friends, went up to my room, got into bed it was about 10:00pm.  I fell asleep and i woke up to someone staring at me bedside.  It was an employee un announced saying I requested towels.  I was freaked out.  I told him to get out of the room.  I immediately called downstairs and told them about the situation.  I also called in the morning and spoke to management.  Everyone was aware of what happened to me.  And management did nothing.  This is not a safe place to stay.  I wanted to share this with other single women to know.  Beware

title: Wonderful!
text: The kindness I experience when I come to this hotel is wonderful. Beautiful atmosphere, staff is professional and caring, room is spotless, great restaurant. When I travel to NYC I can’t stay any where else. The Mark is my NYC home!

title: The Mark has Caring Service
text: From the doorman to the concierge and reception this place has the service you would expect and want from a hotel. I had a stressful event ( that had nothing to do with the hotel) at 2am. Marion from reception and Carlos could not have been more understanding and accommodating. Their actions made me feel like they cared about my welfare. Marion followed up and made sure everything was taken care of. I could not be happier with the way I was treated. The mark of exceptional service is how well the staff solves problems. I give The Mark and Marion the highest of endorsement.

title: Above and beyond
text:
Family and business take me to New York every few months -out of the dozens of hotels I’ve stayed in the Mark is a gem !
The location size and attention to each guest makes this quite the oasis of calm in the frantic city .
A very special shout out to Riya at the front desk-Riya takes the time /trouble /care to make each stay very personal .
I checked in with my 85 year old mother and Riya made sure each of us had a room that suited us -this is the service that regardless of price makes a guest say -I will be back .

title: Always wonderful!!
text: The elegance of The Mark is always lovely and relaxing. The rooms are smooth and sparklingly clean. But ultimately, the best part is the always wonderful service from the welcoming and professional staff.  The staff is totally amazing!! You can see that it is the goal of management to provide the highest standard of customer service. We will definitely return:):)

title: Superb Hotel
text: Myself & my sister visted the Mark Hotel while in NYC as I wanted to see where Meghan Markle had her baby shower. We were not sure if we could go in but we were warmly greeted at the door & directed to where everything was without having to ask. The staff were so friendly towards us. We had coffee & chatted to two lovely people at the bar.. Highly recommend a visit...

title: Outstanding Location, Property and Customer Service
text: The Mark is our "home away from home" when visiting NYC, which we have done about every 4-6 weeks over the last several years. The property is a true gem. The location is ideal, and the staff displays a true "customer-centric" orientation. The concierge team (Isabelle, Jackie, Helen, Gabriela, and Melisa) are truly outstanding examples and go out of the way to ensure your needs are successfully achieved. So are the doormen and front desk teams. In short, we are treated like family, and we have enjoyed getting to know everyone there. We strongly recommend you make this your next choice when in NYC; you will NOT be disappointed.

title: Absolutely incredible NYC stay
text: We have stayed in a lot of 5* hotels. We live in NYC and do a staycation now and again. Cannot recommend The Mark enough. The service from every single person we encountered was impeccable. The vibe is luxurious but relaxed. Great food and drinks. It was my birthday and they sent a few special treats. Best luxury NYC hotel!

title: A True Gem-Elegant Yet Unpretentious
text:
The Mark Hotel is a true gem in NYC.
My husband and I ( New Yorkers) could not have had a better time at The Mark.
From the moment we arrived each member of The Mark team greeted us with a warm welcome.
The Mark team is outstanding with great attention to detail making certain the guest experience is superb.
The rooms are beautifully appointed and extremely comfortable and quiet.
Loved the gym which for a property with 153 rooms is larger and better equipped then many larger hotels I've stayed at. The Peloton bike was a great surprise.
The location is convenient to a great number of museums in walking distance or a short subway or taxi ride away as well as to the theater district.
If you are looking for a special shopping experience Madison Avenue is where you will find it.
Special thank yous to Concierges Gabriela Popeti and Isabelle Hogan as well as Ryan in The Mark Bar and Molly Deuthcher for her kindness.
Our 3 night stay at the Mark was exceptional and we are already planning our next stay.

title: The Mark is a club like little gem on the upper East side of NYC
text: I am a fan on The Mark Hotel for many reasons. The location canNOT be beat. Surrounded by some of the best NYC restaurants, shops and close to wonderful art museums, etc., the size of the hotel, though not small, is more intimate than many of the city's other top tier hotels. From Doormen, to Check-in, to Concierge to the FABULOUS Frederik Fekkai salon, the John Lobb shoe shine operation, the contemporary but very comfy and cool rooms, the hotel feels like some private club that only a select few have the pleasure to belong to. But of course it isn't a club. It is open to all. Just its size allows the staff to treat every guest like a returning friend.  The Mark Bar, which is cool and sexy somehow,  and all of the above makes so one really never leave the hotel, or walk beyond a 4 block area, to have a perfect stay. I should know. I just checked out 2 days ago. I am also a client of The Lowell Hotel,The Park Hyatt (if you don't know, do not assume this is like any other Hyatt you have ever seen), The Four Seasons, etc.,etc. and The Mark has become my NYC home away from home.I feel happiest and most cared for there.  It could not happen with out amazing employees. I must commend especially Mr. Manuel Martinez (GM); Ms. Molly Deutscher (the GM's right hand), the head concierge Isabelle ,and Artan at the Front Desk. Each of these people  are a hotel guest's dream of what hotel employees should be!  You won't be sorry if you try The mark. Just do me a favor, don't make it so I can't get a room next time I visit NYC! Hahaha!

title: I'd give this 11 stars if I could
text: I'm not even sure where to begin with how amazing my experience was with The Mark Hotel. First and foremost I have to thank Molly Deutscher. I wanted to have a little staycation with my girlfriend for her birthday and Molly went above and beyond to provide us with everything and anything we could think of. There was a cake and bottle of wine waiting for us in our room, the doormen and concierge knew who we were the second we arrived and could not be more accommodating, there was a reservation for us for breakfast and literally everything was so smooth and easy. the room itself was a thing of beauty. The bathroom was huge, the bed was so comfortable and everything was spotlessly clean. Again, if you can get a hold of Molly to help book your stay here you won't be let down. It was the greatest hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC and their attention to detail is unrivaled. I would give this place 11 out of 5 stars if I could!!!!

title: 5☆ Luxury in Manhattan
text: My husband and I had a terrific two night stay at The Mark. The food at Jean-Georges was excellent and our room was top notch. I can't say enough good things about the staff and service; simply amazing! Special thanks to Ms. Minela for all her help and attention to detail; we felt extremely special! We can not thank you enough and will definitely be returning to The Mark.

title: The most incredible birthday stay thanks to Molly Deutscher!
text:
I had the absolute pleasure of booking a birthday stay with Molly Deutscher.
She is the most kind, helpful, person I have ever worked with at any hotel.
Her level of customer service is absolutely impeccable! She was always available to answer questions and assist me with my reservations with the most positive attitude.  I will most definitely be referring my friends and family to stay at the Mark Hotel simply due to her level of service!

title: Didn’t mark a mark......
text:
This was a combined holiday and work trip.  The hotel is well located one block from Central Park on 77th, and 2 blocks from the subway station on the 6 line. Service was good and the hotel was lovely but for how expensive this hotel is, I did not feel it was special enough, I’ve been lucky to stay at some amazing hotels around the world where you leave feeling really spoilt in a great environment, The Mark did not leave that mark on me particularly for somewhere that describes itself as New York’s most boldly lavish hotel.   The restaurant, the bar, the cocktails, housekeeping all good.  Room 509 great, loved the big shower and proper lighting for shaving in the bathroom ( can’t believe how many luxury hotels get this wrong).  

I would stay here again but would want to try other options in NY at this price.

title: What a pleasurable experience
text:
Cannot say enough about this hotel. I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels for business travel as well as family vacations and The Mark Hotel works hard behind the scenes to exceed your expectations. The staff throughout are the most notable difference to other hotels. From the greeting at the door when you park your car, to those at the front desk checking in, to the concierge service, to the restaurant and bar staff - each greeted you with a smile, confidence and thoroughness. 

The rooms are modern, clean and quiet. I preferred the courtyard as there was zero street noise. High quality work out room too! Location is great for walks to Central Park, Shopping on Madison Street and local restaurants. 

You will be thrilled you stayed here.

title: Best experience ever!
text:
My wife and I had a wonderful and memorable stay at The Mark.

Amazing staff from Adnan at the door, to Gabriella the concierge and Anastasia in housekeeping.

We loved the elegance, design and comfort of the room.
Great attention to details from the team.

We will definitely be back and make The Mark our base while in NYC!

title: Superb
text:
BH 
Great boutique feeling.. 
Nice architecture and nice elegant details in many small gestures  

Definitly the hotel in NYC 
Specially of you want to have the celebrity feeling and avoiding crowd streets in NYC  like 5th Ave...

title: luxurious and friendly
text: my friend and i took a mother/daughter trip and stayed at the mark for the first time this weekend. we live in dallas but both lived in ny previously and travel there often. i think the mark will be our new home away from home. the staff was amazing from the same bellman greeting us all four days to the reservation manager that left gifts and a tent in our room for my daughter’s birthday. we loved the chic lobby and bar. i loved the bed, linens and shower. the girls loved how bubbly the shower gel got in the bathtub. i liked how my window could open a bit, and it had blackout shades. my friend and i had king rooms with a private hallway connecting them. it was the perfect stay!

title: What a great place in a great place
text:
We’d been to the Mark Restaurant once for lunch a few years a go. We were always impressed by the neighborhood it was in and thought it would be a good place to stay as Midtown can be so congested all the time. We were glad we did! The neighborhood is indeed quieter but there is a lot to do right around there as the Museums are easily accessible and Madison has great shopping. 
The hotel itself has a warm and intimate feeling. Rooms are spacious and service fantastic. 
I especially want to call out Molly and Isabelle and Timothy! They were the icing on the cake!

title: Unparalleled service and a phenomenal experience - my favorite Manhattan hotel!
text:
The Mark is absolutely my favorite hotel in NYC and truly my "home away from home."  I love it more each time I visit - the hotel product, little details and level of service provided by each and every team member is truly unparalleled.  

Molly D. was a tremendous help confirming my reservation details, and she is a truly phenomenal representative of the Mark brand to its guests - going above and beyond to make your stay memorable.  Restaurant is excellent, service top notch, and hotel rooms residential and upscale.  Already looking forward to finding a reason to return!

title: Best Service and Hotel in NYC
text:
For many years now, My wife and I have considered The Mark our, “home away from home” while visiting New York. I just wanted to share a few words about this great hotel. 

The entire team at The Mark do an unbelievably good job in every regard. From the moment We pull up on 77th Street it is a pleasure to see all my friends at the door - always welcoming us with a smile and a handshake, “welcome back.” The front desk team from Minela and Melissa down through the line are always so helpful with whatever we need. Your concierge team led by the MOST FABULOUS Isabelle and supported by Jacky, Gabriella and Helen are the best in the business. I stay at great hotels around the world and I have never been treated as well as I am at The Mark. 

The team makes my family feel special every time! From your amazing Mark tee pee in the room to the beautiful balloons for my daughters recent birthday, you guys go above and beyond and I want you to know that I sincerely appreciate it. 

I will forever be a fan of The Mark because of the amazing people that run the hotel. You have assembled The dream team. Well done.

title: Luxury at its finest
text: Such a Unique hotel. Our first impression set the tone for our entire stay AND DID NOT DISAPPOINT. It was our first time staying in the UES and I cannot imagine staying anywhere else. We were greeted by Arten at the front desk. He was so sweet and welcoming. He even became recognized my boys every morning while we were there :-) My 9 year old would be excited to see his "friend" at the front desk before we headed out. Special thank you to Arten for taking a little extra time to brighten my boys day. You made their visit memorable.

title: Incredible Team of Bellmen
text: Our family of 6 (2 adults and 4 little children) spent the week of New Year’s Eve at The Mark.  The boutique hotel was constructed with solid quality materials.  The interior design was nice overall (not looking like it’s 1 of many other cookie cutter versions). Bottled water was complementary.  The Nespresso machine wasn’t placed in the room at time we checked in, but when requested, housekeeping promptly brought it up.  Housekeeping never made us wait for too long for any room service orders.  I was always referred to by my name by all staff members each time i placed a call.  All staff members were very courteous and non-pretentious, but the team that really brought in the medal was the bellmen.  They talked to our children as though they had been friends for a long time.  Obviously, the way to the heart of many parents is through the children.  I had a wonderful chat with a bellman from Tibet, where he had worked as a guide, reaching the top of Mt Everest 5 times.  I just now finished watching his talk on Ted Talk podcast.  Meeting hospitality staff with unique background certainly adds another layer of fun to any trip.  We are used to the bells and whistles like s’mores and kids clubs at other hotels, and did feel we wished there was something for us to do in the hotel after after dinner.  Nevertheless, we never felt out of place with our children at The Mark. Overall, two thumbs up for the entire stay

title: Special thank you, Helen Chiang and Tatiana Zolotareva
text: I want to express my appreciation for the professional assistance of concierge service at the Mark Hotel, especially Helen Chiang and Tatiana Zolotareva. They were able to arrange everything that I need. Service went above and beyond what I expected. Thank you

title: Bar
text:
I met friends for drinks. The bar is charming and fun. Great ambiance. The service needs to be improved but frankly it does not matter. I will definitely go back. Great winter hang out before dinner.
🥂

title: Top Notch Hotel
text: I suppose you could classify this as a boutique hotel.  Great service, rooms are very nice but not cheap.  Hotel Bar is very, very small and often populated with locals - can be very hard to get a seat, which is a problem.  Food pretty good.  5 minute walk from The Met.  1-2 blocks from Central Park.  Very short walk to Guggenheim and other great museums.  Pretty decent gym for a hotel.  Luxury hotel to be sure.  Staff very, very accommodating and pleasant to deal with - probably the best aspect of our stay.  Certainly go back.  Not quite the Baccarat but considerably cheaper and arguably in better section of NYC.

title: "Average" (or worse) is the word ...
text: We've stayed at The Mark several times recently.  Always very good, but this time they were clearly "off" their game.  Had late check out confirmed but was locked out of our room.  Tons of mistakes at both breakfast and lunch:  forever to get food, wrong food, missing drinks, no refills on drinks, etc.  The couple next to us had to wait 35 minutes for their breakfast.  Another couple sent back drinks b/c the tomato juice was bad.  We had to fight for decent tables (twice) -- even though we had reservations (both times):  they wanted to seat us right by the kitchen or by the front door -- and the restaurant had plenty of empty tables!  Incredibly, they were irritated that we requested different tables!  Again, we had reservations and were hotel guests.  Just off -- the whole weekend.  Hopefully, this was a one-off.  Not sure about booking The Mark again.  The Amex Fine Hotels Program has a ton of alternatives in NYC.

title: THE BEST HOTEL IN NY
text:
The best Hotel in New York.
I had an opportunity to meet by chance in the  hotel elevator  with the General Manager and a Front Desk Manager and the General  gave me his card. I mentioned to him at that time how impressed I was with the service at the Mark. 
And now I want to reiterate that  in this post.  How professional, respectful and accommodating the staff at the property has been to me (and to my family at times).  I am a frequent “stayer” at the hotel.  Most of the staff recognizes me and I am always greeted by a “welcome back” or a “good to see you again”.  From the bell men to room service, everyone is extraordinarily wonderful. 
I would like to say also that Timothy has always gone above and beyond to make my stay delightful and stress-free.  He is a true professional and has a great sense of humor. 
Although I am usually traveling on business, I often feel as though I am on vacation at this hotel.  During my last stay I had my two teenage daughters with me and they were treated like royalty!  
I have a few more trips back to NYC that I am finalizing and will be staying at your hotel…… and looking forward to it!  You are the best. Happy 2020.
Thank you again for continuing to provide me (and everyone else!) a lovely experience.  See you soon,Vicky !

title: A gem on the Upper Eastside
text: The Mark Hotel came highly recommended and certainly lived up to its billing.. An elegant boutique hotel in a great location close to the designer stores of Madison Avenue and a short hop to Central Park. The Junior Suite was spacious and comfortable for a family of 4. Service was superb and very friendly, and we enjoyed some delicious breakfasts in the restaurant. All in all a great stay and we hope to return very soon!

title: Perfeito
text: Instalações impecáveis, incrivelmente silencioso apesar da proximidade com a Madison Avenue. Restaurante e bar fantásticos. Serviço mais do que atencioso. Concierge ajudou muito com reservas. Vale o preço alto.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We recently stayed at The Mark to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The location is superb, half a block from Central Park, within 10 mins walk to The Met and other galleries, fabulous shopping. The staff was lovely from the Housekeeping , Room Service, Front Desk. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we waited at the bar. After a quick snack and drink we were personally escorted to our room by a member of the Front Desk staff who was exceptionally kind. Before too long there was a knock at our door and we were treated to a bottle of champagne and a beautiful dessert from Laduree in honour of our special anniversary! We really felt indulged!  Beautiful quiet room on 77th, you can actually get a peaceful nights rest here. We will definitely stay again.

title: Wonderful
text: This very well located boutique hotel in Manhattan’s UES  is on Madison Ave. This hotel has a great staff!  From the valet to the front desk to the maid everyone is friendly, accommodating and helpful. Prices are high but the price matches the the hotels high standards for quality.  Jean Georges V. Restaurant is adjacent to the chic lobby. The great looking  bar attracts a  very active UES singles scene at night. It is not disruptive. My only complaint, albeit minor, is breakfast. Served in the Jean George restaurant, the quality and service do not match the prices. I have to acknowledge I’ve stayed in other comparable NYC hotels and found their breakfast prices quite high as well. As a relatively frequent visitor to NYC, my original home I would not hesitate to stay here again and again.

title: Wonderful Experience!
text:
On a whim, I recently decided to make a trip by myself to NYC at the young age of 84, which was my first trip which I planned by myself!  I was recommended the Mark hotel by a close friend as a wonderful boutique hotel which catered to the individual needs of each guest.  I had very high expectations based on the recommendation, and the stay exceeded these expectations!

The personal touches by the hotel staff made my stay in NYC a wonderful and personal experience.  Thank you so much for making my stay so memorable!

title: From Zero to Hero
text:
Our experience at The Mark started way below any expectations we had. 

The staff said something promising but then performed otherwise, to the point that we got so frustrated that we were looking to forfeit the rest of our stay and go somewhere else. 

Thankfully the GM took the matter into his own hands, and suddenly everything changed for the better. 
Now, all the reasons why you stay and pay for a 5 star hotel were given to us. The follow up, the turndown service, the personalization etc. were finally there!. 
Now we are able to see what they are capable to do...

Regarding the quality of the rooms we cannot say enough good things! The sizes of the rooms are generous and the pressure of the shower head is incredible. Also very comfy beds and all of the new gadgets for your iPhone are there for you.

Certainly the growth and perfection of The Mark Hotel will be exponential under this type of management.

title: THE HOTEL !!!!!!
text: This hotel defines luxury, What an amazing experience !!! Best one ever!! 4th time staying here, first time with the family  and definitely not the last!!  The moment you meet the General Manager at the door greeting guests...... that means a lot. I have seen things just got better. The rooms are works of art in every way, the black and white marble in the bathroom is to die for!! The staff impeccable, Can not speak highly enough of this place . Hotel is et friendly as its best. It is a must if you are in NYC!! Tim, Ria and Astrid at the desk, Door and Housekeeping teams are amazing. Masiel at the restaurant. You will be wowed on a whole new level. Great  location to Madison avenue shopping. Plenty of restaurants around nearby. The MET  a good short walk down. Concierge service was Informative and excellent service provided by Isabelle and Pablo.   A must when in New York !

title: Excelente hotel em localização ideal
text:
Ótima opção em New York. Localização excelente, quartos bons, serviço competente.  Tradicional e impecável.
Ao lado do Central Park, bons restaurantes na redondeza na Madison. Uma das áreas agradávelis de Manhattan 
.

title: Excellent Service..pristine accoutrement
text: Been staying at the Mark for over 10 years.  They continue to impress with the level of service (its all in the details) and in their rooms' quality and freshness.   Wether needing the "house car" , (a new Cadillac Escalade) to take you to a dinner because you are running late or the "welcome gift" (in our case quality Burgundy wine and fresh fruit)  the staff seems to always be there to make your stay more comfortable and productive.  The rooms which already are furnished with high quality finishes are maintained to an exacting standard....carpeting, bedding, casegoods, and bathroom fixtures are all meticulously cleaned and cared for.  Also of note there seems to always be ample closet space in the different room levels, which even for a short stay can be useful.  Some rooms are small...but its Manhattan so that is to be expected.  If needed, upgrading to the larger size rooms does make a difference. If staying for a few nights might be worth it.  The location is the Upper East Side of Manhattan.  Its more of a neighborhood feeling and a little quieter than midtown which we like.

title: Cher et peu accueillant!
text:
Nous avons passé 3 jours dans cet établissement ( 1 jours de moins que prévu!). Situé sur Madison avenue, pas loin de Central Park( lieu d’arrivée du marathon ce pourquoi nous étions venus), cet hôtel très ancien et très très cher n’offre pas les prestations attendues par rapport aux 5 étoiles affichées! Le lobby est petit et sinistre, le personnel qui se veut aimable est plus obséquieux qu’efficace. Impossible d’avoir une orange pressée au bar que de la conserve...dans la Suite dont je tairai le prix... même pas une corbeille de fruits ni une boisson, il a fallu réclamer pour obtenir quelque chose. Normalement les boissons ( eaux et sodas) sont gratuites... ici tout est payant et pas donné! 
La chambre hormis, le lit excellent, ne donnait sur... rien du tout , des vis à vis de tous les côtés, bien équipée en SDB mais très chiche sur les produits fournis...
Loin de tout, sauf de Central Park, il faut prendre des taxis pour aller n’importe où ...
Le petit déjeuner est servi avec une lenteur telle que cela peut être votre lunch... bon, sans plus et cher!
Bref, nous ne le recommanderons à aucun de nos amis! Erreur de choix bien regrettable !

title: Help with birthday gift for guest
text: Our daughter recently celebrated her birthday at the Mark. We wanted to welcome her with flowers, wine, candy, and balloons but live out of town. Matt, the manager, couldn't have been more helpful and professional. He took care of everything. It was all in her room when she checked in-she was thrilled!

title: Il mio preferito a New York
text:
Dopo aver provato four season, the plaza, plaza athene, Bacarat, etc... abbiamo trovato il nostro hote a New York.
The mark ha una bella posizione, arredi, colazione, stanze, cortesia, servizi... pienamente soddisfatta di questo hotel!
Consigliato a tutti!!!!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The hotel has amazing suites, modern and elegant. Excellent  location in the Upper East side , only half a block away from Central Park and room service and the restaurant are very good. Highly recommended!

title: lovely hotel
text:
very good location. Very nice and quired rooms. They have a cool (hotel)bar which we can recommend you. 
Great employees.
Unfortunately, Breakfast service is very inefficient , a bit chaotic. The oatmeal was served without a spoon, coffee needed more than 15 minutes, instead of ordered dark bread we got sweets.

title: Seen better days trading on its past
text:
Arrogant & complacent . Overpriced & underwhelming  with failure to proactively activate Virtuoso benefits .Service is poor . I asked for a sparkling water which never turned up. The in house  telephone system is poor and leaves guests hanging seemingly forever on a circuit.Rooms are tired and smell musty. AC is noisy . Bathroom towels feel like sandpaper.I particularly resent paying for an early morning coffee in the lobby when every other hotel offers a station complimentary not to mention the full price being charged for a room. Breakfast quality is good albeit not great (stale muffin) & the service is average .
JG Grill for dinner was buzzing and excellent .
All in all , aside from the location and proximity to Central Park for an early morning run, lacklustre at best

title: Unimpressive
text: I just checked into the hotel for a special birthday weekend and what a terrible letdown! Spent $30 at the bar for a drink while I waited for my room, bartender was aloof and had an argument with a customer about his dissatisfaction over a coffee drink. Red flag when a service professional argues with a customer, especially at these prices. Front desk associates were very polite, but couldn’t do much about the embarrassing condition of our ‘deluxe’ room on a low floor, with stained carpets and wallpaper, and a mildew odor. Hot dog, from the cart out front, was the highlight of the hotel so far. We should have stayed at The Four Seasons.

title: 文句なし
text:
NYに滞在するなら、選択肢のひとつに入るべきホテルだと思います。
すこし場所が不便に感じるかもしれませんが、設備、内装、サービスいずれもハイクオリティです。アメリカの良いところを感じられると思います。

title: Great stay!
text: I love staying at the Mark hotel. The bathrooms are big and beautiful with plenty of mirrors and great lighting. The rooms are spacious. Service is what you’d expect from a hotel of this quality. It’s very quiet. They have complimentary pedi cabs to Bergdorfs, and bikes with baskets and locks that you can take into the park since it’s only a block away. Michelin Star restaurant on site with amazing chocolate croissants.

title: Loved it
text:
We had to go to NY for two nights on business. We chose The Mark based on its location which we found to be perfect for our needs. Our room which I think was on the 8th floor was comfortable, clean, and extremely quiet. Not very big but all we needed. We ate at the hotel restaurant once for dinner and once for breakfast. Food was very nice, service was ok but not outstanding. 

Before our arrival at the hotel we had arranged a late check out, but on the day of departure two different hotel employees came to our door within half an hour of each other and politely asked us when we were leaving. That weirdness aside, we absolutely loved the place and would definitely go back.

title: Bohemians like us
text: Das ungewöhnliche Streifenmuster der Lobby setzt sich im Bad des Zimmers fort und steht stellvertretend für die Ausrichtung vieler Gäste. Hip, extrovertiert und solvent ist das Publikum das Hotel und Bar bevölkert. Klar werden Abgrenzungen zum plüschigen, traditionellen Auftritt etwa des Waldorf Astoria gesetzt. Die Zimmer sind großzügig, sehr elegant einweichtet und entsprechen dem 5* Standard.

title: New York Fashion Week
text: Great location, beautiful boutique hotel. VERY small room but it was decorated nicely, it was remodeled and clean. Definitely not the best service (it took forever for reception and concierge to answer the phone, no one ever came up to help with our bags, had to call three times for an iron and then we were delivered two steamers) . Small but efficient gym. Great breakfast and room service. Similar feel to The Surrey.

title: Bom restaurante
text: Dentro do The Mark hotel. Ótima comida, preços não muito baratos mas ambiente gostoso e serviço prestativo. Carta de vinhos cara. Pratos deliciosos ! Recebe reservas até as 22:30. Super recomendo! Delicioso

title: Tennis at Open
text: Traveled up to NY for business and tennis. Was at the Mark for five nights. Room was on third floor. Good sized for NY. Well laid out and nicely furnished. Room faced 77th st, which I understand is better than Madison.  Still some street noise - sirens and trash cans being moved around, but NY... I like the Marks location  because it is near the park. Central Park is a great feature as are museums which are also near by.  Service was very good. We ate either at tennis or restaurants I enjoy nearby.  We did have dinner at hotel one night and it didn’t disappoint.  As I was there for tennis, it was nice to run across tennis players around the hotel. Only disappointment was kitchen fire early this morning, which prompted a couple of very loud alarms along with smoke smell that made it to third floor.  No apology at check out or even discussion of event was surprising and why review went from five stars to four.

title: The best service!
text: We stayed in a spacious one bedroom suite with two full baths.  The hotel is everything you would expect in a premier level property.  Most impressive is how helpful and genuinely friendly all of the staff is.

title: Thank goodness for The Mark
text: We had a reservation at another hotel a block away and the A/C broke in our room at middle. Our travel agent scrambled to get us into The Mark and w it was excellent! Will plan to stay there again when visiting NYC. Wonderful service and great breakfast. Highly recommend!

title: First time will not be the last time
text: The  Mark is a quiet charming jewel in the city.   Check In was easy and the room was very pleasant.  The staff is so there to please you.   Small and intimate. It is a great place to unwind after a busy day in the city.

title: Wonderful Weekend at the Mark
text: I visited the Mark earlier this summer with my mother, and we had an excellent stay! The concierge were so nice and helpful, and the hotel itself, from the lobby to our room, is stunning. If you are looking for a quintessential Upper East Side hotel, look no further. We ate a small lunch in the bar area, which was great, and breakfast in the main dining room, which although expensive, was very delicious. I highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

title: Like a Rolling Stone
text: Stayed here for 4 nights in 2 interconnecting rooms on 4th floor. Faultless service from front of house and support staff. The Mark is a small, friendly , luxurious (and not in the Dubai bling way) hotel. Good enough for Ronnie W. Good enough for us.

title: Like a home in NYC
text: Outstanding location, facility and service. Feels like a home in NY. Exceptional service from the welcoming door staff, front desk and concierge. Every possible comfort is provided for. Great bar and restaurant. Rooms appointed beautifully down to beds and linens. We stay in the hotel on every visit to NYC.

title: Top of the Charts--The Mark is best boutique hotel 2019
text:
From start to finish this hotel is top to the MARK.....The front end from reservations--to check in--to the room selectons--they are terrific--ours was a small apartment with great views---
The bell man(s) Victor and Richard---Cars parked out front;;;;the quaint in front Bar --terrific--the Jean George Restaurant is to of the chart---even breakfast ius an event--Their are many celebrities .that stay there and get in way---Lady Gaga in lobby while we =were there---oops..
Service is the best---Dinner there is great--close to everything---Great shopping---PediCabs to take you anywhere--Bergdoffs---if you need anything they take you there...Front desk cherry and helpful--It's expensive but worth everty penny---
we ate at Le Bernadine--see our review at best resturant in the USA  Over the top--THE BEST

title: Outstanding property, service and location.
text: I can not say enough great things about this property and every employee that I encountered during my stay. I visited NYC with my 5 yo son, it was his first trip to the big apple. Greeted with a smile from the moment we arrived until the day we left. Concierge was the best I have encountered. Minela went above and beyond to ensure my son had an experience of a lifetime. Location was perfect to drown out some of the noise in the city but, close enough to get downtown fairly quickly to explore the Lego and M&M store. The house pedi-cab ride to Central Park was a highlight for my son and I. Jackie with conceirge recommended a spot in Central Park that we both enjoyed. Clean room, turn down service, great location, house car to close locations, house pedi-cab rides, nice cafe around corner...worth every penny. I debated between The Mark, Plaza or Four Seasons. I just can not imagine that I would have been given the same level of service in the larger hotels. I would not risk trying another location because The Mark sets the bar for hotels in NYC.

title: Well deserved stay
text: Perfectly located one block away from central park and Park avenue, the hotel gives you the option to go shopping to exclusive chops in one side while you can go and take a break to central park. Beautifully decorated french style hotel makes the best experience of New York. Staff is very professional and very helpful always willing to please any request, it was a very pleasant stay. I definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great location and food.  Uneven service......
text:
The Mark has a great location on 77th Street between Madison and Fifth.  You are literally two minutes form Central Park.  The rooms are clean and modern design without being clinical.  They have great showers with endless hot water, and nice touches like wireless charging pads by the bed.  

I only ate breakfast one day at the Mark (more on that later) but it was excellent in presentation and taste.  There are two bars with friendly, but not intrusive, bar tenders who know how to mix a good cocktail.  Room service is a bit more hit and miss.  Breakfast is supposed to start at 6.30 but when I called then, I was told no one was in yet.  The next day when I did get a pot of tea, it took two times to get it right, which it really should not when you are paying $32.75 plus tip for it.

The last day I tried to get a table for breakfast at 8.15am and was told they were fully booked.  I explained I was staying at the hotel and "Nicole" at the restaurant let me know, with dripping sarcasm, that she really didn't give a s**t.  Well I guess you only get so much for $700 a night.  Fortunately, Helen, the excellent concierge, booked me into Cafe Boulud, one block south and saved the day.

So would I stay there again?  Yes.  Everyone has a bad day now and again and perhaps I just got unlucky.  Overall its good, sometimes great, hotel in a wonderful location. Oh, and with a very good concierge.....

title: Great hotel
text: Switched from the Mark to the Mandarin about 15 years ago.  Tried the Mark a few months ago and liked the new remodeled hotel.  Came back again and had a good stay.  Great neighborhood and quiet for NYC.  Rooms very nice and good workout facilities along with the Park for jogs.  I also very much like the Jean Georges restaurant.  I have been a JG fan for many years and the food and atmosphere at the restaurant are very good.  The sauce on my halibut was memorable as was the souffle for dessert.  Other good restaurants nearby also.  My favorite NYC hotel.

title: Stay at the Mark
text: This hotel is located in a great location. Close to Central Park, the Met, great shopping area and fantastic restaurants. The staff is extremely professional and very helpful. They go above and beyond!

title: Great spot
text:
Overall a first rate hotel. Superb location 
Service is excellent. Rooms are large by New York standards. Will definitely be the place we stay anytime we are in New York City. Very quiet at night which was a bonus.

title: Best hotel in New York
text: As a native New Yorker who now lives abroad, and who has tried many hotels in the city, I can’t say enough about this place. Stunning decor, impeccable service, great amenities, lovely ambiance and clientele, great location, nice gym. The room service is a bit overpriced, especially breakfast, but other than that, flawless. My new favorite hotel in Manhattan.

title: Muy bonito, moderno, servicio impecable
text: Es un hotel excelentemente bien ubicado, con muchos museos, restaurantes y galerías de arte caminando. Me gustó mucho que es clásico pero moderno a la vez, no te sientes atrapado en lo barroco como muchos hoteles clásicos de NY. La gente de servicio es muy muy amable, muy profesionales y muy atentos. Tienen un salón de belleza realmente bueno. Los cuartos son bonitos, amplios, sin ser grandes. Los baños muy bonitos. Obvio todo es caro, supongo que eso no debe sorprender.

title: Outstanding Evening at The Mark
text:
The suite was gorgeous - from the plush couch, to the 2 bathrooms and luxurious bed.
The restaurant - Jean George has the best caviar and Dover Sole in the city.
Without a doubt my favorite hotel in NYC.

title: Glad we came back
text:
My wife had stayed at the Mark for many years, but after a few issues, decided it was time to leave. 

One of the main issues that we had was with the General Manager, who was never friendly to us as regular guests. He may also have been upset with us for a previous Trip Advisor review I left complaining about a delegation to the UN smoking throughout the hotel when the hotel is a no smoking hotel. But the GM and many others from previous management at the hotel are all gone and it was time to see if things had improved.

We always stay in a particular room design which has a large living room with comfortable contemporary furniture. The hotel also knows all of our preferences including changing the mattress to our liking. 

Coming back was a real homecoming. It was like everyone in the hotel knew we were coming back and wee were welcomed with open arms. The service was great as expected, and we are happy to be back.

title: Some Disappointments
text:
First of all, I experience the beds as having mattresses that are too soft.
Secondly, I asked the my king bed be divided into two singles the second night of my stay, but the housekeeping department failed to relay information to housekeeper.
Thirdly, I asked for a coffee maker to be placed in my room (ought there not be one?) as I headed out to dinner and when I arrived to go to bed no sign of one. Another failure to deliver.

title: Home away from home
text:
My husband and I are American expats living in Paris but are originally from NY.  While back home for the holidays, we decided to switch things up a little and stay at The Mark (until then we were die-hard St Regis fans). We were so happy we did. We were immediately impressed by the professional, but low-key service we received and the luxuriously appointed, modern suite to which we were shown, which had a full kitchen - an absolute perfect perk for us since our friends and family all wanted to stop by and see us and we were looking to have a more "homey" feel rather than a typical hotel room. The UES location is perfect for coming home to a quiet neighborhood - not overrun with tourists - which has access to everything your heart desires (shopping at all price ranges, good food, the Park, museums, etc.). 

When we had to be back in town three months later, there was no debate - we would stay at The Mark.  The level of service and the room were both just as we experienced the first time - impeccable.  

We're heading back to NY in a couple of days and are delighted to check back into our new home away from home!

title: The best
text:
Can’t say enough good things about this establishment. Love the location, it’s quite, next to the park with plenty of access to shops and restaurants.
Rooms are simple, elegant and comfortable. They also did a great job on designing the gym with right mix of free weights, machines and cardio.
But the best thing is the staff, whom are efficient, caring and friendly. The concierge team in particular  will go out of their way to help you. I had to order some prescription medicine and they negotiate a 70% price reduction upon delivery on my behalf!
Super stay and would be happy to come back.

title: Loved it!!
text: The Mark took me as an early morning panic booking (single night in another hotel was horrifying), right before the Met Ball, and it was a FABULOUS stay! Not a celebrity (except in my own mind) but they gave me the best service possible, especially the Concierge staff, and it turned my four night trip to NYC from a disaster to an absolute pleasure.  Large room, comfortable bed, fabulous bathroom, spotlessly clean, charming staff - it was close to perfect.  The only negative was the restaurant-had breakfast there twice, first time was ok, second time was a disaster and the hotel comped the meal, which was appropriate. The restaurant lets down the hotel.  Overall, a wonderful place to stay on the Upper East Side, and I can't wait to go back!

title: Spoil yourself
text: Soup to nuts, the best service staff in the business. Genuine professional service, always with a smile, and all willing to go the extra mile. My waitress assisted with removing pigeon poop from my blazer -- seriously. And the immense water pressure in the delightful rainfall shower? Reason enough to return.

title: Fabulous Five Star Upper East Side Service
text:
Exceeded expectations!! 
The front desk and concierge staff are very accommodating and attentive and made our stay perfect. I asked for a room change (we were staying five nights, and I wanted a soaking tub) the front desk was very gracious and facilitated the room change without issue. The concierge is knowledgeable, helped us find delicious after theatre dining. The rooms are very comfortable; housekeeping keeps everything in perfect order. The location can't be beat. Able to walk to Metropolitan Museum of Art and plenty of dining on Madison Avenue and shopping of course!!  The hotel offers Apple TV for Netflix and other streaming services, but it has to be requested during business hours. (I wanted it at midnight, and the staff tried REALLY hard to get me my Netflix. Suggest the hotel install Apple TV in all rooms)

title: Trip of a Lifetime
text: We have never been better cared for. From the driver of our car from the airport to the doorman and bellhops to reception and the concierge, every single person was polite and helpful beyond measure. Our rooms were luxurious, far exceeding our expectations, and we enjoyed every aspect of them. Although the technology in the room failed us a bit, we did not come for the technology; it was the personal service that made every facet of our stay enjoyable and noteworthy. I cannot imagine a better experience.

title: Daughters Birthday in the City
text: I flew in from Cali to celebrate with my daughter who lives in Manhattan. She wanted a Staycation celebration.   From there the hotel & Pablo the "Concierge" took amazing care of us and made sure everything was perfect!   We had dinner at the restaurant, a lovely bottle of wine in the room and everyone made sure we were taken care like VIPS.

title: NYC Long Spring Weekend
text: We enjoyed the quiet courtyard king room and....yes the amazing bathroom and tub!  We also had a great dinner at The Mark restaurant.  The private car was available (much used) once when we requested and was a relaxing and beautiful way to be transported.

title: Weekend Retreat
text: My husband and I stayed at the Mark for our anniversay. Our rehearsal dinner had been there years ago, and we hadn't been back since the big renovation several years ago. WOW. it was fabulous... the room was very comfortable, and the bathroom a huge step up from what we are used to. The bed was great, with wonderful high-quality sheets - we both slept really well. We had breakfast at the restaurant both days, and dinner one night - all outstanding. We lingered over breakfast for almost two hours both days, and never felt rushed. The staff was friendly and helpful with just the right balance of attention and privacy.  I recommend it highly!

title: your wish is their pleasure
text: wonderful staff from the bellman  front desk concierge the restaurant housekeeping  you feel it every where you go or use the services their only mission that you will feel happy and come back.one should congratulate the manager to be able to inspire the team

title: Five Star property with a boutique hotel feeling, an island of calm in the exciting New York
text: They get the important things very right: great bed, great concierge service, and outstanding service at the door (taxis, transfers, recommendations, personalized friendlyness). THe bar and restaurant are also excellent, and the overal service from everybody is outstanding. We have heard that The Mark is a great "school" for training personnel in the hotel business.....we saw first hand why that is!!!!

title: Exceptionnel
text:
Service digne d’un palace hôtel très luxueux personnel parfaitement professionnel tout est mis en place pour que le client j’ai aucun besoin et qu’il soit le plus confortable possible. Les
Chambres même standard sont exceptionnellement bien équipées. Je peux comparer car j’ai fait trois hôtels différents à uppper east. Je recommande vivement the Mark Hotel.

title: Me
text:
The staff iand service was absolutely stellar. They were responsive and attentive to all of my needs. 
 In particular, Matthew took very good care of me including some specialized requirements. 
 Everything was spot on and the housekeeping staff was terrific. without reservation if you were looking for a five-star place to stay in Manhattan, this is the place to go

title: My favorite so far in NYC - too bad about the concierges
text: The hotel is almost perfect - lovely rooms, fantastic location for the upper east side and exceptional services from everyone with sadly notable exception - I will certainly make this hotel my to go place when in NYC - but equally I will probably never ask the Concierge’s suggestions for restaurants ever again - we were being a bit lazy and asked for a suggestion for a great dinner place (thinking new cool Michelin types) and we went to a very nice Indonesian downtown - it was nice with excellent service but far from exceptional (and of course we knew that at the last minute the odds were against us for one of the great restaurants - that’s why we hoped the concierge might work) but as I said the suggested restaurant was certainly better than OK and so we tried again with a different concierge the next morning for a breakfast place - stupid of us as we could have had breakfast at the hotel’s delightful restaurant - we were given 4 suggestions nearby - two I knew and discounted as tired and unremarkable at best - I guess that was the red flag - and 2 others that were nearby - so we walked in the rain to the first in another hotel and decided against it as the room was frankly uninvitingly boring - so maybe we’re a bit picky - so we then walked to the other suggestion, EAT on 81st and Mad - remember it was raining and I should mention I did have a ravenous teenage boy in tow - what a disaster - forget that it was 70! bucks for my son’s very uninspiring breakfast of scrambled eggs, 3 rashes of bacon, a bagel and cream cheese and 3 OJ’s - the place was at best a very tired diner serving VERY average diner fare - but my indignation at the suggestion was heightened when I politely suggested to the concierge that the place was an expensive dump (paraphrasing) and she responded (again paraphrasing) that New Yorkers love it and that she did give other suggestion (true and all seriously a very long way from great) but I guess some NY’ers might love EAT, BUT having lived in the City for 7 years in the past I wonder who they are? - The Mark is a high end hotel that I love and when a guest asks for a suggestion for a great place to have breakfast, then could it b possible to have a somewhat curated list of actually GREAT places...(thinking London, Paris, Madrid, St. Bart’s, Little Nell - you know the drill) and could you please assume the guest is a bit picky and talking something worth remembering - I guess she got that part right - we certainly won’t forget this one or ask for a suggestion again. Really love this hotel but...

title: Wow.
text: We had enjoyed prior stays at the Mark years ago before the latest remodel. Returned for dinner last fall and had an incident where the hotel front desk provided superior assistance even though we were not a guest - Which made us say we must stay at the Mark the next time we come to NYC.  So we did!  First was the best reservation assistance Ever provided by Tori.  We had some special accommodation needs and she was so kind and knowledgeable; A true example of A+++ service.  The front desk, room service and housekeeping staff were all lovely and efficient during our stay.  The room was large and comfortable, especially by NYC standards.  The bathroom was modern with two sinks plus a tub bath and separate shower.  Just when we thought our experience could not get any better, we found ourselves seated at the restaurant bar (as the restaurant was full that evening) and had the very very best drinks (really!) and attention from Rich.  Even two snowfalls could not deter our weekend when we were fortunate enough to be staying at the wonderful Mark hotel.

title: Great experience, wonderful cozy hotel with excellent staff!
text: Perfect hotel located near Central Park & small cozy designer shops. We ended up always eating at the hotel-it had the best food! Excellent service! Great room/large bathroom! Walking distance to everywhere!

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
text:
Virtually everything about the Mark is perfect if, as we do, you prefer boutique properties on the upper East Side of Manhattan.  Service at all levels in the hotel (as opposed to the bar) is helpful and instantaneous.  Every staff member is friendly and courteous. Housekeeping of this stylish and well appointed property is impeccable.  All the attributes of good management are on display. Rooms,( especially the splendid bathrooms), are generously sized and very well equipped.  Our room had plenty of storage space and two nice sized closets.  A small example of the care taken at this property was the fact that the usual room safe has a small organizer tray inside which, I have never seen anywhere before.  There is a small, very well equipped gym on the property.

 The Mark Bar which may be operated by the restaurant and not the hotel itself is an attractive venue.  Drinks, given the very high prices, did not taste like they contained much alcohol and service at tables in the bar is not quite up to the high standards of the rest of the property.

title: What an amazing hotel!
text: From the moment you step out of your car at the front door, this hotel experience is fantastic! The lobby is small but elegant. The rooms are spacious and look like a million bucks! The bathroom is all marble. There is a stocked bar and snacks. There is ice brought to your room with your turn down service nightly. I do not have the words to describe how I felt each day waking up and ending my day in this gorgeous hotel. In addition the location was perfect!

title: Chic et confortable
text:
Un séjour de 5 nuits à New York à côté de Central Park. L’hôtel est très confortable et très beau, le personnel à l’écoute. Propreté irréprochable, service en chambre excellent. Nous n’avons Pas pris le petit déjeuner sur place car 51dollars c’est un peu excessif...c’est l’un des plus beaux hôtels de New York. Évidemment, ça a un prix.
Nous y retournerons bien volontiers.

title: a revisit- still great
text: Always a friendly smile from the doormen when you arrive and depart.  Everyone is all smiles that you meet and see.  Rooms have the best bathrooms with large tub and nice hot and strong shower.  Always nice to be able to drop into the bar for a snack or drink.  Always a great visit.

title: Fabulous StayCation In NYC
text: My Husband and I celebrated a belated Valentine's day with a night at the Mark Hotel. Even though we only live 10 blocks away we really felt like we were on a vacation in the center of one of the best cities in the world. The hotel was beautiful and the hotel didn't know what to do for us first. We can't wait to go back soon for another special occasion soon!

title: Wonderful Stay (before the News Stories)...
text:
My husband sweetly surprised me with a trip to New York so we could spend time at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Frick Museum and this hotel's location can't be beat!  It was a short eight minute walk to get back from the Met to here which made it easy to spend the whole day there and take a mid-day break.  I also love that it is close to Central Park so easy to head for walks there and close to a subway station too.  The neighborhood is quiet and safe..

The hotel is quite nice as well.  We had a king sized bed which had a great mattress and slept well.  The air conditioning kept the room well regulated as well.  The bathroom was spacious with a marble tub and shower and I do half wish it was a little less spacious so the room could have been bigger!  However, really appreciated the oversized bath towels and strong flow of water from the shower head.

The location of course comes with a price, although seeing the prices now after it has been featured in new stories due to a famous duchess staying here, was grateful to have been able to have stayed there.  The staff was friendly and I appreciated  the complementary Evian water at night and sweets at turn down service (on the first night it was a Laudree macaron). However for this price point had hoped having a hot water kettle and complementary tea/coffee would have been a given.

title: Grand old Hotel, loved it!
text: Great Bar, best Manhattan I had in the city that trip. Large quiet rooms. Fantastic service.  And, the showers are amazing, like standing under a waterfall.  Breakfast room service was almost too fast.  Great experience, I'll be back.
