title: Central Park is a Hop, Skip or Jump Away
text: Such a lovely experience staying at the Mark Hotel! Each day we enjoyed room service before a beautiful stroll through the park that was right down the street. The smiling Attendants always greeted us as we came and went through the front doors. The Concierge was super helpful in making all the arrangements we required during our stay. We will definitely be returning.

title: The BEST hotel shower on the planet!!!
text:
I feel very strongly that a morning shower can set the tone for the day and night. The shower in the baths at the Mark are the last word in bathing! Truly! 

Better than a home shower and Turkish bath! The swank amenities and the black and white marble are entirely the icing on the cake. I mean. This Mark bathroom.

title: Classy Upper East Side Manhattan Hotel
text: For anyone seeking an Upper East Side Manhattan experience, this is your hotel.  Luxury boutiques line Madison Avenue and its side streets and Central Park is a few steps from the hotel. The lobby's decor is quirky and therefore not stuffy and a lively hotel bar (great spot for something as routine as a coffee) is off to the side. Staff is energetic and personable. On the second floor of the hotel is also where well-to-do locals go to the hair salon and get their shoes polished. The guest room was spacious and the bathroom was well designed with heavy-duty (i.e, luxurious) bathroom fixtures including a separate, glass walled shower stall. There are ample closets and a clever mini-bar area with a slide out fridge. This hotel is not for bargain-hunters or the faint-of-heart when it comes to finances!

title: Stayed in The Terrace Suite, Superb......
text: Huge 5 Bedroom Suite that was perfect for our weekend in New York with friends. 1st time at this hotel normally at the Waldorf but this was a little more modern / hipster style but I enjoyed the change. Staff well presented and service was excellent. Great location

title: Serenity with style
text: Such a haven to come home to after a bustling day in NYC. The best shower and bath ever. Staff are super helpful and the food is great. Incredibly well located. A short walk to the Met, or walk across the road and through Central Park. The room was really solid and very quiet.

title: Minha casa em NY
text:
Tenho ficado no The Mark nos últimos 8 anos, desde então nunca me decepcionei com o hotel. Localização ideal, 77/Madison, serviço impecável, atendimento de Concierge o melhor de NY. Gym pequena mas com tudo que é necessário .
Volto sempre !!

title: Wonderful stay
text: My family and I stayed at the hotel for almost a week last week. We traveled with our 8 week old and the staff did everything possible to accommodate our needs. My only few comments are that the food could be a bit a better as could the service in the restaurant and that the property has seen some wear and tear that should be maintained a bit better. Overall we had a really nice stay and would certainly stay again.

title: Over-promises , under-delivers
text:
The Mark, what can I say. It is regrettably one of those hotels that considers itself "too cool for school" and therefore over-promises and under-delivers.  I guess one might say their service is far off the mark !

I've no idea where to start with the litany of hospitality schoolboy errors....

Perhaps I should start with telling you how booking two identical rooms (not the cheapest ones in the house, I might add), leads you to receive one decent sized room and one dark and dingy cupboard. No excuse !

Or perhaps I should tell you about the nickel and diming management and how, for example, free internet is a paltry 3Mb, and you have to pay stupid prices for anything higher.  At the rates charged, this is inexcusable, high speed internet should be free for all guests.

Or maybe I should tell you how ordering poached eggs at the extortionate rate of almost $30 per person gives everyone overcooked eggs.  I mean come on.  At $30 a person the chef should be producing perfect poached eggs.

Or maybe its just best summarised that all the staff I encountered at this hotel are either grossly under-trained, completely disinterested in what working in the hospitality industry means ….or, more likely, both.  They prance around trying to look all pretty and cool, but simple service things just don't get done.  Bar staff leave the bar area unattended, customers waiting. Waiters are inattentive, you have to prompt them to bring you the menu,  dirty dishes don't get cleared from the table once everyone has finished eating. You have repeat a question to reception staff three or four times before the lightbulb clicks and they figure out what you're asking for (“could I have a map ?” … “sorry can I help you ? “ … “could I have a map, please ?”  …. “sorry, can I help you ?” …. its was an experience strait out of an episode of Fawlty Towers  !).

Or the fact the staff seem to spend an awful lot of time chatting and joking with each other.

Singularly unimpressed would be my summary of The Mark. At the prices charged, the service should be spot on. It's not. Its far from spot on. Its over-hyped nonsense.

My advice to management, cut out a whole heap of the trendy hipster bull and refocus on customer service.

title: Best Hotel - best service with a smile - classy ambience
text: Service was tops - we had a lot of special requests - at all times the hotel accommodated with great service and professional friendly attitude.  In the restaurant our favourite table was reserved - lots of small gestures that made a big difference.  The pharmacy sent medicine to our hotel when we were out - the hotel paid for it and sent it to our room - cost to us ofcourse, but great gesture without us asking.

title: Amazing in every was
text:
We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is beautiful, great location, rooms are spacious so are the bathrooms and very nicely and efficiently furnished. The staff is super attentive and friendly, cleanliness is tops and linen beautiful. We definitely will be back. 
Ps. Slippers are extremely cute.

title: The Best Concierges in NYC
text:
I spent two weeks at The Mark and loved every minute of my stay.

The best thing about this hotel are the fabulous concierges who did everything for us and did it so professionally gracefully and always got us into whatever or wherever we wanted to go.  A very big thank you to Isa, Jackie, Helen, Anabela and Pablo.  Simply the best in NYC.

The rooms are fantastic, beds so comfy and the bath is so deep and was the best way to end each day.

Great gym, fabulous food, hair salon in site...and a great bar and restaurant.  What more can you ask for.

All the staff was so professional and the doormen always greeted everyone with a big smile on their faces, even when it was so cold outside!

I love this hotel and highly recommend it and can't wait to come back.

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed for 5 nights for a business event, great location for Central Park, Shopping and Theatre. Rooms were very good and bathrooms retro with great showers, nothing fancy clean and functional. Restaurant and food very good and hotel bar offered a great atmosphere in the evenings

title: A place to remember
text:
We stayed at the Mark hotel after seeing it in a review of the top 10 places tonstsy in NYC. It didn’t disappoint.

The service was outstanding, the venue was gorgeous and the location excellent. 

A big shout out to Helen the concierge- she ensured our trip was the best it could be in the 3 days we had.

title: still the best
text:
most skilled and most gracious
simple as that
people are attentive and just lovely , style and personality
I regard it as the standard in the city and glad to see it remains so
elegance , professionalism.....at the highest level

title: Great Stay at The Mark
text: My wife, 15 year old daughter and I stayed at The Mark for 6 nights around the New Year holiday. We usually stay here when in NYC. We love the quiet location near the Park- great to come back to after a busy day around town. The rooms are quiet, well appointed and spacious enough. The gym is satisfactory. The staff is awesome - friendly and helpful at all times. A really nice, quiet and elegant hotel, without being pretentious.

title: New Year’s Eve Celebrations
text: As usual very friendly and impeccable service. Couple that with the stunning aesthetics makes for a great night. The menu was stunning too!  A little pricey for one night but it truly is a classy stay. Perfect location and extremely welcoming from the minute you step on the kerb.

title: Wow!  What a shower!
text: What a beautiful hotel. Great location - close to fabulous shops, restaurants, museums and the subway.  However my husband usually complains about wifi and showers in hotels but at The Mark he could do no such thing.  The water pressure coming out of the shower was remarkable, we have never experienced anything like it and it has left us wondering what we can do to improve matters at home - an issue we didn't know we had before we stayed at The Mark!

title: Lovely and quiet hotel just off Madison Avenue
text: I wasn’t familiar with the Mark prior to this trip, on other visits I’ve stayed everywhere from the Carlyle to the W in Times Square. I would definitely recommend the Mark.  My 17 year old son and I stayed in a junior suite with a courtyard view for the week after Christmas. The suite had a decent sized sitting area with a pull out bed for my son and a king bed in a separate room for me. Most importantly it had two bathrooms, providing an appropriate amount of family togetherness. The rooms are well-appointed and have nicely thought out amenities like a towel warmer and a heated floor in the bathroom. Other nice touches are a premium hair dryer, trash receptacles placed in the bathrooms and in each room, slippers placed at the foot of the bed at turndown service, and current popular magazines scattered on tables. I’ve found the small touches like this matter greatly in your perception of the hotel. Also the bar area, in the morning, is converted to coffee shop area that sells pastries, yogurt and decent coffee. The hotel is smaller which gives it a low key charm. The staff are friendly, without being officious. The location is excellent. I did eat a meal at their restaurant and found it to be tasty, with good service. Overall the Mark is a gem of a hotel with a great location, a place with 5 star amenities without the frequent 5 star attitude of some luxury hotels.

title: A new favorite!
text: Perfect for families or anyone looking for a quiet, beautiful hotel with perfect service. Its hard to come by 5 star hotels in NYC with perfect room service, professional housekeeping staff, friendly reception and doormen, spacious rooms, and in a great area of the city . My only regret is not staying here sooner, will be back for sure!

title: Beyond great client service
text: When I called the hotel to arrange a surprise birthday and welcome gift for friends staying there, Zach was pleasant and beyond helpful. I have heard my friends rave about the Mark, and after seeing how incredible Zach was with me by seamlessly, tastefully and quickly executing my complicated requests, I can understand why. Thank you Zach and The Mark for the extraordinary hospitality and service!

title: Quaint but a step behind
text:
Average room.   Poor technology and HVAC made even an overnight visit challenging. 

There was no bluetooth music player I could find in the room.  Internet was average in an era when high speed internet costs the hotel virtually nothing The Mark still wants to charge for it.  Absurd. 

Staff was friendly at check-in and check-out.  Otherwise they were somewhat disengaged.

title: Wifes birthday
text:
Grest hotel from reception to departure and everything in between 
Warm wonderful staff great rooms hotel restaurant and bars and room service all amazing 
Special treatment for the birthday 
The doormen were also great and very accommodating 
Just a wonderful experience 
Cant wait to go back again 
My compliments to the general manager running s great hotel

title: Spotty Service
text: The Mark is an elegantly appointed hotel in a perfect location on the Upper East Side.  Rooms are gracious, especially the bathrooms which must be among the largest in the city.  However, service can be hit or miss at best.  Upon arrival the ice machine in the room was not operating.  A request for room service to bring ice took two calls and about an hour.  Wine ordered and told it would be delivered in 10 minutes took 40.  Room service breakfast was cold.  A request to discuss with a manager was ignored.  The front desk, which is helpful and courteous, did send a bottle of wine which I had to leave because I had a business meeting.  The hotel restaurant misses the mark and the bar does not have the feel of other Upper East Side places like the Pierre.  The TV in the restroom did not work (told it was an internet issue).  They were overwhelmed with a large group but that affected service.  For the rate, I would suggest another hotel.

title: Luxurious retreat
text: The Mark was exactly what I hoped it would be. Luxurious, understated and quiet. It's the perfect retreat after a day of taking in the city. The room, although not large, is very comfortable with all the amenities expected. The bathroom was perhaps the best one I've found in a hotel. The bathtub is fabulous for two, and the water pressure in the shower is crazy good too; all topped off by very nice toiletries.

title: Two nights at the Mark.
text: I miss the  Piranesi prints.  The new black and white marble decor looks like an Italian airport hotel.  At least one lamp in 418 was non-functional (or we could not find the switch).  Food varied: two of the main courses were good, especially the smoked salmon.  The aperitifs offered on the Mark welcome card (which does not specify whether it is good for only one night or each night) drew a blank from Server #1 who did not know what they were.  Server #2 produced popcorn, nuts, and potato chips which were uninspiring.  Server #3 produced some guacamole which was very good. The staff was on the ball.  Even the telephone operator knew our names.  But she neglected to give us our 5:30 A.M. wake-up call.  Fortunately, we woke up on our own and did not miss our plane.  The Mark should be able to do better than that.

title: First Class operation all around.
text: This hotel exudes class. Service staff were on top of their game from check to check out and everything in between. Great location near Central park and convenient to  business destinations in mid town.

title: Effortlessly chic uptown abode
text:
Effortlessly chic uptown abode with slick design, polished service and well-trained staff. Absolutely memorable water pressure. Yoga mat provided in room is a clutch accessory. 

What I really enjoy about the Mark is the way that the rooms feel like apartments more than hotel rooms. It’s something about the extensive built-in cabinets and drawers for full unpacking, little amenities you would have at home like a letter opener, an iron, a vide-poche bowl to empty out your pockets when you come home, an exceptionally well stocked fridge (with ice maker) and minibar.  

The gym is also very good, but sometimes totally overtaken by personal trainers working out Upper East Side ladies. 

Madison Avenue rooms are noisy, especially on a low floor.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Pros: 
Location - block from Park,...
Privacy - quiet rooms, no loud crowds
Great bar - feels more like Upper East Side neighborhood bar than NYC hotel bar
Overall Service - Professional and polite

Cons;
Not sure if there are any...

title: Special thank you for a great concierge service
text: I would like to express my appreciation for the professional assistance of the staff of the Mark hotel, especially Jackie Spamer. She was able to arrange everything and provided the best customer service. Many thanks, Jackie!

title: Overall not as good as I would expect for the price
text:
Great location, I wanted to stay walking distance to the Met and this hotel satisfied that wish. 

Suite was nice size, but it was missing some furniture (a table and a lamp that would have been useful) and both the heating element and the tv in the bathroom weren't working. Service was spotty. The concierge was supposed to make a dinner reservation for us but the restaurant never got it (why didn't they confirm when I asked them?), the staff at the hotel restaurant was very inexperienced, which led to an extra long breakfast and issues with other patrons waiting for food, and the staff took forever to set up the sofabed even though we called several times. Overall nothing was very efficient.

I mentioned these things when I checked out and they comped me breakfast (wow), then told me they would add my comments to my file so that they would have the info for future stays. I just looked at them and replied, "Do you know how many hotels there are in New York?" 

It's definitely at most 4-star at 5-star prices.

title: Great stay!
text: Great couple of days spent at the Mark, from the moment of my initial reservation Lindsey took care of every single detail. We had a fantastic room which had plenty of room, some of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in and great amenities. Will be back!

title: Not as good as it used to be
text: This is a very smart hotel, great location and comfortable rooms. However this time my room heating system seemed jammed on cold and extra noisy and the breakfast experience was awful. Something seemed to be very wrong in the breakfast restaurant which I previously loved. Frosty welcome, terrible service, poor food, rip off charges. I will not be returning!

title: You Get What You Pay For!
text: Great location, great service and staff.  Hotel has an awesome bar off the lobby, drinks are little pricey, $25 a pop but it is New York.  The best thing about the hotel was the SHOWER.  Amazing water pressure, you can't find that anymore in any hotel in the USA because of the damn water restrictors, I took a lot of showers!  The room was ample and the bathroom was supersized.  Very clean and neat rooms, no complaints.  One block from Central Park and little more quiet being on 77th instead of Broadway or Midtown.  Rooms aren't cheap but you get what you pay for.....

title: Best while Carlyle renovated
text: More predictable than the Carlyle which is anyway not really open now, and much more relaxing than the Surrey, the Mark has light and spacious rooms, a great restaurant and a nice bar with great service.  Drawbacks:  HORRENDOUS coffee, and tea that is a caricature of tea, mediocre in room dining at inflated prices.  Please please hire someone who knows how to operate a coffee machine, and read—you managers!—that tea is not just warm water, a mug and a single cheap twinnings teabag!  Meanwhile the entrance lounge is remarkably poorly furnished.  Who was their buyer when they chose those chairs!  I’m

title: Lovely hotel
text: Very nice location, in that it’s away from the hustle and bustle but centrally located. We had a beautiful room. The bathroom was spacious and well laid out. There was lots of closet room and multiple full length mirrors. No complaints!

title: Nice tonreturn to this hote
text:
The hotel is very well maintened, the rooms are spaciuos and the bathroom is great.
location very pleasant ( next to central park, in a very nice neighborhood 
a very nice hotel ( this is a return visit for me), friendly staff, perfect service and great ambiance.
I do think though that for that price breakfast should have been included

title: Cool and sophisticated
text: Decadent and decidedly different compared with the other great luxury NY hotels. The Mark Bar is a great place for people watching and bar man Ryan probably the best in New York right now. Bikes are handy for the park.

title: The Best
text: Simply put . . . it is always perfect! Loved my room. The service was impeccable. The bathtub was extraordinary. I enjoyed drinks in the downstairs lobby restaurant. Intimate and nice. I had not stayed here in a couple of years, but i loved.

title: The best of the Best
text: There is a reason I come back to this hotel every time I am in New York. The staff are extremely professional and friendly. They addressed me by name and it is clear that they really care about your comfort and enjoyment. The rooms are quiet and spacious, and the design of this hotel is generally very elegant and sophisticated.

title: Hotel magnifique
text:
Nous y avons passé 5 jours et avons été enchantés par notre séjour : la beauté de l'hotel, la gentillesse et le professionnalisme des équipes, l'emplacement idéal. Nous avons plus particulièrement apprécié la disponibilité et l'efficacité de la conciergerie.

Nous y retournerons.

title: Best bathtub of any 5 star hotel I have stayed at
text: One of the reasons that I prefer to stay at 5 star hotels is because most 5 star hotels have a separate soaking tub from the shower. I fell in love with the soaking tub at the Mark. It was deep and easy to fill with good amenities. The hotel room was on the larger side for New York and the bathroom was huge by NYC standards.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff were excellent. The room that I was in did not offer a view, though the hotel is adjacent to and overlooking Central Park. There was also a fun bar downstairs. Overall, it was a top notch hotel that I would definitely consider returning to.

title: Always Perfect
text: This was my first time staying at the Mark  for 5 nights on a business trip to NY. I will keep it short and simple: perfect stay, in a perfect hotel. I will keep coming back as the hotel  met and exceeded my expectations. Perfect room, the best staff, great services. No doubt that I will come back soon.

title: Good location
text: The Mark is a nice NYC hotel. It's convenient to the Met and several nice restaurants. Service is thoughtful. Because they don't have coffee/tea service in the rooms it would be nice to have a set up in the lobby. After paying $800+ for a room, don't charge me $10 for a cup of tea. The room was clean. Ask to be on the side street for a more restful nights sleep.

title: "The best hotel in New York City"
text: Great cozy hotel in one of the best neighborhoods in Manhattan.  The rooms are comfortable and spotless.  The staff is caring and attentive and they think of everything. The bar is vibrant and the restaurant is off the lobby with world-class food which I took advantage of by ordering room service regularly.  The place is pricey but you get what you pay for at this luxurious Upper East Side retreat.

title: Wonderful Stay at The Mark!!
text: This was the first time my family and I were staying at the Mark and it really exceeded all expectations! I was delighted to find that the rooms were truly charming with an incredible view on Central Park! Check-in at the front desk went very smoothly, the staff was not only very efficient but also very welcoming. My husband and my children don't speak English but that was really not a problem as a lot of employees speak french! Overall, we received amazing service! Breakfast at Jean Georges was delicious and a great kick-off to our mornings. This is a truly luxurious 5 star hotel that well deserves its reputation. Housekeeping did a great job maintaining our rooms every day and the cocktail bar was a great place to spend time in during evenings. I cannot wait to come back with my family again!!

title: 5-Star Service - Exceeded my Expectations!
text: This was my first time staying at the Mark and I am counting down until I can return!  The Mark really exceeded all my expectations. I was welcomed by very friendly doormen and reception staff upon entrance and was delighted to find that the rooms were truly charming with very high tech amenities.  Housekeeping did an incredible job at maintaining our rooms every day and the cocktail bar was a great place to spend time during evenings.  Isabelle at Concierge was great - She reserved a table for us at an amazing restaurant and even managed to get drivers to take us there.  Everything from the staff to facilities was absolutely flawless throughout the stay and I cannot wait to come back again and tell all my friends about this hidden gem on the Upper East Side!

title: Going back to my regular hotel
text: The rooms were comfortable, especially the beds. The gym was adequate, room service good and staff pleasant. Unfortunately, the hotel messed up our reservation forcing us out of our room to wait in the hallways for a couple of hours. It messed up an entire afternoon which could have been spent in a museum. I plan go to back to my old faithful hotel in Tribeca!!!! They have never messed up my reservation.

title: Sumptuous location, poor service.
text: The Mark is located in prime real estate - upper 70's, practically adjacent to Central Park - within feet of luxury retailers, esteemed galleries/museums, and excellent eateries. Unfortunately, the hotel service falls appallingly short of the price point, particularly at the Jean-Georges Mark restaurant. Baffling inattentive servers during lunch service and rude responses to simple requests (i.e., bread, which was ultimately never procured) made for an unpleasant Sunday afternoon dining experience. Also received an unwelcome 0730 AM call while asleep on Monday from room service asking to clarify if we wanted wheat toast and cheese on a breakfast sandwich that was ordered for 0830 AM delivery the night before (girl who took the order night before was extremely clipped on phone, and practically hung up on me - didn't repeat back the order). Compared to peer establishments like The Peninsula, falls extremely short of the [m]ark. At check-out, spoke with guest service relations manager who appeared to be sincerely appalled at my anecdotes and graciously refunded the entire lunch meal in addition to the extra fees incurred by two room service breakfasts (mostly already covered by the Fine Hotels & Resorts, used to book the room). Probably won't stay here again.

title: Chic, Cozy, Cool
text:
I personally enjoyed this hotel.  Excellent location and the most friendly staff that go out of their way for you,  service is excellent.
Rooms are very cozy, and the beds are excellent with high Egyptian count thread sheets.
The Mark bar serves excellent drinks in a fashion set bar.
Definitely not my last time visiting this little gem.

title: What happened to the restaurant ??
text: I live in New York City.  I have eaten many memorable breakfasts, lunches and dinners at the Mark.   I am the patron who never complains.  Ever. In fact, this is the first review I have ever written, but I had such a terrible breakfast I had to write.  Waited 20! minutes for coffee, after gently reminding the server 3 times - which would be fine if you are not paying $150 for breakfast.  Frittata was terrible, dry, with greasy potatoes.  Service was terrible.  Honestly, you can get a better meal at Three Guys Diner around the corner on Madison.  Sad.

title: Terrific Hotel
text:
Nearly everything about this boutique hotel is five star.  The lobby, bar, elevator and rooms are beautifully chic, and everything very well maintained.  Seems like it was just redone a few years ago.  Our bathroom was gorgeous with the floor in black and light cream marble stripes, all marble walls, a deep soaking tub and great shower.  Housekeeping and other staff totally on top of things and very attentive.

Although this was our first time at this hotel, we would return on our next visit and recommend it to our friends.  Very neighborhood feeling with great location and.  We requested an upper floor courtyard room and got it (8th floor - do not accept one lower) as we were concerned about the NYC noises.  Room was absolutely super quiet and had a very nice view over to 78th St. with numerous good looking buildings. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars was the restaurant and breakfast fare room service was a bit of a let down.  However, there are several good places within walking distance.

title: Luxury boutique hotel
text: If you’re looking for a luxury boutique hotel I’d definitely recommend this one. I booked a suite; the bedroom and living room were two separate spaces; our 3 year old daughter crib was in the living room; there was barely extra space for the sofa. But the interior (minus the crib) is very luxurious. Rooms and bathroom are tight but very well planed for its size. The food on the alacarte room service menu is by the famous chef Jean George, divine!

title: Home At The Mark
text:
When I stay at The Mark it’s home for me not simply because it feels like home with all the amenities one could ask for; it’s truly about the way you’re treated by everyone you come in contact with.
What makes The Mark special is the intimacy, kindness and care. Yet most important is the refinement. 
Being in the arts and entertainment worlds with a best selling book, feature film and tv series going into production I require certain cultural details to enrich my soul and my mind.
Culture is significant to me and calm in the chaos of the city.
I grew up in New York, made my way here, experiencing the highs and lows and can honestly say when I turn the corner of 77th Street and Madison heading towards The Mark I have a real sense that I’m in my own world, safe and secure and able to create what I imagine.
As much as the city gives it also takes away. It can be wearing to deal with the combustion, confusion and angst one has to go through to make their way through the intensity that NYC is known for. 
For me it’s all about going at your own pace, taking the city in and being able to rejuvenate which is easy to do at The Mark.
My time at this elegant place started many years ago when I travelled with the then President of Warner Brothers, Terry Semel and his wife Jane. 
We boarded the Warner private jet in LA and landed in NY heading straight for The Mark.
Things have changed since then however only in s good way at 25 East 77th.
I’ve been in my Madison rooms now on and off for nearly two years. I work here, play here and socialize. It’s a great place to network. 
For me The Mark will always be home in NYC.

Tod Michael Volpe

title: My trip to NYC -- and the Mark
text: This is one of my favourite hotels in NY.  The location cannot be beat if one likes to walk and shop.  The service is old world, impeccable.  The rooms are quite well appointed.  Probably the best shower in any hotel I have visited.  If one is into star gazing, one will always see on walking in or out.  On my last visit, rubbed shoulders with Sir Paul.  The service and food at the hotel are outstanding.  Two drawbacks:  1.  If one is on the street side, be prepared to hear rubbish pickup at 10:30 PM.  This is easily rectified by requesting a room on the other side or stay very late.  2.  The bathrobes could be of higher quality.  This could be rectified if the property purchasing from Boca Terry.

title: Relaxation is Everything
text:
From the moment that I checked in, to the moment that I checked out, I had no worries and could truly just relax. 

A soak in the tub, warm towels, and a cozy robe set the tone for my stay. I laid down to watch television and immediately drifted off to sleep for two hours. The bed was so incredibly comfortable.

I can only hope to have the opportunity to stay once again.

title: Good trip!
text:
Hotel service was excellent as usual, esp. Isabelle Hogan (concierge).

Employees remembered us; lots of old-timers -- looks like hotel knows how to hold on to staff.

Bar is wonderful

room-service breakfasts were great

Very clean

This is our NYC home

title: Nice hotel but one staff member ruined the experience of the hotel for us!
text:
My husband and I have lived and traveled all over the world, generally staying at 5-star hotels (when avail), and have never experienced this level of disrespect and rudeness from one particular employee at the front desk upon departing.  

Initially when I checked out I knew there was a fee of $157 of private bar charges. I was surprised, but thought maybe my husband got the midnight munchies.  He was getting a car, so I settled, then asked him....he said "no, just some peanut m&ms last night".  So I called back to the hotel, and was told that she'd look into it, but it might take a while...  I wasn't ok with that, so I emailed the hotel to follow-up.  Eventually I received an itemized bill.  The m&ms weren't on it, but 3 other things were - that we did not have.  After a lot of back and forth, I was told "After further investigation it has been confirmed that these items were consumed in the room. However, as a curtesy, we will adjust the amount off of the bill and send you an updated receipt."  - -  We were livid!  I responded of course, and suggested that they further investigate before they insinuate that their customers are lying thief's.  I received no response but did receive a credit.  This employee turned a 5-star rating into a 2-star rating by her lack of basic service skills.  

Regarding the rest of our stay:
Upon arrival and throughout our stay the front desk (with the exception of above) & concierge were fantastic!
- we arrived early, so upon our room being ready they phoned us. 
- supplied a kettle upon request for coffee/tea

The room was nicely appointed, and very comfortable. 
 A few minor issues:
- mini bar fridge was not turned on when we arrived, so everything in it was warm.  We expressed our concern to the butler, but he wasn't too interested in finding a solution.    We turned it on, and after 4 hours it started cooling down.

- The shower pressure is great, however, it's like someone is pouring a bucket of water on your head, not pleasing at all.  Suggestion:  change the shower heads.

- We had a room overlooking Madison Ave, which was nice until the garbage trucks rolled in early - before 6am. I woke to bottles being dumped. 

My husband and I were planning to bring our 3 kids back to NYC in the Spring, and return to the hotel.  However, after the experience with the one girl at the front desk, we will not return - too many other 5-star hotels in NYC with excellent service to choose from.

title: スタイリッシュ
text:
アッパーイーストのメトロポリタンの近くにあります。一見あの辺りの高級アパルトマンかと思うような外観ですが、一歩入るとニューコンテポラリーなインテリアが印象的なホテルです。NY collectionの時期に被っていたので、四泊中ずっとバイヤーやモデル、ライターなどファッション業界のひとで溢れてました。人気があるホテル何だと思います。訪問したのは9月です。
部屋は広くはありませんが、ストライプを基調としたツートンカラーのツインの部屋で、バスルームは広くて使いやすかったです。
常に清掃も行き届き、無料のペットボトルは掃除後毎回置かれており、チップには手書きの御礼とチョコが添えてありました。フロントはビジネスライクですが、悪くはありません。
NYのオシャレでディープな街にの顔を見た気がしました。

title: Doesn't get better!!!
text: The transportation service they utilize is spectacular. The front desk & concierge were super friendly, respectful & accommodating with any and all your needs and wants. The restaurant & food are to die for and the in-room service even better. This hotel pulls out all the stops. The only disappointment was having to leave. I could make this place my home.

title: A very nice manhattan hotel but please do not order the eggs
text:
The Mark is a very nice Manhattan hotel. It went through a major reno about a decade ago and was a little fresher then.My room was very quiet and very comfortable.I was happy with everything except the breakfasts.

 I ate breakfast there both mornings and must say the breakfast was mediocre at best. The first morning I ordered the spinach and gruyere omelette. It was very greasy rendering the omelette inedible (meaning 2-3 Tablespoons of oil was on my plate). The second morning I ordered the Mark breakfast a typical eggs/ bacon/ potatoes breakfast w a beverage and orange juice (about $44.00). The scrambled eggs had the taste and consistency of eggs you would find in a sterno pot. The bacon was room temperature and very hard. It tasted like both of these items were cooked hours ago. The breakfast potatoes had been cooked in a deep fat fryer. One of my friend's had a fruit and granola bowl and she said it was very good. Based on my experience, the Carlyle across the street has a much better breakfast for the money. 

The food served off the late lunch menu was very good.

The rest of the hotel services were a 4.5.

title: Very good option in Upper East side!
text: Good Location, big room with a nice view, full of amenities and a marvellous bathroom. Very kind and helpful people at the reception. Could improve the breakfast a little bit!. The air conditioning was a bit noisy...

title: Love love love it!
text:
Everything about this hotel is nice.
The room I had (703) was not big very was very quiet.; the amenities in the room are great.
The location is nice is you like to go in the park or if you want to go to museums and shop in Madison.
The personnel are helpful and very professional. I asked the concierge to book a restaurant for me on Saturday night the restaurant that I had chosen as full but he gave me the choice of 6 or 7 other places right away.

I will go back without hesitation. Sometimes unfortunately the rooms are too expensive.

title: Not as good as it used to be
text:
Great hotel, great location. Il love the decoration of the bathrooms and rooms. Certain rooms are a bit noisy due to huge air conditioning machines outside. A bit expensive for what it is. The restaurant and the bar are a bit dark and to much too much air conditioning. 
Don't go during the UN summit! Too many bodyguards, stress...

title: Nothing right or good - avoid !
text:
We had the idea of a nice dinner saturday evening and we booked at the Mark restaurant. 
Unfortunately in our opinion nothing was acceptable:
Too noisy
Almost no lights
Food was unacceptable: we even had a salad with so much vinegard that we could not believe: not edible; we did a mistak in not sending the salad back to the chef. 
I tried a burger: I asked medium and was overcooked. 
For dessert, already suspicious, we shared a tart with verbena ice cream: it seems impossible but we could not finish it.
All of this for about 150 US$.
To my surprise the place was almost full, but I will not go back for sure.

title: Great experience, everyone was so wonderful and helpful!
text: We were updated to a Suite complimentary and enjoyed our stay!  Loved visiting our old neighborhood.  Loved the design of the room and cleanliness.  My husband loved the water pressure in the shower!  Great experience.

title: Early dining yields
text:
Nice quiet dining room..
Hadn’t been for a while
Food good...not great...

Very pricey in keeping with the neighborhood 

Varied menu from Pizza to lamb chops which were great

Desserts on “ The Mark “

Very good service

title: Love trip to NYC
text:
Very good 5* hotel, unfortunately breakfast isn't included in the room price and the restaurant has to many servers, people just seem to walk around without having anything to do.  Concierge service is one of the best I have ever experienced. Thank you to Annabella and her team. 
Great rooms, great beddings and a fantastic bathroom and very clean. Missing a real SPA.

title: New York Fashion Week
text: The front line staff are incredibly kind. I was pleasantly satisfied with their care and attention to detail. Concierge and bell hops go above and beyond to ensure you feel comfortable. Room was very spacious, always clean, and up to date. Only thing I would change about the room is the linens were fraying, and for the amount of the stay I would expect them to be impeccable. My review would have been 5 stars if not for a terrible interaction with sales directors the week prior to my stay. I had found some descrepancies in my reservation and phoned sales to review it, the sales director said that they could not help me therefore I asked to speak with the superior. Upon speaking with the superior, the other party had not advised them of the conversation prior and the purpose of my call. Therefore there was a lot of confusion during that conversation and I was told that they usually do not like guests like me staying at the hotel. To be spoken in that manner is unacceptable. I was disappointed nothing was done with my stay to make up for that interation as it left me very stressed prior to my visit. Luckily the front line staff was kind enough to almost make up for that horrible ordeal.

title: There to visit son and go to US Open
text: Our experience was amazing. We were constantly asked how our stay was going. Our room was perfect- comfy, spacious, with everything we could ever need. We ate at the Jean-Georges for dinner and it was spectacular and breakfast yummy as well.  It was a perfect week!

title: Wedding Anniversary Celebration
text: The Mark was a wonderful experience with a great location on the Upper East Side - close proximity to Central Park, The Met, and fine shopping boutiques along Madison Ave. The hotel room accommodations were very nice, and the turn-down service every evening was a plus. The guest attention provided by staff was also immediate and responsive to ensure a great experience. We would definitely stay there again when we visit NYC.

title: Not without flaws
text: The 77 Junior Suite has a windowless sitting/lounge area making it somewhat claustrofibic. No refreshment of fruit during an eight nights stay. No coffee or tea making facilities in the room. Few international TV channels. No explanation of the rooms upon arrival (find your own way). Breakfast food quality average, very few healthy dish options, no buffet, overpriced especially since the waiting staff though well intended lacks professionalism, too many mistakes. Hotel decor pleasant but not too everyones taste (the black/white flooring is a bit tio much).

title: The Mark Is The Best I NYC
text: The only place I when solo, or when traveling with my family stay is The Mark Hotel! From the moment the doormen opens your car door, until you checkout. The experience is FANTASTIC! Just left there 3 days ago (US Open), and just made reservations for next years US Open. And my wife made reservations to return again to hangout in NY again this Christmas.

title: Ms
text: My favorite New York City Hotel! The staff is excetionable and attentive; they pay attention to every detail. The restaurant is superb. I cannot imagine staying elsewhere in the city and look forward to returning next month.

title: Best in the city
text:
We had a great time at The Mark!! The hotel is in the midst of the best museums, galleries, and restaurants in the city. The rooms are are well-appointed and refreshing. Most importantly, the professionalism and hospitality of the staff is superb. 
Management at The Mark is paying attention, and guests can see it. 
This is our go-to hotel; we are looking forward to a return visit:):)

title: Pure Luxury with great bar scene
text: The rooms are luxurious, with automated everything, including a TV in the mirror of the bathroom. The rooms are large with large soaking tubs and large walk in showers.  Jean Georges restaurant downstairs is superb, from the burger to the lamb chops.  The bar in the front of the hotel is a place to be seen.Don't be star struck, or don't stare at the " less is more summer attire" if you get my drift.  Enjoy 6 star luxury, in a great location off Madison Avenue. PS very dog friendly hotel!

title: Plush in every detail
text: Spacious rooms (bed, bath and beyond) with plenty of closet space, a deep dish bathtub, automated blinds and temperature and white glove test clean.   The service was impeccable and although sparse offerings for vegan dining, what they provided was exquisite.  As good as it gets...

title: Never want to stay anyplace else.
text: The location is impeccable. Amenities are top shelf. The restaurant is Jean-Georges. It is worth the price. But the staff, concierge, housekeeping, doormen and Sharika at the hotdog stand - they make the stay feel like home... also now I want heated marble floors in my bathroom.

title: Short stay
text: Short two days vacation. The staff couldn't have been nicer. All your needs taken care of quickly and efficiently. While the restaurant Jean George at the Mark is expensive service is impeccable and the food is the highest quality and some of the best in the City. staying at the Mark is highly recommended even though it is up in the high 70s they provide express service to Bergdorf and have bikes if you'd like to bike around the city and of course it is just down the street from Central Park. Would certainly go back one of my first choices to stay at.

title: Wonderful! Never wanted to leave!
text:
We have travelled to New York City a number of times this was our first stay at The Mark, and it won't be our last. The room was wonderful, very spacious, spotlessly clean!
Had the best nights sleep on very comfy beds, and the bathroom was spectacular . First hotel I have stayed in were they had the best lighting for putting on make-up! 
The wonderful staff were very helpful, incredibly friendly and took care of every detail. It was home away from home, we didn't want to leave. 
A stones throw from Central Park, and some of the most fabulous restaurants. 
Can't wait to return!

title: Simply the BEST.
text: I can't say enough about how very special it was to be at The Mark again.  The level of care and competence of the exceptional staff makes staying at this beautiful hotel a most pleasurable experience.  The guest rooms are spacious, distinctive and so comfortable.

title: Best family-friendly hotel I ever stayed in
text:
I have travelled to all corners of the world. I have had countless stays in good and truly great hotels, but only once in a while you find exceptional gems like The Mark.

From reservation to departure (and everything in between) this hotel has completely amazed me. This hotel gets everything right: each detail has been thought through.

Athough the hotel is extremely stylish and would cater for even the most demanding business traveller, it is also very family-friendly - but in the most elegant and unique way. 

The examples to subscribe this are countless, I will just highlight a few that really impressed. 

When the bellman helped us offloading our luggage from our car at arrival: when he asked for my last name on top of his head he was able to match it with my first name. For the record: I am not famous so he must have memorized all arrivals for that day (The Mark is boutique but still 15 stories high so I reckon a bit of an effort to do).

We immediately concluded that our suite was superb for us as parents: e.g. welcome champagne, fresh fruits, fresh white roses in each room, ladurée macarons, fantastic beds and for gadget freaks like me: a single panel to control all devices in the room from TV, aircon, shades etc. 

The kids were jumping with joy as well. Was it the The Mark hot dog cart (very tasty!), the The Mark pedi cab, the The Mark branded bikes, a The Mark branded tent to play in their room, books with bed-time stories about New York, or just the special attention they received from the staff? Probably all of the above. The Mark is clearly also a “playful” hotel. The kids felt so at home that they made drawings for some of the bell staff when we left. And we only stayed 3 nights...

Definitely in my top 3 of best hotels I ever stayed in, and for family travel: the very best by far. Business or leisure - next time in Manhattan will be in The Mark again.

title: Celebrating Anniversary
text: The best time! Loved our room & the bed was so comfy. The absolute best part tho was the incredible staff. Debra went above & beyond to make our stay amazing and she wasn’t the only one. The valet guys were incredible too. Also we loved the bikes!

title: Ladies and the City
text:
Spent one week in New York with my two daughters, 25 and 21, staying at The Mark.
Everything was perfect! People are extremely gentle and eager to make you feel at home. The room, a junior suite, was elegant and large enough for three adults. All services at the hotel  were outstanding. Not to mention the area of course! Definitely to be back!

title: Exceptionnel
text:
Nous avons passé 12 jours à « The Mark »
Séjour exceptionnel dans certainement un des meilleurs hôtels de NYC, sa localisation est parfaite à 100m de la meilleure entrée de Central Park, le personnel est adorable sans exception, depuis la réception, les concierges, les grooms, le personnel de la restauration.
Le petit déjeuner est délicieux, le restaurant raffiné et le bar très « tendance » . Beaucoup de personnel parle français, connaissent le nom de leur client tentent de devancer toute sollicitation. Le contact email est très réactif. 
Les chambres sont belles propres, silencieuses et très bien équipées.
En 2 mots, a fortement recommander même si on aimerait garder cet endroit exclusif.

title: Old Fashioned Mom Magazine loves the Mark Hotel!!
text:
Completely divine! Always the royal treatment, truly the best service in town. The staff always has smiling happy faces and our suite was meticulously maintained. It’s great to just check in once a week to relax... 

Michelle-Marie Heinemann 
CEO - Old Fashioned Mom Magazine

title: The best hotel in New York
text: I love this hotel, its like living in your own apartment on the upper east side.  Opt for a one bedroom suite with a kitchen, it gives you lots of space.  The hot dog stand and flower seller really give the hotel a true New York feel.  The restaurant is excellent, don't miss the truffle pizza.  Let thing to mention are the amazingly comfortable beds.

title: Best hotel I've stayed at in NYC
text: What a find!  This was definitely the best hotel I've stayed at in NYC ever!  The location is fantastic - right near lots of amazing shopping and restaurants and the hotel itself is beautiful.  The staff is incredible - always there with a smile and happy to help in any way possible.  The rooms are a good size and they're quiet - we barely realized that we were in the city once we got to the room.  The hotel amenities are great - the gym had ample, new equipment that was well maintained.  The hotel bar was nice and decorated well.  We didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant, but everyone talks about how amazing it is.....we'll have to do that the next time we visit!

title: Stunning hotel with great staff
text: We visit New York once a year for holiday and this was our first time at The Mark. Stunning hotel, great location and service by the hotel staff. Room was great size and very well appointed. Daniel at the front office was fantastic! Highly recommend!

title: Stunning Hotel, almost perfect
text:
Highly recommend this hotel, and in fact probably my favorite to date in New York (although NYC does have a drought of world class hotels)

Let’s start with what I love....

The design. The lobby is gorgeous. Just gorgeous. The hotel and rooms are finished and upheld to a very high standard.

The bathroom. Possibly the most opulent yet modern bathroom ever. If you like marble they’ve got you.

The location. Upper East Side perfection. A block from Central Park and a block from the shopping on Madison. They also loan out The Mark bikes and have pedal bikes to get you to Bergdorf Goodman’s. Appreciated.

The details. The Mark is trying to build a brand and it works. Love the monogrammed everything and the consistency of a statement floor. 

As for the areas of improvement...

The Room. Beautifully built and finished with, as I mentioned, gorgeous bathrooms but the furniture was not to the same standard. Thin curtains, flimsy chairs. The bed was just ok vs other 5star rooms and the toiletries were not great. However the room did smell gorgeous - I didn’t have to light a scented candle once. 

Restaurant and Bar. The design of these areas was such a let down. Didn’t maintain the opulence of the rest of the hotel. Everything I had for breakfast/ lunch/ drinks was fine just not memorable.

I haven’t mentioned service as it’s neither a love or hate, just good. I stayed here after reading a review comparing it to Claridges - well..... Claridges this IS NOT (best hotel in the world) but it’s definitely a beautiful gem on the Upper East Side.

title: Top notch hotel, location and service
text:
Long weekend in NYC for business/family celebration and choose uptown versus midtown. 
After a lackluster stay at the Surrey last year(how it’s rated #1 in NYC confuses me)but enjoying its location near Central Park, The Mark seemed a good option.
And it was.
From the very instant we arrived, this hotel felt special. 
Gracious welcome, quiet and luxurious bedroom, fabulous bathroom with the famous shower, incredible restaurant fitting a 5 star hotel and steps from Madison Avenue and the Park-what more would you expect? Plus, the commotion of the crowds just 25 blocks south is absent. 
Definitely will stay here again.

title: Beautiful hotel, amazing service in quiet neighborhood
text: We absolutely loved our stay at The Mark. The rooms on 77th were very large, comfortable and beautiful! It is important to realize this is not close to the tourist attractions other than the MET however Central Park is very walkable during the day and Madison Avenue was safe after dark. Also plenty of taxi and Uber available. The water pressure in the shower was amazing and the soaking tub was so relaxing. The staff was very courteous. The room service breakfast was great but the extra charges doubles the cost. No coffee maker in the room. The Mark Restaurant was our best dining experience in NYC. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Always good
text:
Thank you for getting me a special attention in my room. Your hotel is like home for me. Here for business and everything was perfect . Cocktail was amazing and room service very kind .
See you soon .
Cheers

title: Great hotel!
text: The room was clean, large, beautifully appointed and had all of the conveniences one would expect from a 5 star hotel. Linens were top rate, service was excellent, large marble bath with tv in mirror, etc

title: Effortless excellence
text: My recent stay at The Mark was seamless. Every experience was efficient and expedient, from the breakfast room service, to the smiling young woman offering turn down service, to ordering drinks and hors d'hoevres in the bar. Check-in and check-out service was a pleasure. I commend the personable and professional staff for making my stay as comfortable and peaceful as possible.

title: 매우 좋았습니다!
text: 늦은 시간까지 돌아다니는 것을 좋아하는 지라 안전한 위치에 숙소가 있는 것을 최우선으로 숙박을 정했는데 이곳은 위치적으로 매우 좋았습니다. 그리고 늦은 시간에 돌아다녀도 전혀 위험하지 않은 곳이었습니다. 센트럴 파크랑 가까워서 아침 운동을 하기에 좋았고 덕분에 매일 아침 운동을 거르지 않을 수 있었습니다. 센트럴 파크와 가까운 것이 최고 좋았습니다. 룸상태는 매우 좋았습니다. 베드도 너무 좋았고 룸에 먼지가 없어서 너무 좋았습니다. 청소상태가 좋았습니다. 먼지 알러지가 있어서 먼지가 많으면 기침 계속 하고 간지러워하는데 이곳에서 자는 동안은 그런 반응이 없었습니다. 굿! 직원분들이 친절하셨습니다. 늦은 시간에 원하는 것들을 다 해주셨고 궁금한 거나 레스토랑 예약등은 컨시어지를 통해서 했는데 완전 친절하셔서 완전 만족했었습니다. 굿! 추천

title: family vacation
text:
we stayed at the mark for a week and had an amazing experience, the rooms were very comfortable with a lot of closet space and an amazing bathroom.
The Hotel is located at probably the most upscale part of manhattan. really nice property with extraordinary service overall.

title: Still great but challenging Start
text:
I have been staying at The Mark for a few years now, every time really I come to New York. I love the location, the tranquility of the hotel and the overall style of the hotel and the rooms and in particular their impressive bathrooms (with really strong shower pressure). The Service and food historically have been excellent and I have always been treated very well with all my requests being met with a smile (which is why I keep returning to this lovely place).

This time around however they were off to a slow start. While check-inn is usually 3pm, historically the front desk has been very forthcoming and I had no issues getting my room well ahead of that time. This time unfortunately I had to wait to almost 4pm before the room was ready - which after a long journey is sub optimal. 

Once checked into the room I wanted to grab a snack from the minibar, only to discover that half the items in the minibar were off by weeks if not months. Additionally, my luggage was not delivered until I called and asked for it. When leaving the hotel later that night, none of the guys at the doors bothered to ask if we wanted a taxi and only after I walked to the corner to get one one helped us out.

To their defense I received a room upgrade, free minibar items and generally great service thereafter including a late check-out on the day I was leaving.

I still love this property and shall be returning but hope these issues in the beginning will not be repeated.

title: Service could really be better
text:
Another reviewer mentioned that the service was a hit or miss and I completely agree. The bellhop was great but everyone else I experienced had some attitude problem. Might be spoiled from just having moved over from The Greenwich Hotel. That place is faultless and probably the best money you’d spend on a hotel in nyc. 

The Mark’s lobby is beautiful, very instagram worthy but no other notable amenities within the hotel. Beds are comfortable.. they left a lauduree macaron one night and chocolates another for turn down... The towels are probably the plushiest in NYC but the water pressure in the bathroom was just acceptable... the bath products provided were very mediocre and generic... 

Bicycles were in good condition but the door guys pretends not to watch while you struggle and doesn’t even attempt to adjust the seats for you - unlike at the Greenwich..

I’ve moved down to The Surrey since and I like it much better. Beautiful rooftop bar, Diptyque products, really good water pressure and great beds.. 

Hope this helps!

title: Missing the Mark
text:
I was in the City for four nights to see some shows this month with my niece and picked The Mark over a number of other hotels based on its location and room layout. We were in a Junior Courtyard Suite, which has a sofa bed in the living room and two full bathrooms.  The room was great - very quite and the layout was exactly what we were looking for.

The location is good - just a block from Central Park, two blocks from the Met, and a 20 minute walk through Central Park to the Natural History Museum.

However the service was really hit or miss.  I'd say 30% hit and 70% miss.  At check-in the agent gave us that look and tone that suggested we just weren't worthy of her time.  No confirmation of the room type, etc., and when I asked I got this huge sigh.  

Same experience at breakfast: The hostess looked at us like she's rather have us arrested than seated, and then gave us a table that was practically in the kitchen, even though there were only about 8 tables occupied in the entire restaurant.  Wait staff just dropped items off on the table without confirming what they were or who was to get them.  And check your bill carefully; they overcharged us, and then, when I called out the mistake, tried to claim that the price on all the menus was wrong.  We were there for four days and the price on the menu remained "wrong" the entire time.  I'd bet it's still "wrong."

The same was true of room service - they just drop the tray and hand you the bill.  And you really need to confirm what they've brought, as it was wrong about 50% of the time).

And their phone system doesn't work reliably.  One morning I called for 15 minutes straight to get through to room service or the operator to no avail (the "zoomie zoom" hold music will send you over the edge). When I walked down to the front desk to ask about what was going on, the four of them (only one of them doing anything) treated me like I was this huge imposition, telling me they were sure there was nothing wrong with the phones, and patronizing the insane guest that someone from room service would call right away.  So I go back up to the room, but there is no call, and I have to go back down with the menu to order the food, which they then get wrong.

After all that, I did get a call from the front desk explaining that I had been right and their IP phone system had been malfunctioning and had to be reset. And to their credit, they did comp the breakfast - a nice gesture, but the package we had "included" breakfast.  I use quotes around "included" because what they really do is give you a $30 credit per person for breakfast, but this is New York, the cheapest breakfast on the menu (the continental breakfast) is $40 per person.

There were some bright spots.  Helen, at the concierge desk, was wonderful - so helpful and friendly, and we had a nice guy take us to Bergdorf's in the pedi-cab.

But overall, the service was a significant disappointment.  New York is filled with great hotels that really understand top-notch service. The Mark could learn a lot from them.

title: Amazing!
text: The hotel is beautiful and located very close to Central Park.  Excellent service and staff. Everyone was very knowledgeable about the area and things to do. Our room was large and very nicely appointed.  The bathroom was spacious which can be hard to find in NY. Service is the focus of this luxury hotel. The hotel is not inexpensive but definitely worth it!  I plan to return.

title: Excellent-- one of New York's top three hotels!
text: The Mark is an absolutely excellent hotel in New York's best neighborhood. A superb top-notch staff.  Impeccable attention to detail.  Understated, elegant, unpretentious.  And the best ice cubes I've ever had in any four-star hotel.

title: The Mark is a benchmark for luxury and best in class service!
text:
I would like to note that after experiencing luxury chain hotels and luxury small boutique hotels, it's been my conclusion that if one has a top-tier status at a chain hotel the experience there is usually superior to that in a small boutique hotel - elite status at a chain hotel brings personalized service, upgrades, ultra-late evening checkouts, and benefits. Additionally, my general experiences with hotels in New York have not been memorable, and I often tell myself that the folks who rave about the luxury hotels of New York do so as they haven't experienced luxury hotels in Dubai, Singapore, Hong Kong or even India.

My conclusion was wholly dispelled upon my first visit to the Mark.

From the moment of arrival, my expectations were surpassed. The bell boys were smart sharp and attentive. The check-in experience was swift and enjoyable. The rooms were huge by New York standards. The decor is modern and the "right" kind of luxury, to my mind - attention to detail and to what the customer would experience.  As we had booked using the Amex concierge, we received USEFUL free benefits such as a credit towards F&B at the hotel.

The room was very comfortable. The bathroom was luxurious, however a tad smaller than expected. All typical amenities were provided, especially an adequate number of water bottles. While our flight out was during the early afternoon, I asked for a late checkout and decided to check how late they could go, given that I was a first-time visitor - without disclosing the specific time, I would say that I was surprised at their leniency.

The minibar selection has to be seen to be believed, its stocked like a corner store.

The staff were ultra-nice and seemed to have great memories as many of them knew my name within a day of my arrival.

While the location is not precisely on Central Park, it's close enough, and I would say that it's well located.

The Jean Georges back restaurant serves a scrumptious breakfast, and my favourite feature about it is the natural light and tables that are not packed like sardines in a can.

I would definitely like like to stay here again.

title: Just Perfect
text: The Mark is just the best hotel in New York City. From check in to check out, concierge, restaurant, bar, door.. everyone really goes out of its way to recognize you, make you feel at home and give you a sense of importance... no matter who you are! This - in my humble opinion of a constant luxury traveler - is what makes a 5 star luxury hotel a 5 star luxury hotel!! So.. BRAVO! See you Soon, M.

title: Perfect stay
text: This hotel made the stay in New York perfect. The service staff was friendly, welcoming and helpful, even allowed an early check-in which was very much appreciated. The room is furnished in such a way that guests are pampered and well taken care of. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Love the big bathroom and powerful showers. The location is excellent too, close to Central Park, the museums and good shopping. Will be back!

title: Great location, friendly staff, fabulous restaurant. ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
text: Great hotel on the East Side, clean rooms, but on the small size. Friendly staff, the restaurant is not to be missed, organic food, well prepared with a great wine and martini list. Doormen and concierge were very helpful.

title: Surprisingly Lacking in Service
text:
When it comes to hotels in general, the Mark is obviously in the upper echelon. Beautiful location; lovely, lush design in the lobby and the rooms. All manner of upscale extras. Both the beds and the tubs are my new favorites of any NY hotel, including the St. Regis, which previously held the title for me. 

However, when it comes to five star boutique hotels in specific... The Mark falls behind with a pretty serious service deficit.

I stayed five days, four nights. Full freight. The man who checked me in was friendly and thorough, but after that the service was consistently hassled or nonexistent until the second I was walking out for the last time. Only then did one of the six employees in the lobby acknowledge my existence. 

Not once before that moment - Not once! In five days! - was I greeted entering or leaving the hotel. The doormen were always either talking amongst themselves or other staff or otherwise engaged. Concierge never made eye contact. Reception ignored me. 

Tried to get room service for dessert on a weeknight at about 8:30 pm; both of the things I tried to order (a piece of cake, a piece of pie) were out. This turn of events was met with a shrug. Ordered breakfast to my room on my departure day and it arrived with a broken coffee pot and half the order missing. Same response. 

And both times, on the phone, I was interrupted, mid-order, by an annoyed voice.

ME: Hi, I’d like to place an order for break—
VOICE (annoyed, loud): How many guests?
ME: 2.
VOICE (annoyed, distracted, rather DMV-like): Ok, go ahead. 

Service in the bar was chilly, perfunctory. It was busy on a Monday night, so I sat on the edge of a couch occupied by another couple. Placed my order. Then another couch three feet away opened up, so I moved. When the waitress returned to see I’d moved *three feet away* she literally rolled her eyes. I actually laughed in surprise at that particular cherry on top of the overall ice cold service at this hotel. 

After years in NY I had to move away for work, and have long considered the ONLY benefit of leaving my home here was that I could indulge the city’s great hotels every time I come back (four/five times a year). I’d somehow never tried the Mark up to this point, but after seeing some particularly great reviews and rankings, I was excited to try it. 

What a disappointment. There are obviously other things in the world to worry about, but when I’m dropping over $500 a night on a hotel experience, I’m looking for just that — an experience. Not just posh furnishings, but warm, attentive people; smart attention to details; an overall sense of being welcome and feeling taken care of. There are hotels in this town that make it an actual art form. The Mark doesn’t.

title: Spectacular
text: The service and rooms were impeccable, loved taking the hotel bicycles around Central Park and great location to visit Museums. The breakfast was amazing and we did even spot some Movie stars at breakfast.  It is however 5 star to not good if you are on a budget.

title: Petit déjeuner
text: La seule déception du sejour,la mauvaise idée de faire un petit déjeuner a The Mark ,si l entrée est magnifique,la salle du petit déjeuner est désuète ,les portions extra light ,l eau sournoisement apportée,pas de service à table,on ne vous ressert ni le cafe,ni l eau,le scones a 10$ est plus que moyen.pas de recommandation pour le petit déjeuner .

title: The Mark Nailed it Again! 👊🏼
text: Just returned from our annual trip with our 6 year old daughter and The Mark hotel once again surpassed all expectations. From the friendly bell men to the front house team especially, Daniel they all make it feel like a second home. 👍🏼

title: Outstanding Hotel!
text: We just spent the evening at the Mark and we LOVED it!  The staff could not have been more accommodating and friendly.  Our room was beautiful.  The bed was comfortable and it came equipped with an Ipad for controlling the temperature and lights.  The show was had great pressure and it came with a heated towel rack.  The restaurant was very nice for breakfast and lunch.  They also have a courtesy car to take you to nearby places. I would highly recommend the Mark on your next visit to NY

title: Family fun in the city
text: We stay here every time we are in the city!  The staff are always amazing, friendly, and helpful.  Extremely dog friendly with access to great dog sitters.  Close to Central Park and shopping.  Restaurant by Jean-Georges is always delicious.  Love the vibe, design

title: Felt like home.  Everyone very friendly and gracious.
text:
Beautiful and comfortable room.  The room had good lighting, lots of lighting choices and was beautifully designed.  Tons of closet space!  Incredible large bath with a big deep tub!  Good gym.  Great restaurant in the hotel.  Location is fabulous.

Service was impeccable from start to finish.  Very nice people.

title: It is getting worse
text: It is the third or fourth time that I am invited by a friend to the Mark. The experience is deteriorating from visit to visit. The noise level is too high to conduct a conversation without screaming. The background music at the beginning of our dinner was so annoying that my friend had to go to talk to the manager (the waiter refused to do anything about it) to get rid of this nuisance that truly does not belong to a restaurant of these prices. Then trouble started. The first bottle of wine had turned and was sent back. The second was OK (with a mark up by a factor of 4...). We then shared a pizza between three of us, it was good. The main dishes were a shame: two of us ordered rare, and the dishes arrived well done. Two plates out of three were returned to the kitchen. The replacements were OK. Asking for the check required three attempts. Obviously the place needs a floor manager to provide the service and quality that the prices require. I hope that my friend had enough of this place - it is not worth the trouble.

title: Best hotel
text: Loved the hotel! Service was impeccable. Reminded me of the water hotel I stayed at once. (Which is my favourite hotel EVER) This was very similar. Great location and 5 star accommodations. I would stay here again and again

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
This is our second time staying at The Mark and it has been a delight. We especially love the top notch customer service. The front desk manager Daniel Lochnicki went out of his way to make sure we had an unforgettable stay. Daniels energy and thoughtfulness made us want to come back again the next time. First class service!

Thank you to The Mark hotel for striving for excellence, its very telling. Be back soon!

title: 5 Star Hotel / Average Staff :(
text:
Stayed here with my family Monday May 28th until June 1st.  I personally travel for a living and stay in 30 properties a year, around the globe / all 4-5 star properties for at least 3-5 days at a time, so I am aware of comparisons to other properties and services. I do not write this in hopes of deterring anyone from this property - it is lovely. 

Firstly, it's a wonderful location and that cannot be argued.  It's beautiful, it's quiet and comfortable; however, what makes a 5-star hotel a 5 star hotel, is always the staff.  With the exception of one specific doorman / porter, The staff at this hotel were less than friendly, and not very welcoming or helpful. Never did I receive a hello as we walked in, welcome back, or anything for that matter, as we passed the front desk or concierge. For a 5 star boutique hotel, the staff should be familiar with you. When you are spending this type of money, you are spending for an "experience" and you should feel more welcomed.  I hate to say this, however if we were more stylish, I think we'd be a bit more tended to. 

The room was very nice. We stayed in a 77 Jr. Suite. It was nice, the bed was comfortable and the shower / bath was truly the highlight of the room. Simply amazing showers in the main and guest. I didn't want to get out, ever. 

The room service was quite good, expensive, but good. Get the ice cream. 

The maid service was very good, they do a very good job of cleaning and keeping the room in order so you can enjoy your stay. 

The location at Central Park and the MET, was absolutely perfect.  Couldn't be better. 

Regardless of the under trained staff, this is a nice property, it just needs a more well rounded and accommodating staff.  They were quite average unfortunately and that's why I can only give it 3 stars, as this is so important to the overall experience.  

I'd recommend this hotel, if you are in the city for a couple of days and want to be near the park.

title: A Little Disappointing This Time Around
text: Just spent a week at The Mark and not as happy as usual.  We had 2 plumbing issues - water in one basin stopped flowing and no hot water in shower.  These problems were taken care of immediately we complained, but wish they hadn't happened in the first place.   Also, I left my special neck pillow at the hotel when we left and, surprisingly, was not notified of this - should have been emailed  and asked whether I wanted it shipped.

title: Amazing restaurant
text: Terrific food, ambiance, service!!! We enjoyed the samosas, martinis, sweet pea soup, angel hair pasta! The dessert was second to none....the waiters were very caring! We will come back in a heartbeat!

title: Always as a good choice
text: Have stayed at the Mark several times in the past two years. Always top notch service and room quality. The breakfast is a particularly good and reasonably priced (considering the alternatives in the area).

title: The Perfect Experience.
text:
In my opinion, The Mark is the best hotel in NYC. Not only is the staff friendly and welcoming but you get the feeling that they actually care about you. They will go above and beyond and make every interaction a positive one. 

Maarten at the front desk checked us in, and personally brought us to our room. We mentioned it was our anniversary, not thinking anything about it we settled in quickly and went to out to dinner. Upon our rerun there was a beautiful bottle of champagne and a hand written note congratulating us, it was just so thoughtful. 

In the morning we decided to stay in bed and order room service, Gail who took our order was so sweet and accommodating to my wife's dietary needs and made sure the food was prepared for her correctly. Sometimes it is hard to travel when you have so many restrictions but The Mark made it seem so easy. 

We felt so comfortable at here and are excited to make this our new home away from home!

title: The Mark continues to be excellent.
text: I started staying at the Mark before its renovations and loved it.  Now it is even more beautiful and still is IMHO the best hotel in NYC.  I love being on the UES and the service is excellent.  I went with my two young daughters and they had the best time.  The staff catered to them and made them feel at home.

title: Terrible service average rooms. Not worth the money
text:
I have stayed at the Mark for the last 8 years. I come about 3-4x per year for a week at a time. Over the past 2 years I have been increasingly disappointed each time. I come back only due to the location. I have held off from writing a review as I keep thinking maybe this was a one off, let me give it another chance. Last time the service was so bad I met with the general manager and spoke to him about it. However, each time the Mark continues to disappoint. We have many friends who have the same issue and have decided to stay elsewhere. There is huge turnover in staff. Each time we come there are different people. The only consistency is the concierge team and they are great. The rooms are average - tired—but I am ok with that- although I spend an average of $1200/ night. However, the service is increasingly poor.  On Sunday my husband and I went down to have breakfast in the breakfast room  ( which is included with our room since we booked through Amex centurion fine hotels and resorts)- we were told by the manager they don’t accept walk ins! I didn’t realize that being a hotel guest paying $1200/ night we would be considered walk ins. We were told we should have made a reservation as it was mother’s day. We spoke to the hotel guest relations Minela and she was not able to help us get a table. We informed her/ front desk that we should have been informed by email or in person at check in if we needed to make a reservation for breakfast. That would have been the very simple thing to do to inform hotel guests that they would need to make breakfast reservations because otherwise they could not be accommodated. Or better they should block tables for hotel guests. Not accommodating your hotel guests for breakfast is probably not something a hotel such as the Mark should do. We stay at Aman resorts, Cheval Blanc, mandarin oriental, four seasons throughout the world and we have never experienced a hotel that does not accommodate its own guests for breakfast.

We stay at the Mark because we prefer being on the upper east side and we prefer a boutique hotel feel. However, after all these years and the many chances we have given it—there are always consistent service issues— We will be looking at other options such as the Carlyle and the Surrey.  I suggest you do the same if you are a discerning traveler and don’t want to be disappointed.

title: Mr
text:
Possibly the worst service of any “5” star hotel in the world.  They have high staff turnover, exceptionally poor service, they don’t feel the need to be accountable and do the minimal work. Example: we checked into the hotel Friday night. Sunday morning we go down for breakfast and they tell us that even though breakfast is included in our US$1,200 room rate, they cannot accommodate us for breakfast because the restaurant is full for Mother’s Day! Nobody bothered to inform us at any point during our stay that we need to book in advance for breakfast (which frankly we shouldn’t need to do given the amount we are paying per night), nor do they block tables for any of their hotel guests (nor do they inform us we need to book a table, even though we were there for breakfast on Saturday), the restaurant manager makes zero effort to accommodate or find a cancellation (and says, “ no walk-ins accepted!”), the front office manager is completely apathetic and defers to the guest relations manager who says “I  understand you are frustrated” and proceeds to do...nothing! 

Example 2, I order an espresso to the room, the bill says $7.00 for the coffee and $7.50 “delivery charge” plus tax and service!  I have never seen a 5 star hotel charge for delivering an espresso to the room - and the delivery charge is more than the espresso charge!
