The staff at the front desk is poorly trained, they obviously have an outdated software system that doesn’t recognize repeat guest or regulars. This hotel is a 3 star at best! Total waste of money and the most apathetic service anywhere.

title: The Mark Hotel New York
text:
Not possible to review the Mark Hotel New York as despite having a confirmed booking of 2 rooms for this Sunday for 3 nights, upon telephoning to reconfirm booking the hotel said booking had been cancelled!!!??!!
They were fully booked for one of the nights and were quite rude and unhelpful in their attitude. Fortunately we were able to find accommodation elsewhere.

title: Minha casa em NY
text: Sempre é bom voltar ! O serviço excelente, os concierges não poderiam ser mais atenciosos e eficientes. O restaurante do hotel é considerado um dos melhores de NY ! Tem uma academia muito boa! Serviço de sapatos do John lobb, e ao lado do st ambreous !! Para mim um dos melhores hotéis de NY

title: Perfection....but
text:
Arrived for an overnight stay, combining business and a family celebration.  The hotel is exceptional.  We were greeted by a bell staff and a front desk staff that is nothing short of 
superb.  The room has everything you could possibly wish for in a five star hotel.  It was all a dream until breakfast this morning...the service was delayed, a 20 minute wait for coffee and the juice came after we finished our meal.  The front desk, with their utmost professionalism promptly resolved the matter.  But the restaurant doesn't keep pace with the rest of this wonderful hotel.

title: Lovely stay at The Mark
text: Amazing service, love Jean George restaurants, and the warm and friendly staff went out of their way to create a welcoming environment. Anabela at the concierge desk was fabulous! I will definitely be returning soon!

title: Perfect location
text:
It’s recommended by a friend because of its location.   Perfect for visiting Central Park, Metropolitan museum and all those shops. The service is beyond my expectation.  I arrived with early flight of 5am and checking in was arranged smoothly.  Staffs are friendly and professional.

朋友推荐的酒店，说位置很好。确实如此，离中央公园，大都会艺术博物馆还有各种名店都很近。服务也超出了预期。我的航班早上5点到了，入住顺利，极为难得。酒店工作人员都很友好和专业。

title: New York Upper East Side
text: Gorgeous Hotel does not disappoint.  I had visited the hotel to look at the rooms on a previous visit a month earlier and was looking forward to staying here on my next visit.  I was scheduled for 4 nights and due to circumstances ended up staying for 8 nights.  Everyone at the hotel is so friendly and service oriented.  I can't wait to go back again.

title: Normal, esperaba mas
text:
De acuerdo al rango de precio y a su categoria esperaba una mejor habitación, ya que es muy pequeña y no la consideraria lujosa, cuenta con una cocineta que hace que la habitación pierda el glamour, la decoración es antigua debido a su localización. 

Deje un objeto olvidado lo reporte y no hubo buena atención. 
Puntos Buenos:
La ubicación
Es muy tranquilo y puedes ir a restaurantes buenos cerca.
Asi mismo cuentan que en el bar de este Hotel Margot Robbie acepto un papel para una pelicula importante, sin embargo jamas volveria a hosedarme. 
No lo recomiendo, muy decepcionante esperaba mas.

title: A great place to stay in the City
text: The hotel deserves a great rating as it’s ideal location in Upper East Side is matched by the really wonderful staff across the hotel. A warm greeting from the first moment I arrived let’s me know that this is home from home. I am returning soon and looking forward. The room was spacious and very well appointed.

title: A gem in NYC
text: We were last in this hotel 15 years ago when it was part of Mandarin Oriental group , we found the hotel nice but getting worn out . We are glad to be back to this renovated and independent boutique hotel , away from the most bustling part of town , and in a very nice neigbourhood . We arrived late morning , the junior suite  is already ready  . The doorman , check in , concierge ( Isabelle Hogan , hold over from the Mandarin) all very helpful , there is a shoeshine service on the second level ( 7 days a week ) Our room is modern yet classic , do not expect any good view as the highest floor is only 12 . There were separate living and bedroom with two bathrooms and showers . The water pressure at the  shower is among the strongest in any hotel we have been too , like in a waterfall !!  The Queen bed is ok , next visit will request for a King Bed . The exercise room is spacious and well equipped .  We used the house car a few times , a big SVU for 7 people !  We have been all the best hotel in the city ( Mandarin , Peninsula , Ritz , Regis , Trump ). This hotel gives you a homely feeling , yet a 5 star service . Great restaurents and shops all close by , easy and fast  access to upper west side too ( our daughter family resides ) . This may be our hotel of choice in NYC ( no pool only drawback )

title: 素敵なHotel
text:
アッパーイーストサイドの落ち着いた場所にあり公園も近くNYらしさを堪能できました。
部屋も雰囲気があり、Bath Room
のDeaignも素敵で優雅に過ごせます。
レセプションの対応も完璧。
ホワイトブラックのグラスに一目惚れして、特別販売？でお土産に購入しました。次回は紅葉時期に泊まりたいですね。

title: Loud music from the restaurant
text: The hotel is ok. Good location, polite service, nice instagram account, comfortable bed. BUT, we stayed in room 322 and first of all the window looked into an ugly inner courtyard that was basically no view at all. The room was a bit drafty too. I would have overlooked all of that, but the music from the restaurant was blaring every night until 11 PM. Nothing they could do about it other than apologizing... that was unacceptable for this type of hotel. If you go, make sure to request a high floor.

title: Best hotel in NY with a great restaurant.
text:
This hotel makes you feel at home as soon as you get in. The service is friendly and competent, the French manager Olivier brings a French touch of quality and hospitality.
The quality of the restaurant by Jean-Georges is outstanding, make sure  to reserve as it is always full. We will certainly come back to this hotel next time in NY.

title: Excelente
text:
Muy contenta con el hotel . 
Atención de primera.
Hotel ubicado EXC. 
Concierge Isabelle MB
El rest de primera ,  la atención MB en el desayuno igual. 
Habitacion muy linda muy contenta de haber estado
En este hotel .

title: Great hotel for MET fans
text:
Pros: The hotel room is top-notch and the location was convenient for how we wanted to spend time in NYC. We stayed in #517 and the size of the room was very good. It offers turn-down service. Water pressure is very, very strong. Water temperature is not so hot in the morning even at highest setting but in the evening its super hot. 

Cons: The turn-down service can be improved. Moisturizer can be stocked twice a day regardless of how much is used from the bottle especially because the moisturizer is light and people do freshen up in the evening. If the toiletries are stocked by default than we did not get that service unless requested by phone. The A/C in the room was very noisy.

Conclusion: We will have to experience Mark again to be definitive whether we would like to stay here again and again.

title: A Perfect 10!
text:
My new most favorite NYC hotel! Beautifully decorated- spotless- with incredible service!.
Upon arriving we were greeted curbside by a literal "team" of gracious assistants- one person to greet- one person for bags- one to hold an umbrella over our heads!! A wonderful welcome! It really set the stage for our stay!
We had nicest experience of checking in with Karline at the front desk. After giving our information Karline offered to take up to our room and give us a little tour of the hotel amenities! Never before has a person from the front desk taken the time and offered to show us to our room! She is very gracious and a great asset to the hotel!              We had dinner in the hotel restaurant-delicious food -attentive service! Our room ( a king on the third floor) was beautifully decorated and had gorgeous marble bath and every amenity one could need!
Room service was so quick and efficient and housekeeping did an awesome job of keeping everything spotless and a terrific turn down service!
The bell captain and car valets were so friendly and helpful!
We loved this hotel and hope to return again soon!

title: "One of a Kind"
text: If you are looking for a one of a kind and art deco / chic hotel, this is your place to stay!!  Not only is the hotel beautiful,  but the staff is wonderful and they go out of their way to make you feel like you are home. I look forward to many more adventures in the Upper East Side of New York! Thank you for the beautiful experience.

title: Class from top to bottom
text:
It’s been a bunch of years since we last stayed here and boy was it worth returning. 

Staff is warm and gracious, the location vibrant and the rooms leave nothing to want.

From showers that make you feel like you’re in an Amazon waterfall to the finest top shelf thoughtfulness of amenities to bedding that begs you to stay in bed just a few minutes more; the Mark exudes class.

Our junior suite was perfect. Not enormous but therefore warm and inviting. No vacuous rooms with beat up furniture and no soul like the London NYC or the JW Marriott. The suite was laid out beautifully with separate “powder room” complete with full shower while the built in room storage perfectly welcomed in all our clothes and belongings. 

Room was copious enough though to permit massages for two in room while the hallway between living room and bedroom provided tranquil separation. 

The beverage and snack settings are generous and well stocked with daily refreshment that overlooked no small detail. Nespresso brought to the room included a full sleeve of pods and all accompanying elements.

Music from the world radio and automatic blinds make the sense of the room intimate while the are deco bathrooms are enormous and well lit.

Tiffany at the bar downstairs is a delight and the sommelier was superb in getting out what vintage of Screaming Eagle to have with dinner in the Jean Georges restaurant that is always seemingly bustling and vibrant!

Can’t wait to return and return we shall.

title: Perfection in Upper East Side
text: We spent most amazing Thanksgiving weekend at this stunning property. We booked via Amex FHR and were so fortunate to get a room super early when we arrived at 9:45am on Thursday. We were upgraded to an amazing suite, overlooking lovely architecture of surrounding buildings. We dined at The Mark Restaurant by Jean-Georges for Thanksgiving and it was a real feast. We also had delicious breakfast there each day. We have stayed at many hotels in New York including Baccarat, and I must say the Mark was even better. We really loved our Thanksgiving magical experience and weekend in our beautiful suite. Thanks to everyone who made it happened and we can't wait to come back to our home away from home.

title: I ate at the bar
text:
Against my better judgement I agreed to meet a friend at the bar to eat, not the sort of thing I would normally do and I was proved right as to why.
Nice enough surrounding, at first I ordered a pizza but the waitress returned to tell me my choice was unavailable so I opted for a classic Margherita at her suggestion.
My friend arrived and told me I should have ordered off the restaurant menu, so this was duly bought over the pizza cancelled and pasta with meatballs ordered.
All seemed ok, but on eating the meatballs I discovered they were not fully cooked and the meat in the centre was raw, non the less I persevered as I was to hungry to care. 
My friend sent hers back and switched dishes. 
The chef sent over some Indian samosas as way of apology. Hardly what you want after ingesting raw meat and now plagued with the thoughts of, was that really the wise thing to have done and have I poisoned myself.
The bill came surprisingly there were no deductions. I had no energy to challenge such an awful experience.
Confirmation that bars are not places to dine.

title: Amazing  - went back next month!
text: Our stay at The Mark in October was so amazing, we went back in November.  The room was large and lovely, and the staff was amazing.  We loved the location and the bar was the perfect place to relax before dinner, a great local quaint setting.  The restaurant was  exceptional, as well.  We will be returning in March and, of course, will be staying at The Mark!

title: 4 nights in NY
text:
My 3rd stay with them. Always extremely polite staff, exceptional reception and concierge services. The rooms are extremely clean, elegant, comfortable and fancy. 
Mr Phillip Min is a well prepared and professional receptionist whom made my stay pretty much enjoyable.

title: Beautiful Hotel- Lot of Issues
text:
My wife and I could not have been more excited to stay here. Beautiful hotel, amazing location... and then my wife got sick. 
We decided to continue into the city as it was too late to cancel but I called the hotel asking for a room with a second bed or a cot. I was informed a cot would be an extra $50 plus tax or I could "upgrade to a room with two smaller beds". I had originally booked the Madison room- This room seems exactly the same but with two beds so I am not sure why it was an upgrade. I requested a courtesy of the hotel to waive the $75 upgrade fee plus tax but to no avail. They were polite but firm. Policy was Policy.

The room is nice, clean, dimly lit and overall fine. We had a few issues with the room that were not related to any of the previously mentioned. 

1. The room was FREEZING. The windows had cold air pouring in. Not leaking but POURING. Clearly there was no insulation or weather guarding on that windows so the second the heat went off the room was cold.  I had to turn the heat to 76 just to get it to warm up as the thermostat was on the other side of the room. This led to super warm moments followed by cold etc. 

2. Pigeons. We were on the 4th floor right above the entrace of the hotel. I heard pigeons the entire day and night. The window and window sill were covered in pigeon poop. Not exactly the view you want from a fancy hotel. 

3. House Car- This one is not something that is their fault perse, just something I noticed. We parked out car and did not want to move it. The hotel says they have a house car. We asked for it 3 different times. In advance and at the moment. Each time it was unavailable. Maybe I was not an important enough guest? I dont know. Would have been nice for them to take me a couple of blocks. 

The inside of the hotel really was beautiful. Bathrooms were nice but functions need to be updated. Towel warms didnt work and you can tell toilets were old and slightly discolored. 

Shoutout to the woman whose name I cant recall but worked the inside of the front door lobby. She was the only person friendly to us and not only opened the door for us in the lobby but also came to the rescue when our key didnt work. This woman did it all!

In summary: from my experience and their pettiness about charging me extra, I would go elsewhere. Beautiful hotel but my experience was simply severly lacking.

title: Did not hit the mark.
text: Lovely building on a lovely quiet Manhattan block. Reception was a mess since we arrived at 3:30 and our room was not available...check in was 3 PM. I upgraded to the Garden Suite to get a room and the suite was beautiful and well furnished. The shower is the best in western civilization but, alas, only one small bar of soap was provided. After dinner with our friends, we hit the hay.....big problem. The room was 78 degrees and we could not cool it down the entire night. The next morning when checking out; the clerk was indifferent to the problem...borderline snowflake. We needed a limo to the Brooklyn Cruise terminal and the concierge booked it for the day before we arrived. This is not the stuff that 5 star hotels are made of.

title: gorgeous rooms, wonderful bathrooms, excellent service
text: love everything about this hotel. the rooms are spacious and luxurious. the bathrooms are gorgeous, with large, modern showers and stand-alone tubs.  the concierge and staff are so pleasant and accommodating and are always happy to help.  we love staying here!  kids loved it, too, and the staff went the extra mile to make sure the kids had everything they needed.

title: Desrespeito
text: Ficamos hospedados por 5 noites no The Mark, eu, minha esposa e nossa filha de 11 anos. No começo, a equipe foi atenciosa e eficaz. No entanto, na terceira noite fomos surpreendidos por um desagradável cheiro de fumaça de cigarro no quarto. No corredor dos elevadores, ruído e burburinho de conversas masculinas. Quando a fumaça e o barulho se tornaram insuportáveis, depois das nossas reclamações, o gerente nos ofereceu um upgrade de acomodação. Como já estávamos bem instalados,  observei que quem devia se mudar eram os hóspedes inoportunos e barulhentos, não nós. Ele concordou, mas nos aconselhou a aceitar a proposta do hotel, porque, segundo ele, os tais hóspedes eram "intocáveis", pois se tratava de uma comitiva estrangeira, hóspedes frequentes, bons pagadores e habituais. Ele enfatizou mais de uma vez que os tais hóspedes eram "intocáveis". Fomos obrigados a fazer as malas e trocar de quarto, um quarto maior, mas, ao contrário do anterior, sem cozinha e sem geladeira, como precisávamos. Fica a pergunta: por que o tratamento diferenciado em relação aos hóspedes? O The Mark costuma agir assim, privilegiando alguns em detrimento de outros? Estamos muito desapontados.

title: Would definitely stay again
text: Stayed here for Christmas.  The staff especially were very helpful and booked lots of stuff for us including cinema tickets that we didn't pay for until we had checked in.  Our room was lovely - at the back of the building so maybe not everyone's choice but it was soooo quiet, it was an oasis of calm.  Really big bathroom, great mini bar, really really comfy bed with nice bed linen.  The hotel seems to be really well sound proofed, we never heard another guest when in our room.  The bar area is cosy.  One thing that we didn't see was the restaurant and the gym area.  In fact it was the only thing lacking in the introduction procedure at the hotel - the host didn't show or explain to us any of the hotel's facilities.  Minor point as we just found out for ourselves, but maybe that should be something that every guests is informed about when checking in.  Central park right on your doorstep, I would recommend and stay here myself again.

title: “ Fantastic location and excellent service”
text: The Mark Hotel continues to provide the perfect combination of charm and sophistication blended seamlessly with all the new technologies and conveniences. The staff was welcoming, the amenities were great. Dining is first rate, service and food. I look forward to visiting again soon!

title: N. Klein
text: I am a tough critic when it comes to hotels. This hotel is for the most discerning guest. Updated rooms, elegant bathroom, staff is friendly and available for anything I needed. Five star all the way!

title: Incredible hotel
text:
We stayed here during the snowstorm and were so happy we had such a luxurious hotel to stay inside. It was just the perfect trip, great service from the concierge. We had beautiful touches of cake and champagne left for my husbands 40th which just made our trip perfect.

Only gripe was the room service costs and extra taxes made a $22 bowl of plain lemon pepper fettuccine $50... which was kind of ridiculous. Other than that it was the perfect stay!

title: U go for the elegance and stay for the people
text:
Had purchased an exceedingly expensive ticket for a Broadway show.  Really pricey.  Also booked a babysitter to sit during the show through the concierge, who used an agency.

6pm...no sitter.  610...no sitter.  I called concierge in a panic.  They said it never happened before and called to investigate

Extraordinarily, when it was apparent that the agency's sitter would not be immediately available, a staff member of the Mark,Melissa , came to sit.  She was bright, warm and competent.  Came armed with books and toys.  The staff turned a crisis into an opportunity to show excellent service in a heartbeat

Many hotels in Nyc are elegant, well located and serve good food.  The Mark's staff have heart.  That's reason enough to come back every Christmas.

title: Excellence in Design and Service
text: We stayed in a suite for 7 nights during the Christmas holidays. The furnishing were outstanding. Beautiful living room for our whole family to gather at Christmas. The caring service is what many hotel say but the Mark really gets it right. Breakfasts are a real treat too.

title: Always Amazed
text: By far the best boutique hotel in NYC, hip and trendy but not just for millennial. Trendy euro crowd with a chic feel everywhere. The Jean Georges restaurant is spacious and friendly as is the hip bar. We had a high floor room this time so less street noise. Nice shower and decor and turn down. Great doormen always aim to please. They do it all seemingly effortlessly.  They were all over a problem we had with the safe and got it open just as our car was arriving. Apologies all around. Price is fairly high but a great neighborhood Brad the park and the Met. Really makes no sense to stay anywhere else.

title: 場所はよいが。。。。
text:
２Fではジョンロブの靴磨きが無料（冬なので、適当な靴がなく利用しませんでした）。Madison　Aveは五番街に比べるとマイナーだが、日本ではあまり見ないブランドも多く買い物にも便利。またMetにも5分圏内です。セントラルパークのカウントダウンもサムイが十分徒歩圏です。
77thストリートに面する部屋はリノベーションしたのか非常にきれいで、シャワーブースもあり、湯量も十分、シンクも深い。レストランはジャンジョルジュ監修、無料ワイファイも高速。荷物が来るのがやや遅かったがベルやレセプションサービスもまあ過不足ない。ただ、3回の朝食でミス（トーストの間違い、ソーセージとベーコン間違い、請求間違い、注文したものが来ないなど）が多くあったりとか、31日のターンダウンが遅く催促したりはした。大きな問題はないが、リゾートホテルのような感じではなく、年末のせいか結構いい値段なのでコスパはいかがなものか。。。

title: Excellent all around stay on the Upper East Side
text:
Stayed just after Christmas for a quick two night family trip, in two connecting rooms. Excellent location half a block off Central Park, right off Madison, surrounded by good spots to eat, and a quick cab ride up from midtown/tourist areas. 

Rooms were outstanding - very spacious for most any luxury hotel I've stayed in, but especially for NYC from my experience; clean, very well appointed, nice in-room amenities and amazingly comfortable beds. Showers were a bit...powerful (I feel like I "survived" the shower vs relaxed in and enjoyed it), but otherwise excellent rooms.

Service as well was 5 star from our experience. Jackie on Concierge took care of us with excellent restaurant recommendations and reservations, door/bell staff were constantly helpful attentive, and across the board our experience with the staff was very positive.  

Restaurant, for lunch at least, was the one downside for us - food was good, but extremely expensive relative to options in the area. Better for breakfast, but for lunch or dinner we'd probably skip it next time. Prices carry over to the room service menu as well. 

That said, outstanding hotel which we plan on visiting again.

title: Luxurious and warm!
text:
It all starts with first impressions and they do not disappoint from the moment you step out of your car for valet you are treated like you are a welcome guest in someones exquisite Home!
The front desk upgraded our room as  it wasn’t ready right away so they comped drinks and snacks at bar!
When our room was ready it was perfect!
Bathroom is large and very clean and bed was one of the most comfortable I’ve slept in!  Great location on NY’s upper East side!
I will be staying here often!

title: Vol de bijou.
text:
Un journée avant mon départ, j'ai laissé par mégarde un pendentif en diamant sur le coffre dans le placard de la chambre. Après dîner, le pendentif avait disparu. La chambre à été fouillée par nos soins, sans succès.
J'ai donc averti la direction qui a fait venir un agent de sécurité pour fouiller à nouveau toute la chambre ainsi que les bagages. Sans résultat.
La direction a mené des investigations auprès du personnel de service, sans résultat.
Finalement, la direction de l'hôtel n'a pas souhaité engager sa responsabilité. Le directeur n'a pas davantage fait engager l'assurance de l'hôtel. Il a donc laissé planer un doute sur ma probité, ce qui est inacceptable de la part d'un établissement de ce niveau, prétendant que le vol n'existait pas dans leur établissement. Je n'ai même pas eu le moindre geste de reconnaissance, ce qui est scandaleux.
Je recommanderais aux futurs clients de l'hôtel de bien vouloir se méfier du personnel...

A day before I left, I inadvertently left a diamond pendant on the chest in the closet of the room. After dinner, the pendant was gone. The room was searched by us, without success.
So I warned the management who brought in a security guard to search the entire room and the luggage again. No result.
The management conducted investigations with the service staff, without result.
Finally, the management of the hotel did not wish to engage its responsibility. The manager did not have the hotel's insurance contracted either. So he left a doubt about my integrity, which is unacceptable on the part of an establishment of this level, claiming that the flight did not exist in their establishment. I did not even have the gesture of gratitude, which is scandalous.
I would recommend to future guests of the hotel to be wary of the staff ...

title: I've stayed here for business, unprofessional demenor. I will not be back.
text: I stayed at the Mark Hotel this Fall for business as I travel a few times a year and found the upper east side to be quiet and close by my frequent meetings. The rooms are always clean and fairly sized for New York. The front desk has always been welcoming and accommodating even giving me a drink in the lounge to wait for my room. While waiting I went to ask about reservations I wanted at the restaurant that night with clients when I met the wretched women behind the concierge with blonde hair whom with every question I asked she seemed to have a blank inhospitable stare like I was disturbing her. I found her attitude completely appalling. The next afternoon I saw this same employee at the bar with the general manager drinking a glass of wine mid day, very unprofessional. Two days before my actual check-out date my assistant booked me at the Surrey Hotel. I asked to speak to the general manager when I was informed he was taking his dog for a walk. This hotel is not worth the money I have spent. I will never stay here again.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location
text: I consider the Mark a luxury small boutique hotel. I booked the Mark to treat my sister to a weekend in NYC and to surprised my best friend for her 50. I arrived very late on a Friday night and the reception were welcoming and helpful.The lobby is slick, with a black and white theme. Upon arrival, we decided to get a drink in the bar. It was crowded and we asked to be seated in the restaurant. The coat check girl was rude and condescending. She would  not seat us. We found room on a crowded banquet. The waiter ignored us. I finally wen to the bar and was rudely informed the bar had closed. However, i saw a table being served shots. My sister and i decided to have a drink in our room. Our room was a super king facing the courtyard which is very quiet. The bed, pillows and duvet was extremely comfortable. I was disappointed in the bathrobes as I was hoping for something more plush. The robes were stiff terry cloth. The next day, I approached the concierge to help book a table for breakfast and lunch. The concierge was very helpful. We stayed 2 nights. It is a lovely hotel in a great location. Madison avenue is perfect for window shopping and close to the park.  Despite some of the staff were rude, our stay was enjoyable. However, I will not be going back. There are better hotels with better service, like The Surrey which is around the corner. I had stayed there 2 years ago but this time they were fully booked.

title: Family Brunch
text: Horrible service! They managed to get every order wrong and the food was bad. It took them more than 25 minutes to get us coffee and even more for the food. Although we complained, nothing improved. I will never return.

title: Increíble!!!!!!
text: Fue una gran sorpresa descubrir este increíble hotel , desde la llegada nos recibieron con una gran amabilidad , la habitación que nos toco daba a la calle 77 sumamente limpia , ropa de cama de gran calidad , aparte de preciosa decoración de muy buen tamaño , serví bar muy buen servido , el baño muy amplio con muy buenas amenidades , tienen un carrito para llevar a los clientes a central Park por ejemplo , los desayunos deliciosos con un personal muy amable  igualmente su bar de muy buen ambiente en las tardes , el restaurante excelente , y lo mejor fue la gran gran atención de jakelyn en consierge , también Andrés en general todo el personal . Sin duda un hotel para recomendar y seguir llegando... realmente nos hizo este hotel un viaje maravilloso!!!

title: We will return
text:
My wife and I stayed at The Mark for the first time - certainly not the last. Situated on Madison's Upper east site, next to central park and surrounded by art galleries and designer's shops. 
Our room was a seventy seven room - large, extremely clean and beautifully furnished. Great bed and beautiful bathroom - quality is everywhere. Highly competent staff - in every function.
Notable flaw: quite noisy. We were situated at the third floor and were waken up by a waste truck at three AM - stood right under our room for twenty minutes. We asked to move the day after - better at the 5th floor... Room's AC is quite noisy as well.

title: This boutique hotel Rocks!
text: The hotel is darling - love the location near the MET. Gym is small but does the job. The bar at entrance is very cool for a cocktail.  The rooms are a bit small but very well appointed with a modern flair.

title: French Chic in Upper East Side!
text:
Tucked away on a side street, this hotel is a cozy respite from the hustle and bustle that is New York City.  It has been revamped in years past, and I think it has a very welcoming though minimalist vibe.  Black and white checkered floors, subdued lightning, comfy lobby sofas.  Nouveau French, bien sur!
  What I particularly like about the hotel is the buzzy bar scene.  No, it will not be inexpensive, but you can linger on the animal skin ottomans  and enjoy the stellar people watching.  If you are so inclined, you can head over to the Jean Georges restaurant, steps away, under the same roof and have dinner.  Again, expensive.  Not bad, when we were there, but not great.  Service was not up to par for such a place.
   Lastly, if your hair needs a whoosh to head out into the New York scene, Freddrick
Fekkai has a beautiful salon upstairs.  Of course, that coiffure will cost, but, hey, it is the Upper  East Side and the land of the beautiful physically enhanced crowd.  Go  for it!
    Oh, in the summertime, a little hot dog stand sets up outside.  Deluxe dogs, worth the splurge!  Again, from Chez Jean Georges...

title: THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN NYC
text: This IS the best place to stay in NYC- there are no comparable places to THE MARK. The suites are gorgeous, breathtakingly big n luxurious- you have every perk you could ever dream of here. The staff is 11 starworthy. its a great location. there really is not one thing bad to say here- its just excellence at a very high level from check in to check out

title: LA  CLASSE
text: Hotel de luxe de grande qualité dans un quartier calme. La clientèle est à l'évidence "supérieure" et pas mal de clients le montrent volontiers, mais c'est plutôt drôle à observer...et surtout c'est largement compensé par la qualité du staff qui est très agréable et même sympa (ils ont beaucoup de mérite parfois), tout en étant d'une grande efficacité. Pour nous, mention spéciale et merci à Kevin à la réception et Azran aux bagages. Le petit plus: un stand de hot-dogs maison (de qualité bien sûr) à l'entrée.

title: sehr gepflegt, top Service
text: Super Service, grandiose Lage, gutes Restaurant, kleine Suite für NYC relativ gross, sauber, ruhige Zimmer, wir haben den Aufenthalt genossen und würden wieder buchen. Einziges Manko war, dass im 2. Zimmer der kleinen Suite die Luft etwas stickig war, da kein Fenster.

title: Amazing experience, even better than the 1st time.
text:
Our second stay at The Mark honestly exceeded all expectations. Even though we already had a pretty good idea how great the hotel was, the impeccable service and attention we received during our second stay just reinforced the first impression. Truly, best hotel ever. 
As we noted in our first review, the main aspect that distinguishes The Mark even among its NYC 5-star-rated counterparts, as well as among comparable European hotels, is the custom tailored attention to the minute detail its guests receive. During our second stay, we brought along our 2 Scottish terriers, for The Mark is famous by its incredibly friendly pet policy. Not only every possible comfort component was accorded to our four-legged companions, such as plushy soft dog beds by Molly Mutt, designer water bowls and placemats, but even the room service menu included pet gourmet dishes, prepared by the world famous Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten.
The Mark restaurant offers a terrific breakfast, priced quite moderately. The John Loen shoe shine service is complimentary. 
We were upgraded to a corner suite, even without asking. The Reservation Agent ANASTASIA BELOUSKO provided an exemplary service, a true epitome of 'above and beyond'.  
All-in-all, a unique experience. And even though we recently moved our city stays to Lower Manhattan, we will most definitely come to stay at The Mark again, very soon.

title: Chic and beautiful
text:
Me and my partner loved our stay at The Mark, the hotel is in a great location and the whole experience was perfect.

We had a beautiful room, the interior design of the whole hotel was beautiful and  and chic.

I definitely will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family!

title: Exceptional food and service
text: This restaurant blew us away. Simple food at Michelin level. Whether it’s the cheeseburger, the veal or the salmon bagel pizza. It’s all exceptional as is the cocktail menu. As a side note, the chairs in the dining room are most comfortable I️ have experienced in a restaurant.

title: Even getting a drink at the bar I was cramped
text: In the neighborhood, I needed to cool off on a warm day with a glass of wine and a trip to the rest room. The hot dog cart on the sidewalk at the entrance, surrounded by hotel staff, was the first weird note. The bar, a wavy aluminum monstrosity with just six seats, had one open where I faced a huge display of bananas, of all things (they go great with wine and liquor, right?), which forced me to put my glass of wine off to the side, where there was about 8 inches of space. The wine was refreshing -- at $20, it should have been. The restroom? Up a steep flight of stairs nearby, with a gentlemen standing outside holding a stack of hand towels. Why outside? Well, the men's room was too small for him to stay inside. And both of the two stalls had locks that needed keys. I decided not to ask the guy outside for the key, which no doubt was attached to a huge wooden block to avert theft. Having a drink at a hotel's bar is just one of the ways I assess whether or not I'd stay at a hotel, or recommend it to friends. Based on this visit, I think the hotel's attitude toward guests fits the Urban Dictionary definition of "A Mark": "A person identified as an easy target, or "sucker". A mark is always the short end of a joke or scam, and is never let in on whats going on. A mark is usually being cheated out of money." You can be sure I'm not going back.

title: Minha casa em NY
text:
Para mim é o melhor hotel em NY. Tem um atendimento de primeira, quartos muito bem decorados e bem dimensionados. Uma Gym completa, restaurante da melhor qualidade ( Jean George) engraxate ( John Lobb ), cabeleireiro, um dos bares mais badalados da cidades, um servico de CONCIERGE estupendo, serviço de housekeeping e portaria perfeitos,  enfim para mim o melhor hotel de NY. Isso sem falar da localizacao. Fora a pizza do Room service que é imperdoável !! 
Marteen o gerente nao poderia ser mais atencioso e prestativo. Sempre saio com vontade de voltar logo.

title: The best NYC boutique hotel
text:
My wife and daughter stayed in a deluxe room and  had a great time--We enjoyed the hotel completely.  As a fan of boutique hotels - I know The Mark leads the way.
 
Everything at the Mark is done to perfection. The rooms are incredibly well kept. They are well appointed and very clean.  They are also quiet.  You never hear a sound in your room even though the hotel appeared very full during our stay. The staff is very helpful and kind. My interactions with the front desk employees and the manager Olivier proved to me that they are highly competent and focused on delivering a great experience for their guests.  The concierge staff is also superb.  I had multiple interactions with them and they were terrific every time. The Mark is my favorite hotel in NYC and I've traveled there frequently for over 15 years.

title: The Mark New York - ......much show little substance
text:
Polite staff - but the need to pack rooms and guests into small spaces is pretty extreme.  In my "courtyard" room: a) the desk is wider than the window alcove, b) the bedside table blocks the closet doors, c) and if you store your suitcase - that takes up all the room to hang your clothes.
The bathtub plug leaks.
The carpert - as in all hotels with carpets, is full of stains.
Black and brown carpets in the halls and corridors are pretty dirty and quite vulgar really.
But, as always, just treat what their website advertising says as the opposite of reality. Their "courtyard" rooms are advertised as "quiet" - no.  They face an industrial sized air-conditioning plant that cranks out an intolerably loud noise 24 hours a day (and night.) If you shut the window and are forced to use the room's AC - that's worse. And then they thought it was a good idea to install professional SubZero fridges in the minibar....pretentious and useless for sure, but what this really accomplishes is the third and final element to complete making as much noise as possible.  The industrial AC plant outside, the room's AC and the the professional kitchen fridges humming away make you feel as if you never left the aircraft you arrived in.

title: In and out but next time I’ll stay
text: We had a medical emergency and needed a week’s reservation so booked at a different hotel we’d previously stayed at several times; however, first night was unavailable there so reserved at The Mark.  Property was great throughout but icing on the cake was the most gracious and generous bell/front door staff who looked after our bags while I had to tend to family at hospital, and then after retrieving them - personally moved them to the other nearby hotel for me.  Truly above and beyond, and next time I’ll just head there from the start!  Thanks for a thoughtful experience when I had many other things on my mind and hands!

title: Perhaps the best hotel in NYC
text: Upper east site, next to central park, this hotel is hip and happening. A 5* hotel, with a chic but also relaxed atmosphere. The bathroom is amazing. The concierge knows what she is talking about. I stayed here for two days but wish I could have stayed longer. The restaurant was still sparkling after 11 pm, breakfast was good and compared to other hotels in NY not expensive. If I visit NYC again, I will know were to go.

title: Treat yourself!
text:
I had the pleasure of staying at The Mark for a business trip.  What an incredible oasis of quiet refined living! I had a very comfortable room, that was amazingly quiet even though it looked out onto Madison Avenue.  The in-room dining was delicious and timely.  It's available 24-7 and they will even pack a picnic lunch to enjoy in the park.  Staff were friendly and accommodating. Since my flight was late and I was running late for dinner, the bellman not only took my bag up to my room, but also arranged a taxi while I was checking in.  He was top notch!
The rooms are luxurious--from the marble bathrooms with a life-changing shower and towels, to the comfortable bed and furnishings.  I especially liked the Sub-Zero drawer refrigerator that was the mini-bar.  This is an incredible property and if you really want to treat yourself--this is the place.  My only regret was not staying longer.

title: Hip and Chic
text:
We stayed here based on our travel advisor's high praise and booked with points, so we were not rewarded with the usual upgrade stuff upon check-in. The bell staff greeting was friendly and welcoming. 
Our room was not ready at 4PM and we were offered a drink at the lobby bar, which is hosted by a bartender right out of a Noel Coward play, who entertained us while we waited. 
The place is packed with folks who appear to be on an expense account, with their entourage in tow, trickling in for dinner and drinks. The restaurant is beautiful, and the menu is well thought out. Aesthetic of the public rooms and the guest room is tightly planned, but deco chic, with caramel colored overstuffed mohair seating and gleaming nickel lighting throughout the reception area. 
The hotel room had a gorgeous marble bathroom, with deco cabinetry and nickel finishes. The hotel and room was designed to convey whimsy, high style and comfort. 
The one complaint about the check-in was the unmonitored wait - we went back to the front desk after an hour plus at the bar to see if the room was ready. The front desk should have retrieved us when the room was ready instead of leaving us in the bar to fend for ourselves. That said, when we were finally taken to our room, we were moved almost immediately when I showed concern of potential noise from Madison Ave. The room faced an interior courtyard, and was small, but it was serene, which fit the bill. Technology was well planned in the room as was the mini bar and closets. I would guess the hotel gets a great many business guests and would recommend it to my traveling professional friends who aren't tethered to a budget.
The only misstep was room service dinner, handed over to the Morton's Salt rep, and darned near inedible (and I'm a gal that likes my salt). However, brunch in the restaurant for us and friends the following day, albeit expensive, was very tasty (try the avocado toast). I've eaten dinner at the restaurant with friends before, and it's an entertaining scene with great food, so maybe the room service/kitchen was just off their game one night.
Breakfast through room service delivered perfectly poached eggs, and a perk for me: real coffee mugs instead of those tiny little tea cups that don't hold any coffee.
The exercise room is adequately equipped, and immaculate. Housekeeping is well managed because the room was spotless, as was the exercise area and public spaces.
Overall, management gets the joke here, and there's a "ricksaw" to Bergdorf's as well as a hotdog cart outside for the welcome pooches. I'd go back to this hotel, given it's competition in the neighborhood, but would opt into an upgraded room with FH&R or Virtuoso, and get the accompanying perks. However, for the rates, the game needs to be on point in every regard.

title: Peaceful location, large rooms, amazing water pressure!
text:
The Mark is my new favorite NYC hotel. The staff was kind and welcoming. I was thankful to be given an early check-in so I could freshen up before a 1pm Yankees game.  I LOVED the room - it was very large by New York standards.  My hair looked great thanks to the fantastic shower pressure. The room was spotlessly clean, and I enjoyed the beautiful and well stocked minibar. It had a full ice drawer!

It is peaceful to step out onto the street from the Mark due to its ideal location on 77th one-half a block from Central Park. It is a lovely little street. I enjoyed running in the park everyday.  Next year I hope to bring my dog,  I appreciate the dog-friendly attitude of the Mark. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Oasis de calma en plena gran manzana
text:
Reúne todo lo que a mi me gusta. Pequeño, atención personalizada, bien situado, camas súper cómodas, amables conserges, bicis a disposición de los clientes.....pequeños detalles que marcan la diferencia. Muy agradable.
También es definitivo que este año an próximo a 
Central Park. Para los paseos mañaneros de los que venimos de EUROPA

title: Otra gran estadía
text: Gran semana pase con mi hijo en este gran hotel. Me tratan igual o mejor que en mi casa! Desde nuestra llegada , a pesar de ser temprano a la mañana, una de las habitaciones nos estaba esperando. Esta vez ambas miraban al patio interior, ya que en otras oportunidades miraban a Madison Av. y eran más ruidosas. El baño maravilloso con su súper ducha que adoro. El restó es muy bueno y el servicio también. El personal de conserjería es estupendo, siempre recomendándonos lugares buenísimos para ir a comer después del teatro. Lo mismo para la gente de recepción y su gerente Mr Angel Mejía. Quiero decir unas palabras para el personal de limpieza del 5 piso en especial una señora de Albania encantadora y muy eficiente también!!!

title: Luxurious and fun
text: Everything was modern and clean and classic with a little edge of style. Fabulous food and cocktails as well as a great location. Rooms and bathrooms were pretty big for New York, exceptionally friendly and attentive staff.

title: Incredible Hotel!
text: Visited NYC last week and stayed at this amazing and incredible hotel. The staff were just superb and made us all feel at home. Being so far away from home, we actually felt like being at home!! Location is so important and its on 77th and Madison so walking distance to all the shops on Madison and to 5th Avenue, with central park right in front! A huge thanks to the concierge team: Jackie/Isabelle and Casey for making our stay in NY so enjoyable, prior to arrival and during our stay. Thanks to Eloise in reservations who reserved a great room for me! . Breakfast was amazing with every item you could think of, including gluten free pancakes! The Mark restaurant by Jeans-Georges  is probably the best in town and is beyond delicious and service was impeccable. The best cheese burger and the best Blueberry Pie! The brunch there is also very good and I highly suggest it! Hairdresser on the 2nd floor was so convenient and accommodated me last minute! I have no other words to say except a huge thank you and I cant wait to come back to NYC again very soon and stay with you!

title: Best hotel and service in the US
text:
Dear Mr Senbahar,
Congratulations on having such a wonderful team put together for your guests! The service was unbelievably fantastic.
Location, location, location... does not got any better! 
The rooms were amazingly comfortable and luxurious.
The food and restaurant flawless.
Your Conceige team from Isabella, Jackie, Cassie and Dan and the rest made life beyond easy. 
Anything we wanted we got. No matter how last minute the reservation or request.
We will be back - you have a huge fan in us.
Thank you all at The Mark.

title: Nice boutique hotel
text: We really enjoyed our visit to The Mark Hotel. My son and I went for a birthday weekend and reserved a one bedroom suite.  Room was really nice and comfortable.  The manager delivered a beautiful birthday cake for my son while we were out walking in Central Park.  Concierge was wonderful -  she suggested a comedy show for us, which was just perfect.   Restaurant was great for breakfast.   Great stay.  Will definitely go back.

title: Best Showers Ever
text: The Mark is conveniently located on the upper East side, just one block from Central Park.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and well appointed.  While not spacious, the rooms are large for Manhattan standards.  They have an excellent restaurant and lively bar.  What stood out the most however was their shower.  The stand-up glass-in shower provided plenty of room to move around and the water pressure was outstanding.  It was like standing in a torrential rain of hot water.  The huge drops and strong water pressure massaged my shoulders, while the shower stall filled with steam.  I'm not kidding, it's the best shower I've ever had and I've travelled all around the world.

title: Good but not great
text: Although the hotel is well located on Upper East Side and rooms spotless, the service was ordinary at best and very poor at other times. The reception team are trained to say the same thing and smile while delivering the least. I will revisit again but if the service doesn't improve customers will stop returning.

title: ラグジュアリーの一言
text:
2017年3月に宿泊

記録的大雪の夜に宿泊。
今まで泊まったホテルで、一番高級だった。
ロビーもバーも部屋も今まで見たことないほどのクールなデザインであった。

メトロポリタン美術館にも徒歩圏なので、
途中で戻ってきて休憩もできる。
もちろんセントラルパークはすぐそこ。
Sant Ambroeusももちろん行こう！

鍵を無くした際に、スタッフが皆で探してくれた。
優しい。

値段は高いが、高いだけの価値は十分にあると思いました。
NYC訪問の記念にぜひ！

title: Very pleasant stay
text: Very nice boutique hotel on the Upper East side of Manhattan. Very close to Central Park, the Met museum, Maddison avenue, its shops and restaurants. Very warm staff. Quiet and comfortable rooms. Very nice design across the hotel. Fun bar and nice restaurant. Gym, hairdresser etc. Dogs allowed. We enjoyed our stay very much and will stay there again if the purpose of our trip to New York takes us more toward mid to upper Manhattan and less so to lower Manhattan.

title: My Favorite
text: I love staying here. From the moment that you pull up in your car, everything is on point. Sophisticated staff, exceeding in attention to detail, and welcoming... I'm always so happy to see everyone here. They even remember my dog and give her treats. The decor of the lobby is bright and inspiring.The rooms are perfect, really, so clean, wonderful bedding and lighting. The bathtub is spotless, literally, deep, and luxurious. The Suite came with books, including one of the history of NYC. I love the hotel so much that I have to remind myself to go out and enjoy Central Park, less than a block away. I really appreciate the staff, who clearly value their guests. Highest recommendation ....

title: Great stay and service
text:
Boutique hotel with great service. They really pay attention and go out of their way to help in every situation from pushing the elevator button to holding an umbrella over your head as you walk to your uber.

I stayed in the Seventy Seven King and it was spacious with great decor. The room came with macaroons by the bed which was a nice touch. Overall the best part was the most amazing shower pressure along with a beautiful marble bathroom and large bath tub (enough for 2). They also have free bikes to ride around central park but we couldn't use them during our stay due to the weather.

The bath amenities were very nice quality but with a very very subtle scent.

As a travel agent, I would highly recommend and will book for future clients of mine.

title: Fabulous!!!
text: I stayed 2 nights at this property in July 2017 with my sister. It is situated in my favourite part of the city, close to central park and the metropolitan museum, as well as a wide variety of luxury retail stores. The hotel was outstanding. All of the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The interior is gorgeous and well kept. I loved my bed, which was super comfortable. Every part of the hotel is an instagram dream! I also had dinner at the restaurant. This a great room for people watching and  solid fare. I cannot wait to return!!

title: Fabulous Mark Hotel!!!!!!
text: The Mark hotel is our very favorite in NYC. Excellent location to Central Park and shopping, fabulous staff, excellent restaurant by Jean George's. Rooms are lovely and comfy. I highly recommend this jewel on the Upper East Side.

title: Impeccable 5-star service, an ultimate in luxury Manhattan jewel
text:
Great hotel, probably one of the best we have ever stayed at. The only comparison that comes to mind is Claridge's in London. 
To be honest and unbiased, first, after walking in our room (Madison Suite on the 12th floor), we felt a bit disappointed. Is that the famous Mark Hotel? Nothing special from the first glance, some other of thirty-plus hotels in Manhattan we stayed at, even those rated at 4-stars, offered more opulent room decor and more impressive room layout. The first impression has completely disappeared after a few moments, when one gets to realize that a hotel stay is all about comfort and convenience, which is a key to a great hospitality, not the amount of mahogany and gild or a size of a TV screen. 
And The Mark delivers on its promises. As a matter of fact, our positive experience started 3 weeks or so prior to our physical arrival, when our request to be lodged on a higher floor wasn't met with a customary 'per availability' brushoff. Anastasia B., the reservation agent, went above and beyond to assure our request was fulfilled. And then, the little things, that always have been a part of a stay in a reputable hotel but gradually disappeared - like being shown to your room by the hotel staff, complimentary overnight shoeshine by John Lobb The Bootmaker, turn-down service, welcoming fruits and chocolates and mineral water, everything had one master-plan behind it - attention paid to guest's comfort and satisfaction. 
Now a few practical advises. The Madison Suite, i.e. rooms facing Madison Ave as opposed to either 77th St or even courtyard - the view is not worth extra money. The huge apartment building on the north-eastern corner of 77th and Madison takes up the entire window. 
The location is otherwise more than envious. The Central Park is right behind the corner. The calm and relaxing solitude of the Upper East Side is a welcomed contrast to the hustle and bustle of the Midtown. 
A few little things that need attention - the electrical outlets/USB ports are available only on one night table, the other one needs a longer than usual cord to reach to the outlets in the opposite wall. In our day and age of smartphones with rapidly dying batteries that is an inconvenience. 
The Juice Bar in the lobby is great, highly recommended. Jean Georges' The Mark doesn't need any recommendations; refer to our dedicated review of the restaurant. 
The minibar choices, both liquids and solids, are more than numerous. The soundproof quality of the room - thanks to a long hallway leading from the door to the room - is excellent. The bedding is chic and the sleep quality is great. The number of elevators and thus waiting times are average. 
There are bicycle-driven Bergdorf-Goodman cabs available for all your shopping needs, right at the hotel's entrance.  
One thing we would like to emphasize is the amazing pet-friendly policy of the hotel. Not Surrey neither Plaza Athenee - The Mark's two closest competitors - even come close to the comfort and welcome pets get at The Mark. We were so impressed with it, that we are planning to book another stay at The Mark specifically to bring two of our dogs to spend a weekend in the Central Park.

title: Lovely
text:
The Mark is beautifully designed and the rooms are large. Bathrooms are gorgeous with lots of storage and the best water pressure we have ever experienced. 
Housekeeping is prompt and efficient and room are set back from elevators, making it supremely quiet.
An electrical problem in our room was met with a move to another room with no problems as quickly as possibly, and the hotel provided us with a vase of white roses in our new room. 
You will love the exquisite furnishings and understated, witty decor. Ample closets and drawer space, great room service from Jean George. In this crazy world, if you are seeking a refuge, you'll find it here.

title: Excellent Stay in NYC!
text:
We came into the city over the weekend to see a Broadway show and well of course we stayed again at The Mark Hotel! The Mark is amazing! The service is superb, staff is courteous and kind! Everyone from the moment we stepped out of our cab was so welcoming and professional! It made us feel like we were coming back "home"! Thank you Mark!
We would recommend this hotel to anyone coming into the city! The Mark is top-notch!

title: One of the best rooms in NY...
text: Following a renovation the rooms at the Mark I found to be one of the most spacious and modern in NY, compensating for the small lobby and bar the hotel has. Worth a try if you fancy a change, would definitely stay there again.

title: Styl a luxus
text: Takto nejak si predstavuji luxusni hotel se smyslem pro velky detail ale samozrejme i pro male veci zdanlive nepodstatne ale prave ty delaji v konecnem souctu velke rozdily. Poloha ok, pokoj super, personal aktivni

title: Five Star Service, Accommodation and Compassion
text:
We stayed at The Mark two weeks ago.  We travel to New York very frequently and had become a bit disenchanted with our previous "go-to," hotel and wanted to remain uptown so decided to try The Mark.

First the basics:  the rooms are beautiful, comfortable, clean and functional.  The bathrooms are gorgeous and quite large especially for New York.  The mini-bar is well stocked and beautiful  (sub-zero drawers filled with whatever you could want plus an empty drawer for things you may want to grab on your own).

There is a Fekkai Salon in the hotel.  It is phenomenal.  I had two services here and everyone was excellent.  

The Jean-Georges restaurant is one of my favorites in the city.

The scene is sophisticated.  This isn't a super "touristy," place which is a plus for me.

Now, in my opinion, it's not that hard to get the rooms, bathrooms and dining right.  I found out my mother had passed while staying here.  There are not words to explain the compassion and attention the staff gave my family during this time.  I had my young kids with me and was managing the immediate demands of a sudden death and the hotel, without even being asked, sent food up to the room every hour to make sure they were fed.  They sent a concierge to the store with a list of ingredients to make slime to bring back to my kids.  They literally carried me to a front office after I was delivered the news.  

This is something that only happens at a hotel where the people are kind.  Staff members who were off duty approached me on the street to express their condolences.

This hotel has earned my life long loyalty and if you are wavering between this and the other Upper East side hotels, I can tell you, having stayed at them all, this is really your hands down best option.

title: Need to work on the details
text:
For a 5 star hotel I was expecting things to be close to perfect. But they weren't. 

Our room was not ready until almost 4pm, an hour after the official check-in time. They kept saying "the manager is in the door making sure everything is perfect." It was the same line they used at 2:45, 3:12, and again at 3:45. They did give me $100 food voucher. But for a 5 star hotel the room should have been ready on time.

The extra bed for our daughter was not ready on arrival, even though it was requested when we booked the stay with Expedia. They said it will be there in the evening around 6-7pm. We reminded them of the bed before we left to our show at 6:30pm, but when we got back to the room at 9:30pm the bed was still not there. I had to call the front desk to request it. It was finally set up after 10pm. 

Yes the rooms are nice, yes the staff was friendly, but they missed a few details and our one night stay didn't feel special. I'll not stay here again or recommend others to stay here.

title: Superbe hotel
text: Un emplacement de rêve ,un accueil parfait ,le restaurant de l hotel est delicieux ainsi que le bar pour un Quick Lunch .Les chambres sont spacieuses ainsi que les salles de bain ,la décoration de Jacques Grange est parfaite

title: The ONLY place to stay up town.
text:
I love this hotel because  the rooms are gorgeous, the service is superior and it's small so it's easy to get in and out of.  The location is the best : walk to the MET and walk to the Park.  This was the only hotel I could find up town that had a room with TWO bathrooms. Aa a mom traveling with her 16 year old son, I wanted my own bathroom. He had a separate space with a pullout  sofa and his own bath. The master where I stayed was
separated by a door.  and all in one suite - not two connecting rooms. Perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!   The only thing missing is an outdoor space for relaxing. There's some outdoor seating in the dining room though. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

title: πολυ ομορφο ξενοδοχειο
text:
πολυ ομορφο ξενοδοχειο. Πολυ εξυπηρετικο προσωπικο, manajer  αν θυμαμαι καλα το ονομα του igor  πολυ εξυπηρετικος και βοηθιτικος. ζεστο κλιμα και πολυ ανετο περιβαλλον αξιζει να το επισκευτειτε
