title: Fantastic stay at The Mark
text: This was my first time staying at The Mark and loved my experience! The hotel is very luxurious and elegant. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side with everything I needed for my visit. The service was available 24 hours with incredibly friendly and professional staff! On arrival felt very welcomed and taken care of with kind porters who helped us out of our taxi and into the hotel. The lobby caught my eye straight away with beautifully decorated black and white stripped marble floors! My room was incredibly spacious with a spectacular bathroom. The restaurant by Jean George's is the perfect example of a well balanced fusion cuisine and would definitely recommend making a reservation. This hotel was nothing but amazing! Will definitely be retuning and recommending to friends and family!

title: Esperienza di lusso
text: La mia visita a l'hotel Mark e stata un esperienza fuori dal mondo - il servizio era perfetto e le camere erano eleganti e splendidamente decorate! Nel hotel c'era una palestra, un parrucchiere e spa che era una bella pausa dalla vita cittadina di New York!

title: Lovely stay at The Mark
text:
I spent a few days at The Mark as part of my honeymoon and it was such a special experience! The service was impeccable and loved the general atmosphere of the hotel, so chic and elegant! The front office manager Lindsey was very friendly and welcoming.The hotels Upper East Side location couldn't be better , just a few steps away from Central Park!
Definitely coming back to The Mark!

title: Приятная поездка
text: Мне очень понравилось в этом отеле! В комнатах  очень уютно, как-буто вы дома и мало шума с улице. Мебель удобная и обслуживание замечательное. Сотрудники вежливые и профессиональные.Супер, рекомендую всем!

title: Het beste hotel in New York
text:
Om een context te geven ben ik iemand die al lang in de hotel industrie dus ben ik daarom ook super krities als ik andere bij andere hotels blijf. Ik heb ook een beejte alles gezien als het om luxe hotels rond om de wereld gaat. Maar deze ervaring in The Mark was gewoon speciaal. 

Van het moment dat je binnenloopt tot dat je weg gaat voel je in een oase van luxe. De lobby is buitengewoon mooi met een hele elegante zwart witte marmer vloer die meteen de toon aangeeft voor de gezellige ervaring die je in dit hotel meemaakt. Toen ik aankwam was de check in super efficient geregeld zonder dat ik 5 minuten papieren zat in te vullen en gelijktijdig heb ik ook nog meteen wat leuke lokale tips voor brooklyn gekregen van het team aan de front desk. Mijn wens was altijd om bij Eleven Madison Park te eten, maar als we allemaal wel weten is het vrijwel onmogelijk om daar een tafel te krijgen. De concierge had binnen 10 minuten een tafel kunnen regelen door hun ongelooflijk netwerk waarover zij in NYC beschikken. Door hun is het mij ook gelukt om bij Jean-Georges te eten wat echt een bijzonder belevenis was, de service team van het restaurant behoort echt tot de top 5 van de wereld als je het mij vraagt (en ik ben al bij best wat 3* geweest). 

Daarnaast heb ik ook gebruik gemaakt van de Frederic Fekkai Haar salon. Dat was ook een super fijne ervaring, ik zag er bijna zo goed uit als harvey specter toen ik weg liep ;) 

Ik was door mijn bedrijf hier ingeboekt dus kon ik van de "premier studio" genieten. Je merkt gewoon dat er over alles mogelijk was nagedacht en voor de prijsklasse kan ik mij slecht voorstellen hoe dit te overtreffen is. Ik ga niet eens over de douche beginnen, ik zou daar uren onder kunnen staan. 

Ik kan echt alleen maar complimenten geven aan dit hotel, elk detail van je ervaring is iets dat je voor de rest van je leven meeneemt. Ik weet verder niet hoe ik dit hoog genoeg kan aanschrijven, maar als hotelier is dit de eerste keer dat een hotel zo bijzonder was dat ik een account moest aanmaken om een review te schrijven. Dankjewel voor deze bijzondere ervaring!!

title: Best hotel in all of Manhattan
text: I can't say enough incredible things about The Mark! My Fiancé and I stayed here last week and couldn't have received better service. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We basically lived at the juice bar!

title: BEST family reunion!
text:
What an incredible holiday that we've had! Travelled with my family including my sweet 1yo nephew and had the delight to be welcomed into yet another family, not only into a hotel! Staff was so kind, always available and the property simply fantastic! We celebrated my grandmothers birthday (97!) at the yummy Mark Restaurant, where service was just impeccable and my family's allergies were well respected! Special thanks to lovely Helen for her tips regarding NY's hidden gems! 

We all look forward to come back to the Mark!

title: 无可挑剔的体验
text:
1. 完美的地理位置：这次入住 The Mark 酒店主要就是因为其地理位置，位于纽约上东区。而且这次入住，前台给我安排的是面朝庭院的客房，晚上非常的安静。
2. 无可挑剔的服务：办理入住非常的快，前台的服务人员非常友好！礼宾部的服务人员也非常的热情，也给我提供了许多不同周遭的就餐选择！
3. 低调奢华的装潢：我个人认为，酒店的装潢非常奢华，但是却不会太高调。大堂的香味也非常让人觉得舒服，不刺鼻！

title: Amazing in so many ways!
text: Always amazed at the Mark from the minute we walk in.  Impeccable design, superior service, spectacular food, there really isn't anything else we could want in a luxury hotel.  Kudos to the Mark team for maintaining such a high level of sophistication and style.

title: Herligt sted i NYC!
text: Vi var meget glade for The Mark, som har super location tæt på Central Park i NYC. Værelserne er store i forhold til NYC standard, og hotellet tilbyder cykler, så man har muligheder for at nyde parken, og byen generelt. Restauranten er top class, men også højt rent prismæssigt.

title: Great Hotel!!
text: Really nice Hotel with roomy rooms and very good beds. I will stay again for sure!! Don't miss out the breakfast! Its unique! Bathrooms are big and very confortable. Location is good and quite. Staff is excellent

title: Lujo y servicio de excelencia
text:
The Mark es un hotel sublime, la decoracion, los espacios, el tamaño de la habitacion, la ubicacion, el ambiente, todo es perfecto!!!La amabilidad de todos es notable.
Pablo, Anabela y Casey, se destacan por su amalidad y experiencia.
Volveria mil veces.

title: Made/saved our wedding day!
text: Our wedding planner abandoned us 35 days before the date.  The Mark concierge booked/provided salon services, flowers and a photographer via email within days!  Our suite was wonderful.  Having two baths is a must pre-wedding.  We are planning a master bath remodel and want that floor!

title: superb design trumps all!
text: this Jacques Grange designed hotel is a visual and functional delight.  the reviews that complain about absentee doormen are right, the problem should be fixed.  now let me rave about every detail in this wonderful place.  the elevator cabs are works of art, the lobby is iconic, the hallways.....oh they are a wonder of mirror and incredibly well done mill work and metal casings that work so well heavy hotel traffic doesn't result in wear and tear.  rooms have drawer style refrigerator and freezers in all rooms, what a convenience.  even the tiniest room has the most useful cafe table, my new desk, dining table, dressing table, genius!!!  window shades, electric as they should be.  bathrooms, in every design magazine for a reason.  Lefroy Brooks fixtures that are being maintained by housekeeping nicely.  jean george restaurant downstairs is very good and supports room service, check.  nice gym, check.  smart smart smart beautiful design really does make a difference!!  cheap imitations can't compete.  bravo!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Decepción
text:
Dos semanas de vacaciones con dos niñas pequeñas en New York, elegimos dos hoteles de mucha categoría para estar cómodos, el primero fue perfecto, la segunda semana nos mudamos al The Mark porque pensamos en un hotel de ensueño. Nada de lo que pensamos ocurrió, la habitación muy costosa, es una habitación por demás común sin ningún tipo de detalle de un cinco estrellas, ruidosa con la iluminación del cartel del hotel iluminándola toda la noche. Me quejo por la condición y calidad de la habitación, me expresan que si quería algo mejor hubiera contratado una suite.
El servicio del hotel muy poco colaboradores y siempre ocupados en atender a los huéspedes más importantes. Es más pase mi cumpleaños en el hotel y ellos nunca se enteraron.
No creo que volvamos a pensar en The Mark cuando busquemos un hotel boutique que se preocupe por la calidad de atención a sus huéspedes.

title: Great UES experience
text: Of all the top-end hotels in this neighborhood (Surrey, Carlyle, Mark, etc) the Mark is the most consistently excellent.  And the bathrooms are FANTASTIC.  Bar is buzzy, staff are great, rooms very comfortable.  But those bathrooms?  The best.

title: What a bummer!
text: I have dined many times at The Mark.  And usually it is better than the average rating that I am giving it.  I had Thanksgiving dinner with out of town friends at The Mark last year.  Our friends were raving.  So disappointed in last week's dinner with friends.  The Mark has a very active bar scene that spills into 77th Street.  Once you fight your way into the dining room, service was indifferent and very slow.  The busboy seemed to be challenged by the difference between still and sparkling water.  The poorly trained waiter was unable to put bread on the table because "that's not how we do it."  Then he  managed to confuse my medium rare steak with the medium one that my friend ordered. The beef was tough.  Another friend's lamb chops were cooked to a cinder. There was a glacial quality to the meal.  And all of this did not come cheaply.  For now, I think that I will stick to brunch at The Mark.  Eggs shouldn't be too much of a challenge for present management of The Mark.

title: Hôtel cosy et raffiné
text:
L'hôtel est à la fois chic et très confortable.
Les services sont de grande qualité et je pense tout spécialement à la concierge Isabelle qui est une vraie professionnelle.
La seule réserve que j'émets concerne la durée d'attente du petit-déjeuner en chambre qui est beaucoup trop longue

title: First rate on all fronts!
text: Staff, room decor, restaurant, front desk...all scored a 10 in my experience . Check in front desk people were super at Ck. in, hotel room had everything you ask for , bathroom was spacious  designed to high end stds. And the technology in the room was first rate. One small suggestion....you need some softer pillows as well as the larger firmer pillows provided . The. Breakfast room was Terrific as well as the quality and variety of the menu provided....this is a 5 Star hotel providing a level of service and product you would expect for price....great job by all.

title: Contemporary and elegant hotel
text:
The Mark is a newer, contemporary and elegant hotel on Madison Avenue and 77th Street East in Manhattan. The Met Breyer Museum and the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Central Park are in walking distance. Rooms are modern, but not "cold" in their design and spacious. The baths are also very nice.
The restaurant and room service were very good (room service is a bit on the expensive side and for some reason the meals for room service came on  trays instead of a cart). The staff is very polite and attentive. For some reason numerous employees seemed to be standing at the entrance without a real task - that was a bit unusual. I can surely recommend this hotel if you are looking for  a newer and more contemporary hotel.

title: UPPER EAST SIDE EXPERIENCE
text: Perfect location uptown steps from Central Park and Madison Avenue's finest boutiques . Impeccable welcome from staff from start to finish . Eclectic decor with elegant lobby , bar and restaurant are excellent and attract a fine mix of local and international clients . Hotel has a gym room . Rooms are elegant and perfectly fitted including white marble bathroom with shower and bath . The relatively small size of the hotel provides a homely feeling . Always a pleasure to return to this upper east side favorite . Some of the common parts and rooms are starting to feel the weight of a successful occupancy rate .

title: All attitude and no service
text: I visit The Mark frequently and have come to expect the doormen to look the other way or engage in conversation with each other as I walk past them and let myself into the hotel. At this point my blood starts to boil as I approach Madison Avenue and anticipate the rude treatment.  The front desk staff are no better. By comparison the Resturant team and the delightful shoe shine gentlemen on the gym level are real delights.  The hotel is well located and could have a pleasant vibe but it's a huge missed opportunity instead.  Yes it's cute to have logo'd bikes and snack stands on the street but until you correct the snarly behavior of the men who are the guests ' first point of contact I am going to recommend that all of our corporate accounts lay their head elsewhere

title: Excellent
text: This hotel is an amazing boutique hotel. The rooms are spacious and very nicely decorated. The bathrooms are very elegant. The breakfast was to die for, so is the brunch. We have visited on several occasions. The Mark is a must visit.

title: Girlie trip
text: The Mark hotel was really lovely. All the staff were very helpful and the hotel felt like a home from home. Only reason I can't give 5 stars is because the only time we ordered room service (prices were very expensive) our breakfast was terrible!! Delivered to the room with no cutlery, by the time it arrived the food was stone cold! Luke warm water for the tea and no milk with it so he waiter had to go down again! Came back a third time with a hot tea pot and forgot the milk again!! Was a farce! The hotel did give us breakfast on the house due to the problems but the food wasn't that great anyway. Having said that I would definitely stay there again, the free bikes are a great bonus especially with the proximity to Central Park.

title: Superb down to the last detail
text:
The Mark is really an excellent hotel, whether you are staying on business or holiday. I have been there many times, but this recent stay with my parents really stands out.

We were in New York for a family wedding and the Mark did everything above and beyond the call of duty to make the stay perfect for my parents and me.

The rooms are beautiful and spacious. Although you might not get the great views of the taller hotels, they make up for it with their beautiful design, great furniture and spotless cleanliness. The maintenance of the rooms is top tier: I am not quite sure how they manage it, but across years of staying here, everything still manages to look perfectly new.

The beds and sheets are great. The bathrooms, in black and white marble, are both elegant and practical, and I just wish I had the water pressure that the Mark enjoys back at my house.

The location is also great, all the more so now that the area around the Trump Tower is a mire of security. From the Mark, Central Park, the Met and the Guggenheim are just a few steps away as are some of the best shops, cafes and restaurants on Madison.

Most importantly every single person working there seems dedicated to making your stay as good as possible, anticipating needs and making great suggestions.

Wow! Well done to everyone at the Mark!

title: Little things matter.
text:
When I'm willing to spend $1500+ for 2 nights at a hotel the little things really do matter. Great hotels are very detail oriented.

I've stayed at the Mark in the past and found it to be a well run operation at that time.

We arrived around 9 pm, and the hotel very nicely left out a tray of fruit in the room. Unfortunately it must have spent the day sitting out and the fruits were getting a bid brown. Well intentioned but a lack of detail.

I booked this hotel as it was close to where my son was to give his Doctoral dissertation on Friday. We obviously didn't want to be late. I got up in the morning and ordered a bowl of cheerios from room service. I also asked that someone bring the individual serving cups for the coffee maker. It took a total of 4 calls and an hour to get the coffee. I had to call the manager to get them.  The bowl of cereal took 2 calls and an hour. I never received the the sugar that I called down for to put in the coffee. I was told that the room had the coffee and sugar but I'm afraid it didn't. 

This all may seem minor but my wife is a coffee addict and has trouble getting up without the coffee and something (cereal) to buffer it in her stomach. The added stress before the days events were a huge negative. 

I will say that the staff was otherwise polite and helpful. The manager was very sweet and she truly seemed to care about the issues. When we left something in the room after checkout, they were nice enough to go and retrieve it for us. The room was nice and the soaking tub looked great. The pillows and mattress were hard in case it matters to you. Some folks like that. 

The only other complaint was in regard to the room service. I'm willing to pay $750/night for a hotel but I truly resent room service that is insanely priced. I was hungry on arrival and the Caesar salad with shrimp would have been over $55 with delivery etc. Instead I ordered a delivery meal via Yelp from a nearby restaurant and a lovely salad arrived within 20 minutes for around $18.00 all inclusive. 

All in all, the small lapses in service create a significant downgrade of a rating at this price.

title: Loved The Mark – warm service and lovely accommodation
text:
We recently enjoyed yet another return to one of our favourite cities and tried The Mark for the first time, but it won’t be the last.

We’re BIG Four Seasons fans but only like to stay in suites and, frankly, especially with sterling: dollar rates, we just couldn’t justify/ face/ afford the high-end suite rates at the FS this time. So we tried the Mark and thank goodness we did.

The hotel is excellently placed – I really like this area of the city as it’s so convenient for many of the galleries and museums we like to revisit. 

We booked a Manhattan Suite – with 1.5 bathrooms and a kitchenette as well as a very useable sitting room and lovely bedroom. However, although the suite was very comfortable it was the service that we found to be so special at The Mark. We found the staff at the door/ valets truly outstanding and the nicest and most helpful group of people you’d ever find in these positions – they just couldn’t do enough for us and it was much appreciated (including the Maybach ride to the Met Opera on a Wintry night). We felt tremendously at home there, so thank you to The Mark and we will definitely be back!

title: Lovely Hotel
text: I recently stayed at The Mark Hotel and have only great things to say about it.  The location is a welcome respite from the chaos of mid town.  The hotel is the perfect size, service is first class right from the  moment your arrive through to the room service staff. Granted you pay for this experience but I found it was worth it.   I have already recommended this hotel to friends and know that it will now be my go to hotel when traveling to New York.

title: Perfect Hospitality
text: The Mark is gorgeous. I was treated so well by all the staff. They made my dog and I feel more than welcome. I would live here if I could. There is 24 hour room service, including prepared meals for my dog. I loved it. The time went by so fast. Its less than a block to Central Park. Wonderful bed, tub, and shower... everything you could want. I didn't want to leave.

title: continued excellence all around
text: As they say, you get what you pay for, and in this case the price is absolutely justified to the last penny. The staff is superb - any one of them could run an entire hotel. The whole place glistens - no "deferred maintenance" as at so many other properties. If the hotel were an airline, it would be the equivalent of first class on Emirates. One of the best touches is the refrigerated wine and victuals drawer with the ice drawer, and the full set of polished crystal glassware. Oh, to be a bit negative, zero screaming kids and harassed moms. An intentional and business clientele mostly. Hard to beat.

title: Very good !
text:
My stay at the Mark was great. Upgrade to a bigger room ( the rooms are beautiful ).
Very elegant hotel, nice design.
Overall quality was very good and the staff very friendly. I will come again for sure!

title: Hard to beat for High Class in NYC
text:
I am still giving The Mark 5 stars despite the rocky start I had in a queen madison room. The room itself was cozy and lovely and the bathroom great. Let's just say I had a major heating/cooling problem that could not get fixed - all cold, then 90 degrees.  At that point, in the evening, they moved me to a madison king -but it wasn't actually a king bed - it had a divider in the middle so I didn't sleep that well.
.
The "mark" of a good hotel is how they treat guests when there is an issue  - Melissa (pretty sure that was her name) after I asked to see a suite, upgraded me on my 3rd night to a Park studio which I very much appreciated and Tucker was awesome helping me move a ton of hiking gear into my new room. This room is so nice I never want to leave - love the bathroom, (water pressure in the hotel is INTENSE - the best anywhere!), amenities, closet space, kitchenette - I may move in. This room is 800 square feet and has a big outer room, long hallway and huge bedroom with amazing views.
The gym is great - I used it more than once - very spacious and well supplied for a hotel gym. The restaurant is 5 star - i ate by myself at the bar and enjoyed a truly special "Mark Manhattan" along with an amazing spicy tuna tartare and salad.
And the staff - truly first rate. Yes, the Mark is pricy, but with the jean Georges restaurant, chic bar, amazing location, great service and super nice staff at every level, I can't recommend it highly enough. The suites for sure are a lot nicer - the regular rooms are small compared to others at this level imo. Though I didn't get off to a great start, it's the finish that's important and this was a 5 star experience. Thanks to all the Mark Staff for making me feel at home during the blizzard!

title: Power breakfast
text: Busy breakfast scene.. hotel staff efficient and polite. Decor as expected from a hotel restaurant bright in the attrium dark and moody in other areas. Breakfast was well executed with decent coffee.. it appeared to be a leisurely affair with guests staying an hour plus..

title: Classic uptown NY
text:
My recent stay at the Mark was fantastic. The staff, the service and the room was top notch. I used Platinum American Express and received a free upgrade to a junior suite, which had a full refrigerator and stove. Not that I needed either, but good to know its an option for future travel.

The Mark Bar is incredibly chic, not overcrowded, with excellent drinks and service. The room was well appointed, with a very comfortable bed, deep tub and INCREDIBLE water pressure in the shower. (coming from Los Angeles... water pressure is quite a luxury.) The room had smart features to control lighting, temperature and shades, the blackout shades were very effective. Room service was fast, with excellent food. All and all just what you;d expect and want from a 5 star hotel.

Location is good, half a block from central park and steps from where all the good shopping has moved. (Madison has far surpassed 5th ave these days)

Last, I was concerned that there was some construction on my floor. The room was so soundproof that I never heard any noise until exiting through the corridor.  Repairs have to get done at some point, and its a testament to the building quality that it was not an issue.

I travel to NYC for business frequently, and while the Mark is a little far from my midtown office, I can absolutely see staying again, and even bringing my family to stay for vacation.

title: Could not have been better
text: I arrived in NY on a red eye flight from California and called the Mark for a reservation.  It was my first time at the hotel and I chose it because I wanted to be on the upper east side.  I CANNOT tell you how wonderful it was. The reservations agent was so patient as I dealt with an awful cell phone connection and helped me get a great rate on a wonderful room.  The amenities were great, the staff was warm and friendly and I absolutely loved the hotel.  I will be back with my family for sure.

title: Restful and beautiful
text: What a gorgeous hotel in a perfect location- could walk to great museums, shopping. Beautiful hotel bar and restaurant with impeccable service. Our room was spacious with a beautiful bathroom. Separate shower and tub, double sinks. Well appointed.

title: Delicious brunch
text:
Our second visit but first for brunch. We all had different options and all were delicious. No issue with asking for minor amendments to any order.
Absolutely great - do ask to sit in the atrium conservatory if dining in the day.

title: Grand Dame
text:
If you are familiar with Claridge's in London, this place will remember it .
Defenetely more boutique'ish feeling, lobby is less grand, but attention to details, quality of food, general décor , is similar and outstanding. 
nothing too much trouble for the great concierge and reception Team , easily arranged shipping boxes and late check out. 
it is not cheap but you defenetely pay what you get for. 
Minibar is more a maxi bar and the collateral items in the room and very stylish. 
A glamour address in NY with a Mayfair feeling. 
I wouldn't doubt a single second to go back.

title: Great getaway
text: Welcoming and polished,the service is attentive and helpful, the rooms are well-appointed in a modern but traditional Manhattan style. It is near to most of the main museums, and half a block from the always enchanting Central Park. It is in a quiet location, sleeping and working in the rooms is easy.

title: 5 jours à New York
text: J ai séjourné au Mark. Très bel hôtel dans Manhattan Madison et 77th Street. Proche du Met et De Central Park. Un bonheur pour le shopping. L hotel est très agréable. Possède un bar branché the place to be pour prendre un apéro ou un verre après dîner. Restaurant à la mode De Jean Georges :le chef ! Chambre spacieuse claire calme . Concierge clé d' or française adorable ainsi sur tout le personnel . Je recommande.

title: Aesthetics and Substance
text:
I cannot explain how much I thoroughly enjoy my stays at The Mark with words--the hotel itself is gorgeous, the vibe is cool but without pretense, and the mini-bar...well, I have not seen a better one in the US yet. 

I think the room service and restaurant are both stupendous, and the staff is attentive, genuine, and have excellent follow thru. The rooms are well-appointed and ofter sanctuary after a day in the city. The BG rickshaws are also a favorite for transporting me for my shopping indulgence. 

I stay at this hotel whenever I am in NYC and could not picture staying elsewhere. It's a home away from home.

title: Beautiful hotel and very friendly staff plus amazing location
text:
I stayed here for a weekend and it was definitely very nice and everything that I hoped that it would be. The staff was friendly. Our suite was decorated lovely. They had fruit and wine waiting for us in our room and no it was not a honeymoon. We were also able to walk to central park and to some other restaurants and if not catching a cab was very easy. 

The bar/restaurant had great food and drinks. It was pricey but what would you expect? I will be going back here again in the future. The room service was also 24/7.

title: Well worth its price tag!
text: I don't normally give a 5 star rating that easily - but this hotel definitely is worthy of it. Excellent customer service. Timmy went above and beyond for my partner and I during our short stay. Rooms are absolutely stunning. Absolutely love the marble bathroom (and its massive!) Very prompt with the housekeeping. Nice view out Madison Ave. Great location on the Upper East side across from Central Park. Partner loved the gym also. Highly recommend and would definitely return.

title: Favorite getaway in the city
text: The Mark has besides the fantastic service, great rooms, bathrooms also fantastic restaurants! The gym is also great and you can lift and do a proper upper and lower workout. I stayed here more then once, and will go there in february again I can't wait to be in NY city again!

title: Cozy corner
text:
Had a tiny queen room on the back of the hotel. While much smaller than the price tag, it was adequate. The bathrooms in this hotel are the real star. Although I had the smallest room category, my bath was full size, the same as in their large suites. 

I have been fortunate to stay here before. The Jr Suites are the size of a small NYC apartment. 

If you are posh, you will feel at home. If you are not, well... you won't even feel comfortable in the lobby. This hotel is in one of the richest post codes in NYC. And the clientele are no exception. It's definitely not for the little people. 

The service is 5 star. Every need attended to with a smile and acknowledged by name. Or if you prefer, no name or pseudonym. 

The restaurant is world class and the food is as beautiful as the customers you will see while people watching. Make sure to make a reservation. It gets rather busy, even on weekdays.

title: The Mark Revisited
text: Is it possible that The Mark has improved since our last visit?  Yes!  This a a super chic hotel with terrific services and a great attitude.  We had a beautiful room overlooking a noisy (of course) Madison Avenue.  Fantastic spacious bathroom with a super shower and incredible turn down service (yes this is important).  The location is idea for a visit to The Met, shopping on Madison Avenue and some great trendy restaurants including St. Ambroise.  The bar is very cool and serves a quick breakfast.  The Mark restaurant is great and not stuffy at all.  Plenty of servers everywhere.  Everyone who works at the hotel is attractive as are all the guests (I don't know if this matters but its true).  The prices are high but who really cares.  Indulge.

title: Love this hotel
text: My place in town when I am in New York. Love the style, the staff and the rooms are wonderful. Even the entry level rooms are large with quality fittings. Had New Year here and the whole atmosphere was friendly and fun. Will be back soon.

title: Ottima posizione nel cuore dello shopping
text:
Piacevolissimo soggiorno a The Mark. Posizione ottima per shopping,  Central Park ed i principali musei della città.
Personale molto gentile e collaborativo. Camere nuove e pulite, letti molto confortevoli. Un po' rumoroso.

title: family trip
text: We were so glad that we decided to stay here rather than The Carlye which has been our New York hotel for the last several years. This hotel was superb! The service from everyone we encountered was warm and helpful. We stayed in a 77th avenue suite with our 3 year old granddaughter. I loved the art deco decor and the amazing bathrooms! We had the hotel set up a teepee in the room which our granddaughter loved; along with the milk and cookies delivered every night. Will definitely stay here on our next trip to New York!

title: A positive surprice
text: Proces for good Hotels in New York are High and Many times far from Worth it but The Mark is absolutely worth The price. The room I had was also in good condition with a great bathroom. Service is also very friendly. Breakfast was a positive surprise with a lot of variety on the menu. Definitely going there again.

title: Lovely luxury
text:
I have found this restaurant here in Trip Adviser. It was market as a place for steaks. I came on time for branc. It was special menu without steak. But finally I had my steak. very good and tasty. Good chose of wines (Americans and European) Quite expensibe but you understand for what are you paying.
The waighter was so amazing! Wanted to stay there till dinner :)

title: Fantastic visit; Impeccable Service
text: My wife and I spent 2 nights at The Mark to celebrate her birthday during the week leading up to Chrismas.  Everything about the visit was spectacular!  The room was spectacular, the lounge was wonderful - and with great food - but the best part was the staff.  Everything we possibly needed was taken care of.  Every single member of the staff went out of their way to give us any and every possible assistance. I had called the Concierge the day before our arrival to arrange for a dozen roses to be in the room for my wife (given her birthday).  When we came back from our dinner and show, there were 2 dozen roses in the room, and a custom-made dessert and a bottle of champagne.  I would definately recommend The Mark for a special occasion.

title: Elegance without pretension
text: This was our first stay at  The Mark in New York City and we were impressed, as we expected to be. The staff makes the experience warm and welcoming; they seemed genuine in their caring and helpfulness without any hint of pretension or five-star haughtiness.  Our room was wonderfully large with every imaginable convenience and our bathroom might have rated ten stars rather than five.  No one ever needs an excuse to go to New York City but we'll be looking for more reasons to go now that we've found The Mark.

title: Classy lounge
text: Very comfortable place to stop for a glass of wine and rest your tired feet. Good wine selection, not huge but very nice. Good service as you would expect at a 5 star hotel. It's easy walking down from the MET, and makes a convenient stop.

title: Super bon hotel
text: Décoration d'intérieur a couper le souffle très bien située le restaurant ést très beau et les plats sont très bons le services ést nickel rien à signaler room service un peu lent les chambres sont très jolies et design je vous le conseil fortement

title: Back again!
text: We really love this place!  It's in the upper price range, sure, but it's worth it when compared to others in its class. Clean and quiet rooms with all the expected appointments. Near Central Park but in a significantly more peaceful area than around 59th. Subway and bus lines conveniently nearby. And about a 10-15 minute walk to the Met and Museum of Natural History.

title: Minha casa em NY
text: Ja experimentei varios notéis em NY, mas sempre acabo voltando para o The Mark, bem localizado, serviço impecável, quartos de tamanho razoável, serviço personalizado. Hotel de um tamanho bom, todos sabem que voce é etc.... Serviço muito pessoal. Localizacao ótima !!

title: Ten great days
text: I stayed at the Mark with my two daughters!!! We had a great time in two excellent rooms. The service was perfect very nice bathrooms with excellent showers. The maids and the cleaning very good. People at the front desk willing to help us in everything we needed I remember Kevin of great help and the general manager Mr Angel Mejía ,I also want to name the concierge staff,all of them were very good. The restaurant very good and breakfast the same. Room service the food wasn't so good. This is my hotel in New York,nice people and very well located!!! Congratulations!!!

title: Great Upper East Side Property Close to the Met Museum
text:
We came here from staying at a lovely small hotel in the Tribeca area to finish up our week stay in New York City.  Traffic is horrible and it takes about 45 minutes during the day to get via taxi, Uber or Lyft from Tribeca to the MOMA, so the change in venue made for easier access to uptown entertainments.

The Metropolitan Museum of Art is a few blocks away and Fifth Avenue and Central Park are just steps from the hotel door.

The room was adequate:  a large king sized bed, a small round table with chairs, a bureau with a smallish television and three closets with the usual amenities.  But there were other amenities:  Sub Zero refrigerator and freezer drawers so the ice we called for on our arrival kept  frozen throughout our three day stay.

Complementary Fiji bottled still water and Pelligrino fizzy water were provided when we arrived and Evian was given at night at turn down.  

The bathroom was huge with a monstrous soaking tub and a large walk in shower with such great water pressure that both the shower fixture and the hand held could be operated at full blast at the same time.  Double sinks.  Only drawback:  the toilet is located across from the shower door and not in a separate enclosure.

Our Madison Avenue facing room was very quiet and the climate control system was excellent.

The hotel restaurant is operated by Jean-George Vongerichten and serves good breakfasts and excellent dinners (although the meat dishes skew to the grilled variety), with a very good wine list.

Service was excellent and exceedingly friendly.

title: Rooms are poor value for money - hotel is great though
text:
The hotel is probably one of the trendiest and most "upper east side" style in NYC.

Everybody from the doormen, the reception desk staff, the concierge desk or the servers is top notch, friendly, helpful and really professional. 

The interior design is really interesting, with a 70s feeling that is really well made.

The bar is particularly cute, as it is small, but the bartenders are always on top when it comes to a good drink, and the crowd is good and interesting.

The only problem is the rooms, although well decorated, they are really small. The bathrooms are nice with a shower and a bathtub with good appliances and good amenities. But the rooms are claustrophobic even for european standards and are definitely not worth the money.

title: Chique!
text: The Mark is one of the best hotels among the best hotels. Location, design, comfort, service... Service was absolutely superb. I got a Madison Ave. facing room on the 3rd floor; it was too noisy and had no writing desk. The next day I was politely moved to a courtyard facing room on the 7th floor, which I liked a lot: very good bed, writing table, spacious bathroom with a bathtub, a strong shower, and nice amenities. The rest of my stay went very well indeed. To my taste, the rooms have too much electronics, telephones, etc., but it's how hotels try to attract 'new generation' nowadays. I belong to an old generation, as most of The Mark's guests. Anyway, I loved the place and will stay again. Yes, and a very good (and very expensive) restaurant. Highly recommended.

title: 法式風格的精品酒店
text: 位於紐約上東城,地理位置非常好,離中央公園只有幾步之遙,附近還有大都會博物館等藝文區環繞.酒店就在許多高級住宅區旁,入住其中,可感受到紐約上城的生活方式.

title: Amazing!
text: One of the best hotels of the world! Luxurious, classy, excellent service, details and great location. Don't miss the bar at nights! The staff is outstanding, everyone is willing to help and have the most high service standards! Very private and exclusive, details in every room tell a lot about the great taste on decoration and design.

title: Keep it quiet!
text: frankly not willing to share my impressions on this ideally located next to central park (E77) boutique hotel. My favorite place in Nyc  whether for business  or in couples. Rooms by jacques grange , food by jean-georges! All is great including an impeccable service under an excellent general management . To be improved : no sauna and the darkness of the dining room.

title: Service with a smile
text:
Top location- walking through central park south and across west to culture , shopping, eatery . Otherwise all forms of  public transport at doorstep
Great restaurant , bar, gym, bathroom equipment, concierge
Warmth and comfort for the guest!

title: tal cual se ven las fotos en interent
text: viaje por 10 dias a New York y luego de ver diferentes opciones elegimos The Mark Hotel, quedamos encantados ya que cumplió con nuestras expectativas. El hotel esta remodelado a nuevo con un restaurante muy bueno. Quizás la única critica seria el colchón en las habitaciones, se ve que realizaron una remodelación del hotel pero a este detalle no han llegado.

title: Ok I guess
text: This is a nice little hotel smack bang near Central Park. But its very over priced for the size of the rooms - its pretty noisy and the concierge was very very bad.  I mean they didn't even know where to see good Jazz nearby  - everything seemed to be a bit hard for them. Yes ....there was a TV in the mirror in the bathroom and thats 'cool' but at the end of the day what you really remember about a place are the people. I just remember concierge being really unhappy about the help.

title: Great Five Star Option in NYC
text: We've been searching for that perfect New York hotel for the past few years, and have stayed in a number of different properties as a result (Plaza, Trump Soho, Crosby, Lowell). Although not quite as exceptional as some five star properties stayed at elsewhere in the world, the Mark is certainly one of the top that we've stayed at thus far in NYC. Pros are excellent location close to Central Park and amidst the upscale upper east side (with the great shopping that goes with it!), and a close walk to many other main attractions but without the busy traffic and noise. The rooms were well appointed with spacious bathrooms and good technology. We liked the decor - modern and warm - although the furnishings etc were nothing spectacular. Nice fitness centre and hair salon on site were big pros, and we had room service a few times and it was very good. In-room massage arranged by the concierge was excellent, as was their service. Areas for improvement were very minor - a bit of a snafu with the check-in with a wait and no adjoining rooms as requested (although we were offered an upgrade in one of the rooms), very dark lighting in the main restaurant at lunchtime, turn down service that was far too early (although we did not give the hotel the opportunity to correct - confident they would), and the smell of smoke from the room across the hall (which we appreciate is not the hotels fault and was an anomaly given smoking is not permitted). Overall, a very nice stay and one of the best combinations of location, rooms, service and amenities that we've stayed at in NYC over the past few years. Would recommend.

title: Great Hotel in a Wonderful Location
text: We spent 4 nights here before departing to Boston and then on to tour New England. The Hotel is in a great location with friendly and helpful staff. Our room was at the rear of the hotel overlooking the courtyard, no views but lovely and quiet, you wouldn't know your were on Madison Avenue. The room was immaculate with an amazing bathroom. We used the complimentary Rickshaw to view parts of Central Park, the driver was fun and full of information, a must do. the bar is a lovely spot to meet at any time. Expensive but worth it.

title: So Chic So Upper East Side
text: Had a great time during my recent business trip. The Mark was recommended through friends and I lover using the hotel bicycle to commute and drive around the Central Park. The concierge there is super efficient and the boutique feel of the place suited me well. I will come back to stay when in NY for sure.

title: The Mark is on point. EXCELLENT
text: The Mark is all about details. What impressed me the most was a tiny detail, however it was so on point that it really made a lasting impression. When my husband and I checked in, I guess the staff noticed that I had a Fiji water and a Pellegrino bottle in my hand that we had brought from the airport and had finished drinking. We checked in, went into the room, and went out for a walk. When we came back there was a large bottle of Fiji and large bottle of Pellegrino in the room along with some tarts. Everything was pristine and clean. The bathroom offerings such as the shampoo and soap are presented in a very nice, oversized containers that have whimsical beautiful illustrations on them and more importantly they smell good!! Every time we would step in or out, the staff would greet us appropriately by name  and that was very nice. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and cozy.  At turn down, there was a Laduree Macaron on the pillow. The surrounding neighborhood is very nice too, and chic, with access not only to the park, but to shops as well. The hotel has an adorable rickshaw/pedicab named the Bergdorf express, and Bobby our driver was excellent and took us through the park. The hotel has a beautiful hotdog stand outside too. We have stayed in excellent hotels in New York City but honestly this has become my new favorite.

title: Best hotel in this great city - New York
text:
The Mark is truly a modern home away from home, attention to every detail, nothing is too much trouble. The French GM (Olivier) is amongst the best, hospitality is in his DNA-up to date and attentive.
Had a slight issue on checking in, the manager on duty Omar was on top of it right away-well done. Everything went smoothly thereafter and all staff were friendly even if initially seem aloof-they are v nice...
Rooms are nice (need a bit of nice art on the white walls) as are the bathrooms (great powerful showers), concierge excellent as are reception staff.
I like the idea of calling one person to deal with everything.
Clean and professional.
Good gym.
Relatively medium size at 150 rooms, though feels like it is all yours.
Their restaurant Jean George has excellent food and a beautiful room. It's bar buzzing at night.
Well done The Mark...

title: Put friend in my home and treated myself to The Mark
text: Can you blame me? They are a terrific staff. The rooms are lovely. The bed was delicious. The view was sweet. I just love this hotel and while it's conservative next to a few places in NY, I loved every tasteful, pampered, appreciated minute.

title: Amazing hotel, lovely staff, couldn't be happier
text: My husband and I stayed at The Mark Hotel in NYC in September 2016, which was the weekend that we were getting married in Central Park.  I cannot say enough great things about our experience there. The team brought fresh roses to our suite, chocolate covered strawberries, and even a bottle of lovely red wine just to congratulate us before our nuptials. We stayed for two lovely nights. We ate in the Jean George restaurant downstairs for breakfast each morning, which was equally delightful. The hotel is near some amazing restaurants to explore for dinner. Our room was large (we had the two bathroom suite.) On our wedding day it rained all day and The Mark loaned us their awesome umbrellas to use, which made for really cool wedding photos. The staff was extremely friendly and tended to our every need. On check out day, they let me relax in the room a little later than our checkout time and even stored our wedding cake in their restaurant fridge for us to take with us when we left. The housekeeping staff was incredibly accommodating and couldn't have been more friendly. All in all, the entire weekend was amazing and my husband and I have now decided to make staying at The Mark an annual tradition for our wedding anniversary.

title: Nice Place to stay in New York
text:
Really nice hotel with great Place in New York , convenient for every think , the room are big and confortable , the bed very confortable , and the concierge very efficient !!!
One think not good and really not good ! Don't use the restaurant , food terrible and service also ( pity )
But stay to this hôtel , good choice !!

title: Very Nice Hotel with Perfect Upper East Side Location
text: My husband and I spent four nights at The Mark in September. The staff was very pleasant, helpful and attentive from the moment of "check in" to the moment we departed. Our suite was spacious and very nice; the bed was quite comfortable, the bathroom large with a big soaking tub, large shower, double vanity. Our view however was non-existent; and if we had one complaint it was the noise from the street at night (sanitation trucks and some type of construction) which did disturb sleep. The lounge and restaurant were very nice; and the food delicious. The Mark is in a great location - Upper East side; an easy walk to Madison Avenue shops, the Guggenheim, Frick, the Met, Central Park. It is definitely pricey, but would recommend, and stay here again, because of the great staff, comfy bed, perfect location and restaurant.

title: Maravilloso hotel y excelente servicio al cliente
text:
Excelente ubicación. Maravilloso servicio. precioso hotel. 
Fue un placer el haberme podido quedar ahi. 
Comida deliciosa. 
Los "hot dogs" en la entrada hacen del hotel un lugar mas relajado. Otra cosa que me gusto muchísimo es que aceptan mascotas. Es increíble ver salir del elevador a los huéspedes con sus perros 
Desde que llegas al hotel todo el personal te llama por tu nombre, es mega personalizado el trato a huésped.
Lo recomiendo a ojo cerrado. 
Le doy 100 de 100
Gracias a todos en el The Mark por su profesionalismo.

title: The Mark nothing better
text: Have had the pleasure of staying here many times. First class service, delicious room service, amazing spa in the hotel. Romantic room. Huge bathtub and the best technology. House car is good but not always available. Best hotel in NYC.

title: Marvelous at The Mark
text: Wow,  from the time you enter the lobby you feel like "you just made an entrance"!  It is spectacular and the service matches the quality of decor!  Loved loved loved the junior suite we had since we were celebrating our 29th wedding anniversary.  The sitting area had this unique cool wallpaper of books. The bathroom was huge and had the best shower ever in NYC! The beds are super comfy and cozy.  The hotel is in the perfect location,  I mean,  perfect!  Loved the free bike service and the outside hotdog stand. It was Fashion Week so it was very busy,  but service was still awesome. Expensive but worth it!

title: First class service, moderate comfort
text: This fine hotel with a friendly and excellent staff is a comfortable haven in the upper Eastside. The rooms a bit tiny, but it is NYC! The restaurant is superb, of course, but loud and usually quiet. We usually sit at bar in the back. The bar upfont is always too crowded.

title: Perfect stay  2 steps away from the park
text:
My family and I stayed at the Mark at one of their busiest time I think. The hotel was full of celebrities and famous business men but we were still treated as A'listers :)
Outstanding, friendly service, gorgeous and most comfortable rooms everything justified the rather high price we paid.
Definitely the place to go.

title: Fashion Week in the heart of New York
text: I just stayed at The Mark during fashion week, as I am a fashion blogger. The scene in the lobby, bar and restaurant was electric. The staff was friendly and professional, yet unpretentious. The doormen were great, as were the concierge with their recommendations. I really loved the Mark bicycles and pedicabs out front. It gave a fun, yet cool vibe to the hotel. I stayed in one of their Courtyard rooms, which was spacious and immaculate. The courtyard/garden view in New York City was serene and peaceful. The fact that the hotel is so close to Central Park was a tremendous asset, since we took tons of pictures of New York in the Fall. Great stay and looking forward to going back in February for Fashion Week again!

title: Merveilleux voyage!
text:
Nous avons séjourné au Mark Hotel à New York ou Nous avions une magnifique Chambre !Tout était parfait.
L'accueil chaleureux,toujours à ´l'écoute!pas le moindre faux pas!
Le Chef concierge Du Mark Hotel est charmante et très expérimentée dans son domaine!Tout le staff du Mark est adorable.Nous sommes repartis avec beaucoup de regrets!!!Mais reviendrons avec plaisir.

title: Outstanding Stay!
text: The Mark is the true definition of excellence and superb service.  I usually stay at another hotel in the city, only because I had not discovered this gem.  The service from the second you walk in to the moment you leave are simply perfect. I know a lot of upscale hotels thrive for perfection. The Mark has reached and surpassed it.  The only thing I’d change would be my plans, and make sure I stay longer next time.

title: Great stay at The Mark
text:
I booked my Dad's trip at The Mark because it is close to my apartment and I love everything about this hotel.
My Dad and his wife had the best time and really enjoyed the hotel.  I usually don't write reviews but they asked me to write something on their behalf since they absolutely loved their stay at The Mark. 
I personally love going to the restaurant for lunch/dinner!

title: Wonderful stay at The Mark
text: I had the opportunity to stay in the Madison Suite at The Mark earlier this year.  It was a great experience!  The suite was very luxurious from the marble bathrooms to the comfy beds.  The Mark also sent up chocolates and wine, which was a great surprise for a special night in the city!  Would highly recommend the hotel for its awesome location and beautiful rooms!  The breakfast at the restaurant was great as well!

title: Unforgettable weekend.
text:
My wife and I decided to stay at The Mark Hotel for our wedding anniversary, and it was truly an unforgettable weekend. From the moment we stepped in, we were amazed by the elegant style, yet warm & welcoming atmosphere. Our bags were taken, and the check-in was swift. Not only did they upgrade our room, but they gave us a tour of our suite and made sure that we could always contact if we needed anything during our stay.

 

The actual room itself was the most spectacular thing I had seen. It was enormous and the marble bathrooms was the spotlight. The heated towel racks and vanity mirror made all the difference for when I was getting ready for dinner, and my husband enjoyed the vast selection in the minibar.

 

Later in the evening when my husband and I came back from our dinner, the hotel had sent us some lovely amenities including chocolates, strawberries and champagne. We were taken aback, and had no words.

 

The Mark is a beautiful hotel, the service is impeccable and restaurant is amazing. It was the staff that truly made this experience memorable. There is no doubt that we will be returning when we travel again to NY.

title: The Best in New York
text:
The Mark is absolutely elegant and chic. I loved the location! Only steps away from Central Park (with branded pedicabs that you can take for a ride) and countless designer boutiques along Madison Avenue. Not to mention The Met is a short walk up the street. The Mark Restaurant by Jean Gorges was absolutely delicious (I recommend the Crispy Sushi and Steamed Shrimp Salad).
 
The room was spacious and beautiful with an extremely comfortable king sized bed. The bathroom was huge – not to mention the marble soaking tub!
 
The lobby was beautifully decorated and so New York! From the moment we arrived, up to our departure, our stay was absolutely perfect. The staff was so friendly and courteous, going out of their way on numerous occasions to ensure all our needs were met.
 
Next time I am in New York I will certainly be staying at The Mark Hotel again.

title: I look forward to returning
text: For the past few years we have attended the US Open and stayed at The Mark. It is always a treat! The rooms are large and nicely appointed. The bathrooms are fabulous. I particularly enjoy the fragrance of the soaps. Location is great for shopping, service is truly 5-star and the rooms are wonderful. Elegant and comfortable at the same time. Some people may find it expensive, and it is, but was worth it to me.The Mark Hotel is my favorite in New York City.

title: Home Away From Home
text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Mark for the first time for a weekend getaway in New York. The word that pops into my head whenever I think about the Mark is luxury. From the moment we walked into the lobby we knew the Mark was unlike most NYC hotels. The staff we checked-in with was both friendly and accommodating. We got to our room, which was spacious and beautifully decorated, and decided to immediately take advantage of the marble bath, which, as it sounds, was unbelievably luxurious. Our meal that night at the Mark Restaurant by Jean-Georges was unforgettable and delicious. After taking an evening stroll down Madison Ave, we got back to the hotel and were surprised by how quiet our courtyard-facing room was. The bed was really comfortable and afforded one of the best nights of sleep my wife and I have ever gotten. The Mark helped our NYC getaway feel entirely one-of-a-kind.

title: Viel Licht, aber auch einige Schatten
text:
Die Lage ist hervorragend, wenn man nichts Downtown Manhattan vorhat. Ansonsten zwischen Madison Ave und 5th gut gelegen, um sich die Stadt zu erarbeiten. Zimmer nach hinten ruhig aber dunkel - zur Madison raus möchte man nicht wohnen, wenn man die Fenster öffnen will, um dem Krach der Klimaanlage zu entgehen.
Die Zimmer haben alles was man braucht, insbesondere die Bäder sind vernünftig gestaltet. Weiches Wasser im Überfluss. 
Das Frühstück ist allerdings ziemlich gewöhnungsbedürftig. Das Team ist vornehmer als die Gäste, allerdings nur auf amerikanische Bedürfnisse geschult. Zeit sollte man auch mitbringen. Die Bar ist krachig und laut, das Personal im Überfluss vorhanden - man läuft in 5 Tagen nicht Gefahr demselben Team wieder zu begegnen. Die Klimaanlage im Empfangsbereich arbeitet so stark, dass empfindlichen Gemütern eine Überdosis Vitamin C anzuraten ist, um Krankheiten vorzubeugen.  
Vermutlich werde ich trotzdem wiederkommen - irgend etwas hat es, das Mark

title: THE MARK S(m)ELLS OUT
text:
My wife has been staying regularly at the Mark Hotel for several years and I occasionally stay there with her as well. We booked last minute to see a show and were graciously put into a large 2 bedroom suite as the UN meeting was ready to take place. The room was really a nice apartment, kitchen and laundry facility included.

Unfortunately, a certain delegation including the Emir of XXX (I use xxx to protect the privacy of the Emir) had over 40 rooms of the hotel, and while the hotel is a Non Smoking property, they chose to smoke. We even had a lady ( not sure if she was with The Mark or the delegation) tell us it was the sweet smell of hookahs. Security was stationed by the elevator of the floor, and when my wife mistakenly thought he was a guest and stated that the smell of the smoke was terrible, the agent replied " are you telling me." And the next day we encountered the same agent in the elevator on a different floor and he asked if it had gotten any better?

It is obvious that this is standard behavior which we have previously encountered at other hotels ( see my Leela Palace, New Delhi Review) and hotels are willing to break the law, turn their head, and inconvenience guests for the large sums that these people spend. This went on day and night and sleeping was difficult since the AC did not run as much due to the cooler night time weather. 

Had this situation not occurred, I would give this property a 5 star review because that is what it truly deserves. But when management accepts this type of behavior in return for the large sums of money and states that they try to stop the smoking but they are not successful, I cannot accept this.

title: THEY SHOULD AHVE JUST PUT MY BED IN THE STREET
text: This was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I actually Have a lovely apartment in NYC, but had some out of town guests come and offered them my apartment as they were a large family.  I thought, oh how fun I'll stay at some of the hotels I always wanted to try out so I can recommend when people ask where they should stay.  Well !! The hotel is dark and it's hard to see.  Staff is friendly, but not overly eager. Lobby is super small as are elevators.  My room was on the 3rd floor right above the entrance to the hotel.  I can't believe they would rent this room to anyone!!  It was seriously like actually being on the street.  It was so loud, not only from the traffic, but from the people coming in and out of the hotel, etc.  I swear I didn't sleep a wink.  The garbage trucks, the taxis, the doors slamming, the people drunk who were leaving the hotel and restaurant.  Oh my god !  The worst !!!  This was not some 200 or 300 dollar room this was over $1000.00 !!!!  Like I said I live in the city, I live in a very busy area, but I only sometimes hear just a bit of noise.  Worst experience ever. I will not go back, nor will i ever recommend to anyone ever !  Charging that much money for that room is a crime !!!!

title: Chic, Urban Refuge
text: This was the third time I stayed at the Mark Hotel as I love the locale close to Madison Avenue (the boutiques), central park for my son. We stayed this past May as a treat to my father who had celebrated his 70th birthday, we stayed in of the suites which as always is beautifully decorated, welcome gift was a beautiful Chardonnay bottle along with fresh roses! The Mark is pristine and for me is my urban refuge in NYC. We had dinner at Mark Restaurant by Jean Georges -excellent cuisine. As always the staff goes out of their way to ensure your needs are met, the hotel is beautifully decorated, I took advantage of the bike service to Bergdof's and also my son loved their hot dogs! Its just a haven and its hard to choose because we always stay either at the Mark, the Surrey or the Carlyle.

title: La peor experiencia
text:
Worst rooms I've been
