title: Wonderful Hotel in New York
text: Everything was fantastic. Location, quality, staff. Absolutely loved every minute except for the first few minutes (we arrived slightly early so to be fair not the hotel's fault the room wasn't ready). After that, only a one word description WOW.

title: A very good hotel but made to feel (by some staff) second-class to the business men and power dressers.
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights during a wedding anniversary trip to New York.  Our overall experience was very good although there were a few small annoyances.

To start with ... the reception and concierge staff were a mixed bag with some being very friendly and helpful while others were verging on the rude - one conversation I was having with a concierge about taking the subway was interrupted by his apparent preference to greet and briefly chat with someone over my shoulder. Very disrespectful.  Given that the Mark is frequented by many businessmen and (I assume) local personalities I got the strong impression more than once that anyone on holiday here - and dressed in teeshirt, shorts and trainers - was definitely treated as second best.  And yet presumably we pay the same ... if not so often.

Our room wasn't available until 3.30pm after a journey from Dubai but on the other hand we were allowed a late check out at 2pm.   So maybe they balance out.

The room was excellent - good size bathroom, comfortable bed, well-stocked minibar and nice view over Madison Avenue.  Kept very clean throughout our stay.

Breakfast was of good quality but was generally quite slow - so much so that I assumed there to be only one chef but apparently there were two sous-chefs as well.  Even though we weren't in any particular hurry it did become a little frustrating. Also a few times smaller orders like juices or milk were forgotten and staff had to be reminded.  The waiting staff were on the whole really friendly and efficient themselves - so, maybe the supply chain from the kitchen could be improved.  The breakfast is generally a la carte although a Mark breakfast and Continental do group some items together.  I loved the over-easy eggs, the fried potato and the bacon!  By the time we'd ordered a cereal/granola and maybe an extra juice or coffee our bill often came to $120 excluding tip.  So, if you're into full breakfasts like we are, then be prepared for the bill!

We had lunch (day of arrival) and dinner (day of departure) in the restaurant - it was perfectly OK but nothing really special - either on the menu or in the presented dishes.

I had previously checked the location - and yes it is a few stops on the subway to downtown and, although it has a few shops close by, it is not in the main shopping area.  On the other hand it is just a few steps from Central Park which I enjoyed walking round nearly every day.

Overall we enjoyed our stay but I just felt - as mentioned above - that we weren't afforded the same welcome and treatment as the suits and well-dressed females at their business breakfasts, power lunches or whatever.

title: Felt like family
text: Probably one of our nicest experiences anywhere. It felt like home.. We were greeted warmly..treated like family. Escorted to our lovely suite after a tiring overnight red eye flight very quickly after a short check in. And it only got better from there. The staff were helpful and engaging at every turn. We chose this hotel in our old neighborhood to celebrate Madison 16th birthday. We had friends and family come and go all week and the hotel staff couldn't have been more receptive and helpful all week, arranging comforts and transport and being very accommodating all week.  Truly a wonderful stay.

title: アッパーイーストサイドに憧れて。
text:
スタンダードルームキング・77thストリートシティービューで46㎡の部屋に
滞在しました。NYのホテルの中でも比較的、浴槽も広くシャワーも固定でなく
ノズル式、水圧も満足しました。冷蔵庫も氷常備で問題なしです。
海外ドラマに憧れて選択したホテルでしたので、メトロポリタン美術館・セントラルパークなど、とてもワクワクした滞在になりました。
アッパーイーストサイド最高でした。次回のNYがさらに楽しみです。

title: Very cool place
text: I always have a great time here and meet interesting people I've been going there for years. I love the lounge and food at Jean George restaurant is amazing. It is A boutique hotel with a very fashion crowd I've seen Diane von Furstenberg and Carolina Herrera.. A favorite  off of 77th St. and Madison ave!

title: A piece of heaven in NYC
text: Impeccable housekeeping, the room was small but then I picked the cheapest room so I don't understand people who book small rooms and then complain. Laduree macaroni at turndown, beautifully designed bathroom and the hotel smells divine. I had an interior room with a lot of light and quiet in the middle of NYC. The breakfast was good but didn't compare to continental breakfasts across Europe. I like the location as I am fan of the UES but it may not work if you are looking for a touristy location. For me The Mark is almost perfect.

title: Friendly staff, but unprofessional service. Not 5 star quality at all.
text: The Mark is more like a 4 star hotel. The best thing about it is it's location on Madison Ave. You definitely do not get what you pay for. It is under renovation so you have scaffolding to walk through to enter the hotel. I called ahead to request early check in by 1:30pm instead of their usual 3:00pm, and our room was not ready until 4:30pm...unprofessional! We had to wait for hours so we had lunch at their Mark restaurant. It was supposed to be great given that it's by Jean Georges, but that was a huge disappointment, very average nothing special at all. The room I got was also disappointing for $650 no breakfast per night. They told me they had given me an upgrade but our room had a blocked view. All views are appearantly not nice. After being in the room another half hour, our bags were not yet sent up. They said they couldn't locate them. I had emailed ahead to request a hair appointment at their Frederic Fekkai salon in the hotel, they gave me an appointment and asked me to send them my room number which I said I will send as soon as I check in. Once I checked in, I asked the concierge to notify them of my room number and he told me it was done. The next morning before my business meeting I went to do my hair and they told me that I don't have an appointment, that I never sent them my room number! They were now full, I was stranded! Who didn't do their job and why didn't the salon simply call down to get my room number...unprofessional! They ended up sending me a couple of blocks away to another salon, where I ended up paying a rediculous $360 and was 20 min late to my meeting! Later, after housekeeping cleaned our room nicely, we went to shower and the shower gel was out and not replenished. I had to call to request it & wait again! Manager did give us a credit for our lunch & sent us a bottle of wine which was nice, but not enough for all our troubles and waste of money by staying at The Mark.

title: Excellent Stay at the Mark
text: This is an elegant hotel located on the Upper East Side of Manhattan that offers a lot of unpretentious personal service. I chose this hotel as it is close to my daughter's apartment. I found the hotel and staff to be quite lovely in every way. I did have some trouble with the electric shades in my room and I was moved quite quickly. The entire staff was warm, friendly, attentive and above all, truly professional. There is a fun, intimate bar in the lobby and the hotel is close to all the great museums and excellent shopping. Fabulous restaurants are everywhere! This is an elegant and understated hotel. If you are looking for flashy, go somewhere else. This is a quiet hotel that is smart, chic, personal and attentive. This will now be my go-to UES hotel. Perfect place for a mother-daughter weekend. I will be back!

title: Stylish boutique hotel with room for improvement
text:
We stayed there for several nights and picked this hotel so we could have a comfortable stay, we tried dozens of hotels over the years in Manhattan.

Experience at check in : when we checked in they told us the room is ready but they first needed a supervisor to inspect and it would take 5 more minutes. We waited and waited and had to remind them twice, each time they said it would be inspected right away " supervisor on the way".
Finally after 45 minutes we got the room keys and went up to the room by ourselves . We asked for the luggage to be sent right away and after 20 mins still nothing , had to call twice the reception to get it. Finally the bell man came up and apologised for the delay, I said "you must be very busy" but he told me that actually he was never told to bring our luggage up.

We booked a courtyard room, when we checked in they told us that they gave us an upgrade so we were happy. I mentioned that I had booked with a special mention for a quiet room, hence my booking for a courtyard room and they told no worries even though it is a Madison avenue room it is a high floor and won't be noisy.
The next day after an almost sleepless night, we told them it was not what we booked and they said they were running on 100% occupancy and could not change us to courtyard room, however the next time we would come back they would put a special comment to make sure we got a quiet room. I was very surprised and still wondered why they didn't give us the room we booked in the first place.

They didn't offer anything to us to make us digest this problem , just nice smiles . Really not professional.

Do not book the rooms on Madison Avenue as they are very noisy unless you are not sensitive to noise.

On their website, they advertise the size of the queen beds between 150 and 180 cm. All the rooms we stayed in had 150 cm beds.
Also important to mention that the room was very tiny as the configuration was weird . Half of the size of the room was in fact the entrance and corridor area , the room was only half the size of what it was advertised for (400 sq. feet).
Also on their website they advertise best rate guaranteed but that's not the case as their rates are at 20% higher than booking.com

Nice decoration although too much electronics and many useless gadgets: TV didn't work first, we could not get past the welcome guest message on the TV screen. A technician came and had to reboot a box in the closet under the TV. The remote for the electricity and domotic didn't work.

Bedside table lamp was blinking as we entered the room, so much for the inspection of the room by a supervisor. We had to call again a technician to replace the light bulb.

Shower door could not close fully when inside the shower (no inside handle).
Tower rack on top of the bathtub looked like about to fall off soon (check photo.

TV size too small and too far from bed. Limited number of TV channels compared to same standard hotel. 

Hard mattress and pillows were not comfortable. This needs to be improved to justify for the high price of the rooms.
No coffee machine in the room but instead a giant mini bar, being trendy doesn't mean being not practical ...

Complimentary Shoe shine service not served: I left a pair of shoes outside the door as indicated (it was 10 pm) and the next morning the shoes were still there but not cleaned).
Complimentary newspapers didn't come on the first morning ?

In a nutshell : Great location, nicely decorated hotel, friendly staff . This hotel could easily become a real great boutique hotel if all the problems/issues encountered were fixed. So much miscommunication between various departments of the hotel . Overall the staff seems friendly and professional but they need a proper management and more guidance.

Back a second time a week later to try one last time the hotel and overall a much better experience this time. Better service, they provided the room we booked. The room on the courtyard was much more quiet. The room cleaning service was ok this time but the room service was very slow. Still many room fixtures were out of order. 
Air con has a molded smell. They need to maintain better the air con.

Overall definitely a totally different experience this time. We are thinking to come back.

A special mention for the concierge: he was very professional & helpful.

Excellent hotel, staff, restaurant and location! We stayed for 4 days and enjoyed the restaurant, the gym, the hair salon as well as the bikes. The rooms are clean and the bathroom offers everything you need. We had dinner at The Mark restaurant and can recommend the asian inspired starters as well as the excellent pizzas.

title: Great location, quiet street
text: Great location on UES near Central Park on a quiet street with nice neighborhood vibe.  Nice bar with a welcoming "locals" feel.  I highly recommend it if you like to be out of the Midtown madness, but still close enough for meetings and such.

title: Luxo!
text: O hotel- butique é impecável, o hall de entrada é lindo com um bar super charmoso ao lado! Os quartos são grandes com sala e dois banheiros. Decoração de super bom gosto e serviço incrível! Se quer gastar e ter mordomia vai tranquilo que irá amar!

title: Best of the Best
text: The Mark is an intimate hotel with an attentive staff, extremely comfortable rooms, excellent restaurant and cool bar.  I spent four nights here with my family and we loved everything about this hotel.  The Mark has a small boutique feel, with many of the amenities you find in a larger property.  Everyone is professional and friendly and the location is a great launching point for exploring the city.  I think I've found my new favorite hotel in the world.

title: Ótimo Hotel
text: Ficamos pouco tempo, estávamos apenas de passagem, mas gostamos muito. Para quem gosta do upper east side, a localização não poderia ser melhor. O atendimento é excelente, muito atencioso - desde a recepção até os porteiros. O concierge foi muito atencioso antes de nossa viagem, nos ajudando com nossas reservas de restaurantes. O quarto é espaçoso e muito confortável. Pretendemos voltar para uma estadia mais prolongada.

title: Good to be back
text: The renovation of the property is clearly a success. The room was very nice with noticeable attention to detail.  Easy to set up laptops, tablets. Love the amount of light in the bath.  Entire staff is friendly and certainly helpful. Bar and restaurant are trendy - and busy - with guests and locals alike. A tad pricey but still definitely a perfect destination for a special occasion. We'll return.

title: Very Good Sums it up
text: I was expecting more with all the 5 star reviews and considering the price I felt a little disappointed but by no means would I not consider going back.  Just for the same price you are at the Mandarin for example.  I had one bizarre dialogue with Reception.  With a line at at the Conceirge, I asked the Reception for suggestions for dinner, I was told to go to the Conceirge.  A bit of a turn off.  Doorman guys were super great...just down to earth fellows who appeared to love there job.

title: Our stop in NY ALWAYS
text: Nous allons régulièrement à NY autant pour le travail qu'avec les enfants.  Cet hotel est toujours au top, extrêmement propre, confortable, avec un personnel parfait, discret et toujours très efficace. Parfaitement situé, avec un service impeccable.

title: Experience at The Mark
text: We had a lovely experience at The Mark Hotel a few years ago and are returning this October. We switched to the Mark for our NY stays from The Carlisle because our favorite concierge from the Carlisle works now at The Mark. She has assisted us for many years and we are fans. The rooms are interesting and the bathroom modern and chic! The restaurant wonderful!

title: A Gem
text: Enjoy returning to the Mark, with friendly staff, from concierge to valets...to driver of the Tesla house car. Jean Georges Restaurant, and popular Upper East Side bar as well as hair salon, Frederic Fekkai draw neighborhood -- and out of town --regulars. Small enough to feel personal welcome.

title: Absolutely fantastic
text: This New York icon was purchased from a chain by a local NYC family in 2006 or so and closed for over two years for a complete remodel. We stayed there before the remodel and now twice since. What an incredible change. Our room was superb- good sized (for NYC), well appointed, and with a great bath room (shower, deep tub, 2 sinks and all of the accessories). The restaurant is spendy, but memorable. Overall, one of the best values in New York.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
This is our second visit to The Mark. After staying in many other uptown and mid town hotels in NYC, (The Four Seasons, The Pierre, The St Regis, and The Peninsula)  several times,  we have finally found a place that feels like home from home. 
Great personal service, excellent restaurant, comfortable beds and bedding, and modern bathrooms with nice amenities supplied fresh twice a day. 
We had an excellent stay and will return in August.

title: X Mark's the Spot
text: Luxurious...Luxurious....and...Luxurious...The rooms are a lavish lair after a long day enjoying all that NYC offers...Situated in the wonderful UES, The Mark is only steps from central park, delish dining, super shopping and sightseeing... So, if in doubt, let The Mark, bring you about! :)

title: Perfect hotel!
text: It's my 2nd time to stay in the Mark when I visit New York. Everything is perfect, make me feel as comfortable as I was at home. I got to hotel on 8am this time after the long night flight from CA, very tired. The reception people was so nice that just give me an early check-in. So helpful and really appreciate. Great thanks!

title: Home from home in NYC
text: This is our second time at The Mark and we enjoyed it even more than before.  Once again I booked the cheapest room (largely because they are the quietest ones on the courtyard so you get NO street noise) and it was large for NY standards with a gorgeous bathroom and plenty of room for two of us to sit and chill.. There are lots of nice touches - Nespresso machine etc and the staff are fantastically helpful.  The restaurant is great for supper one night and the breakfast room is lovely.  We like the location but even if you don't want to be so far uptown, the subway is very near.  It is great to be so close to the park and the surrounding area has lovely bars and restaurants.  We will return (am already booked in for July).

title: The Mark Never Ceases to Amaze, Surprise and Delight!!!
text:
We recently returned from another wonderful and memorable stay at our New York "home away from home" for business travel, as well as leisure time with the family. 
 
The Mark is a hotel to visit multiple times throughout the year, as there are seasonal surprises and delights in store each time.  This time, upon arrival, we were greeted by a chic Hot Dog Cart outside of the hotel, serving Jean-Georges' gourmet organic chicken and grass fed beef hot dogs accompanied by unique condiments.   While I often try to talk my daughters out of a street hot dog in the City, this delicious haute dog is not to be missed!  [During our winter visits, the cart serves Gourmet Hot Chocolate, which is also a seasonal favorite.] This time, we also enjoyed a lovely ride through Central Park to the New York Historical Society in a Pedicab ridden by Bobby, who was a fantastic guide.  It was a fun and memorable way to see the Park, and the Mark pedicab, with its black, white and orange motif, was by far the most stylish.   We can't wait to see what the Mark has in store for the Fall and Spring . . . .

The location of this gem of a hotel simply can't be beat!  It is steps away from Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, incredible shopping and some of the best restaurants in the City, including its very own (and one of our favorites) the Mark Restaurant by Jean Georges.  But what sets this hotel miles above the rest is its superb level of service.  From the moment we arrive, our girls are warmly greeted by name, and they love catching up with everyone, from housekeeping to the concierge.  It truly feels like home! The fact that most of the staff has been there for the years that we have been coming speaks volumes for the Mark and the way they treat their employees, as well as their guests.

Having traveled and enjoyed luxurious hotels around the world, the Mark is at the top of our list, and we would not dream of staying anywhere else during our trips to the City.  We look forward to exploring the seasons with the Mark!

title: Excellent
text: This is a great hotel. My wife and i visited for a long weekend and they looked after us very well. The decor of the hotel suited us fine and the staff are very attentive. We ate in the restaurant on our first evening and it was an imaginatively cooked meal and it was excellent. The bar was great and the cocktails were all that you would expect from New York. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. A couple of points that knocked the hotel back was the concierge service which was not particularly helpful prior to our arrival and the breakfast arrangements are a little too rigid for our European tastes in that the choice of dishes was extensive but getting what we wanted was a struggle with the staff who really did not understand our peculiar requests such as identifying the difference between camomile and English Breakfast tea! A limited buffet might be a better approach.

title: Pleasant stay
text:
Great location. Walking distance to Central park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Guggenheim and the subway for access to downtown. Its also in a relatively quiet and more residential part of Manhattan which is a plus. The rooms are well done and the service is five star. They have a high end restaurant in the hotel, a little dressy for my taste but it was convenient for breakfast and had a nice ambience to it. 

The only reason I wouldn't give The Mark five stars is I felt the claim of free internet was more than a little misleading. Its free internet for 3 Mbps which is extremely slow in today's standards. They had an upgrade to 80 Mbps for an extra $19.99 a day which is about the speed I have at my house and comparable to the speeds at hotels I've stayed at in the last couple of years. On principle I didn't upgrade and ended up primarily using my cell phone connection for internet since the webpages were loading quicker than with the hotel WiFi.

title: Beautiful location and friendly stadd
text:
I think this is the most unpretentious upscale hotel in NYC 

It's very family friendly. They have high chairs for the rooms and their in room dining is so delicious. 

Ask for a room with a view and use concierge to book anything that's hard to get into- they have great relationships  with NY institutions. 

There is an amazing restaurant just around the corner called Saint Ambrouse which is the best place for coffee to go. Try their little sandwiches that they sell in a glass case which are hand made. 

Concierge is always friendly and they will do upgrades if you ask. 

Always beautiful fresh flowers in the rooms and the suites are very very roomy for NYC. 

Overall amazing experience.

title: Upper Eastside at its best
text:
Le Mark est une adresse de choix, situe a proximite des musees, de Central Park et des boutiques. Chic et elegant, chaleureux et raffine, tout est reuni pour un excellent sejour. Tres New York New York avec ses declinaisons en noir et blanc, les chambres sont spacieuses et comfortables. Les salles de bain sont fabuleuses (la douche parfaitement concue).
Le Bar et le Restaurant de Jean Georges sont autant d'adresses a decouvrir au sein de l'Hotel (prisees des new yorkais egalement)

title: Lovely hotel
text: Really lovely hotel, rooms are well decorated, bathrooms are particularly nice, very clean, stylish, comfy rooms throughout. The hair salon is very good and easy to book and appointment. Lobby is beautiful with friendly and helpful doormen. The hotel has a car available for short trips. Very close to Central Park, museums and shopping. Would highly recommend it!

title: Hoy merece la pena
text: Con el descuento que he visti hoy si que merece la pena ir otra vez. Es caro pero sus servicios instalaciones y habitaciones lo valen,aunque repiti,coge el descuento que he visto hoy. Un lugar centrico y muy bien localizado para coger el ttansporte publico.

title: Class act, low key.
text:
Stayed at The Mark for 3 nights with our two 18 year olds.  The condition of the rooms was great with comfortable beds, excellent linens, and nice baths.  This may be weird, yet we loved the large shampoo, conditioner and body wash bottles!   Not the standard skimpy bottles!  The rooms have a safe and an awesome two drawer refrigerator, freezer combo unit with an ice maker!

Located a block from Central Park, just off Madison, and two blocks to the Lexington subway.

See Casey at the Concierge desk for excellent dinner suggestions, she was so very helpful.

title: Stylish and great
text:
Great location
Lovely service and a very exclusive decoration and set up.
We really liked the "tucked away" location on the upper east side.
Definitely worth the money. But thats New York...nothing comes cheap

title: Incredible hotel with excellent service
text: The hotel itself proves to be some kind of oasis in this really busy city. It was my first time there and I found the room extremely comfortable and clean; services impeccable. I actually lost my wallet there without knowing. The hotel Security unit and Concierge service were extremely professional and helpful in retrieving it and ensuring that it was returned to me. I am truly grateful by their professionalism and dedication to excellent guest experience. I will always want to come back here whenever I visit NY again.

title: Трендовое место
text: Отель - один из самых трендовых мест на сегодняшний день. Стильные интерьеры, модные соседи и потрясающая локация. Дизайнерский бутик-отель идеален ля романтического путешествия или пребывания в период fashion week.

title: a nice place
text: location, location, location ..... Great rooms and suites...room service good... staff excellent..... upscale and at same time on edge... We stay at Carlyle or Surrey quite often and this hotel a bit updated but lacks the feeling of home that the Carlyle has. However, the bathrooms and suites are very comfortable with obscenely fantastic water pressure... The hotel was nice the bar was a bit euro.

title: Top
text: Melhor hotel que já fiquei em NY. Localização fantástica, serviço maravilhoso, quarto lindo, até o secador de cabelos é acima da média dos hotéis. Amei todos os detalhes. Concierge outstanding. Ajudou bastante não apenas com as reservas de restaurantes, como na recepção de pacotes.

title: Une oasis chic et privé au cœur du quartier le plus élégant de New York City
text:
Très grande suite de 82 m2 situé au 9e étage, composée d'une chambre, d'un living-room, d'une cuisine, d'un wc visiteur.
La salle de bain de marbre noir et blanc possède deux lavabos, une baignoire profonde et cabine de douche en verre séparée
La literie est excellente

title: This is our NYC home
text:
I maintain my high opinion of the hotel -- from room cleaners, through porters, bellboys, doormen ... to _concierge_ &manager.

The sleepover option for kids is wonderful -- the set up a tent in the room; our Ella (5) took the big stuffed dog Husky with her there and slept the night. It also comes with milk &cookies, and a movie (we did not use)

We wanted to stay through 5/2; 5/1 is the busiest day -- big Met gala (with paparazzi); they did manage to extend our stay through 5/2 (different room), despite the heavy booking.

Excellent restaurant. 

They have a courtesy car for short trips. Also a courtesy rickshaw tricycle -- Ella _loved_ going with Bobby in it to the theater (we too).

Excellent hairdresser (esp. Kevin); best pedicure/manicure by Gabriella

Special mention: Isabelle (concierge) is a the jewel in the crown. Can get everything. Casey (concierge) too.
Anna (cleaning lady
Farid (porter)
Francis (doorman)
Pablo (front desk, night)
Jane (front desk)
Olivia (front desk)

The _one_ negative: no view

title: Right on the Mark (I know, I can't have been the first"
text:
BESIDES the fact that I am probably not the first person to review The Mark by using some word play, I will say that I was pleasantly surprised at just how wonderful this old Upper East Side property remains.

We were in town for Passover - a busy time of year in this part of town - and though I'm not the kind of guy who reviews a property when things meet my expectations, I am the kind of guy that writes a review when a property exceeds my expectations or prior service.  The Mark is better described as an apartment than a hotel because it has all of the conveniences of an apartment with all of the quality of a hotel.  Our room was wonderful, clean, planned very well and made excellent use of space - there was not a wasted piece of furniture or a wasted use of space. Sometimes a luxury hotel will fill a room with furniture that is unnecessary or stuffy (or just plain uncomfortable), but The Mark made great use of space and understands well that people are using their rooms and not showing it off to people.

The staff could not have been more friendly and was quick to respond to every request. Additionally, every request was met with a YES or ABSOLUTELY and that is the mark (I did it again) of a great group of people who take great pride in their careers.  I say careers because unlikely some other properties in NYC, the folks at The Mark truly seemed to care about their jobs because the hotel was just small enough to be better than the larger hotels.

I don't give 5-star reviews, but the issue here was whether to give 4 stars or 5 because my reviewed star level would have really been 4.5 (there is ALWAYS) room to improve. Given the pleasant stay, proximity to everything, quiet, residential feel and staying true to tradition (the place has been updated since my last stay, but was still quite obviously The Mark), I give The Mark a 5 out of 5 and wish it and her employees many happy years in making travelers happy in the future.

title: Un hotel londonien à New York
text: Impeccable! Le motif noir et blanc de l'hotel est elegant et reposant.  Le personnel est aimable, polyglote et serviable. Le restaurant (Mark 2) a un menu original et une excelente cave.  Il est très bien situé si on veut être dans le Upper East Side.

title: L'Upper East Side en concentré...
text:
Cet hôtel possède tous les codes du luxe, tout en conservant ses dimensions humaines. 
La décoration est sobre, chaleureuse et tout en nuances. 

Nous y avons séjourné en famille en avril et il faut bien le dire, les chambres sont spacieuses et particulièrement confortables pour un hôtel de NYC. Plus de 40m2 je pense avec tout le confort inhérent à ce genre d'hôtels. Très grande salle de bains avec télé dans le miroir, grande douche et immense baignoire. On regrettera de ne pas avoir de WC séparés à ce niveau de luxe et de tarif... 

Literie au top. Difficile de faire mieux. Rangements multiples. Mini-bar qui pousse à la consommation. Rien à redire. Le room service est de très grande qualité et le prix à la hauteur. Petit-déjeuners généreux et service aux petits soins.

Notre première nuit fut néanmoins un peu difficile quand notre voisin direct a commencé à 4 heures du matin à retracer l'histoire de la musique des années 80 aux années 2000 tout en hurlements prononcés. Après 1h30 d'insomnie et après avoir involontairement partagé son goût pour la musique et l'alcool j'ai contacté la réception par email (pour ne pas réveiller mon fils qui avait tenu le choc). Bref, un premier contact un peu rude, réglé plus tard avec le staff qui nous a offert 50% sur cette nuit épique.

Le restaurant de Jean-Georges au rez-de-chaussée est très couru par la clientèle chic et très féminine de l'UES, tout comme le bar, toujours bondé en début de soirée. C'est un endroit agréable, élégant, et la nourriture y est plutôt soignée, le service étant également à la hauteur du lieu. 

Bref, un séjour remarquable. 

Un conseil cependant: les rues et les avenues de l'Upper East Side étant particulièrement bruyantes, demandez si possible un étage élevé ou une chambre ne donnant pas sur la rue...

title: Chic Boutique Hotel
text:
The Mark is well located for traveler's and business people who prefer Madison shops and restaurants and quick access to Central Park. Jean Georges restaurant and small outdoor terrace were an added bonus as was our room.
Room size was adequate but the WC was quite large with double vanities, large tub and separate shower. I am not a huge fan of a pocket door in most circumstances particularly so when its for the WC.
The bed was Ok. Not great. it had sections that were uneven but maybe I am being picky. 
Bar lounge was attractive, concierges were informative and valets were present and proactive.
The only reason why I did not rate 5 stars was that the hot water is turned off at night (at least it was on our final night) and I wanted to take a bath at 5 AM before we left. Not sure if this is hotel policy. The shower is great though with lots of water pressure which is a big bonus. I should return but I may look at staying at The Surrey which is one block over.

title: The perfect romantic escape!!
text:
We planned an anniversary getaway to Manhattan – wanting a slightly indulgent celebration of the day.  The Mark, and all the wonderful people there, far exceeded our expectations in so many ways. 
 
We flew into JFK and the concierge arranged a delightful and effortless car service.  Like movie stars we pulled up and were whisked inside with cheery smiles and many hands.  The entire staff, from the moment we arrived, was exceptionally friendly,  pleasant and accommodating.  The décor is stylishly glamourous.  The room was lovely and very well appointed.  Tidy and with all the 5 star accoutrements.  We had an enormous soaking tub like we’ve never seen before.  Perfect for.. well, just perfect. 
 
It was simply dreamy to wander around the Upper East side to and from our luxurious residence.  Cared for and tended to in the best possible ways.  In the evening, the turndown service was splendid.  We sipped exquisite chilled champagne and shared a toast to the town – and to us.  We couldn’t have planned, or even asked, for a more romantic escape.  In the end we were left wanting only one single thing -  more time.   The Mark is now one of our most favorite places and we’ll look forward to visiting again soon.

title: The Mark is Super
text: In the hotel there is nice , relaxing and friendly atmosphere. It is locatated near Central Park and fifth Aveneu is around the corner. Friendly Staff and good food are waiting for you. A hotel for relaxed people.

title: Beautiful 5 Star New York Hotel
text: The Mark Hotel, perfectly situated right outside Central Park, is a true five star experience. The staff could not be more accommodating and the welcome is very warm from every person working there. It is not cheap but it's good value; everything is superb quality from the food to the gym. We loved the cabinet full of goodies in the room - not really a mini bar as its huge! We had a junior suite and it was tremendous. Just a brilliant hotel.

title: Mein Lieblings-Hotel in New York
text:
Tolle Lage in Upper East Side
Gute Service
Individuelles Interior-Design
Hochwertige Zimmerausstattung mit guter Schlafqualität. 
Sehr schönes gemütliches Restaurant (mit Bar-Bereich). Nicht nur Speisen und Getränke sind super sondern v.a. die Atmosphäre und die Akustik sind top. Viele New Yorker Restaurantgäste aus der Nachbarschaft machen den Restaurantbesuch noch einmal schöner.

title: Поездка на неделю в Нью-Йорк
text:
Весьма неплохой и дорогой!) отель, расположенный в 2-х шагах от Централ Парка.
Единственный минус - вся тусовка расположена примерно в 15 минутах ходьбы от него, поэтому планируя поездку имейте это ввиду.  
Номера в целом хороши. как и ванная комната, отделанная мрамором, что удивительно горячая вода и напор выше всяких похвал. Принимать душ одно удовольствие.
Кстати, из неприятных минусов- отель берет в качестве депозита 30% от стоимости. разблокировка этой суммы потом занимает примерно неделю, да и сама сумма, честно говоря очень значительна, если приезжаете больше, чем  на неделю. Об этом,конечно, предупреждают на ресепшн, но уже поздно

title: Six Star Contemporary Elegance!
text: Our room, facing a quiet upper east side street, was a true oasis. Our room was far from the hotel hall, because of an extra long entry foyer. The room itself was spacious and beautifully appointed. The bathroom was super luxe with a double-sink vanity, full large tub, and spacious shower and marble aplenty. The front desk was very welcoming and willing to help. There was NEVER a wait for anything.I will stay here every opportunity that I have. We generally stay at 5 star hotels, and this may be a 6!

title: Luxury boutique
text:
This hotel is located in the Upper East Side of Manhattan.

The rates are standard for a luxury boutique hotel.

Great service, great ambiance.

The lobby is always immaculately clean and the rooms are designed nicely with great amenities.

title: AMAZING!
text:
Everything about this hotel is fantastic! This is my fourth or fifth time staying at this hotel and I will not stay elsewhere.  The location is perfect!! I love being so close to Central Park, Madison Avenue, top museums and my favourite coffee place, San Ambroes. 
The hotel lobby, rooms, gym and restaurant are all fantastic.  The rooms are spotless and have excellent storage. I love that the drawers are spotless and there is no dust (something I rarely find at other hotels).   The Laduree macaroons provided during turn down service is something I always look forward to.  The beds are excellent! Concierge service is excellent.  I have nothing bad to say!! I always look forward to my visits to The Mark hotel. I find it hard leaving the hotel  because the atmosphere and amenities at the hotel are so special.

title: Very Disappointing for a so called 5-Star Hotel
text:
We come to Manhattan 4-5 times a year and when we were having dinner on our Thanksgiving Trip here we thought for a change,  let's stay at The Mark Hotel for our 5 night stay. 
We came approximately 2 pm and couldn't check in until 6:45 pm. 
Well we were given an option to get a downgraded room and check in earlier-we chose to wait. Well We waited and waited and I believe we got the downgraded room anyway-2nd floor a view of the front door where we heard doormen and Guests yelling Taxi-guests talking, car alarms until 2-3 am and on Easter Sunday the Garbage Trucks tossing in bottles for an hour-5:30-6:30 am. 
 I can't believe there is a worse room then the one we had.
 The shower in our room goes from cold to scalding hot- there really is no In between. Well for a few minutes you get warm then scalding hot again.
 Before you come, the hotel emails you a list of preferences-which I checked off extra pillows, towels, and for a microwave. None of which we received. 
 When the bell hop came up with our luggage we mentioned it and he said he would tell housekeeping. Still nothing...called downstairs twice and got extra towels and pillows. The microwave took several phone calls and when we came back to the room there was a toaster oven, so again we asked and were told they gave them out to other guests but they were purchasing another one. So at 10:45 pm they showed up to the room with a brand new one in the box ready to leave it for us to unpack, etc...rather comical. 
 After we laughed in disbelief the woman did unpack it. 
 My husband ordered room service for himself-breakfast for one-and the next morning received the wrong breakfast but they did come up with the bacon. However the bill he signed was for $34 plus tax, gratuity, room service and he added another $10 tip so the bill was $58. Then on our portfolio it showed 2 pages of charges for breakfast totaling approximately $140. 
 We had to call down for that-again everyone is ALWAYS POLITE and Very ACCOMMODATING, but it's not an enjoyable experience knowing we will have to deal with this for 6 days. Very disappointed in the room especially, .since...we always love coming in to the restaurant and bar. 
BarTenders are so unfriendly at both bars.  They talk with one another, but never interact with the customers at all.
It would have been nice to know that the hotel has a hair/nail salon-but nothing is even in the rooms advertising it.

title: Absolute perfection!
text:
From the minute you arrive at the Mark, you are showered with attention from the staff. The customer service is literally off the charts! The rooms are beautifully appointed with plush bedding, automatic blackout shades along with refrigerator drawers with drinks and snacks. At a price of course. There is also a bar with crystal glasses if you are having drinks in the room. The bathroom setup is brilliant..there are drawers to put away your toiletries along with plush robes and a heated towel rack. 

The restaurant is very good with the exception of the drip coffee. It's also not very hot when it's brought over in an individual pot. We ordered cappuccinos only ti avoid the coffee.Otherwise, the food is very good but not truly exceptional. 

I am looking forward to staying at the Mark again in the future!

title: First time favorite
text: We've been to NYC many times and always stayed in midtown, but this time our travel agent suggested the Mark and she definitely hit it out of the park! From the first greeting to the staff at reception to efficient room service to a great concierge Isobel, we were pampered and treated royally.  Even when I messed up an open table reservation to the Mark Restaurant our first night, the host found us a table despite a full room. Our room was large and comfortable and the shower the best we've experienced in years. We loved the location, too. Near the Met and great shopping on Madison. Try the Mark on your next visit.

title: Such a great location!
text:
A great location in NYC! Rooms small, that's NY. Major problem: breakfast coffee was always cold and not strong. Every other place we went brought coffee in insulated thermal pitchers or filter presses. We were there a week...on the first morning, I ran into another long- time guest coming back from the coffee shop on Lexington carrying his tray of coffees...he said he does that every time he stays there. What a simple thing to fix- serve strong, and warm coffee in insulated coffee pots. It is already lukewarm when they bring it to the table due to the pots they use. In one week, I never got a fresh pot of coffee or any of my refills that had steam to indicate warmth. I am not a complainer, and there was too much inherently wrong with their process for me to say anything- each of us had two or three pots of coffee every morning, and it was always the same.

Other than the coffee issue, it's a great hotel! We always enjoy staying there, the staff is lovely, and the renovation is very, very nice!

title: Possibly favourite NYC hotel
text: I've had the pleasure of staying here on more than one occasion and have had excellent experiences. The rooms are stunning and the ice maker drawer is a huge plus! We had a great time in the hip bar but the breakfast was a bit lacking for the price. Overall, I would happily stay here again and again.

title: Not quite seamless
text:
The Mark Hotel’s website conveys a luxurious image, but during our 3-night stay too many seams showed to warrant a 5-star rating. Doubts arose even before arrival: little things, like an e-mail enquiry left unanswered and technical glitches with the guest preference form. 

Impressions weren’t improved when, on our first night, my wife and I ordered cocktails and a cheese plate after 11 p.m. from room service and the clerk told us that, while the cocktails were no problem, he’d need to check with the kitchen if our cheese request could be accommodated since they were now serving only the overnight menu (meanwhile, “Artisanal Cheese Plate” stared up at us from the “Overnight” section of the menu), and also since there was only one chef on duty (didn’t know slicing cheese was such a daunting prospect). Then we’re told that chef says the cheese plate can be done, just not right away, so the drinks will be sent up first, cheese plate to follow. In the end, everything arrived together, though indeed not right away. First World problems, true, but not having to sweat the details is a major reason I choose to stay at luxury hotels.

Photos of the bathrooms at The Mark were what sealed the deal for me, and the soaker tub was even deeper than I’d hoped. On the other hand, the toilet was surely designed by the Marquis de Sade. It was mounted so high on the wall that anyone shorter than 6’6” who sat thereupon would have their legs dangling in space like a toddler, blood circulation painfully cut off. Take care of business fast, or you’ll be walking on pins and needles. And I’ve never encountered a more inefficient and ineffective flushing mechanism in a hotel bathroom anywhere; even though the high-volume button sends Iguazu Falls cascading down that bowl, nothing solid ever vanished on first flush during our entire stay.

On the plus side, the bed was comfy and very little street noise made it up to our seventh-floor room overlooking 77th Street. I also appreciated the complimentary standard shoeshine, and treated one pair of boots to the more intensive John Lobb treatment, which was well worth the charge—they came back gleaming.

For the most part our room was in good condition, the major surfaces clean, but the carpet could have used a good de-scuffing, and the TV remote was so grimy I was reluctant to touch it.

Overall, then, a mixed bag. My memories of our stay haven’t been made rosier by additional charges appearing on my credit card after our check-out invoice with no follow-up itemised bill to identify which incidentals these cover, nor by the fact that nearly 3 weeks ago I gave less-than-glowing ratings to several aspects of our stay on the hotel’s online comment form but have received no follow-up.

title: My favourite New York hotel
text: The Mark is an upper east side gem. I travel to new york often with work and would stay no where else if I could get in. I normally stay for a week at a time and it really feels like home from home, the location is perfectly located by Central Park and it is relatively quiet for a Manhattan hotel. The rooms are beautiful, very cosy beds with gorgeous linen and marble bathrooms. The decor is superb, the staff are always very polite and helpful and they have a cute little bar on the ground floor that serves the best wines by the glass. The gym is also perfectly sized and open all hours for those of us who have jet lag and cannot sleep.

title: Memorable
text: The Mark experience was beyond expectations! Stayed one night in their Madison Suite and was pleasantly surprised at the extent they went into making our stay comfortable. . The suite was immaculate and well designed .Even the sofa bed was very comfortable. Great service always with a smile!

title: most awesome hotel from top to bottom
text: from sense of arrival to friendly, trained and respectful staff at every encounter to great room and amenities, it's my and my wife's new place to stay in New York. I've been traveling to New York on business for many often accompanied by my wife but this time we needed to be on the upper east side and this hotel is just perfect all around - boutique, professional, friendly, exclusive, well appointed, our room smelled great, my wife loved the tub, best shower I've ever been in and lots of great nearby eateries and high-end shopping.

title: Wonderful luxury stay
text: The Mark is beautiful and convenient. The service and amenities are very good, and the restaurant excellent. The Mark is a convenient place to meet for business meals in NY. The room was comfortable and had everything I needed. Appreciated the complementary choice of newspaper, available shoe shine, etc.-- like the old days of travel.

title: Birthday weekend for wife
text: Stayed at the Mark, close to my daughter who is here for college. Room is nice a bit pricey but I have been told room is Bigfoot the prices in New York, we had a nice experience at the Mark restaurant slash bar kept if open for us to sit and enjoy our cocktails. Hospitality was exceptional!

title: Breathtaking hotel stay at The Mark!
text: The service was superior and the hotel staff was attentive and so professional, the lobby interior and rooms were absolutely gorgeous and the food at the Mark Restaurant was superb - I LOVE the little cocoa kiosk outside - genius idea!.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.  I love being within walking distance to Central Park in one direction and the shops in another!

title: Excellent hotel with some exceptions!
text: The hotel was great; location, rooms, cleanliness, the room service food and the breakfast was really good ( they have a MUST taste hot chocolate). The staff was friendly but not ALL of them some had some issues. The problem that I faced was with the money they took from me 3 times the cost of my stay and they still say that we are not receiving anything from you and with checking with my bank it shows that they deducted the money!!!!!! It was a big problem and they took big amounts from  even after everything was settled,after I came back to my country they still deducted some money and when I e-mailed them they said that they have no idea about this deduction but my bank if confirming that they took the money!!!! Till now after coming 1 month nearly I still have problems with them.

title: Simplement le meilleur
text: J'ai eu la chance de séjourner au Mark pour affaires, c'est l'hôtel le plus élégant et raffiné dans lequel j'ai dormi à NYC, belle et grande chambre, une multitude de services pour le bien être du client, bar et restaurant toujours très fréquentés, vraiment belle adresse.

title: Upper East Side at it's best ...
text: Room was well appointed.  Bathroom was very large, with double sinks.  Great service and felt welcome.  Highly recommended to anyone looking to stay on the Upper East Side.  Steps away from Madison Ave and Central Park.

title: Fabuleux
text: Cet hôtel redécoré par Jacques Grange est un des lieux les plus agréable de l'Upper East. Sa situation est idéale et sa proximité avec le Parc un bonheur. Hotel impeccable, la literie est parfaite et l'équipe bien sympathique. A découvrir ou redécouvrir !!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: This amazing hotel with its warm atmosphere played a major role in our wonderful stay in NYC. Excellent location next to Central Park, the Met, the Neue Gallery and the Guggenheim, in a quiet posh street in the Upper East Side. High quality design and comfort. Attention to detail. Friendly and efficient staff. Super service. Excellent restaurant.  We are certainly looking forward to coming back again.

title: Excellent in each aspect!
text: The whole experience of our stay at The Mark was just amazing, the location, the friendliness of all the staff (especially the concierge), the luxury of the room! Bottom line: One of the best luxury hotels we've ever stayed at, and the best area in NYC!

title: Looking forward to come back
text:
A friend advice me that an espresso at The Mark was such a treat after a run in Central Park and here is how I discovered this great place. 
The service was really nice, and as I walked around the restaurant, I discovered the menu and I will definitely be back for a breakfast or a brunch over there.!

title: Just didn't seem joined up...
text:
The Mark is in a fantastic location, we had a lovely room on the 5th floor just above the entrance to the hotel. The concierge and front of house team were accommodating to all requests, nothing was too much trouble.

Sadly there just didn't seem to be the quality of service throughout all areas... 

On two occasions we had to wait almost an hour to get a sofa bed made up for the children, not normally an issue although we had requested this be made up prior to arrival due to the time difference... on another evening all the bedding had been removed and we had to wait for the bed to be remade... 

On 3 occasions we ate in the restaurant... on each occasion the orders were mixed up with others and incorrect items were bought to the table. Drinks were ordered which didn't arrive.

When checking-out there was an issue with the bill, which was another area that just didn't seem to flow.

It is also worth mentioning that a garbage collection woke us up between 03.00 - 06.30 every morning, no objection to city noise but next time we would look to request a courtyard room !

I really wanted to give The Mark an 'Excellent' rating to match its 5 star flag, although there were just too many things that didn't flow during our stay.

title: A great 5 star hotel
text: One of the better hotels in New York and very similar to The Surrey and The Carlyle around the corner is a new favourite. Beautiful rooms, super service and superb concierge combined with excellent food and perfect location next to the park makes this place a new classic 5 star hotel on upper east. Interior is contemporary and very smart!

title: Outstanding Holiday week at The Mark in NYC
text: Our week in New York over the Thanksgiving Holiday was magical. Kenny Candelario The Manager of Reservations, made sure that our room at The Mark met all of our needs and far exceeded our expectations. The service as always, was exceptional. My friends and family enjoyed the experience and plan on returning often.

title: “Authentic UES Living”
text:
I come to New York often, and I’ve had bad and good experiences when it comes to hotels, but I just can’t say enough good things about the Mark. It may not have the hype and history of the Plaza, but it’s just a block from Central Park and on a quiet street, so I’d take its big suites and Jean Georges room service every time. 

If you go, stay in my favorite room: the seventy-seven junior suite. It may not have a window in the living room, but I think it provides the best value in the whole building. Leave the city behind and enjoy a quiet evening of luxury in your room or hit up the scene in the lobby bar. Either way, you can’t lose.

title: the best in New York
text: every year we are coming back to NYC for business/pleasure and one of the highlight of it ,it is to come back to THE MARK. We love the rooms , the restaurant, the staff and the location, it feels to be at home !

title: Perfect
text:
A peaceful and well located place. This hotel is awesome.
Refined. Great service. Isabel is so cool. Employees are helpful and warm with guest. The Restaurant is great.. Want to come back again soon.. Loved it!!

title: The Elegant Mark
text: Professional staff, good restaurant, comfortable quiet room, elegant huge bathroom.....and the location couldn't be better for visiting The Metropolitan Museum of Art, strolling Madison Avenue shops, and close to both elegant and simple restaurants.  I stayed for 6 nights and ate at the restaurant every day.

title: Очень хорошо!
text: Друзья !Рекомендую.Если объективно рассматривать очень и очень достойно!!!расположение!ресторан!для Манхэттена соотношение цена -качество наверное это лучшее предложение за все разы когда я останавливался в Нью-Йорке.

title: Simply delicious
text: Having dinner at The Mark has been the best experience I've ever encountered! My boyfriend took me here to celebrate my birthday. Absolutely amazing from the decor, the staff, and the food! The food had my taste buds dancing and my stomach satisfied! I can still taste all the wonderful food I had that night, counting the days I'll return. MUST VISIT! Noting can compare!

title: An experience like no other...
text: In need of a winter staycation in Manhattan, my husband and I selected The Mark Hotel due to its close proximity to Central Park, The Met and the variety of designer boutiques on Madison Ave – perfect for our holiday shopping! Never having stayed in the hotel before, I must say we were quite impressed. The lobby is stylish and ideal for people watching. The restaurant (by Jean-Georges!) has a busy lunch crowd and offers a great vibe for late night drinks. The staff has just the right combination of charm and professionalism. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, while the bathroom (my favorite part) is pure luxury; complete with a deep soaking marble tub, plush robes/towels and a TV in the mirror. Laduree (a must have treat while in New York) offers macarons at turndown and also serves delicious hot chocolate from a holiday themed cart outside of the hotel entrance. To top it all off, branded black & white pedicabs and bikes are available for guests to explore the neighborhood at their leisure. As first time guests, The Mark certainly won us over.

title: Chic and Elegant!
text: We stayed at the Mark on our November visit to New York. We have  stayed at the Surrey, and love Upper East Side so we decided to give this one a try. I must say this was one of the most memorable stays in The Big Apple. The Mark makes you feel important and at the same time at home. The service is immeasurable catering to our each and every need. It is nice that you don't have to be a celebrity to be treated like one. I also loved the location. You are in Manhattan, but don't feel that huzzlebuzzle of Fifth Avenue or Time Square, which is something I don't really like about this city. The Mark is located close to the MET Museum, Guggenheim, Lincoln Center and Central Park. I would like to thank every employee that we met: Isabelle and Jackie, the concierges for your great recommendations and directions;Steven and Taylor(FnB & Pastry chef) for the exquisite amenities; Lorenzo(the Maitre D) for your suggestions and kindness; Jane for checking us in with your beautiful smile and courtesy; Ricky, doorMAN for your greetings and happy mood. And last but not least, I want to thank Angel and his amazing sales team for our reservations. Thanks to all of you who made our stay PERFECT.

title: Chicest Hotel on the UES!
text: I mean you cannot beat this hotel! This is hands down the best hotel in New York and might even be the best hotel in the world. The service is outstanding AND the rooms are to die for! There's something very special about this hotel - between The Mark Restaurant by Jean-Georges and the stunning views from my room I could not have been happier. I traveled with my parents and dog (pet friendly) - the last night we didn't even want to leave the room! We ended up cancelling our reservations in the city and eating Truffle Pizza in the room! I miss The Mark and will always remember our experience.

title: Quite Nice Hotel
text: Quieter above ambience at the lobby and bar lounge but most importantly, very clean room, not huge but greatly decorated rooms (very clean and elegant finish) and yet decent size (not like the W at Lex, where it is you or your luggage). The bar lounge has a quite good vibe although a small space. Rooms sort of a Japanese style quite Coen, neat and minimalist but with style and all commodities to the level of a "Bon Vibant"

title: Well located comfortable hotel
text:
I last stayed at the Mark about 20 years ago when it was very trendy and pleased with itself - Over the years it has mellowed into a hotel confident of its reputation - and deservedly so - Helpful friendly staff - Reception, Concierge and Restaurant were all excellent and the boys 'out front' a delight.  I travelled with my daughter- we stayed for six days &  were on the 6th floor facing on to Madison Avenue - in a Club Madison room which was a good size and had a really good bathroom.  The room was light and sunny (we were v. lucky with the weather)
The location of the Mark is brilliant - one block from Central Park  and a couple of blocks from the Metropolitan Museum and other Museums are all close.   The area is so much nicer than being right in the middle of Manhattan where it is more crowded and can seem a little dark because of all the tall buildings.   I would definitely recommend this area - and this hotel

title: Outstanding
text:
Where do you stay in New York when you're staying 1 month?
I'm a former New Yorker who really knows the city
I'm spoiled and demanding and expect only the best!
My hotels of choice are The Ritz in Paris and Hotel du Cap in Antibes
We have stayed in several different hotels in New York over the past 10 years ...all of which were extremely disappointing

title: Caro pero bueno
text:
No es tan bueno, es de alta calidad, pero muy caro.
El Hotel, está bien ubicado, y es muy cómodo.
El personal de servicio del Hotel está muy capacitado para todos tus requerimientos.
Buen ambiente, y tranquilo.

title: Top notch hotel in a prime location!
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Mark for one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary, and were extremely impressed. Location wise, you cannot beat it, right in the middle of manhattan with a walking distance to Central Park and 5th Ave shopping. The hotel is trendy, with an elegant modern ambiance, the staff extremely friendly and professional. Francisco, the bell captain who handled our luggage and car, realized that we were there to celebrate our wedding anniversary, so he arranged for a little surprise for us when we came back to our room from dinner: a chilled champagne bottle with a delicious cupcake! Such a sweet gesture!
We reserved a courtyard room, but were upgraded to the bigger Madison Ave room. The room is clean, with lots of closets, a nice view of Madison Ave and very comfortable king-size bed. The bathroom was absolutely amazing, clean, bright and spacious, and the shower head better than a real message. The bar is well-stocked and were asked upon checking in about our preferred Sunday newspaper. 
For brunch, we headed to The Mark Restaurant by Jean George, a great restaurant, though a bit pricy for the portions we received. 
All in all, we loved our stay at The Mark and would love to go back. Highly recommended for couples and business stays.

title: Holiday Inn decor; luxury price
text: For a a budget hotel this would have been fine but not when you are paying $800 plus tax a night for a standard room!  Starting with the almost non-existent lobby with very limited seating in a cold drafty area near the door so no comfortable place to wait.  Our room was Spartan with not a comfortable place to sit and no desk to work on. All the furniture is undersized.  I didn't know that such small TVs are still being produced.  The supposedly highly acclaimed decorator sacrificed American ideas of comfort for a former Soviet Union look; cold, barren, modernist and uninviting; worthy of a budget hotel.

title: excellence in every aspect
text: The Mark is an old property as I understand but it is elegant. The service is intuitive and extremely helpful and courteous. The bathroom is the best in my experience. The shower is as you like it temperature wise with plenty of pressure....and the full bathtub and the separate sinks and the tile floor...all beautiful and functional...heated towel racks...the blinds in the bedroom, the snack and beverage selections in room...the bed is so comfortable and the linens are elegant...Great experience!

title: Marvellous
text: I spent a couple of nights in this hotel recently, and will definitely return. Great staff, attentive to every need. Very nice room, and a fabulous bathroom. I was in a room at the back of the hotel, no view to speak of, but very peaceful. Excellent position on the Upper East Side, close to Frick Collection, Metropolitan Museum, Guggenheim and all the good shops. Not cheap, but hey it's five stars, and deservedly so in my view

title: The best hotel to stay in New York
text:
Great rooms,great service and amazing ambience at the restaurant and bar.You have the feeling of been in a boutique hotel and the services of a world class operation.Its the best off both worlds.
Have the egg white omelette for breakfast,they are fab.

title: 5 stars for 5 star hotel
text:
I am a firm believer in evaluating accommodations based on their reputed quality. If a 1 star hotel gives you a 1 star stay, that's fine. Good review. So, the Mark is a 5 star hotel.
Check-in took no time at all, with no wait. The woman checking us in came upstairs with us, and took time to show us all the amenities of the room. She also answered my wife's questions regarding local shops, etc. The bellman was also very helpful, and gave us the name of his favorite local "pizza by the slice" place.
The room was tastefully decorated, with plenty of lighting, and plenty of space. The bathroom was also very large. The walls were obviously quite thick, and we heard very little of the NYC traffic outside.
It was extremely clean--no trace of dust, leftover dirt, etc. 
The bed was very comfortable. Plenty of pillows were provided, giving us all kinds of choices. 
Concierge was quite knowledgeable. We also talked to check-in staff in the evening, and they were pleasant and professional.
Overall, a very pleasant stay.

title: our NYC home
text:
We had many stays there, have our favorite types of rooms. Note there is onl 1 room of each type on a floor.

One of the best we have been to. Its one negative: no view.

Excellent restaurant &bar. Semra &Sami there were great; also the greeter (forgot her name). Room service is as good as restaurant.

Above all: wonderful people, good &courteous service.

My wife needed a bandage, got it on very short notice, very late at night. ?David?

Isabelle (concierge) took care of a complicated tuxedo rental; always gets us good tickets on short notice

Lukas (concierge) is also excellent

Jane (front desk) got us oriented as to room maps.

Pablo (front desk) helped a lot w/reservations; ditto Paula (ibid)

title: Great time
text: Top of the line service, room and experience. Our bath tub stopper had issues, but they came up to the room to repair it as soon as I hung up. Our waiter was memorable if not my favorite part of the trip. He was respectful, funny and prompt. He even offered me tea on the house! I wish I could remember his name (middle aged African American) but I've been to many places around the U.S. as well as Europe, stayed at the Ritz, the four seasons etc. but none of them were comparable. Thanks guys!

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We spent three days at this very comfortable chic hotel, beautifully furnished, extremely comfortable and very courteous friendly staff.
We had room 502 which was very quiet plenty of cupboard space and an amazing bathroom with a huge bath.

title: Forgot my Breitling watch AND cash in the safe
text: Came for Electric Zoo from DC and I forgot my Breitling watch and some cash in the safe and it was FedExed to me with insurance. What I didnt like is that Fedex left it at my door without a signature(I specfically told the hotel to ask for signature) and I dont if that was The Marks fault or Fedex's fault, I got lucky. They are great and I will only stay at The Mark from now on, customer service is everything to me.

title: Maravilhoso
text: O hotel The Mark é sem duvida nenhuma maravilhoso, ja na recpção fui muito bem atendida e orientada, os funcionarios sempre atenciosos e dedicados. O quarto era muito aconchegante e as camas muitos macias. Adorei me hospedar nesse hotel. Indico pra todos.

title: New York Glamour without the customer service quality
text:
After a 7 and a half hour flight all you want to do is freshen up however america checkin time is 2pm and we were there about 11.00am. This wasn't an issue we dropped off our bags and went for some lunch however when we returned it was after 2 and our room was still not ready. They offered us a free drink in the bar but quite frankly if your check in time is 2 you should be ready we had to wait an hour and half after 2 to get access to our room. The excuse was that customers checked out late this is not satisfactory for a hotel with such a reputation and at the cost per room. 

The hotel looks very glam and the rooms were very clean the bed and the sofa bed were both comfortable and as a stay in a hotel it was enjoyable. 

There was an in-room fridge and freezer that you could turn off at night if the noise irritated. Controlling the air conditioning was complicated and the room was either freezing or too hot. 

There was plenty of wardrobe space however they did what every hotel does and leave about three hangers in there when you have the room booked for 4 nights and three guests are booked in there should be a wardrobe full of hangers. 

Concierge was not great when asking for suggestions of places to go all they seem to recommend were the local ones to the hotel as if New York doesn't have other areas. For a hotel of this caliber they didn't appear to have a great deal of knowledge.

We had room service a few times and most of the food was good however avoid the hot chocolate as it was more like water very unpleasant. 

Overall a pleasant stay but I have stayed at better hotels in New York, ones that actually supply you with your hotel room when they should! For me The Mark is a glamorous platform without the full service.

title: Lovely hotel in great NYC location
text:
My family and I stayed here prior to a trip to the Hamptons and really enjoyed ourselves. The Mark has a reputation as an iconic NY hotel and it lived up to this in our eyes. 

The rooms were luxurious and well appointed and the restaurant produced excellent breakfasts and lunches.

The staff were pleasant and efficient, but the location made the hotel a perfect place to explore many of the tourist attractions of NYC.

We would definitely stay at the Mark again

title: EXCELLENT
text:
If I ever come to New York again I would only want to stay at this hotel. The staff are so friendly, helpful and professional. I could find no faults, just a brilliant and beautiful hotel. Our room and bathroom was pure luxury. Spotlessly clean and extremely luxurious and comfortable  
Many thanks for such an amazing stay.

title: My favorite in NYC
text: This is my third visit to this hotel. The location is perfect. Shopping, great restaurants, and museums are nearby. The staff is terrific, they will take care of anything you need. including transportation. Their  own car is available if you request ahead of time. The hotel is not one of those huge, crowded, typical city hotels. It is a smaller, upscale well-maintained, beautiful property. There is a renowned restaurant, Jean George's in the hotel, and a wonderful salon, Frederic Fekai, which I have frequented many times. The bar area is very popular among the locals. It opens onto the street and it is quite lively. This is my go-to hotel whenever I stay in the city.

title: The Mark makes it's mark
text:
This was the 1st time we stayed at The Mark Hotel but have been to several hotels on UES, so we love this location 1 block from Central Park and close to cafes on Madison Ave and on Lexington Ave, to eat and a subway to travel from.
The Staff were the key to this hotel being as fabulous as it was and truly added to our fantastic experience at The Mark, from reception check-in to bell-boys and bar staff. All the staff were so polite, friendly and helpful which is not always a given in a 5 star hotel, but they were all so relaxed and effortless in the way in which it came across.
So for this reason we would return initially and also the fact that The Mark is a classic example of a luxurious, contemporary 5* hotel on the UES with very comfortable rooms that are light and airy and bathrooms and beds that you look forward to returning too!!
we are frequent returners to NYC on vacation from UK and have experience of where to stay and visit and this trip was fun and happiness due to the Mark!!
The Bell Hops and the bike man were great fun!!
thanks to ALL at the Mark

title: Lavish and Serene Hotel
text: I often wonder why visitors to NYC flock to midtown hotels. The minute they walk out the door, they are typically in a commercial neighborhood with shops that cater to travelers. If you are willing to go uptown to a residential neighborhood on the Upper East Side, you can stay at The Mark. It's in an architecturally lovely building with lavish suites and rooms. Since you are in a truly affluent neighborhood, I would advise skipping the hotel bar and restaurant and eat and drink with the locals. I ask the concierge for recommendations. At The Mark, you're a block from Central Park and at the lower end of Museum Mile. My experiences here have been very positive. It's a five star hotel with high standards.

title: Big Apple Chic !
text: The absolute best staff best rooms - And the most amazing bathrooms in all of NYC ! My home away from home while in the city. Cozy beds,great location and the front desk can make all your NY dreams come true ! Cheers and don't miss a cocktail in the bar xx

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
I have reviewed this hotel before in previous years. However it is rare that when a hotel just keeps getting better and better. The Staff, particularly the concierge desk under  Isobel and Casey were incredibly helpful. The guest relations director Rebecca is very efficient, and never disappoints.
The GM Olivier Lordonnois is always a superb professional, mixing warmth with efficiency.
It is not cheap...but you get what you pay for...the best!

title: Great hotel
text: Just finished travelling round the States with the family for several weeks.  This was the lasts hotel we stayed in and definitely the best. Great location, staff very kind to us and the kids and the restaurant is very good too. No hesitation in recommending it.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location
text: The staff was wonderful. They made us feel right at home. The desk staff upgraded our room to a suite because our room wasn't ready at check-in. I will definitely return. The location is perfect. I can't comment on the restaurants - we never had a meal there, but there is always next time!

title: Ótimo
text: Ótimo hotel. O atendimento foi ótimo também, os funcionários deste hotel foram muito prestativos, nós deram muitas dicas de restaurantes e passeios. O quarto era muito confortável e aconchegante .... Tudo muito bom!

title: Brilliant Hotel
text: Faultless Hotel. We loved everything about it. Sure, its not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Bedrooms, Linens, Service all exemplary. We would return to this Hotel next time we are in NY. Location was good too, just a block from Central Park and in a classy and expensive part of town

title: Classy Elegance on the Upper East Side
text:
I was looking for a quiet oasis during my husband's recent hip surgery, and found that and more at The Mark. This hotel exemplifies all the best things about understated luxury. There's a first-class staff, over-sized rooms with sumptuous beds, gorgeous art deco style bathrooms with powerful showers, and a very good restaurant ( Jean Georges) on site.

The location is in the heart of the Upper East Side, very close to lots of shopping, restaurants, and several top NYC hospitals.

Although I only stayed for two nights, I really felt like I had a mini-vacation. I hope to return soon!

title: Parfait et raffiné.
text: Ambiance raffinée et feutrée, un véritable bijou. De bon goût de A à Z. Un service impeccable. A 2 pas du Metropolitan Museum. On s' y sent bien, comme chez soi ce qui est le vrai luxe. Aucun bling-bling. Clientèle allant de pair (la nature est bien faite). L' élégance est le maître mot.

title: Happy to Return
text:
Our room was spacious and quiet and the automatic shutters worked well.Water pressure in the shower and bath tub was amazingly strong. The bed was comfortable and the bed linens were top quality. We did not try the restaurant other than breakfast since the menu looked uninteresting when you compare it to the top flight restaurants in New York City. Location is excellent and the service was as good as we remembered.
One small slip up: I had asked the concierge to make reservations at two restaurants.We changed our mind about one of them and I called directly to cancel. They had no record of the reservation. 
Other than that, this is a highly recommended hotel.

title: Lovely uptown stay
text: We loved the Mark - we were there for only two nights however.  The room was super super quiet (we booked a courtyard King) and despite being pretty well the lowest category was plenty big enough with a gorgeous comfy bed and huge bathroom with tub, walk in shower etc.  The place is very well managed and service is great without being pushy or in your face - discrete I guess you would say.  Everything we asked for came quickly and with no fuss - they seem to like to say 'yes' to their guests.  The location is lovely for an uptown experience. Concierge and front desk charming and efficient and all in all a super stay.  Would def go back.

title: Great hotel
text: We really enjoyed staying few days at this wonderful hotel. Very well managed. Room was beautiful, service exceptional, felt that we should be back. Very elegant and classy, clean and comfortable. Quickly became my favorite hotel.

title: The Ultimate New York Experience
text:
True elegance, exemplary staff, stunning accommodations, the coolest decor, luscious bedding, luxurious bathrooms, incredible technology within the suite, Fekkai Salon - my hair looked amazing, fitness center - perfect, along with what matters most in real estate - location, location, location resulted in this married couple wishing we could have stayed much much longer!
Back to the staff, from the moment we arrived the staff was truly the definition of old world fantastic customer service. We were treated like stars - they were all so kind.

title: My favorite NYC boutique hotel - been going for years!
text:
First of all, fabulous location, on Upper East Side, near best shopping, museums, & restaurants in the city. 
Inside: Beautiful rooms, large, distinctive bathrooms with awesome showers & fab toiletries. 
Very small lobby, & too small & expensive bar (try +$20/drink).

title: Luxury and Comfort
text: Great Boutique Hotel. Amazing and comfortable rooms near Expensive Madison Avenue. The service is incredible. They really know how to amuse their guests. The Bar scene is very nice with amazing cocktails. The restaurant as well has exquisite food  I must say is worth paying.

title: Expensive and worth it
text:
This hotel has it all, upper east side location, great restaurant, great rooms with all the amenities and a top concierge. 

Every member of the staff is tuned in to your needs from the minute you arrive, doorman, until checkout. You will have a comfortable stay.

title: Luxurious and comfortable
text:
This time I wanted a comfortable and luxurious hotel close to Central Park East side. The Mark fits in perfect! The location is great: 2 minutes walk to Central Park (close to the fabulous restaurant the Boathouse), 10 minutes walk to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and 5 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station (on 77th street and Lexington). 5 minutes walk down Madison Avenue and you find the restaurant Via Quadronno on 73rd street (great for breakfast and lunch). Just before reaching 73rd there is a bakery on Madison where you can buy your breakfast if you want to eat it on a bench in Central Park - highly recommended!
The rooms at the Mark are spacious, comfortable and beautiful. State of the art TV (Bang & Olufsen), great minibar (but not cheap!), a wonderful bathroom (with a TV in the mirror!), and appreciated a lot by my wife; two big wardrobes and lots and lots of drawers).
