We had a Superior King bedroom towards the courtyard, and no traffic noise.
The staff is helpful and friendly. The concierge knew everything and had no problem fixing me up with tables at popular restaurants (but he could not get tickets for a U2 concert the same evening for another naive guest!). 
The Wi-Fi was of course complimentary and very fast.
The only negative thing I could point my finger on was trouble with the hot water one day.
It's not the cheapest hotel it town, my room was $ 467, out of this $ 63 was different taxes, but it was worth it.
All in all a very nice hotel I will gladly come back to the next time in New York.

title: Truely amazing
text:
The Mark is just an exceptional property in all regards. The service when you arrive is impeccable, especially the ladies at reception make you feel welcome and treat you with utmost respect. 

The design of the hotel is stunning, the black and white, dark red and orange backgrounds just ooze class and style.

Once you arrive to the room it continues, one of the best stacked and thought through minibars in any 5 star hotel, beautiful layout and bang & olufsen entertainment system

Amazing huge bathroom, beautiful frette bathing robes, shoes that are comfy etc. just divine

Every question and wish was taken care of immediately and I felt at home from the very minute I arrived. Love the location too as its more quite than other NYC hotels.

Only bad thing is leaving when your stay is over - I cant wait to be back!

Thank you team for making this a very special stay

title: Worth the price
text:
Just finishing a 3 night stay at The Mark -- and it was a great experience. With a 20% off summer rate for multiple night stays, we were able to get a $400/night rate for a courtyard view room, which was a decent rate for a 5 star property, but at the upper end of our price range. They upgraded us to a 4th floor Madison Ave view room at check in, so a nice surprise. Beautifully laid out room, with a bathroom (2 sinks, incredible water pressure, big tub, heated towel racks) that was exceptional.

Food and drink prices are 5 star high, so we had to pick our spots. In the morning, we carried in BLTs and coffee from Pick a Bagel at Lexington and 77th rather than face a $100 room service breakfast, but splurged on room service dinner one night (pizza mainly) and ate a late dinner in their first class restaurant after Broadway show, and while both were very pricey, service and food both were first rate.

I'm an old-fashioned fan of the mini bar, even if I don't use it much, and The Mark's is the best you will ever see. Full selection of sweets, room temperature booze, ice cold fine wine and soft drinks, and then a deep freeze drawer with ice. And total flexibility to stock your own in the fridge or freezer.    

Great front desk, but the only weak link was the concierge service, which was definitely functional and responsive, but seemed too lack a real focus in finding out what you were really interested in (hard to explain, just that feeling that they wanted to get you an answer and move you on).

But those are small complaints. The location is exceptional -- close to Central Park -- and the service is generally first rate, with some great food right at your doorstep, so we'll return in a heartbeat if we can get a room rate that doesn't break the bank.

title: Exceptional experience
text: Our recent visit to The Mark in New York was incredible. The hotel and restaurant are truly five star and the staff extremely helpful and attentive.We certainly give this hotel our highest recommendation and look forward to a return visit!

title: Five star hotel at four star (or less!) prices
text:
I stumbled upon this hotel as I culled through the countless options available when looking for a place to stay in NYC. We typically stay on the Upper East side because it is quiet. The Mark is a little gem nestled in the heart of the Upper East side. I'm so glad I found it.

The pros: It was definitely quiet. Our room was a courtyard king and we didn't hear a thing. No street noise at all. The room itself was on the small side, but it was adequate. The luxurious bathroom more than made up for it. It was huge by any standard, gigantic by New York standards. It had double sinks, a lovely shower with amazing water pressure (Speakman) and a soaking tub that we joked my husband could have swum laps in. The entire bath was marble - beautiful flooring and amazing slabs on the walls. The towel warmer and heated floor were nice touches, as well.

There was plenty of storage in the closet and built-ins.We were able to stow away luggage so that it was not in our way - very convenient. The room contained refrigerator drawers and a full bar that were above and beyond what is typically found in most luxury hotels. 

We ordered room service several times. It was delicious and timely. Not a surprise since the hotel is connected to Jean-Georges. 

I felt like we were greeted and sent off by our own host each day. Francisco was warm and gracious, so friendly. I never got his title, so I am not completely sure what his position is, but that part he did perfectly. There were a couple of others who stood out, as well, I hate that I never learned their names. 

The hotel is only a block off Central Park and offers complimentary bikes and pedi-cabs. The Hotel (Jean-Georges) will pack you a lunch for a reasonable fee. Madison Ave is on the other side of the hotel, so stellar shopping is just a stroll away.

The cons for the hotel overall is that it is a good bit uptown, so it takes time (and money) to get to midtown or lower Manhatten. Even the subway can be time consuming. So, you just have to go in with that expectation and know that it is a trade-off for the serenity of the neighborhood. 

My one and only disappointment with our room was that it did not have black out shades. We were out late several nights and the last thing I wanted was to know it was dawn already! An eye mask could remedy that. Or take my husband's approach and be thankful, otherwise you won't want to leave the room!

There are very few places we stay that are as luxurious and comfortable as our own home. The Mark met the mark. We are thankful we found it and that it made our weekend so wonderful. We will treasure our memories of NYC and our time at this lovely hotel.

title: Fabulous
text: The hotel has all the makings of a great hotel. Tremendous rooms, service, food and staff. Every detail has been considered. The service level is excellent. Highly recommend. Shortly returning for another stay.

title: Excellent
text:
Very stylish and elegant hotel. Good location.
Very nice rooms with everything you wish to have. It is a real 5 star boutique hotel.
The resaurant is also very good eventhough the prices are high.
Over all an excellent hotel ! We liked it very much and will return.

title: The right place to stay in NYC
text: After a long lasting decision I can say this was the best one . I stayed in few 5 stars hotels in NYC, but this one was the best so far. Location: Upper East Side - nearby Central Park , not that busy. Service: very professional - and attentive, from check-in until check-out. Room /Mark Studio-10th floor/ - decent size with small Boffi kitchen, cleaning service very good. You get complimentary newspaper every morning, Laduree or chocolate minis plus Evian water every evening, use of Mark bicycles.Breakfast not that good (The Mark breakfast choice incl.eggs any style,potatoes, juice, coffee for 30 USD), need to be improved. One can get breakfast in nearby area,Lexington avenue or Plaza Food Hall (little further), depending on budget and taste. Small but professional gym.Basic wifi good with some problems during busy hours (evenings or Fridays), you pay extra if you want quicker. The Mark has an atmosphere usually missing in other NYC hotels.  We ll be back.

title: Precision - Excellence - Near Perfection
text: The Mark is a great hotel property in every way. Quiet elegance in New York's upper east side. Warm and friendly front desk. Beautiful rooms - nice size - large clean double sink bathrooms.  Comfortable beds. Nice linens changed every day. Complimentary shoe shine service. Good gym - plenty of machines and free weights.   Good bar. Nice restaurant. Turn down service. Easy check out.   Every aspect was efficient and hospitable. That's why we keep coming back.

title: Absolute perfection!
text:
Pity that it's not possible to offer more than 5 stars!

My wife and I checked out of the hotel today after a two and a half week stay in Suite 1102 and we really couldn’t let the moment pass without noting what a wonderful experience it was.

In a word, and quite remarkably, the stay was perfect in every way.  We could enumerate each aspect specifically but it would get redundant.  Let me simply say that the ambience, the old-world courtesies of the staff (at all levels) and the luxuriousness of the facility all combined to create an experience that was not only memorable, but magical.

It recalled to us to finest hotels that we have stayed at in Europe.

Our apartment in Manhattan has been undergoing renovations and was uninhabitable.  The Mark was truly a soothing balm during this very stressful period.

After a brief break, the renovations will resume either next week or the week after.  We look forward to another, albeit somewhat shorter stay very soon!

title: Luxury luxury and location location but what was this extra charge on my bill?
text:
What a great location for visiting the met museum and the upper east side. Swanky neighborhood. Super nice doormen too. Bikes are available for free and transportation to bergdorf-goodman. Super nice space-large for New York. Wonderful marble bath. Slippers, ample toiletries. Great pillows, linens, towels. Even a Sub-zero refrigerator. Can you believe that?  I don't know what this all cost but for two nights it was heavenly. Everything was A+. Except after we got home and looked at the bill there was a $200 charge for using the bar/food. We explained that we did not take anything from the food supply and a heated argument ensued with the hotel saying we ate their food and 
 would have to check with housekeeping, making the assumption that we were lying.  Well this did not settle well with my husband who found it insulting. I don't think we will stay there again after having this argument over the charge for bar use. The charge was removed in two days but we were sorely disappointed with this occurrence. Check your bill closely.

title: "  Elegant and CLass Hotel"
text: If you want great service, class and great location then this is the hotel. Spent four days and it was amazing. As soon as you arrive your greeted and taken care of. The room was spacious and spotless. Central Park is walking distance and shopping around the corner. Found small cafe around the corner, great lattes and sweets. Would recommend if you want a quiet, elegant hotel.

title: Top!
text: This is hotel is just fantastic. High class all over. The service is more than 5 stars. The bathroom has tv if you want to watch a programme while taking a bath. Attention to details pays of course back. And you can also do vip-watching, we spotted a famous actor in the hall. It is expensive but it is totally worth the price! I strongly recommend!

title: Wonderful vacation
text:
Had a fabulous visit at The Mark end of June 2015. We initially booked for two nights we were so pampered that booked for additional two at end of stay.
location two minutes from Central Park,you have their bikes to borrow too.
Bathrooms with oversized bathtubs and seperate marble showers.
Personal touches were staff taking you to your room and explaining how everything works,to the personal message welcoming you on the tv screen.

You have a large selection of beverages in the well stocked fridge, aswell as ice and large fridge freezer to store your own supplies.
Twice daily they service your room and at night you return to dim lights,soft music, chocolate and water by your bed and fresh new slippers on the floor.
Staff so friendly and pleasant I would go back tomorrow if I could.

title: The great style in a right place!
text:
This is absolutely a particular hotel in NY city. From the first step you feel the style of this place: the textures and colors are made with the great taste. The check-in procedure was very quick and then I had a room tour. I had a queen courtyard room, for me in NY it is always important to have the room with the courtyard view to avoid the street noise, but here I had the ventilation system just behind my window, so it wasn’t quite enough actually if you decide to open the window (so ask for the highest floor). The room is not so big, but well equipped and made with the unique style. I was a bit surprised to discover, that you can’t open the second door of the cupboard because of the bedside-table, so maybe the slide doors are better for this small room (but of course I understand that everything should be in one style).
Bathroom is great! So spacious and with a lot of light: to be honest, I was ready to spend all my time in this marble paradise. The only thing, that should be in each bathroom – the hygienic pack, but I didn’t find it, maybe it was hidden away. The bathtub is very deep, so you can enjoy after a long and active day. 
The turndown service was very pleasant and made with a care, so I felt as I came back at home. 
I had breakfast at the hotel and I think, this is the point for improvement. The food was good, but there is no buffet, so you are in the frames of the same choice each day. You have 30$ to spend for the breakfast which is covered by your rate, but in Mark 30$ is not enough (each dish is about 25-28$), so it’s up to you to decide where to eat, but next time I will have my breakfast out. Also, I highly recommend to the hotel management to pay more attention to the restaurant staff. There are a lot of staff, but only one person does something while others are busy with each other, so you need to remind each time about the forgotten tea spoon, additional cup, jam or butter, milk for the porridge or your juice. I’m sure that the hotel of this level can afford the best staff for them.
I want to say a big thank to Melina, who was so kind and so operative with my booking and room requests. 
All in all this hotel is the great one, actually for its location – just 1 minute from Central park, so I had no excuses to miss my morning cardio. I wanted to go to the gym, but it is small, so I decided to keep it for the bad weather. Also, I think the bottled water is necessary in the gym, not all people are ready to drink tap water with sliced lemon.
This part of the city  is the best one, so the hotel is situated in the right place. So be sure, that you will be in a good company! 
I would be glad to come back here!

title: An excellent upper East Side alternative
text: Contemporary feel, and first class service.  The staff is as good as any NYC hotel.  Rooms are good, but furnishings feel a little more like cheaper contemporary.  Views are fine for NY.  Room service is good, but expensive.  Fitness center is adequate, and probably in line relative to other NYC hotels.  The lobby bar is a major Thursday night hang out and a lot of fun.  If nothing else, stop by and have a drink.

title: Right next to Central Park, The Mark is amazing.
text: We really enjoyed our stay at The Mark.   It's situated in a quiet part of NYC and yards away from Central Park.   Make sure you sign up for iPerfer before you go.   That is their affiliated honors program.  Because we were members, we were upgraded to a beautiful room with a full modern kitchen, complete with Subzero refrigerator!   The service was amazing and everyone was very friendly.   My only critique would be the cost of Food and Bev.....but it was very good.   I would stay there again, it is definitely my new favorite in NYC.

title: You can't beat perfection!
text: This place has true heart. You feel pampered from the moment you arrive. The doormen are very attentive and personable, opening the car door, chatting, and remembering my name, making me feel at home. Front desk and concierge were very professional, always going out of their way, above and beyond, without any hesitation. When you're happy and you love your job, everything just works perfectly, and this place nails it. The GM greets guests in the lobby, making sure they are taken care of, I could tell he really cares, once again I was very impressed.

title: Phenomenal hotel, great service
text: This is a really nicely designed hotel that has a unique style. The room is large, elegant and very well designed for comfort. They have thought of every little detail. The service team are outstanding and more than happy to help at every opportunity. Location is good in the upper east side. Prefect if you want to use the park. Highly recommended!

title: Great stay
text: We were delighted with our room at the Mark Hotel.  it was like having booked an apartment but with the amenities of a hotel.  The linen, china, glassware were all first class.  Everything was perfect.  Personally, I did not like getting into the lift. It is all black and white and sometimes I could not tell if the doors were open or not.   This may be because I am getting old and I am sure young people just love that vibe.  Very well situated away from the hustle of New York .  A very nice place to return to after a day out.  Be aware that the free bikes the hotel provide do not have any gears.  Again the younger visitor may not have a problem with that issue.

title: What a trip!
text: The Mark Hotel goes above and beyond their call of duty. From the moment we called to make our reservation with the extremely resourceful Melina to the moment we left, The Mark Hotel felt like a home, and the employees an extension of our family. The rooms were comfortable and beautifully decorated, and the receptionists were quick to answer any of our questions. My family and I are eagerly awaiting our next visit to New York City just to have an excuse to stay at The Mark again!

title: Great experience
text: We stayed at The Mark last year. Overall we had a great experience. The rooms are not too big, but are confortable. They have a excellent fitness center. The bar is great, is always full of people. The location is a benefit because you are in one of the best areas of Manhattan. Can walk everywhere.

title: Fabulous
text: I had a wonderful stay at The Mark. Incredibly stylish, fell in love with the elegant rooms. Fantastic location right in the heart of New York City. Service was impeccable. Would definitely stay again!

title: Hochzeitsreise
text:
Wir waren in der Zeit vom 08.06.2015 - 13.06.2015 anlässlich unserer Hochzeitsreise im "The Mark".
Was soll ich sagen. Es war ein grandioser Aufenthalt. 
Das Personal: super freundlich und super hilfsbereit. Besonderen Dank hierbei an Pablo und den Concierges, die uns in allen Fragen unterstützten, all unsere Wünsche real werden ließen und so dafür sorgten, dass unsere Hochzeitsreise unvergesslich bleiben wird. *****
Der Service: top *****
Das Hotel: top gelegen in der Nähe zum Central Park. Das Zimmer einfach ein Traum. *****

Insgesamt eine für uns ganz tolle Woche in der Stadt die niemals schläft. Auch Dank des tollen Personals.

Wir werden mit Sicherheit wiederkommen.

title: Hits the Mark
text:
What a great location upper east side one block from Central Park and close to the best shopping on Madison Avenue, the Jean George restaurant serves some of the very best food in New York and has a great bar on to 77th street.
State of the art gymnasium. All the areas and the rooms are beautifully appointed.

title: Moderno
text: Hotel super moderno e de bom gosto. Fica distante dos principais pontos turísticos e restaurantes (fica no upper east side), mas é uma localidade bem charmosa também. O quarto é ótimo: muito confortável espaçoso.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Hotel excelente em todos os sentidos.... Fica bem próximo ao central park e metropolitan museu. Os quartos são amplos e muito aconchegantes... Os funcionários são muito educados e simpáticos, nós deram várias dicas de restaurantes e passeios.

title: Very nice hotel, except: no proper sound proofing so you can hear everything from the street
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband in a superior room with queen bed. The hotel is very nice from a design point of view. I truly loved the bathroom with its cool marble black and white design. The food we ordered from room service was excellent, although the portions were quite small. The concierge was very helpful when we had some things delivered from a store, even though we had checked out already. In terms of location: you are directly on madison ave and very close to Central Park, which is great for some, not so for others. Great for high end shopping, but lacking the little boutiques, cute restaurants and quirkiness you can find in other areas. 
   
The main reason I would not return however: I was truly shocked how badly sound proofed the windows of the room were. I did not expect this from a 5 star hotel. You truly could hear everything from the street side, including the conversations of people walking by, which is not great when you are experiencing a jet lag and are trying to sleep. Can't remember exactly which floor we were on though.

title: 'Amazing Hotel'
text:
I've just returned from an overnight stay at The Mark. I loved everything about the Hotel. The customer service was A+ from checking in to the information and assistance given from the concierge. 
The Mark is in a lovely exclusive area just a few minutes walk into Central Park.
The rooms are very spacious with very comfortable beds & pillows. The bathrooms are a great size with a separate bath and power shower.
The very trendy vibrant bar is great for cocktails before dinner.
I can highly recommend a stay at The Mark.

title: Good with room for improvement
text: I had the pleasure of staying at The MARK for the first time for an overnight in early April of this year. I loved almost every aspect of the hotel and hence have given a top rating. A few things could have been improved, but overall the hotel is charming and the staff truly delightful. My room was extremely spacious, with an amazing bed and superb linens. I especially loved the USB ports next to the night stand....no need to jump up an down while charging the phone or iPad. The bathroom was great, although small, but very functional and very well appointed.  Spent a good 3 hours in the very popular and wonderful bar. Service there was great to begin with , but deteriorated after when waitresses seemed to be switched on us. Not sure why, but it was less than perfect. had caviar and martinis. We asked for menus, mentioning we were starting with caviar and would possibly have something else after ...she was not overly in favor of more food being served, in spite of a food bar menu being there for that exact reason. " well as long as you are not really having dinner here" was more or less the response.  We still tipped 20 percent. Not sure why.  Breakfast in the restaurant was fair. Got in as they opened as I had to get to JFK early. Difficult getting fresh carrot juice....overheard the staff discussing the broken juice machine...loud discussion whi8ch is not what guests need to hear. Coffee served promptly but a second cup not so easy to get. Major criticism was the staff being all present and visible or nobody at all.  This drives me crazy. In spice of these shortcomings, I really did like the hotel. But there is room for improvement .

title: The best charming exclusive location . O melhor de NYC !
text:
Bright but calm and relaxing big rooms . Excellent service and amazing cousine .
 The bar is vibrant at night with delicios drinks . Very good fitness centre . The most powerful shower that I ever had ! 
 The bykes in Summer and a picnic at Central Park are an amazing excellent idea .
 Everything is just perfect .

title: Great Hotel
text: Always one of the best choices in NYC. Housekeeping is excellent, close to the best of any 5 star hotel anywhere, and I stay in many all over the world. Very nice spacious well maintained rooms, great comfortable beds and pillows, very good size well lit bathrooms with tub and shower seperate, good refrigerator with icemaker, good concierge service and wifi and very good restaurant in the hotel. Within walking distance of many other very good restaurants as well as a St Ambrous just around the corner for the best coffee in NYC. Definitely at the top of my list in New York.

title: Amazing hotel and customer service... It's my favorite A++
text: In this hote, I feel like home, everybody it's taking care of you and always pending on your marvelous stay, the rooms are very comfortable and amazing decorations, this hotel is my only one choice in New York City.

title: Fabulous accommodations, service, and location! LOVE!
text: I enjoyed a lovely stay at the Mark over Memorial day weekend.The property definitely has a luxurious and glamorous residential feel--from the moment I walked through the door, I felt like a resident of the neighborhood. Check-in was super smooth the front desk agent even escorted me to my room and gave me complete overview of the accommodation and all its features--seems like a small gesture but I stay in many hotels and it is quite rare that I receive such a personalized introduction. The service throughout my stay was seamless and everything I needed was at my fingertips in minutes. The staff was extremely pleasant and responsive, and the beds are divine. The bathrooms are luxuriously large and definitely help to differentiate the hotel from competitors.The proximity to Central Park can't be beat, and the hotel provides charming bikes and rickshaws to be enjoyed by guests--a very nice touch. Overall, I couldn't be happier with my stay!

title: Le luxe discret...
text:
J'ai eu la chance de connaitre l'hôtel avant sa rénovation et il est aujourd'hui signe de raffinement et d'élégance. L'ambiance est feutrée et un esprit familiale règne.
La proximité de Central Park permet de profiter d'un peu de campagne en plein centre de New York

title: Juste sublime !
text:
Une experience extraordinaire... le personnel est discret et efficace. 
il faut absolument aller au restaurant de l'hotel, le chef est exceptionnel. 
l'emplacement est parfait, et j'ai adoré la chambre design. Hate d'y retourner !

title: The best in NY
text:
the best experience in NY . The staff is perfect and always listen to your needs .
a wonderful feeling like I was " at home " .
a beautiful views of NY and the best district of the city .
a restaurant of quality and impeccable service .

title: Felt like my own upper east side home
text: loved the mark. the service was impeccable. francisco took care of us like we lived there. gorgeous subtle soothing decor of rooms, insanely sleek beautiful bathrooms. the only problem was the sound--easily heard other room doors open and close at 6am which woke us up. the doors are beautiful heavy wood doors which is probably part of the problem. everything else is perfection. some kind of soundproofing might help or don't get a room with another door right in front of you--maybe a lone room in a corner of a hallway. the downstairs bar is a bit of a night time scene but has no bearing on your experience at the hotel--it's sectioned off. loved the restaurant. recommend asking for a high floor on the madison avenue side.

title: Excellent Service, great restuarant small room
text:
The Hotel is in the upper East side and one small block away from the park.
You have very close by great restaurants and lots of stores in Madison Av.
The concierge help me with every thing and was very well informed.
The rooms are small but very nice, the Wi Fi is free and fast.
In summer they have bikes to ride in the park.
We will be back soon for sure.

title: Impeccable, Consistent, Attentive, Welcoming
text:
For the past two years, I have been fortunate enough to visit the Mark on at least 8 occasions.  I am familiar not only with the residences at the Mark, but also the hotel and the hotel services.  Having stayed at many wonderful hotels in the states and abroad, I can honestly say - there are few that do it better.  

My visits to the Mark are always proceeded by a great deal of preparation - assistance with dinner reservations within the hotel, and outside.  Florals for the rooms we are using and if needed for our guests.  Stocking of food and wine and specialty items.  Having the pleasure of working with Isabelle Hogan from the Concierge desk and her team - I can tell you there are none better, and they have never missed a beat at making sure our arrival is perfect.   

From the moment we arrive at the front door and are welcomed home, through the lobby, assistance with luggage, all the room preparations, dinner reservations, - and right up until we depart, General Manager Olivier and his team deliver world class service.

In a city filled with hotels, some great - some not so.... I would seriously address any issues you are having with someone of authority before you take to the internet to air your disappointment.  Customers are certainly the eyes and ears of management, and if you don't feel you are getting the services you expect in a hotel like this - I would reach out and ask to speak to the manager on duty - I am sure you will find they will fix it faster than you might expect.

Having recently hosted a birthday party weekend there - all of our guests that stayed at the hotel were impressed, de-stressed, and joyous after having visited here.  The attention they were given from the doormen and bellmen - offering hotel transportation services including bicycles, rickshaws, and a hotel car - to flagging down a cab - everyone that goes through the doors is in my opinion, well taken care of.  

The Food and Beverage department are an outstanding compliment to the hotel with Stephen Carro at the helm, our birthday weekend in room catering , and meal at Jean Georges were phenomenal.  

I have been in the hotel just prior to the Met Gala, during UN sessions, and other busy weekends, and am astounded at how calm and accommodating the staff can be.  

I would honestly give them the benefit of the doubt on any slips, as you can see by the GM's response - he cares deeply, doesn't make excuses, and acknowledges where there is room for growth they are all but willing.  I have met the GM, who is readily accessible when you have an issue, and if he is not , the manager on duty certainly is.  I am sure that they would be more than pleased for the chance to make it right!

title: Amazing!!
text:
We just left this hotel and I felt compelled to write a review. From the minute we stepped out of the car the entire staff made us feel special and very welcomed. We had my four year old with us and they all talked to him and treated him great! Even though it was our first time there they treated us like family!! The hotel is beautiful and glamorous! The rooms were clean and decorated nicely, and very spacious at 500 sq feet which is quite large for new your city, the bathroom was gorgeous with the black and white striped floors and very deep bath tub. The shower pressure was unbelievably strong and invigorating! We got amazing haircuts in the Frederic fekkai salon.  Loved the 

location on the upper east side it was quite but close to action. All the best stores are right there on Madison Avenue and Central Park is a half a block away. You really feel like a New Yorker in this quintessential neighborhood! The house car will take you anywhere in the city which is extremely convenient. We were so sad to leave and really missing this plAce after checking into a hotel in philly that isn't anywhere close to The Mark!! The management should be proud of their entire team!!! The housekeeping staff is also great, so sweet and friendly and thorough! This place is our new New York home away from home!

title: Business and leisure trip
text: Stayed at The Mark for the first time this April and it was a wonderful experience.  The room was beautiful and the bathroom downright gorgeous and I found the service to be excellent.  The service is why I am writing this review, the staff was friendly and helpful and made me feel welcome every time I walked into the lobby - they were by far the favorite part of my stay!

title: Raffiné
text:
Cet hôtel est luxueux mais pas ostentatoire et de taille humaine. Le personnel est à l'écoute et le service de conciergerie est de grande qualité. 
Nous avons également apprécié le bar qui est branché et le restaurant qui sert des mets raffinés.

Le matin nous avons vite abandonné l'idée de prendre le petit déjeuner à l'extérieur car celui de l'hôtel est PARFAIT.

Pour mes prochains séjours à NYC je retournerai au MARK sans hésitation!!

title: Disappointing 2nd visit to The Mark
text: We were very excited to come back to the Mark on Upper East side. We had a great time 18 months ago so decided to come back with our friends. On arrival we were greeted with welcome back we have all your details on file - a great start. But then it went downwards. The room was at the back and can only be described as overlooking air con plant and equipment. We were in 603. Make sure you insist on a room that looks out onto the road not out the back. Most hotels I go to value returning clients and give them a nicer room. Clearly The Mark doesn't do that. The refrigerator in the room Is so noisy at least you can't here the air con plant outside. When we checked out the concierge forgot to send someone to collect the bags and bring them down. The car booked to take us to the airport by the hotel was late. So not a great experience and be warned.

title: Elegant and luxurious
text: I stayed there on a brief visit. The service was excellent, the front desk being particularly helpful. The room was quiet and well appointed. The hotel's restaurant is well worth a visit - one of the upper East Side's best; smart and chic and very popular .

title: No value for money
text:
After reading so many reviews on which hotel to choose for my weekend in New York, I picked the Mark after a friends recommendation and what I read about the hotel. I was v excited to come try this hotel, however I wasn't very impressed. As a fellow reviewer stated there was no 'omph'.
First the staff were all very blah. They seemed to be there because they have to. There was no energy or friendliness to the service they provided. It was as if they were doing us a favor by being there. I do have to say a special thank you to Jackie from the Concierge for arranging to have cookies in our room upon check in. 

Second, I think the bed was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in in a 5 star hotel. It sunk in the middle and was way too soft. Even after requesting a harder mattress twice, we never noticed a difference. Please learn from the Four Seasons or the Mandarin, and get more comfortable beds. 

One positive note: the breakfast was delicious. Skip the lousy pastries offered with the Continental breakfast and ordered the scrambled eggs and their freshly baked scone. Delicious. 

Overall, it was a very unmemorable stay at the Mark.

title: Hôtel très agréable
text:
Hôtel de taille humaine a deux pas de central park, calme , très belles chambres design, service efficace et sympathique , restaurant bar branché et vivant . Si vous voulez une adresse bien placée mais intimiste à Manhattan c'est parfait.
Seul bémol petit déjeuner continental assez rachitique (quelques mini viennoiseries)

title: The best
text: Para mim é o melhor hotel em NY. Hotel que é hotel. Os funcionários sabem que você existe, lhe dão atenção, ajudam em tudo. Os quartos para a madison são ótimos, super bem equipados. O restaurante é maravilho, o ponto não pode ser melhor ! Talvez seja o último hotel com atenção pessoal aos seus clientes em NY

title: Tolle Lage, etwas steif
text: Hotel in perfekter Lage zum Central Park. Schöne renovierte Zimmer. Personal eher steif und gefühlt nur gelernte Freundlichkeit. Frühstück teuer und auch hier ist das Personal nicht wirklich motiviert. Alles in allem gut, aber eben nicht perfekt, was aber so vorgegeben wird.

title: Outsdanding All the Way!!!
text:
I been in NYC many times, and never stayed at this Hotel... My Father in law recommend me this Hotel and was the Best Recommendation ever!!! The rooms are Great Size, the quality of everything inside the room its SUPERB, there is details in every inch of the Room... All the Staff since you walk inn call you by your last name and you just arrive!!! How they do it??? In the Bathroom there is a HOT towel rack, so you always have Hot towels, the pressure of the shower its unbelievable!!! The bedding, the turn around service at nights... the TV system its Bang & Olufsen so you can experience a super high quality room in the BEST location of Madison and the 77th St. They offer free transportation to many places nearby and also they offer you Free bicycles for your use!!! This is going to be my Hotel Every time when i came to NYC!!!
Room Service comes form the restaurant of Jean George from downstairs witch its GREAT!!!

title: Nice but no "oomph"
text: My husband and I visited for one night for a "staycation" without our young child just before valentine's day.  The location is wonderful and very convenient, and while our room was nice, there wasn't anything particularly unique about it.  (The bathroom was great however!)  We had a room overlooking the back of the hotel, but there wasn't anything special about our stay - no one asked if we needed anything, on our way in our out, maybe I noticed this more because we just wanted to relax in the room as opposed to exploring Manhattan, but...I'd say it was fine, great location, but I'll try somewhere else next time.

title: Classy
text: Upon arrival, you are definitely going to feel VIP.  Staff is very kind and helpful.  Beautiful decor.  We stayed on 5th floor facing Madison Avenue.  Beautiful rooms, however, the windows lack any noise blockage.  We heard EVERYTHING from the 5th floor.  Other than that ONE negative, Central Park half a block away, great shopping near by, overall, great location.  Definitely a place to stay at if you want to feel like a celebrity and maybe even meet one.  Complimentary Umbrellas were nice to have on the rainy days.  Wifi is free, but limited gigs.  You can always purchase additional wifi if needed.

title: Hay mejores opciones en NY
text:
Es el hotel que esta de moda en estos momento en NY.
Uno de los probelmas es que esta en la 77, lo cual a mi gusto es un poco demasiado arriba todo y que me encanta el Upper east side. (sobran diez calles basicamente).
El hotel es bonito, buena decoración y esta bastante nuevo.
Habitaciones comodas, poco ruido externo e interno. Recomiendo pedir Madison Rooms, que estan de la planta 2 a la 8 y son algo mas grandes de las Courtyard. A partir de la novena planta solo hay suites.
En cuanto al servicio y personal hay que diferenciar claramente a la recepción con un muy buen servicio y al personal de F&B, que realmente deja mucho que desear. 
El desayuno no vale nada, es carisimo y el servicio es nefasto. 
El bar es muy pequeño, el servicio tampoco es nada del otro mundo teniendo en cuenta que una copa de vino normal cuesta 25 dolares SIN PROPINA!
En resumidas cuentas, es un hotel en el que me ha gustado estar por una vez pero que no creo que repita. Por estos precios, hay hoteles mas centrico en el Upper east y con muchos mas servicios y calidad del mismo

title: Outstanding in every way
text: As a surprise 40th birthday for my wife, we flew First to JFK and had an outstanding week in Manhattan, underpinned by the extraordinary service, quality and comfort of The Mark. The hotel is superbly positioned and is an oasis from the challenges and delights of NYC.

title: The Place To See and Be Seen
text:
Without a doubt, if you want to nudge with the rich & famous, just come here, especially during big events like the Met Gala and Fashion Week.

But what I like about this place is that the atmosphere actually matches it's clientele - luxurious. It's surprisingly a hard thing to find in NYC of all places.

title: Upper East Side Gem!
text: From the moment you step out of the cab the staff of The Mark make you feel like a VIP.  No detail was forgotten.  The suite we reserved was huge and we were welcomed with a lovely note, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries!  The bed was extremely comfortable and the bath, spacious luxury! Exquisite flowers were not only in the entrance lobby but in our room as well.We both love The Mark!!!

title: Best NYC hotel
text: I've stayed here many times, since 2011. Definitely recommend it. Price is quite high, but if you want an elegant, intimate, real NYC experience, this is the place to stay. I love it's location and service. Fantastic boutique hotel on the upper east!

title: The Best NYC Hotel!!!
text:
Once again, The Mark Hotel hits the mark of excellence! 

Could not find any faults at any point during this stay, and all our previous stays. The staff are all very professional and provide the best possible experience. The rooms are spacious and very well maintained. Fantastic beds, amazing showers, very clean.

The location speaks for itself, if you haven't tried The Mark, you must the next time!!!

title: A perfect place to stay in NYC
text:
We have just completed a 5 night stay at The Mark and can not speak highly enough of it.  The rooms were very comfortable and the staff were 1st rate. There is a good bar downstairs for a drink or two after a long days touring the sites of the city. 
The position on 77th street was perfect for us allowing easy access to Central Park or a 15 minute stroll down Madison to see all the shops.

The position of the hotel really suits people who don't want to be right in the middle of all the activity, ie Soho, Meat Packers, but close enough for a quick cab or tube ride to access it.

My only small complaint would be that the food and beverage costs seem to be very expensive compared to other hotels of similar standard.

Other than that well worth a visit.

title: LUXURIOUS
text: Gem of a boutique hotel upper east side near Central Park. Sleek modern decor. Neat as a pin. Attentive service at every turn. Comp car svc within 20 block limit. Bathroom is palacial with towel warmer and in mirror TV. Electric shades for blackout sleeping. Bedroom space is tight but not unexpected for NYC. Courtyard side was so quiet. Wi-fi was free & worked perfectly. Only issue was you can definitely hear hallway sounds like slamming shut of others' room doors and the loud rapping on your neighbors' doors by housekeeping, room service, & mini bar people but not a huge problem.

title: Elegance by the Park
text: Location is perfect if you are looking for Upper East Side elegance, great shopping and proximity to the park. The rooms are high standard as is the service. It's a shame that the rates fluctuate so much and that they do not offer any loyalty points despite being part of the iprefer group. Room service and on site restaurant is high end and a good standard if slightly over priced. The bar is a focal point. For day to day food requirements, try Three Guys cafe two blocks away. Very good value.

title: Wonderful staff, lovely room
text: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in January 2015. The staff is superb. The doorman left an impression with me - always genuine and offering directions. Seamless check-in. The rooms are varied. We stayed in a suite with a bedroom, small sitting area and small galley kitchen. I loved the storage space in the room, allowed us to clear our clutter. Beds were comfortable, electric blinds worked, kitchen had it all (fridge, stove, microwave). The tub was amazing, the deepest I've ever been in. Awesome. The location is truly Upper East Side with designer stores right there on Madison, and only a few short blocks to Central Park. In terms of overall value, it's expensive for what you get. eg: a room with kitchen and sitting room is $1,100-$1,300 a night. For a couple and a short stay, it's worth it. With children, no way. The New York Palace is half the price and better located for kids. For longer stays, I'd recommend checking out One Fine Stay - they rent out high end apartments for one week or more. Two bedroom with full kitchen for $550 a night. If you need a kitchen, this is a better alternative. If you want a lovely hotel experience in a wonderful location, The Mark is an excellent choice.

title:
Misses the Mark...
(Pack earplugs if you stay!)
text: Located in a lovely Upper East Side neighborhood, The Mark sadly lacks the charm of The Lowell and the grace of The Carlyle. Our rooms were furnished in a rather unattractive mix of styles. Furthermore, the noise from the street was LOUD, interrupting our sleep. Peaceful it was not.

title: A fine Upper East Side stay
text:
We were upgraded to a larger room.  This was both good and bad, as it was located on the second floor at the front of the building just above the entrance.  New York never sleeps, so even in a fairly quiet neighbourhood, you can get some noise. Ask for a higher floor if noise bothers you.

But on the positive side, the room was spacious and the bathroom excellent.  And being on the second floor meant that we could skip the elevator and take the stairs, which was great.  There was a person providing shoe shines on the second floor.  They never seemed that busy, but it was handy to have.

The hotel has an elegant restaurant.  Breakfast isn't included, but (depending on your package) they give you $60 each to spend, which just about buys pancakes and coffee!  We preferred to sit in the sunny part of the restaurant; apparently so does everyone else.  The staff try to seat you in the darker section where no one wants to be.  It's fine during dinner, though.

I would rate the service as perfectly fine, but not outstanding.  No one wowed us, but no one disappointed us either.

If you're staying on the Upper East Side, definitely consider staying at this hotel.  It's a short walk to the Carlyle, where you can get a drink in the iconic bar.  And the great NYC museums are a short or short-ish walk away.

title: ottimo 5 stelle lusso
text: ottimo hotel abbiamo soggiornato 4 giorni a metá febbraio,devo ammettere che sono rimasta colpita dalla bellezza delle camere molto ampie e con tutti i confort di categoria sinceramente non manca nulla unica pecca la posizione sulla 77st bisogna usare spesso il taxi almeno in questo periodo molto bella comunque la madison ave con tutti i suoi negozi.ottima la colazione....

title: Excellente adresse au cœur de l'Upper East Side
text:
J'avais lu quelques avis critiques sur The Mark. Mon expérience m'a très agréablement surprise. L'hôtel est à taille humaine et l'accueil est très aimable. Dans la chambre, nous attendaient deux grandes bouteilles d'eau plate ou pétillante, ainsi que des fruits frais. Les chambres sont de bonne taille et très confortables. Les salles de bain sont vraiment très agréables et méritent d'être mentionnés : vastes, très bien équipées, belles, la baignoire est immense et la douche très confortable. La déco est vraiment très réussie et les serviettes de toilette sont très généreusement disposées à plusieurs endroits de la salle de bain, afin d'être toujours à portée de main. Le soir, des petites bouteilles d'eau et un macaron Ladurée sont déposés sur les tables de chevet. Le petit déjeuner est bon, il est servi dans le restaurant (qu'il faut essayer car c'est une des adresses du moment à NYC). J'aurais aimé un thé moins infusé et plus largement servi. De même, le petit déjeuner continental est un peu décevant car il n'y a pas de pain grillé et la baguette annoncée est un tout petit pain. Le granola maison en revanche, servi avec des fruits rouges très frais et généreux, est tout simplement fabuleux et beaucoup plus local!
Belle adresse, situation idéale près du Park et des musées. A recommander.

title: The Mark almost hits it
text: Great renovation in UES NYC euro-attitude hotel.  Fashion week and Valentines Day stretched staff to the breaking point.  40 minute wait for car, jammed street and indifferent Concierge on Sunday morning (wow, she gets paid to be that way?  Is Don Rickles looking for a job?).  BUT many staff members were simply lovely and made the extra step to serve us and other people.  We truly enjoyed ourselves and overlooked the mayhem due to one of their busiest weekends.  Bathroom was solid and we had a great sleep.  We will absolutely come back on another weekend and be sure not to use the Concierge.

title: Perfect!
text:
We have been going to New York frequently lately and just love the city.  We stayed at the Mark this time and absolutely loved it. 
The room was fantastic and the bathroom outstanding.  The water pressure in the shower could not have been better. 
We ordered food up in the room the first night and it was amazing.  We ate in the restaurant the night after and again a great meal. 

I must say I was overly pleased with The Mark.  

I will probably be my hotel of choice for a long while. 

Julie

title: Elegance and comfort in NYC
text: This has to be my top choice for a New York hotel. I had a suite, I love hotels built with noble materials. THis is one of them. The location is great it is a part of the upper east side that is the most desirable. Nothing to look out for just wonderful.

title: Luxury Hotel for Excellent Price
text: This was our third stay at The Mark. This hotel keeps drawing us to return with accommodations that are luxurious but at a cost that is not. The service of all the staff is outstanding. The neighborhood is a combination of residential and shops/restaurants.  We love the bathroom and the shower is excellent. One block from Central Park.  We think that this hotel should rank as the best luxury hotel in NYC with a boutique feel. Highly recommend The Mark.

title: My Feedback
text: I am just on my last day at this very nice hotel. The service is good (what is expected in NYC). The rooms are very nice and have the latest gadgets to keep you occupied. The bathroom is very nice (very good shower). The bed is comfortable and large. My wife has one complaint, there is know where to sit and do her hair and makeup (common problem in hotel rooms apparently). We had breakfast included and the service and food was excellent. Although we've only made it down once. Some good shops close by and a very nice deli on 77th and Lexington. Central Park is very close but it's too cold to venture in there. Overall a very pleasant stay in a very nice hotel.

title: The Best
text:
Very elegant interior. Peaceful setting close to Central Park in a primarily residential area of the UES.

The Hotel has a very old school feel--without feeling dated or pretentious. 

I stayed here for a weekend, and will definitely be coming back.

title: Disappointing
text:
Don't get me wrong, this hotel is very nice. However, it's expensive for what it is and the service is...superficial...

The rooms are lovely - the bathroom is particularly nice. The quality of the toiletries/toilet paper (!) is poor. 

Bed and bedding is very nice.

We ordered room service on one night and it was prompt and delicious. We could've done without the opened and used jar of mustard that came with the other condiments, but hey, mistakes happen. $75 for 2 x burgers with fries is pretty pricey, even by our standards!

We had an unfortunate experience with an extremely disrespectful neighbour (smoking, playing loud music). It disrupted half our stay (evening/nights especially). We got several apologies but nothing was done in terms of offering to relocate us so we basically just had to put up with it.

We also had a couple of small issues with the room but we would have overlooked these on their own.

I complained about the bill when we were leaving and I was promptly contacted by the front office supervisor who offered to adjust our total bill by approx 15%. I also responded to the feedback request and was promptly contacted by the General Manager with more apologies and the offer of a free night - not great as we live in the UK but I understand the gesture. I responded to both of these people and thus far, neither have graced me with a reply. They have promptly charged my card though! I suppose I shouldn't have expected more but they SAY they stand apart from the rest...they do, but not in a good way. 

So, yes, overall, disappointing. (I guess it had to happen at some point - we stayed in over a dozen hotels all over the world last year and didn't have any problems.)

title: Disappointing Service
text:
First I will say that my review is not related to a stay at the hotel.  I live in the neighborhood and stopped in for a drink with some friends during the big "blizzard" the other night.  The bartender was not at all friendly and promptly informed us that the bar was closing early due to the storm.  

Though the bar was nearly empty he seemed too busy to give me the water I requested several times, and it was a major chore to provide us with the nuts they typically serve with your drinks.  What really upset me was that a hotel guest came in and the bartender refused to serve him, saying that if he wanted a drink he could order room service.  The man came back in a few minutes later and tried to reason with the bartender, to no avail.  My friends and I were horrified that a hotel of The Mark's reputation for service would treat a guest that way.  I understand the City was shutting down and public transportation closing, but arrangements should have been made by the hotel to keep the bar open for guests who had limited other options.  Sincere New York apologies to the unknown guest.  If we had met you at the bar we would have brought you along to some other neighborhood establishments that managed to stay open and provide great service!

title: The true essence on New Yoirk City's upper East side
text:
We stayed during Christmas and New Years. 
The hotel is fantastic!
The rooms are classic and finely remodeled
The Bar is truly spectacular 
The restaurant is without a doubt. World class. 
Best place to stay while in New York!!

title: Simply the Best Small Hotel in Manhattan
text: This was our first visit to the MARK since its renovation, and we were delighted! The distinctively inviting lobby and unequaled service remain. The infrastructure and rooms have been substantially rebuilt with a marked increase in comfort, amenities, and quiet. The Mark has a great location - an easy walk to Central Park and the Metropolitan Museum of Art and some world class restaurants like Boulud and the MARK's great little bar. And it is an easy cab ride to the rest of Manhattan. The buzz and the lights of NYC are within easy reach while the MARK is a quiet, calming retreat.

title: Divine little gem a few steps from Central Park
text: I loved this wonderful hotel! The rooms are beautiful, the food we ordered up was absolutely sublime and the cherry on the top was the most fantastic strong shower I have ever had anywhere ! Morning runs were great as Central Park was a few steps away. Nothing is too much trouble . A Nespresso machine complete with a stash of pods sent up to my room, cookies and milk left in my kids room- everything was just perfect! The only flaw was a lack of a shower door in my kids room which left a very wet floor but the kind letter from the manager assuring me that we would not get this room when we visit again made up for that! GO TO THE MARK!!!!!

title: NYC at its very best
text:
All I can say is "wow".  Wow to the food!  Wow to the service! (Our server shake was the best ever) Wow to the ambiance.  wow to the prices! (But worth it).  We walked away at $160 per person.  Be carful about what they do with the tip suggestion check box for credit card users.  As has been previously mentioned the shrimp and avocado salad was stupendous. ($28) The pizza with tuna and or salmon was delicious.  The pastas were as well done as any fine Italian restraunt.   My pesto and brussel sprout was just a bit disappointing.  If u want to mingle with recognizable faces and dress up is fun.  This is a must see in the upper east side.

As in any very fine eating establishment, be prepared to wait a good deal of time in between steps of service.  Our total dinning time was not short of 3 hours.

title: Recuperating from surgery
text: This hotel is gem.  Stayed here to recuperate 2 days from a surgery, and staff, room service & housekeeping discreet, courteous & efficient.  Can't wait to return.. Room service food impeccably delicious.

title: Great location, and equally great staff.
text: This past break my family and I stayed at the mark hotel. Prior to our stay we were throughly impressed by the concierge. They helped to plan things to do, restaurant reservations, and took great care of us once we got there. The restaurant is fabulous, and the rooms are very clean and well furnished. I will book here again when I travel to New York.

title: A very chic experience.
text: Loved the interior! Loved the room! Loved the bathroom! Loved the service! Loved the staff! Loved the location! Loved the Bar! Loved the Restaurant! Loved! Loved! Loved! Loved everything about my stay! I highly recommend it!

title: Excelente hotel!
text: Estive neste hotel com minha esposa em 2014. Hotel com excelente localização. Staff atencioso e prestativo. Academia boa. Limpeza impecável. Vista do quarto para rua, nada demais. Tudo funcionando bem. Não tive nenhum problema, recomendo e voltaria a me hospedar.

title: Stopped in for some drinks
text: My wife and I were up near The Mark and had some time to spare before dinner so we stopped in for a few drinks.  The bar upfont is nice and cozy and the drinks are really good.  Service is great and we found the place to be quite relaxing for a hotel bar.

title: Amazing
text: This hotel is amazing! The location is great, the food is amazing. The only thing is that it is very pricey. For breakfast I would suggest going 2 blocks down to 3 guys. It's half the price but still amazing!

title: A true boutique hotel in the heart of New York
text:
The hotel entrance is colour coded with black and white marble tiles carefully inlayed. The rooms were small but had a comparatively large bathroom.  The room had a kettle.  Not much a view from our window.
It is a truly luxurious hotel in the heart of the big apple. Would happily return.

title: Luxury in the Details: The Mark gets it right!
text: It's so nice to stay in a hotel and feel immediately like you are at home. I just stayed at The Mark on the Upper East Side (great location on 77th between 5th and Madison). It was my first visit, and what I loved most about it was that it had great style and attention to detail. It's not often anymore than you find hotels with true personality. It's like Paris in the 30's, contemporary chic and a buzzing atmosphere. Had a delicious Brunch at the Jean-Georges restaurant (don't miss the famous Truffle Pizza.) It was full of locals from the neighborhood and menu was excellent and not fussy. My corner room on the was bright and airy, great closet space and nice bathroom. A big plus was complimentary wifi. I love to work out when traveling and for a hotel this boutique size, it has a really great gym. Lots of equipment and not just an "exercise room" like you'd find in other hotels. This is was a full gym and they also had a Frederic Fekkai hair salon. There is a fabulous little Mark Bar where in the morning where you can grab a coffee and a bagel and relax without having to go to the main dining room if you just wanted something light. In the evening, it seemed to be a popular spot for cocktails. I loved the Cocoa Kiosk during the winter - guests can have complimentary hot chocolate throughout the day and homemade cookies - I went back several times. The staff always knew my name and everyone seemed to truly enjoy working at the hotel. The GM Olivier has done a great job in managing this wonderful hotel. I will be back.

title: Weekend at The Mark
text: Excellent location, terrific staff, extremely comfortable bed, luxurious tub, incredible shower, spacious room, unusual and interesting mini-bar selections. Over-priced restaurant and bar, but that's what you can expect on the Upper East Side. I'll definitely stay here again...

title: Eccellente
text:
Stupendo! Sarà il mio 'forever' Hotel in NY
Posizione strategica: puoi raggiungere a piedi molte delle mete interessanti.  Ben arredato, bagni molto confortevoli SPA deliziosa
Ristorante eccellente, personale preparato
Tutto perfetto, tranne i portieri!! Piuttosto assenti e le porte sono scomodissime, ma è proprio l'unica pecca
Per il resto, di tanti hotel super stellati di NY , questo è il mio preferito

title: Wonderful Experience
text: The reviews are true. The hotel staff could not have been nicer. Everything from making the reservation, to having an early check-in, to having a crib in the room on arrival was flawless.  The upgraded room was much appreciated. The room was well appointed and spacious for New York. The location was perfect for access to the museums, park, and upper East side.  Wish we could have stayed longer. And unfortunately due to family commitments, we did not eat in the restaurant. We will definitely go back.

title: Hotel wonderful! Restaurant service disappointing
text: I stayed at The Mark for five nights last week. The hotel is beautifully appointed,the rooms comfortable,the bathroom stunning and the staff pleasant and helpful. Although the location was further uptown than I have always stayed,taxis were quite easy to hail and the walks to surrounding landmarks and shopping enjoyable. The only disappointing experience was on Saturday evening when I decided on a late lunch/early dinner in the restaurant. I had looked forward to the event,given the supposed reputation and affiliation,however I was immediately identified by the youthful,blonde haired hostess as being older and alone - hence once again,relegation to the farthest seat,although there was only one other party of three ding at the time. The gentleman server was delightful.I ordered the chicken sandwich on ciabatta - the bread was so heavily toasted it was totally inedible - I returned almost the whole thing and notice that two of the other lady diners did the same thing. I mentioned my disappointment to a lady server who was ambivalent but said she'd let the chef know - and then when I ordered the Butterscotch  pudding signature dish she delivered it saying 'this should be softer for your teeth'!!  Perhaps some staff training would not go stray.

title: Nice Upper East Side Hotel
text: I cannot give this hotel five stars due to the small size of the room. The bathroom was very large; however, the actual room was much too small for a five star hotel room. There was also a hair in the tub. Other than those two flaws, the hotel staff and the other aspects of the accomodations were fine. The bathroom had heated towel bars and a heated floor. The tub and shower were separate. The bed was very comfortable. The Mark Restaurant was quite good and the hotel's clientele was extremely upscale. If you can book a suite, this hotel would probably be fine. The house car took me to my business meeting and all of the staff were extremely polite and professional. Staying there for any length of time in such a tiny room would be depressing.

title: Awesome
text:
Probably the best hotel in nyc. Great service and lovely place. Top bar too with excellent cocktails if that's what you fancy
Located upper east side which is ideal and near park.
Superbly attentive staff and well presented rooms make it such a great place.

title: Our Home Away From Home!!!
text:
The Mark Hotel, on the Upper East Side of NYC, is our family's "home away from home!" While traveling with two young children is not easy, the Mark makes it a very pleasant and memorable experience for all.
My husband and I began staying at the Mark initially for our business travel, and enjoyed the hotel for its sophisticated decor and impeccable attention to detail.  Having traveled and enjoyed luxurious hotels around the world, the Mark is at the top of our list, and we would not dream of staying anywhere else during our trips to the City.  The Mark Bar, as well as the Restaurant by Jean Georges are excellent places to entertain friends and clients.  Cafe Carlyle, which offers a unique and intimate cabaret experience is across the street.
Our strong appreciation for this gem of a hotel only deepened once our children were old enough to travel.  From the moment we arrive, our girls are warmly greeted by name, and they love catching up with everyone in the lobby.  While one would not necessarily think that such an urban and sophisticated hotel would cater to young children, they certainly do--from the duckies for the tub to step stools, and comfortable roll-away beds.  The location simply can't be beat!  The hotel is located steps (or a short stroller ride) away from Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Whitney, and some of the best restaurants in the City.  
In fact, you don't have to go very far to visit one such restaurant, as  the Mark Restaurant by Jean Georges is located inside the hotel.  It is, by far, one of our family's favorites, and we try to eat there at least once during our stay.  The Basil-Pistachio Pesto Angel Hair is our daughters' favorite.
To be able to travel with children without sacrificing luxury, comfort and convenience is a gift, and we are so grateful to the Mark for this gift!  We look forward to our next visit with the Mark as soon as our cab pulls away from the curb . . .

title: The MARK Cocktail
text: With a cocktail of a Fabulous General Manager, the Finest Chef Concierge in the United States and brilliant Guest Relations you have the Wonderful Mark Hotel. Their efforts to make guests feel very special are an example to every Hotel, and i cannot recommend the Mark highly enough.

title: Disappointing
text: I personally did not like the interior and found it a bit .. Confused. Which isn't a huge part of a hotel experience (albeit still a part) but it was the service which is ridiculous. We waited more than an hour just for our luggages to be brought up to our room. Our rooms btw were also nothing special and really did not warrant such a high price nor the 5 star label

title: Excellent
text: Excellent modern style hotel. very comfortable very nice sedated and the Central Park and fifth Avenue beautiful rooms and excellent service very recommendable for business or pleasure visit to New York on my point of wiew one of the best places in town. Recommend

title: Show
text: Um hotel que não deixa a desejar. No que se refere a conforto foi maravilhoso, com certeza vc não vai se decepcionar. É bem localizado. Possui refeições maravilhosas, magníficas. Recomendo com empenho pra quem for a Nova Iorque.

title: The Best Hotel in NYC.
text: I've stayed at them all,  Four Seasons, St. Regis, Mandarin Oriental, The Carlyle and hands down The Mark wins for always getting it right. They give you fantastic personal service and take care of all your needs. The rooms are modern and functional with tons of closet space and nice amenities. I just know when I go to these other hotels that something is probably going to go wrong due to untrained staff or so-so service. Does not happen at The Mark. Also a great location on the Upper East side. NYC Hotel Bliss

title: A good one!
text: Large, comfortable rooms in Art Deco style, like the rest of the hotel. Wonderful technology, and lots of fun gadgets in the rooms. Very good food, both in the restaurant and from room-service. Great service, plenty of little pampering touches( eg: macaroons on the pillow with turndown service). Perfect location in the best part of Madison Avenue for restaurants, cafes, great boutiques, not to mention the Metropolitan Museum and the Frick collection on your doorstep, without the major traffic jams and crowds of mid or downtown. The bar is a very trendy, people-watching one, can be a bit noisy for hotel guests, but all in all, the Mark is a place to recommend thoroughly.

title: The best.
text: This is by far the best hotel of my life, with the best hotel restaurant of my life; and I have stayed in many hotels throughout the world over many years. The shower alone is worth at least one night splurge. :) And it is basically across the street from Central Park for the best jogs and strolls ever and along what has to be the best row of art museums in the world.

title: Люкс бутик-отель в 5ти мин от Парка
text: Это был мой первый визит в Нью-Йорк. Очень удобное распрложение отеля не сравнится ни с чем. 5 минут ходьбы от центрального парка. Рядом музей Гугенхайма и исторически музей. Лучшие рестораны рядом с отелем ( советую настоятельно заглянуть в Сан амброш это маленькая кафешка налево от отеля). В самом отеле чудесные завтраки. Сами номера немного маловаты, но чудесно уютные. Минусом для меня стало отсуттвие вида из окна. Отель принимает с животными. Останавливалась там со своим щенком. Нам даже в номер принесли для него коврик и тарелки. Отличная консьерж служба в отеле. Бар отеля на первом этаже весьма популярное место для тусовок и встреч с друзьями. Не зря именно этот отель выбрала для себя Мира Дума на время недели моды. Всем советую отель ( особенно для любителей маленьких уютных бутиков отелей).

title: On The Mark
text:
Tres Chic and impressively expensive this is a great NYC hotel.  Check in was smooth--no tickets for the bags and no ticket for the car.  Everything seemless and smooth.  The hotel lobby is impressive in a boutique hotel type way and check in was quick and efficent.  We were taken to a room on the second floor but we decided to wait a few hours for a 7th floor room to become available.  The King Madison Avenue room was impressive featuring one of the nicest most powerful showers I have ever experiened.  And while I am not a fan of technology for technology sake, the system worked ok and we could control the TV, lights and temperature from one device.  The TV had to be rebooted once but no big deal.  Nicely appointed with a comfortable bed.  No views to speak of unfortunately.

The bar was beautiful and friendly (all the service was top notch) and we could have a quick late breakfast of cappucino and pastries. Otherwise breakfast was in the Jean Georges which was fine.  The dinner was spectacular--great food and very friendly accommodating service.

The area is great--we ate in Cafe Boulud one night and some trendy Italian place next door for lunch.  Great museums and shops and much better than midtown.

So a great weekend splurge and a welcome addition to my favorite NYC hotels.

title: Отличный отель и вкуснейший ресторан!
text: Отличный дизайнерский отель с сумашедшим холом в чёрнобелую полоску. Просторные номера, бесплатный Wi Fi.  Вкуснейший ресторан с крутой тусовкой. Мясные блюда - шикарные! Лучший бургер в моей жизни! Заказывайте заранее!

title: Chic boutique style hotel in great location
text: I'm not surprised that the Mark rates so highly on this website.  It is superbly located on the chic Upper East Side just a block from Central Park but a world away from the madness on the Central Park south east corner beside the Plaza.  It definitely can be described as boutique and it oozes style.  The continental breakfast in the bar area was a nice touch and the museums, shopping and restaurant delights of the upper East Side were all within walking distance.  The rooms could be described as a little "cold" in terms of decor, but that's just my personal taste (and being "picky").  I loved our stay, but most of all I loved the staff.  Their warmth and service was first class.  A big "Thank you" to all.  We used to stay at the Four Seasons or the St Regis.  We have a nice new choice away from the maddening crowds.  We will be back.

title: Great hotel, nice rooms and pleasant staff
text:
This luxury hotel in located in a nice position, is near restaurants and shops and is next door to Central Park. I enjoyed taking the bikes the hotel offer free of charge out for a ride around the City. 

The Hotel has a boutique feel to it as its not a huge size, it has nice decor throughout, rooms are lovely and clean, really good size (for a couple), nice comfortable bed, TV, good bathroom with excellent shower and the staff are really nice and accommodating. 
Free wi-fi in rooms (limited but generous)
The Bar is very popular in the evenings. Although we didn't eat at the restaurant it has a very good reputation, I will next time for sure. 
I found the hotel peaceful and relaxing. The room we had was on the 7th floor and was nice and quiet. 

Look forward to my next visit soon.

title: Great Marks for The Mark
text: My mom wanted to return to The Mark after a memorable stay two years ago. but wasn't sure I'd like it. "The  rooms are kind of small," she cautioned. Needless to say, the Sunday we arrived I knew right away that I'd never stay in another hotel but this one, at least on the Upper East Side. So chic, so clean, so Impossibly Parisian. The hood can't be beat if you are consummate shoppers as we are and the hotel restaurant has the best menu I've seen in years along with a festive dining room where upscale families were partaking in their ritual Sunday dinner. We had two Madison kings across the hall from one another with a private entrance for both. The space wasn't huge but ample and very efficient in European decor and fixtures. The bathroom had a double sink which I shared with my fella and was luxurious with generous storage for longer stays. Good marks as well on the bedding, sexy mini bar and espresso maker brought in by request. Even better is waking  to  coffee and pastries around the corner at San Ambreuse cafe - one of the best Italian haunts around for bfast lunch or dinner  after the theater.  The Mark also serves up good breakfast in the dining room and we enjoyed yogurt and fresh fruit one morning and delicious soy lattes. Dinner was even better with salmon roasted to perfection and beet salad. The bar is hopping most nights and very swank. It's walking distance to the Carlyle where woody Alan and his New Orleans band was performing to a sold out  crowd and rumor has it he also frequents The Mark.  I will be returning and we did get good rates on Hotel.com and since rates fluctuate you can monitor them before locking in. Love that Grange did the design as I've been a devotee for years. Also we had a bellman named Tucker who really went the extra mile to help us with bags and flag down rides.

title: Hospitality in style
text: We stayed at the Mark twelve nights this September and can safely say that our stay was excellent. The location is perfect for shopping, walking in Central Park, visiting the Museums, walking to many very good restaurants and at the same time it is as quite as it should be for a nice sleep at night (even the rooms overlooking Madison Avenue).  The hotel decor is beautiful, modern, elegant but also warm, comfortable and very clean. The staff at every post was perfect,  polite, helpful and as friendly as it should be. Our special thanks to Isabelle and Jackie at the consierge desk that helped make our stay in New York memorable. Dinning at the hotel restaurant was also a very good experience and I would recommend it to anyone visiting the city.  We shall definately  visit the Mark again.

title: Perfect option
text:
A small luxury hotel with a courteous staff located a few steps of the Central Park.
The room located in the third floor at Madison was a bit noisy but spacious and with the best shower I have had.
A very good bar and restaurant.

title: The Mark Hits The Mark!!
text: We had not been back to NYC since The Mark underwent extensive remodeling a few years ago. Bravo!! Clean, elegant, modernized without losing any of the small-hotel feeling. Extremely courteous staff at all levels and attentive service makes this an upper east side oasis in a very hustle-bustle city. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Services, i.e., restaurant, are elegant. Would definitely return next visit.

title: Perfect
text: The service was excellent and the room was well appointed. Although we were just in New York for one night, I could definitely stay a week at this hotel and feel very comfortable. We were upgraded upon an early morning arrival which we greatly appreciated.

title: Tudo bem, menos o ar condicionado!
text:
Gostei muito da minha estada neste hotel. Escolhi-o pela localização pois está na mille museum e também numa ótima zona comercial e perto do central park.
O serviço e o ambiente são o que se espera do seu nível. O bar, logo à entrada, era sempre animadíssimo, com hóspedes e nova iorquinos animados.
O único defeito era o frio, sobretudo ao pequeno almoço. Até o pessoal se solidarizava connosco, mas parece que são "normas"...

title: Beautiful Aesthetically staff need retraining
text:
The Mark is a glorious hotel, it's design and facilities are wonderful. The details in every aspect of the design are a real delight and reflect the vicinity perfectly.

The devil is indeed in the detail as it is a huge shame that the hotel is let down by gross inconsistencies in staff behaviour towards clientele.

We were met with some exceptional hotel service, and some that could have been an offshoot of a better dressed fast food restaurant.

When asked with an enquiry close to reception, the staff threw comments over to the concierge rather than walking the guests there. Comments were then hurled back in a dismissive manner and suggestions not written down.
Very unusual, lets say for a 5 star establishment.

Many of the staff do not go out of their way, nor even appear remoyely hospitable or interested. Staff worked most effectively when often told exactly what to do. If this a part of the Marks in house style, it certainly needs to be addressed as service is the crux of a good hotel.

We met some truely professional reception staff, bell boys and reateraunt staff. 

The Mark would be exceptional if these issues regarding staff behaviour were standardised and addressed appropriately.

One could look to the Penninsula for some tips regarding all of the above.

The Mark could well be a cut above the rest one day.

title: One of the best holidays I have had!
text: I had heard a lot about The Mark from my colleagues and friends in London and it came highly recommended from the London hotel industry. It was definitely on the top of my list. I arrived Friday morning and received a very warm welcome. I was very early and was assured they would call me once my room was ready. The staff was super helpful in storing my luggage. Above all, what I loved was the attitude of the staff including the Assistant Hotel Manager who recommended an awesome breakfast place next door. I stayed in the Seventy Seven Kings Room, extremely spacious, uber luxurious and the level of comfort is astounding! I would compare The Mark to some of the best hotels in London matching their level of service, taking in to consideration requirements of guests. James in the reception team was super helpful and even extended my check out time for my convenience. I couldn't have asked for more! This is definitely the epitome of luxury off Madison Avenue.

title: Great Hotel
