text: I spent just one night at the hotel and my experience was awesome, so next time I hope I  can stay longer. The hotel is quite small making one feel at home away from home. The bellmen were readily available and ushered us in, and brought our luggage straight up. No fuss during check-in and we were given a late check out which was most appreciated since we had a long flight ahead of us that night. The hotel has been renovated and the room was very comfortable. The beds and the bathroom were outstanding. Also of notice that even though we left our room for dinner quite late ( around 8 pm) we still had our turndown service. We enjoyed the neighborhood ( many nice shops on Madison and great restaurants), and the Whitney Museum too. Overall, very pleased!

title: my favorite hotel in NYC
text:
I stayed at the mark for 3 nights in August with my wife and kids (9 and 6). I have been at the mark several times and I genuinely believe that it is one of the best choices if you like staying in the upper east side of the city.
breakfast is gorgeous (best scones ever and coffee is ok also for our Italian standards). service is really good. great bathroom all made of white marble

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text:
We just returned from a 5 night - 4 day stay in NYC and chose the Mark mostly based on TA reviews. 

Here are the Pros: 
*Location - right next to Central park, Madison and Park Avenue. CP is not even an entire block away. 
*The value for the room was excellent considering the location and square footage. 
*Very quiet for NYC - we were not disturbed at all, in fact it was almost eerily quiet compared to some places where the incessant honking will drive you up a tree.
*Large rooms, huge bathrooms by NYC standards, double sinks, marble everywhere.
*Very modern and sleek design. I understand it was recently remodeled - they did a beautiful job
*Intense water pressure from shower and tub - loved it! 
*Fully stocked mini bar (although shockingly pricey, even for a mini bar)
*Friendly and helpful staff
*Tons of closet space (in the Seventy-Seven king room)

The only cons are as follows: There were several large stains on the carpet, I mean really large stains that (I would think) in a hotel of this caliber would warrant the carpet being replaced, and the closet has 2 shelves that are resting rather precariously on screws over the closet hanger rail that both fell on me when I was hanging up my clothes. The may want to consider securing those shelves since I nearly broke my hand when they came crashing down. Thanks to my cat-like reflexes (ha) I was able to dodge them but someone else may not be so lucky.

Overall this is a lovely hotel and I'd definitely recommend a visit. No complaints other than the tiny details above and neither of them detracted from the enjoyment of our stay at all.

title: A wonderful experience
text: This is a beautiful hotel which oozes quality and attention to detail. The rooms are comfortable and superbly fitted out and we loved our 3 nights here exploring New York. It is a 15 minute taxi ride to downtown however we felt we had escaped to a calm oasis when we returned.

title: Great hotel but terrible restaurant
text: My wife and I celebrated her birthday one weekend in June. We had a very nice room with a view. The hotel is on a quiet street just a block from Central Park. We found the desk staff to be very friendly and efficient. We worked with the concierge staff prior to our arrival to secure restaurant reservations and in the end found them to be helpful, but there seemed to be lack of communication among them. The main negative was the hotel restaurant. At lunch, our appetizer and main course arrived at the same time, followed later by our beverages! Both mornings at breakfast, the wait staff seemed unprepared and untrained.

title: Love the attention to details
text:
This is a lovely hotel and I'm so glad I decided to try it out. We requested an early check in as our flight got in at 9 am. They arranged it without any fuss at all! I loved that.

The rooms are so tastefully done up. Large bathrooms with marble flooring, and spacious rooms with very comfy beds. The rooms are really big for NYC!

They also had vintage bicycles at the entrance that guests could take for a ride. We decided to try them out and had a wonderful day cycling around central park and the UES. 

We needed to meet friends for brunch and the hotel restaurant The Mark by Jean George was a clear choice. Fantastic food and equally great service!

Highly recommended!

The only downside would be that the area is pretty dull at night, but for a jetlagged couple going to bed by 9 :30 pm that wasn't an issue.

title: Great Hotel. A bit pricey but it is in Manhattan
text: We stayed here for 5 days. It's not as expensive as the The Surry or Carlyle but certainly the same standard and location. It's very new, modern and trendy and very clean. Room size was excellent, we stayed in room 701 which was a courtyard room which I believe are slightly larger but lack a view. Staff are very friendly and knowledgable. They have complimentary bikes to hire too. The bar is very open and welcoming but very pricey if you like your wine like we do. But you pay for what you get, great service, friendly and excellent location.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: I was very happy staying in this lovely hotel in a great location. The rooms are large and very comfortable. I travel a lot and this hotel had more drawer and closet space than most of the other hotels I have stayed in. The service is impeccable and the hotel is very lovely. Beautiful furnishings and very clean.    Jean Georges restaurant on the premises. This is a definite return trip for me.

title: Stylish, chic and fabulous!
text:
We stayed at the Mark for a week+ when we moved back to New York.  The hotel is very conveniently located (and it was in our old neighborhood, bonus) half a block from Central Park and a couple of blocks from the 77th St 6 subway stop.  We stayed there for the location, reputation and the fact that they are very pet friendly.

Our room was lovely and had plenty of closet space so even with our many suitcases and bags, it wasn't cramped.  Bed was super comfy and the room had a seriously fabulous bathroom.  That is one feature in some hotels that gets overlooked but ours was not only spacious with two sinks, a soaking tub, stand up shower, etc. but it was impeccably designed and really beautiful.  Very high tech features to speak of, including a remote control that controls the entire space.

Our dog arrived a few days after us and was treated like an A list celeb.  We've stayed in a few hotels that allow you to bring your dog.  Some just tolerate your dog and others will roll out the red carpet for your dog.  The Mark really rolled out the red carpet - he got bowls, a placement and even a doggie bed that matched the decor!  The staff always petted him and had treats and even offered to walk him if we were going to be out for awhile.

Speaking of the staff, they were really first rate.  Super accommodating, super helpful and really kind.  From the bar to the front desk to the door staff to the housekeeping staff, just all really sweet and lovely.  They even helpfully stored our dog's giant travel crate until we left.  We had to stay a few extra days because our apartment wasn't ready and even though the hotel was nearly overflowing, they managed to accommodate us which we really appreciated.

What a great way to come home!  Can not recommend it more.

title: Great
text: my family and I when to stay a week in New york it was great. The hotel had a great restaurant and the rooms are very confertable and the bathroom  is a great size. The room service was also great. The hotel is next to central parnk and the 5th Avenue and its location is also great!

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text: The Mark was excellent.  The staff is very courteous and helpful, exceedingly polite but not at all stuffy. We were happily surprised when they upgraded our room. Nice linens, lovely bathroom, very clean, all the amenities one might want. The location is fabulous - just a couple of short blocks to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The area has good shopping and some nice restaurants. We would return.

title: Very hard to fault.
text: My wife and I just spent four excellent nights at The Mark in a Madison King for my wife's birthday. It's a fabulous hotel and covers off pretty much every conceivable detail you can think of. We didn't get to use the bikes and cruise Central Park with a Jean-George's picnic, but would have loved to. Highly recommended.

title: Great Hotel
text: My husband and I just had our second stay at The Mark.  The hotel is still as great as ever.  The first room we checked in to was very small and not the type of room we thought we had booked so we asked to move rooms.  By the end of the day we were moved to a larger room.  The room was bright and had lots of storage.  The rooms are spotless and the bedding is luxurious. THe concierge provided excellent service.  The gym was perfect.  We ate at the restaurant for Sunday brunch and the food is excellent.  The location of the hotel is ideal for walking/running through Central Park, museums, shopping and restaurants.  We won't be staying anywhere else.

title: Superlativo!
text: Hotel que faz jus aos títulos que recebe e ao preço, um verdadeiro 5 estrelas, fino, elegante, tradicional, gastronomia de alta qualidade, quartos luxuosos (o quarto básico é pequeno, mas a suíte é ideal), atendimento impecável, localização ideal - perto de tudo e em bairro nobre, residencial, da cidade.

title: as close to perfect as you can get in NYC
text: I finally tried the Mark, thanks to the insistence of my friends. I have never found a hotel in NYC which i enjoyed, as opposed to other cities in the world - it seems NYC always has problems of some sort when it comes to finding Quality and Faultless hotels. I have stayed at almost every 5 star hotel in NYC including St Regis, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, Ritz Carlton, the Quin, etc. The Mark easily outdoes them all hands down, and is as close to perfect as you can get in terms of service, luxury, and quality. There is no better hotel in New York, and the location was beyond superb and incredible. Hard to find a fault here, with the exception of the restaurant's staff during breakfast. they were terribly slow, taking over 20 mins to get us a cup of coffee, and messed up orders bringing wrong items, and also forgetting to bring some items we had ordered. Other than the experience at breakfast, we are extremely picky travelers, and there is nowhere else I would stay in New York City. Don't even hesitate for a second to think about booking.

title: Outstanding hotel
text: I have stayed in many of the finest hotels around the world and in NYC and The Mark ranks among the very best. Excellent service, very helpful and friendly staff, lovely room-- in short, everything was top-notch. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Really good, prepare to pay for quality !
text: Will stay again, great location and excellent service, very, very helpful even picked my shopping and orginised new trainers for my son!!! You could walk everywhere or take a taxi. did feel like I was on holiday in a middle of NYC!

title: surfait
text:
bel emplacement près de Central Park, hôtel très confortable, de belles chambres bien équipées avec de grandes salles de bain.
Le petit déjeuner est très cher et moyen, pas de buffet mais un service à l'assiette: bof.
Le restaurant, ils se prétendent un des meilleurs de NewYork mais là encore rien de vraiment exceptionnel.
Le personnel est très pro, sympa et le concierge efficace.
Il y a aussi bien pour moins cher à New York

title: This is a wonderful Five Star Hotel
text: I am a bicoastal plastic surgeon who travels between Southern CA to NYC once a month for work and pleasure. I have stayed in most of the nice hotels in NYC. The Mark hotels definitely ranks as one of the best. The staff is attentive and in-tuned to your needs. The rooms are a nice size and well appointed. The proximity to Central Park is wonderful. The hotel is also dog friendly which is incredible. (Since our dog Sammy always travels with us). I have started recommending this hotel to all my friends traveling to NYC.

title: Home Away From Home
text: When you move out of the upper east side of Manhattan and move across the country you know whenever you return you should stay at The Mark.  The location is just perfect.  You are near  Central Park, just blocks from the Met, and wonderful shopping on Madison.  It is quieter than mid-town, the staff could not be more accommodating and Sant Ambroeus is just around the corner.

title: Legendary New York Experience
text: Everything I could dream for a legendary New York staycation. Elegance, decadence and comfort in the ultimate location.  Personal attention of John L made the experience unforgettable. Hotel has a European styling but New York soul. Dining and service are standouts.

title: Excellent service, just one small complaint
text:
I stayed her for two nights on a quick trip to NY and found the service excellent. For example: I checked out at 10am and spent a hot day walking around and came back for a 5pm limo to the airport; the staff offered me a room for 15-30 mins so that I could change clothes before heading out. The concierge was knowledgeable, pleasant and effective. My room, a larger 500sq foot room toward 77th street, was nicely appointed, with high end finishing. Very good room category.  
The one small thing that I annoyed me: when I had breakfast with my daughter, they automatically added 20% tip to the check, perhaps believing we were international tourists, which we are not. It's a harassing tipping policy not worthy of such a luxury hotel. As I said, a small issue that I hope the manager will instruct the staff to abolish.

title: Exceptional NYC Hotel
text: I spent two nights at The Mark and was extremely impressed by the quality of the staff and of the room.  The room was not large, but was perfectly laid out.  Particularly notable was the bathroom.  In a relatively small space, they were able to fit a double vanity, a large bathtub and a separate, large, shower. The hotel was full, but there was no sense that anyone was overworked or stressed. Everyone was polite and helpful. If you want to stay on the Upper East Side, The Mark is a great choice.

title: Прекрасно!
text:
Ездили в Нью-Йорк этой зимой (в конце января)-лютый мороз, да еще и мало снега (ну, лишь в центральном парке). Мы остановились в отеле The Mark. Приехали заселяться уже вечером (в России была глубокая ночь), устлавшие после длительного перелета. На ресепшене нас быстро обслужили и подняли наши чемоданы к нам в номер на 6 этаж. 
В номере был длинный коридор, две ванны (маленькая и большая), гостиная и большая спальня. 
Номер уютный, светлый и чистый. 
Большой мини-бар. 
Завтраки и обеды в ресторане на первом этаже шикарны. Через несколько дней нашего пребывания нас уже знали в лицо все швейцары, а так же официанты в ресторане. 
Прекрасное расположение отеля и много хороших магазинов поблизости. 
Спасибо вам!

title: Exceptional Hotel
text:
I first called to make my reservation at night (after hours) and was delightfully surprised when I spoke with Sean W. at The Mark Hotel.  He was very informative and pleasant to deal with.  When we arrived, we were greeted by bellmen (Dritan??) who too, seemed very professional.  We checked in at the front desk with Jane and again, were greeted in a professional, welcoming manner.  All of our contacts with hotel personnel were fantastic.  It appeared they very much enjoy what they do and seemed to make sure our stay was perfect, which it was!!!  
The room was extremely clean, spacious and the bed was very comfortable (bathrobes and slippers were provided).  One remote control for TV's, lighting, shades was very convenient.
Overall, a terrific, luxurious hotel with great staff. Located one block east of Central Park. 
Can't wait to go back!!!!!

title: Party at the Mark Hotel
text:
We hosted a cocktail party for the partnership for inner city education at the Mark Hotel 6/17
It was absolutely fabulous!! The Mark couldn't have been more accommodating and looked after every detail

title: Top marks for The Mark
text: I had booked The Mark based on feedback on Trip Advisor - mostly positive - and location. Sometimes I wonder if the people giving these reviews actually stayed there and I hope to set straight some of the myths - having been there all of last week. The first thing I want in a hotel is a quiet (very important in NYC) room, good air conditioning and it must be a pleasant environment too. The Mark ticks all the boxes - the beds are big comfotable and changed daily, the air conditioning is easily adjustable and very, very efficient, top quality fittings, stylish and more storage room that you could every use, with fantastic 'drawer style bar and freezer' with tons of ice on tap. These rooms are quiet, draw the blinds (electric) and the room is a perfect environment for uninterrupted sleep. The B&O TV system was being upgraded while we were there (it needed it) and it is now excellent with moving on tap and TV listings. The bathroom is beyond good, it is fantastic, the shower has everything you need and the bath is huge (you could float in it) and fills quickly, there is even TV built into the mirror above the sinks - all black and white marble and everything you could ever need. Room service is very quick, top quality and if I had one complaint more space round he table would be nice. Breakfast in the Mark is the best value there is, lovely dining room, impeccable service, coffee, fresh orange juice, cooked breakfast, toast etc all for $28 + tax and service ($24 for continental) you would not get anything half as good in the area, I know because I read the reviews that said it was too expensive - and I tried to get something of better value and failed miserably! This is the Upper East Side and value is rare here but for us The Mark delivered real quality at a fair price, convenient to Central Park, The Met, the Frink, The Guggenheim right on Madison Avenue for top end shops and galleries, great bar, great staff we had a fantastic stay. The Mark offered us an oasis every evening when we returned to have a refreshing G&T. The hotel is not perfect, there were small things that annoyed us - the main restaurant for dinner was just OK - concierge offered things at a price not solutions but we worked round them and it delivered us a great spot to base ourselves while in New York. It is not cheap but you remember the value long after you have forgotten the price.  The Mark made our stay in New York not only memorable but unforgettable - Thank You!

title: Unsurpassed 20th Anniversary Stay at The Mark
text: The Mark is an outstanding hotel for a special occasion in NYC.  The service and attention to detail were a delight.  We had the king room which was very spacious and beautifully decorated.  We especially loved the large bathroom with full size bath and massive shower.  The bathroom toiletries are all made an Italy and very generous in size, they also smell divine.  An important detail in my mind!! The location is brilliant because after a very busy day in the hustle and bustle of downtown, it is an oasis of peace and serenity to come back to the hotel which is so beautifully located near Central Park. If you are looking for a memorable stay, you have found it!

title: Another excellent stay
text: I love staying at The Mark. Excellent service, wonderful rooms and great area. The staff were consistently helpful and pleasant. The food and wine list were as good as I remember. I can think of very little that should be improved in this gem of a hotel other than hoping it doesn't become even more popular so I can keep getting reservations when visiting New York.

title: my NYC favorite hotel
text: Bien placé, à coté de Central Park, le poumon de NYC, un hotel de luxe ou l'on se sent vraiment bien! on regrettera l'absence d'un sauna ou d'un hammam mais l'ambiance de ce "petit" hotel est top! à revoir : le wifi trop lent! pas digne!

title: Beyond Excellent
text: We have stayed in some high end, quality hotels around the world, but I have to say that up until now this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. Not only was the Hotel stylish and extremely comfortable but the quality of service and attention to detail was absolutely first class. All of the staff were courteous and friendly and would offer you assistance in any way possible. The concierge staff were particularly brilliant, (especially Isabelle and Jackie) they were very kind and attended to our every need....I would re-visit in a heart beat! Thanks, you really hit 'The Mark'

title: Clearly black and white....
text:
....is both the theme of The Mark and the theme of any review, which in this case is all white and no black marks at all. The location is superb, just what one needs for all the shopping and culture of the upper East Side, without the grime and noise of mid-town or the West Side. Though at a crossing on busy Madison Avenue the double or probably triple glazing is thoroughly effective. The staff are helpful and helpfully remember your name, not if you have forgotten it, but to personalise your stay - a very good white mark indeed. 

The black-and-white theme of the decor carries on from the exterior, through the lobby, and very neatly onto the bathroom floors - a charming touch. The drawer-like well-filled ice 'bucket' was also a white mark, as was the alternative to a full restaurant breakfast, provided in the bar. Altogether more white than black......

title: Broken Elevators!
text: Our magnificent trip was ruined because the hotel's elevators were broken.   With only 2 small elevators to serve the entire hotel, we had to wait in a crowded lobby 10 minutes every time we wanted to get to our room.   And of course for the ride down too.   Never again.

title: Amazing!
text:
The Mark Hotel is our favorite place to stay in NYC.
We love the location on 77th and Madison!
It is a luxury hotel with beautiful rooms and an amazing staff.
The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are meticulous.
During our last stay, our six year old daughter got very sick.
The hotel staff were incredibly caring and supportive.  They had a doctor available
to see our daughter and they worked fast to get us the medication that we needed.
We would not stay anywhere else!

title: Hôtel très classe
text:
Cet hôtel est réputé pour accueillir des hôtes de marques et cela se reflette sur l ambiance générale. Très classe, les chambres sont très belles et superbement équipées, une très belle salle de bains, une moquette épaisse, très bien insonorisée malgre la rue passante.
Très beau.

title: Can't Give It An Excellent This Time
text:
I have stayed at The Mark  in its various incarnations: before renovations, while it was a MandarinOriental property, after renovations, and now when it is owned by investors. 
I checked in at 1 pm and was given a room over the canopy on the second floor. Oh no! There were no other king bed rooms available until the next day so I was stuck. You can hear people coming and going all evening. The next morning at 5:45 a.m. the industrial trash cans we're hauled out right under my window so the truck could come by and make as much noise as possible while picking them up. I did get a higher floor room that afternoon. But  Room 811 had a dirty looking, tired stained carpet and the drapes were falling off the rods at both sides. Housekeeping should be paying attention to these things.The window has a shade and no black out drapes. So when the sun comes up, light streams in around the edges. 
The heated towel bar in the spacious and lovely bathroom didn't work. I love the shower and the deep tub is great for soaking at the end of a busy day.
Personnel is a plus at The Mark; always  pleasant and accommodating. I appreciate that kind of service. I know the glitches I encountered  will be taken care of and I would certainly stay here on all my future trips.

title: Good hotel, inconsistent attention to detail
text: The Mark is a very stylish luxury hotel.  Reception and concierge and excellent (as they should be at a hotel of this standing).  However, some of the rooms are small with the door opening straight onto the main room with the bed - which if you are travelling on business and colleagues might pass by your room lacks privacy.  Also, attention to detail of housekeeping is variable.  For example, one day there might be a shower mat for the bathroom floor, another day it gets forgotten.  A hotel of this stature should have excellent and consistent housekeeping.

title: Our first time at this hotel
text: We booked the Mark as a diversion from our usual hotel on the West Side of NYC based on its web site and reviews.  It is a truly luxurious venue.  It is a nice size with no convention traffic and the rooms are quiet and restful with all the expected amenities (we especially liked the abundant ice in the freezer compartment).  We were offered the hotel car for a complimentary trip to the Opera.  The staff are efficient, courteous and promptly responded to our requests to clean the room at a  certain time.  All in all, we feel we have discovered a new favorite in NYC with access to Madison Avenue and the museums of the upper east side.  Not inexpensive but for us it was worth the price.

title: Wonderful
text: Great location, great service, wonderful rooms, comfy beds. All and all a great place to stay. Location on the upper east side is nice for shopping or going for a run in the park. My go to place in NYC

title: Great hotel
text: Just returned from NYC and stayed in a junior suite at the Mark. Great location to Central Park, staff brilliant, room excellent. Nice touch of a bottle of champagne and a cake for my wife's birthday. Will definitely return and highly recommend. Garbage collection a bit noisy in the morning (early) but no fault of the hotels. Only disappointment was no free wi-fi

title: Great hotel, lovely location on the upper east side!
text:
The location is great: a block from the park, next to the Whitney museum, close to all the nice stores on Madison.
The rooms are beautifully decorated and have great large bathrooms. We loved the mini-bar- best ever mini-bar I have seen so far!
The staff - concierge, reception and maids- are lovely and the restaurant - for breakfast and for dinner- is incredible.
When it is not high-season in Manhattan, it is the best hotel in town - for its value.

title: Exceptional Boutique Hotel with 5 star Service and Cuisine
text: Many years ago, we stayed at the Mark Hotel, pre-renovation, and loved it then. The oak bar with forest green leather chairs, the black and white tiled floors and bathrooms, the New York City feel...all was glorious.  I was initially skeptical about the renewed, refurbished Mark, and worried it might be too flashy and lose its previous character. Those fears turned out to be unfounded - the new, improved Mark retained its marvelous, boutique, uptown New York City character without sacrificing one iota of modern luxury.  First, let me say, the Mark is one of the few hotels in the US that serves a proper afternoon British-style tea, complete with authentic scones and clotted cream. While such may be of little consequence to the average American, it was hugely important to me. Second, the restaurant offers exceptional cuisine. My friend and I had dinner there and left feeling quite overcome by the culinary bliss - the crab with a crisp Sancerre is not to be beaten.  Third, the rooms have now been retrofitted with great taste to add the modern touches missing before - enormous and highly-functional closest space, grand and full outfitted bath room, a mini-bar to rival the most glamorous 5-star hotels.  And all of this is delivered in an unpretentious, somewhat low-key manner. The staff offer unparalleled service - opening every door, securing taxis, delivering extra towels, extra drinks, and swift responsiveness at every turn.  The door man even gave me a Mark hotel umbrella, and I use it to this day (thank you!).  I stayed in a queen room that never felt small or cramped in any way - the space has been so well designed to function at a high level and feel uncluttered.  The unrivaled location sets you at the door step of Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and Madison Avenue's art gallery haven. I love the intimate feel of this hotel and plan on making it my New York home base many times in the future.  I am also a fan of the Ritz-Carlton properties, and what I would say to those who ask is that the feel of the two hotels can be quite different, and difficult to compare.  While more expansive, the Ritz properties offer an excellent, business-like experience. The intimate boutique feel of the Mark, combined with its location, make it an equal and excellent choice.  If staying downtown, I would choose the Ritz; when staying up town, the Mark gets my vote.

title: Well located oasis for a business trip
text: I was visiting NYC for business and to see the Whitney Biennel.   Easy walk to the Whitney from the Mark, and not far from my appointments in mid-town.  My room was extremely nice and well-designed.  Best array of mini-bar snacks I have ever seen.   Double sink perfect for couples.  Breakfast was delicious, I recommend trying the creative, healthy, delicious smoothies.

title: Head and shoulders above its competitors
text: We spent four nights in the hotel as part of our honeymoon. Everything was faultless, but what was particularly memorable was the attentiveness of the staff who had the perfect balance of being very friendly and helpful without being intrusive. A big highlight for us was The Mark breakfast. We were already thinking about it when we went to bed already!

title: オシャレなホテルで、スペックも良しデス。
text: ビジネスで利用しましたが、立地、客室ともに文句無しに良いです！オススメです！特にバスルームの浴槽が広いので、ゆったりつかれます。シャワーの出もじゃんじゃんお湯がでるので、海外独特のあつの弱いかんじが全くありません。また、客室の冷蔵庫に氷がたっぷり常備されているので、共用スペースや電話で持って来てもらう手間もかからず、部屋飲みの人にはうれしいおもてなしです！

title: Fashionable, boutique hotel.
text:
Excellent location - quick walk to Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, shopping, cafes, etc. 
Quiet, upscale, residential street (perfect for those who want a retreat from the confusion and noise of the city).
Clean, comfortable rooms.
Helpful and friendly staff.

title: Great location - very uneven staff performance
text:
We stayed at The Mark for three days, the room was well-appointed and pleasant, apart from the climate control which was rather unresponsive.
While the reception staff working at night was professional and friendly, we were quite taken aback by the repeated dismissiveness and displays arrogance by one of the receptionists during our stay. I did not feel like complaining to Management at the time, but it was quite annoying and certainly reduced our overall enjoyment. I do not understand how a company can keep such a person on its staff.

title: A perfect stay from check in to check out!
text: My husband and I stayed here for a last minute anniversary trip. We chose it based mainly on location and reviews. It was way beyond our expectations!  What struck us the most was the way the staff was so friendly and helpful in a very genuine way. Many times when we stay in hotels it feels like everyone is out for a tip. Not here. They are truly happy to help you and want you to have a good stay. We had dinner at the restaurant which was also very good. Our room was very comfortable and nice and quiet. The bathtub was wonderful and the linens lovely. We had our shoes shined complimentary and they came back like new! When we asked the doorman for a cab to go to the west side they had the hotel car take us.  We can't wait to go back and have already made reservations!  We will stay here from now on for all our nyc trips!

title: Pas adapté pour séjour familial
text: Je voudrais tempérer un peu les avis sur cet hotel. Nous l'avions sélectionné au vu des critiques plutôt excellentes sur TripAdvisor pour un séjour de 7 nuits avec 2 enfants de 9 et 12 ans. Certes la décoration est parfaite et la chambre était très confortable mais pas de vue ni de service particulier (ex piscine ou terrasse). Le gros bémol était pour nous le petit déjeuner car comme il n'était pas compris dans le prix de la chambre nous sommes descendus au restaurant le premier jour: service empesé, entourés d'hommes d'affaires venus en rendez-vous avec des clients, bref nous avons après cela pris systématiquement les petits déjeuners à l'extérieur.  Le service était excellent, rien à dire sur le service de chambre ou le personnel, très aimable, même si la conciergerie n'a pas fait des prouesses: ils n'ont pas pu réserver des places pour le tour de l'ile en bateau à cause de problèmes techniques et quand j'ai demandé pour la visite de l'Empire State on m'a proposé des pass VIP à 67 USD par personne alors qu'en me rendant sur place nous avons payé le même prix sans faire la queue pour 3 personnes. Cela est assez représentatif des prestations de l'hotel, très haut de gamme et plus adapté à une clientèle en solo ou en couple avec un gros budget qu'à une famille prête à mettre le prix certes mais pas un prix aussi élevé pour au final une très bonne chambre, dans un quartier agréable.

title: Excellent choice
text:
Stayed 6 nights at The Mark - the hotel was just perfect for us.
We had found a great deal  and we very glad  that  we made this choice.
Our room was rather compact but very comfortable and the bathroom was a real delight. We had our breakfast served in the room  each morning - always delicious, on time and  excellent quality.
As our room faced the inner court we had  lovely quiet night sleep and woke up with  birds singing and not with sirenas and truck traffic noise.
The area is upscale and charming.
Unfortunately  we were  not lucky with the weather - it was very cold and  lots of water and snow outside so  there was no any chance to use  hotel's bykes.
Compliments to all the staff - the front desk, concierge team, bellboys, housekeeping  - everyone  tried to make us feel at home. Great job! 
I would stay again at The Mark with great pleasure.

title: Приятный, стильный отель
text:
Это небольшой дизайнерский отель в приятном районе Манхэттана рядом с лучшими магазинами Madison ave (да-да, именно здесь, а не на пятой сосредоточены дизайнерские бутики). 
+ очень стильный отель, с очень стильными номерами
Замечательные ванные комнаты!
Комната была просторной и тихой внутри. Видимо ввиду того, что это Аппер Ист Сайд.
Неплохой ресторан внизу. 
В общем все понравилось.

title: it really is one of the best
text: stayed for 4 nights - room was not ready and they up graded us before we had a chance to complain.  The service was impeccable - staff were very professional but friendly. There was a car and driver available at no extra charge.  Hotel was very clean and our room was large and  well furnished.  Restaurant was always busy so it is best to book a table.  Food was very good and it is popular with stars - we sat next to Oprah one evening. It is modern and very classy -  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Mark my words, the Mark is a gem in New York
text: really liked my stay here in the conveniently located Mark   - 77/Madison.Many New York hotels are outmoded, dirty and expensive, but this one is a shining exception.The staff are brilliant, particularly the concierge staff who really helped me.Its not cheap, but my room was perfectly appointed, had two bathrooms, a great desk and luxurious appointments. I am coming back here next time!!!!

title: Ah....Mazing!!!
text:
We booked the Mark for one night to splurge in NYC. It turned out to be the best night ever as we got engaged! The hotel did a great job. They upgraded us, the champagne, roses (nicest I've ever had), bathroom (best part) were superb. TV in bathroom mirror, huge tub and THE BEST SHOWER pressure ever! Funky lobby floor, fancy/ritzy part of NYC I can go on and on. 

The only downfall...super tiny lobby bar. Would have been great to go for a drink but it was so small and packed! 

If you're going to splurge or like luxury...The Mark is the place! Right by the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Central Park.

title: Excellent location
text: Stayed there in Jan 2014 while in NYC for business for 3 nights. Service was excellent as well as the room itself, though expensive, and would have preferred a buffet breakfast! Overall enjoyable, and the location was superb, so close to central park and similar attractions

title: Wonderful stay
text: My 22 year old son and I spent 3 nights here on a special celebration trip and thoroughly enjoyed it. The reservations staff and concierge were excellent- really helpful, our room was comfortable and more spacious than we expected and the whole experience felt very personal. We enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast and dinner and had late night drinks in the bar. We loved the location-great for Art, Central Park, Lincoln Centre as well as shopping and everywhere was easily accessible via the 6 line or cab. I will definitely be back.

title: A top-end hotel on the upper east side !
text: There are many hotels in NYC that vie for the 5-star market, and it's the little things that make the difference given the significant room rate. We chose the Mark for its location, close to Lexington Ave shops and restaurants, Central Park and the subway; and on recommendation from a friend. We were by no means disappointed ! The rooms are spacious with subdued decor, and ours on the 5th floor had an outlook over the street, which is nice. The small thoughts in the turn down service are appreciated after a long day. The foyer and small downstairs bar seemed to be always crowded though, and a couple of times we turned away because there was just nowhere to sit. Also, 'cheap and cheerful' restaurants close by seem few and far between, unless you want to head downtown to soho ... then that's the nature of the upper east side, I suppose.The big upside for us was the help at the front desk. Sam, Daniel and Jimmy could not do enough for us - from help at check in, to a late check out, and all in between. Their making us feel welcome was probably the big upside that means we will certainly pick the Mark Hotel next time we are in NYC !

title: One of my favourite hotels
text: Although a little formal for my tastes the staff were incredibly friendly and made such an effort to make me feel at ease. I was working in NYC as part of a film crew, often arriving back late, dressed like a tramp and filthy. Yet they could not have been more understanding during the 3 week stay. When my wife arrived from London for a week they upgraded us to a suite at no charge for the duration of her stay. Good location for many things especially the park which is almost as good as the London Parks on a Sunday. Very clean, very comfortable, sumptuous even.

title: A special hotel and great service
text: We were in NYC for a special event, and everything about The Mark added to our wonderful trip. The service was great. We loved our spacious, lovely room. Every amenity was available. The restaurant was fantastic. We would give this a very high recommendation.

title: A little snooty, but a very nice hotel
text:
The room: Lovely.  I have a difficult time relaxing in hotels because I am fastidious to the point where one stray hair (that is not mine) in the bathroom will make me sleep cramped, on the edge of the bed.  But my room was super-clean and I felt very comfortable from the moment I entered it.

Price: Not cheap, but if you can get a deal, like I did, then it's worth it.

Service: Snooty.  Such that a very nice lady at reception and a nice doorman stood out.  Aside from those standouts, however, I didn't feel like an appreciated guest.

The food: Expensive hotel food, like most hotels, but at least it was pretty good.

Location: It depends what you want to do in NYC.  I had a few dinners downtown, so I sometimes didn't love the location, but overall it's great: the Met, Frick Collection, CP.  Hard to beat.

I would stay there again, if I got a good deal, solely for the room.

title: Бутик-отель у Центрального парка
text: Роскошный и, соответственно, не дешевый отель в знаковом месте Нью-Йорка. В просторных номерах бесплатный WIFI, стильная мебель из какой-то ценной древесины. В ванной есть телевизор. Отличный одноименный ресторан (завтрак, правда, дороговат даже для 5звезд).

title: Elegance and Style
text: Our recent stay at NYC's The Mark was wonderful.  I would say that it was the most beautiful and elegant hotels I have ever experienced.  The rooms are stylish and extremely well-appointed.  We were upgraded to a larger suite, and this was such a treat.  The room had two large bathrooms with showers in each.  There was a huge and luxurious tub in the master bath.  The sitting area was spacious but warm, with many fabulous books on the shelves.  I'm sure that the sofa was a sofabed, but we never used it because it was just my daughter and I (who is surely spoiled now, because no other NYC hotel can compare!).  The master bedroom was also quite spacious and the bed?!  I never have slept that well in a hotel!!  It is a bit pricy, but well worth the splurge if you can afford it.  The restaurant was delicious, and at night, the lobby comes alive with the coffee area turning into an intimate bar.  There are bicycles lining the sidewalk for rides to the nearby Central Park and the hotel is situated amongst the finest shopping in the city.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and wished we had booked a few more days.

title: Impeccable
text:
The Mark met la barre très haut. L'équipement des chambres est de toute beauté et très complet (baignoire géante, tv dans le miroir, système audio Bang et Olufsen... Les meubles et la déco apportent cette touche si Newyorkais du noir et blanc. Rien que les chaussons sont beaux (ma chérie ajoute simplement qu'ils devraient penser au pied des femmes qui sont plus petits). Et nous avions même le petit macaron La Durée près du lit. Service impeccable, parties communes impeccables, comme le reste. 
Attention : emplacement un peu excentré au nord de Manhattan mais proche du Métropolitain, de Central Park et des belles avenues. 
Pour résumé, si vous avez le budget, vous ne prendrez pas de risque à réserver au Mark

title: MODERNITA' E CONFORT
text:
Si tratta di una struttura rinnovata poco tempo fa , elegantememte arredata e situata in una posizione che consente di raggiungere il cuore della città con una "abordabile"passeggiata ma  anche  di rimanere fuori dal caos della Fifth Avenue e dai maggiori punti commerciali .Nelle vicinanze Metropolitan Museum e Guggenheim .
Unica critica : una lobby quasi inesistente e , durante l'inverno , esposta alle gelide correnti provocate dall'apertura del  portone di ingresso .

title: Feel like a celebrity!
text: Everything everything everything was amazing! Rooms were top notch! The lounge was very cool. Everything decorated to the tee. Doormen were awesome. Tv's in the bathroom mirror. Best hotel in NYC. Concierge made our trip by bending over backwards! Ask for Lukas!!! Will be back!

title: Wonderful Time
text: What stands out for this property is the excellent service, spacious and beautiful bathrooms and short walk to Central Park. They provided a bed, treats, food and water bowl for my friends dog. Complimentary internet service in the room. View of Madison ave from my room.  Flat screen tv imbedded in the mirror in the bathroom. Heated towel rack. It is a quiet neighborhood as far as traffic and crowds. Nice retreat from the hustle and bustle. I will be back.

title: Service and Style
text: the service is what sets The Mark apart from other hotels in the city. Proximity to the park, great location and amazing food. My kids are comfortable with the doormen and concierge staff. The doormen provided a major convenience by keeping my car close so i would have quick access to my transportation to get across town or out of the city. i would definitely recommend the hotel to others for the amazing service and personal attention to detail. We will be back. Scott Robinowitz

title: The best and trendiest in New York
text: By far the best and trendiest hotel in New-York. The service is perfect, with a smile - a very rare quality in 5 stars hotels or restaurants. The kitchen mastered by Swiss chef Jean-George is one of the great discover in the Empire State...

title: Stylish Hotel in Great Location
text: Your New York experience can be greatly shaped by what part of town you choose to stay in, and The Mark is perfectly located on the Upper East Side. The rooms are generously sized with a very modern and stylish interior. Much nicer than the bland or corporate decor you find at so many other places in NY. The concierge team were really helpful and in particular recommended some great places to eat. Much better value than some of the high end chains, and the gym was good. Not huge but had all the equipment you could hope for.

title: est ce vraiment un hotel ?
text: ou un restaurant avec des chambres  ?... l'emplacement est parfait mais l'immeuble est modeste entre madisson avenue et central parc . la decoration est somptueuse de chic et de détail . petit bar à l'entrée que l'hôtel privatise sans prévenir  ( les clients de l'hôtel n'y ont plus accès...) grande salle de restaurant jolie mais très bruyante ( les branchés mode du quartier ont font  leur cantine ..) , les service du restaurant est expeditif et sans rapport avec une hôtellerie de ce niveau et enfin les chambres , grandes et  belles . Pas de terrasse, pas de piscine , pas de vue , . un peu juste quand meme eu egard aux pretentions affichées et tarifées  .

title: Luxury a few steps from the park
text: Loved my stay at this fascinating and vibrant hotel. Very comfortable with great rooms recently renovated, offered very good service and a superb restaurant with a trendy bar. Price over $600 for my room was a little bit more I would have paid for this hotel but it's New York and all hotels are expensive here.

title: Good but not outstanding
text:
Pros: good front desk service, large bathroom, comfortable beds

Cons: room itself was very small and provided nowhere to work, water took forever to get hot in the sinks, fitness club is pretty skimpy

Overall: you won't be disappointed but don't expect to be wowed!

title: Clean, comfortable and convenient.
text: Expensive!  However, it is New York and one block from central park.  I love the location.  The room was a decent size, very clean and well appointed. The cost was more than $900.00 per night.  Bathroom had all the comforts, heated towel racks, plenty of space and a tv.  I would stay again.

title: Top quality
text:
Everything about this hotel is top quality. From the rooms décor, facilities and staff who are excellent and committed. Free bicycle and hotel car (when available and on a first come first served basis) ad something to the stay, at a price of course.
We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.
We did not try the restaurant but the bar was fun (noisy and expensive).

title: It makes a mark
text: extremely comfortable upper East Side Chic. Since the Renovation a few years ago they have really made the room super comfortable albeit a bit hip.  The restaurant by Jean George is better for dinner than the other meals. The day time servers all seem to be looking at themselves in the mirror more than at the tables.  Dinner however is superb crowded with "beautiful people" all noisy and texting. Doesn't any one have a meal without their smart phone anymore?  All in all one of the best in NY - It probably helps that their staff are not part of the hotel union.

title: Wow !
text:
First time at this lovely hotel,I stay in NYC often and have tried many others,but this is a real gem . Keep it quiet!!!
I will without a doubt stay here next time. 
The hotel is in a wonderful quiet location yet at the same time so handy for the many museums on the upper east side as well as it being a real Ny neighborhood.

title: GOOD CHOICE ON THE UPPER EAST SIDE
text: As this speicific weekend in NYC we were planning on visiting the Metropolitan Museum and spend time with the grandchildren in Central Park, our choice was The Mark on the upper east side instead of a hotel in midtown.  We did not regret it,  although there was some more street noise to put up with because of some road work on Madison. I don't think a room on a higher floor would have helped in this case.  Very friendly saff, comfortable rooms and bathrooms. We had dinner and lunch several times at Jean Georges restaurant, besides breakfast. Good service, excellent food, we were never dissappointed.  Only detail, strange for us, at the bar they do not serve alcoholic drinks before 12am on Sundays! As we did not want to wait 15' for a drink, a tonic water without gin did the job. We will certainly return.

title: Never misses The Mark
text: My third visit was as satisfying as my first (which was extraordinary).  I always fear that when I have a perfect hotel experience, I don't want to return and 'ruin' the first impression.  But my third visit last week was as perfect as my first.  The staff is key in making this hotel work and they are professional and warm.  The facility is beautiful and the neighborhood is perfect.  I love the housekeeping team's efforts (the room was always perfect) and it is my favorite hotel bathroom in the city (the best water pressure in the showers).  It is important enough to me to be noting it here.  I will continue to select The Mark for my New York business meetings.

title: trip to the mark
text:
i stayed at the mark for three nights while attending a wedding in new york. i thought the hotel was conveniently placed close enough to town, central park and the museums(met and natural history).
service was excellent and hotel was up to standard. i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay there.

title: A pleasant experience
text:
Very helpful staff, lovely room with kitchen facilities and a buzzy bar and restaurant made this a pleasant stay in New York. We needed a microwave and one arrived almost immediately on request.

The only downside was that the corridors and public rooms were kept at an unnaturally low temperature and we all went home with sore throats and colds!

title: Lovely Upper East Side hotel
text:
The rooms here are a highlight.  Sizable for New York City and extremely comfortable, with an understated decor.  The bathrooms are large and not understated - a fun, Art Deco vibe complete with black and white tile floors and a walk-in shower.  Plenty of closet space and hangers, a selection of upscale magazines and consistent wifi.

The neighborhood is beautiful and quiet.  You're not talking trendy here and it's a hike to most of the city's tourist attractions, with the happy exception of Central Park just down the block.  But it's great walking down Madison Ave and window shopping at any time of day or night.  

Restaurant selection in the immediate vicinity is relatively limited and pricy, but by venturing east and north you can find more casual options.  The hotel has an expensive restaurant that draws an older, moneyed crowd and a bar that's crowded with local 30-something socialite types and Eurotrash.  We amused ourselves for 45 mins one night having a drink in the lobby and watching the parade of older women in too short skirts and younger women in too tight dresses teeter in stilettos up and down the stairs to the mezzanine level restroom serving both the bar and restaurant.  

Overall a very pleasant stay and I would return.

title: Perfect upper east side location
text:
All you expect from a 5 star hotel a block away from central park you get at The Mark. The fitness area is quite poor though, but who needs a Gym when there is a Central Park just steps away.
The also have a shoe shine service provided by John Lobb!!!

title: 2 Reasons to Stay Here: Fabulous Bathroom and Walk to the Metropolitan Museum
text:
I stayed at The Mark for 2 nights in August while helping my daughter move into college in Morningside. 

I prefer to stay at boutique hotels and almost always like the hotels on the Mr. and Mrs. Smith website and although The Mark is not one of their recommended hotels, I chose it for its location and the eye-catching bathroom. Even though there were many things about The Mark that I enjoyed (close proximity to Central Park and the Met, safe neighborhood, all marble bathroom, highly functional room) there were aspects of my stay that were less than stellar (service, room decor, noise, linens, degree of charm). 

Details of my stay:

Decor
Mid century meets art deco with lots of highly polished surfaces. I thought the lobby was blindingly shiny and the seating was uninviting.

Guests
Suave and international.

Staff
Mature, seemed to be trained in hospitality, lots of slicked back hair.

Room
The first thing I saw when entering the room was a chartreuse curtain caught up in the lamp cord exposing an electrical outlet. Disappointing first impression. I couldn't wait for the front desk person to leave so I could fix the curtain and cover the outlet. Really?

I was on the 5th floor in a Madison King (although maybe it was a queen because the bed was really small). The entrance and hallway inside the room were large; the bedroom area was about 200 sq. ft. Although the decor was a nice seque from the pale brick buildings lining the street outside, the overall effect was bland: lots of neutrals. Design details included grass cloth on walls, commercial looking art, matching blond furniture and a mid-century style table and chairs (eyesore - looked like they were borrowed from the set of I Love Lucy). 

Lots of closet space. Ironing board. Super cold A/C. 

The bathroom was huge and entirely clad in marble. Double sinks. Giant bathtub. Mint green vanity. Good lighting. Lots of mirrors. Heated towel rack. Highly functional. No window. 

Highlight of room: ice drawer

Drawbacks: Street noise, coarse BEIGE sheets

Service
The Mark really fell down on the job for me. I made the reservation directly with the reservation department via email and phone. I requested an outside room on the 7th or 8th floor and if it wasn't available to please place me in a courtyard room. When I checked in, I was placed in an outside room on the 5th floor. No mention of my request. 

I heard lots of street noise on the 5th floor. 

On two occasions, my room key failed to open the door and I had to call for help.

The front desk was accommodating with both an early check in and late check out. Much appreciated. 

Room Service
I only had breakfast. I called in the morning and my tray was delivered in about 10 minutes with everything exactly as I ordered it. Nice job. 

Housekeeping
Immaculate. Inconspicuous. (Except for the offending curtain).

Transportation
You can walk to the park and a number of museums. If you want a NY deli experience, there is a Pastrami Queen deli a few blocks east. There is one train station a few blocks away but overall, you will be taking a taxi and I found that just about everywhere I went it was a $15 cab fare (including tip).

title: The Carlyles charming neighbor
text: Our annual trip to New York has had us in many hotels. The Carlyle has been one of our favorites  but the rooms can be a bit tired given other options. Enter The Mark, one block away. Renovated, refreshed with drop dead gorgeous bathrooms, lovely staff, a nice little street side bar and a John-George restaurant that didn't disappoint. Add in a Tesla S hotel car and you have one very nice, very friendly, very updated New York hotel choice less than a block from Central Park.

title: Stylish hotel in the best part of Manhattan
text:
My boyfriend wanted to surprise me and he booked 3 nights in a private appartment on Manhattan (Chinatown) - this surprise was a nightmare for me! I will write more about it on another occasion. 

So after one night spent in that horrible appartment (120 E Broadway) I decided to treat myself and was looking for the most possible - but affordable - luxury. So this is the story how we found out The Mark hotel. I loved the design of the lobby, bar, restaurant and the rooms very much. The staff at the reception desk was extremely polite and nice, we could check in even earlier (noon) than according to the official hotel policy (3 p.m.) and were upgraded to a better room. It was impeccably clean and quiet. The only disturbance I could hear - and I am very noise sensitive - was the refrigerator, but it was not too loud, it was just a nuisance. After we have spend two nights there, we booked a car to the airport, it was not only there perfectly on time but it was a limo with a very friendly driver who gave us a lot of information about the city as well. We have had breakfast only once in the hotel, we were given a beautiful table but the organisation of the staff was not perfect. They forgot to bring us one order at all (they did not charge it though), the people attending to our table were changing and the signature breakfast was fine but nothing special. The belgian waffle was outstanding with fresh cream and strawberries. So after my terrible experience with a private appartment I was more than happy in The Mark hotel. I have been do NYC five times in total and this was definitely the most beautiful hotel where I have ever been. Of course the hotel is not for free but comparing to other hotels, the value meets the price.

title: Too expensive , no transports around and the staff at the restaurant is rude
text:
I stayed there when going for a consult in ny
I was very sick and all the transpot were very far
The rooms were lovely and the hotel is nice
I was expelled from the restaurant because i was wearing bermudas
All in all i did nt like it

title: just fabulous!
text: I am writing this on behalf of my 19 year old daughter who was lucky enough to be taken to NY for five days with her aunt who was on a business trip.  They stayed at The Mark on the Upper East side for two nights, and this is my daughter's review: "The Mark is just fabulous! It's the best ever location - just a few minutes walk to Central Park - and a haven of luxury.  All the staff were so good, they knew our names and took good care of us.  Tim the doorman was brilliant.  We were upgraded to a junior suite which was amazing; two large bathrooms and extra-comfortable beds.  I would recommend The Mark to anyone wanting a luxurious hotel close to Central Park".

title: Eccellente
text: Ho avuto il piacere di soggiornare presso questo hotel per 15 giorni, resi indimenticabili non solo dallo splendore della "città che non dorme mai", ma anche dalla cordialità, pulizia e location dello stesso. Molto elegante, stanze ampie, lussuose e moderne. Personale disponibile. Cibi ottimi, dal breakfast al dinner. La posizione è ottima: due passi e puoi deliziarti con un pic-nic a Central Park. Palestra e SPA non sono state altro che la ciliegina sulla torta del mio soggiorno al The Mark. Da consigliare per chi, come me, vuole abbinare il lavoro al lusso.

title: Just Not Worth the Cost
text:
This hotel attracted us with its great location, right near Central Park and several museums, and its brightly-lit lobby with that cool zebra stripped floor.  (Although some may feel they are in a fun house). 
Front desk was energetic and helpful -- which I don't take for granted. Room was pleasant enough and bathroom was enormous. But we paid plenty for this and at the end of the day I didn't feel it was worth the cost. Yes, NYC is expensive and I maybe naive, but I'd like to think the city could do better.

title: vale a pena ficar no the mark??
text: Quis experimentar uma localização diferente em gotham. Nada de midtown ou soho. Valeu a pena?? O hotel é muito luxuoso, quartos ok para a cidade com banheiros excelentes. Tem um carro com motorista privativo do hotel que te leva (sem cobrança) para locais até 30 quadras. Um mimo e tanto. Um porteiro excelente, atencioso. Mas tive uma decepção com a concierge do hotel. Não parece preparada e foi muito antipática. Parecia que estava me fazendo um favor ao conversar comigo. Conclusão: na melhor cidade do mundo, tem lugares melhores para se hospedar.

title: Posh hotel
text: Stayed one night at this hotel and was super impressed by the elegance of this madison ave boutique hotel. The lobby is very chic and modern, location is excellent if you want to be on the upper east side, close to boutiques and museum mile. The room is spacious and beautiful. Feels like an upper east side elegant apartment. Bathrooms are gorgeous with luxury amenities. Expensive but well worth the treat!

title: Elegant still
text:
The Mark had a redo a few years ago, I think. Some of it was successful and some less so, however, the hotel still has a luxe feel to it, the staff are top in NYC, and the restaurant is superb.  
I love the refrigerator - it is nicer than most, and the tv in the bathroom mirror.  The master control was fine, but the system was down a few times so we could control the lights and TV, but not the shades. I like that the Wifi is free - too many places charging in bits and pieces for such things.  Hope I can afford to return!!!
They say the sign of a great restaurant is the roast chicken.  Jean- George's is excellent as is the chicken, cocoanut, ginger soup. Loved the pistachio pesto.   If you like butterscotch or caramel ( I still get them confused) don't miss the pudding - sweet beyond belief...along with three tiny almond cakes. The staff seemed genuinely happy to be of help - very cheery group and attentive...and humorous too.

title: Impeccable Service
text: Love staying at The Mark for the impeccable service. Location is perfect: close the Metropolitan Museum and great shopping on Madison.  The Restaurant by Jean-George and the Bar is exceptional. After trying different hotels for novelty sake, I continue to return to The Mark...for the past 15 years.

title: A gem, tucked away in the Upper East Side!
text: We absolutely loved The Mark.  We stayed here two nights this past February as we were in town for the Westminster Dog Show!  This hotel is so incredibly chic!  The hotel rooms were huge, the decor was incredible, and the bathroom's were amazing!  I loved the TV in the mirror!  I also got my makeup done at the Frederik Fekkai salon in the hotel for our Valentine's Day dinner, which was so much fun!  I definitely suggest staying here if you like a quieter area, with smaller crowds!

title: Excellent Service
text:
The Mark is the epitome and standard when it comes to great service. The staff made sure I was taken care of from start to finish, very attentive and personable making sure you have the absolute best experience possible. The hotel itself has a great mixture of classic yet trendy look and feel, which coincides, with the overall atmosphere of the place.

The experience here is definitely priceless and I will be coming back soon!

title: New York élégant et calme
text:
Nous venons a New York une fois par an environ et avons préféré de tout nos séjours, the Mark pour son emplacement et son service vous faisant sentir chez vous.
Footing a central park en prime!
Chambres élégantes et fitness center complet.

title: Possibly the best hotel, ever.
text: Over the past couple of years, I have stayed at The Mark for the odd-weekend and sometimes for longer stays. It has got to rate as one of the best hotels around. Impeccable service, super-clean rooms, a great bar and a fantastic location. I can't say any more! As a seasoned business traveler that spends most of his time around the world in upscale hotels, I can safely recommend The Mark as a New York hotel that you should try.

title: Madison Avenue Gem!
text: Just returned from another wonderful stay at The Mark. We travelled with friends and once again loved the hotel. The room is lovely with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom large and bright. The restaurant serves a wonderful breakfast and the concierge and staff at the front desk exceptionally welcoming and helpful. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel and the location. Looking forward to our next trip to NYC.

title: Short but enjoyable stay
text: Stayed at The Mark in Manhattan for a one night business trip.  Hotel is in a great location for shopping, museums, galleries etc.  Very accommodating front desk staff who were able to give us one of our two booked rooms early so we could freshen up after our flight and before our business meeting.  Rooms were spacious (by New York standards) and extremely comfortable. Lovely bathroom with great lighting. Well stocked mini bar and separate fridge.  Breakfast was good and service excellent in the restaurant.  Would definitely stay at The Mark again.

title: A perfect place to stay
text:
The Mark is a great place to stay in the city! From the bellman, to the restaurant, to the Laduree macaroons for our turn down treat (the best I've ever had!) The Mark did not disappoint...at all. Every time we came back from an outing we were greeted warmly by the bellmen. When we wanted a cab, they offered us their house car. When we were hungry for breakfast we stayed on property and ate at Jean Georges, so delicious. They have bikes you can borrow and ride into Central Park-a must do. The Mark is in a quiet part (relatively speaking) of the Upper East Side-there is plenty to do and see. 

Long story short-if you can, you should stay here!

title: Absolutely impeccable.  Can't wait for a return stay!
text: Every detail of the room is amazing.  Staff is superb and very accommodating.  Food, drink are wonderful (Jean George). The in-room furniture, electronics, bed, bathroom are unbelievably top notch.  Yes, its on the Upper East Side and not in midtown but midtown is too congested and undesirable to stay in anyway.  The Mark is a very short and easy cab ride north a bit from midtown.

title: Top 5 of my NY list
text:
Only problem was being away from Manhatten Center ,but the rooms are larger than usual ,very well decorated , all the details in the room are perfect ( lights,air conditioning , closet ,tv..etc )
Bath rooms and their accesories are perfect ,if somebody wants to decorate or renovate his Hotel 
Room they should simply copy The Mark

title: 大好きなホテル
text:
とにかく近年泊まったホテルの中ではイチオシです。NYCはホテルの選択肢が多くていつも悩みますが、どこか落ち着かないホテルが多い。またそのホテルに帰りたくなるような、そんなお気に入りが見つからないことが悩みでした。が、THE MARKに出会って、もうここ以外には泊まりたくない！と思いました。お値段は安くないですが、一度泊まればその価値が分かります。ただ、私自身は冬には泊まったことがないのでその点では参考にならないかもしれませんが。

お部屋はNYであの広さは立派です。ちなみに私はマディソンキングに泊まりました。正確に言うと、マディソンサイドにアップグレードしてくれました。かなり十分な広さです。内装は白を貴重に品よくまとめられています。コンテンポラリーでありながらクラシックさも感じられ、高級感もあり、かつ明るい。バスルームのタオル掛けがスイッチで温められて、タオルがホカホカになるのには感動しました。完璧です。
ホテル自体は小さいです。こじんまりとしています。ですが、むしろこのこじんまり感がまたいい。バーもレストランも隣に併設されたジョンロブも、どれもセンスがいいです。
立地は歩ける季節でしたら散歩に最適、パークまですぐです。５番街までも十分歩ける距離だし美術館までも苦になりません。特に大好きなフリックコレクションまで近いのがありがたい。近くにちょっとしたレストランもあるし、マディソンアベニューをのんびりとショッピングしながら歩くのもお勧めです。
サービスも完璧です。どのスタッフもさりげなく親切です。決してフレンドリーすぎもせず、かといってスノッブでもない。サービスに温かさを感じます。
客層は、年齢層高めのヨーロッパの方が多いように感じました。

総じて品の良いホテルです。滞在者も恥ずかしくない品を持ち合わせていたいと思わせるホテルです。

title: Magnifique hôtel, super service, bravo!
text:
Hôtel complètement rénové suite à la sortie du giron de la chaîne Mandarin Oriental en 2005-2006. Le style a bien changé, plus moderne, mais le niveau très élevé des prestations a été maintenu. Situé un peu loin du centre touristique, en plein quartier résidentiel chic de l'Upper-East, mais proche du Met et bien desservi. Les chambres sont assez grandes, ce qui est rare sur NYC. Et le bar est toujours au top, dans un genre différent! 
En bref: une très belle adresse sur Manhattan, à recommander.

title: the hotel which will go the extra mile for you
text: i have stayed again in this property and would like to praise them for their kind attitidude.i was schedule to checkin very early morning and offered to pay an extra night to make sure that the room will be ready upon my arrival..the reception desk advised me that as a returning customer it will not be necessary  and the room will be available upon my arrival without an extra charge i find it a very nich jesture and we likethem  to know its very appreciative.

title: Excellent
text:
Fabulous hotel! Impeccable! Wonderful rooms, with fine design decoration. Extremely confortable and clean, wonderful bathrooms. 
Reception very warm and helpful.
Is one of the hotels in the US with more style!

title: Good, but room for improvement
text:
We stayed for two nights at the end of a trip round east coast USA. We usually stay in Midtown, but thought we'd try the Upper East side on this occasion. We enjoyed our stay, but would probably try somewhere else next time. Our room was on the third floor overlooking 77th street. I would suggest getting as high a floor as possible (we should have insisted on a higher floor) as the noise from the road is very loud on lower floors - we were woken up by delivery trucks etc from 3:00am onwards.

The pros:

- Very comfortable bed
- Room size decent by New York standards
- Very tasty breakfast (best of all the hotels we stayed at)
- WiFi provided free (but it is painfully slow)
- Welcoming & helpful doormen

The cons:

- Road noise impact on lower floors during the night
- The bar is too small for the hotel & whatever seating room is available is partially wasted by seating with no backs (so nobody sits on that part of the sofa). The lighting in the bar is modern & funky, but the impractical cow-hide sofa clashes horribly with the decor of the rest of the room.
- The 'one device controls everything in the room' concept sounds great, but isn't very practical at 3:00am in the dark.
- Breakfast service patchy (repeatedly had to ask for coffee top ups & milk etc).

title: Next time we are in New York we will stay at none other than The Mark!
text:
I had the pleasure to stay at The Mark hotel with my girlfriend.   From the moment we stepped into the hotel we felt welcomed and cared for.   Our experience started with Lucas and Paulette at reception.  They were both ‘bubbly and fun’ yet very professional.  We relied heavily on the concierge Jeanie and Isabelle who were nothing short of perfect.   They were very knowledgeable, professional, yet again wonderfully pleasant to speak with.  Of course we did not fully appreciate the quality of the staff until we travelled to a luxury hotel in Soho to spend two nights there.  There was a stark difference between both the hotel and the quality of staff.  As for our impression of the Mark over and above the staff, it was also perfect.  All small details were thought of; bright and inviting design, rooms were cleaned perfectly; the bathroom’s shower pressure was spa like; the bed was the BEST mattress I have ever slept on (in fact got the name of the manufacturer) and the list goes on. 

In short it was a perfect visit to New York and The Mark played a very large part!  Of course as a business owner I fully appreciate that such perfection must be well orchestrated, so my compliments go out to Management as well.  They have obviously coached staff well and led expectations for attention to detail.

Next time we are in New York we will stay at none other than The Mark!

title: a bit to cool for school
text: hum, MEGA pricey for an average room. Did love the bathrooms, very funky, bedroom was pretty bland and basic. VERY noisy madison av side, weirdly not on friday night but very much so saturday night beep beep of reversing rubbish trucks?? I know you are in NYC but it was noisier than less expensive hotels. the bikes are great fun take them out. We had a nice picnic too (it did cost £100 though!) staff were on the whole a bit as the title suggests "too cool for school", it was definitely THAT look where they analyse if you are wearing the latest fashions or not and god forbid you are in semi "scruffy" attire they will look down at you, NOT classy. A really Classy hotel doesnt do this... and a word of advice you never EVER know that the "scruffy" guy isnt the richest guy in the joint (look at zuckerburg!) BIG mistake. Mind you it was the upper East side so.....

title: Bel endroit, très agréable dans la quartier des musée
text: Nous avions choisi cet endroit sur les conseils avisés d'une amie, pour le raffinement des détails et l'emplacement près de Central Parc, du Met et du Guggenheim. C'est effectivement un bon choix. Un bel endroit pour une base d'excursion, l'accueil chaleureux et la déco bien faite, un rien trop déco sans doute. Le petit déjeuner continental pourrait être compris ou plus abordable, c'est dommage, les autres menus sont un peu à l'avenant. Les petites idées comme les vélos à disposition, le cireur de chaussure sont bienvenues et donnent, avec le bar sympatique et agréable, l'atmosphère particulière et originale du lieu.

title: What Happened?
text:
I had a 5 nights stay in this hotel in 2013 after a previous stay in 2010. I really do not understand what happened to this hotel! In 2010 it was a dream: immaculate and clean rooms, superlative service and very attentive staff, very high end guests...I came back this January and I could not believe to be at The Mark, NYC. 
Public areas ( including floors hallways) were dirty and bad mantained.
Room cleanliness was poor and walls, carpet and furnitures seemed to be in bad conditions.We could hear every kind of noise coming form the street and from the hallways and cold air passed trough our window. The heat system was extremely noisy.
We were 3 adults and everyday we had bathrobes, bath towels and bath amenities for 2, also after several requests.
The staff at the reception and at the concierge was very kind but they gave us a lot of wrong infos.
We booked a table for breakfast and dinner at The Mark Restaurant for 5 consecutive days and at the third day we had to cancel all the following reservations: they take care of usual local guests and treated us in a very bad way ( they gave us always the worst and littlest table available, the waiters always tried to charge on our bill the 20 % gratuity for groups of 8 or more even though we were only 3! and so on)
I think to remember that in 2010 this was a SLH hotel and now it is not any more in SLH hotels list! There has to be a reason for that!?
Definitely I will not be back!

title: In love with the Mark
text:
First time at this fabulous hotel, and we loved it. Traveling with my mom is not easy, as she is very particular about details.
And what makes it so fabulous --- everything!  Above all, it was the staff and their attention to the guests.  No matter who you are, celebrity - or just regular folk like us, you are given the same attention, respect and care.  And by the entire staff.  From the General Manager, concierge, front desk, housekeepers, valet, security, restaurant staff, --- they were always warm, friendly and helpful.  The rooms are lovely.  Bathrooms very large with more cabinet and drawer space than any hotel I've stayed in.  Located in a quiet and beautiful part of Manhatten.  Convenient to shops, restaurants, the park, taxis, etc.  No complaints!  Mom, who is a professional complainer, loved the Mark.  Enough said.

title: My favourite hotel
text:
The only bad thing about The Mark is that once you have stayed there other hotels seem disappointing in comparison. 

The rooms are very well furnished and decorated to extremely high standards, the staff are helpful, the location is perfect for museums, shopping and Central Park and I and my family have frequently been upgraded which is always appreciated. The bar is great for a quiet drink earlier in the day or for people watching a night and the restaurant wonderful too. I feel utterly pampered from check in to check out. It's pricey but you are getting the best and sometimes that is just what you need.

title: What a great Hotel!
text: Loved staying at this large boutique hotel in New York last summer. A very elegant hotel in a great area. Excellent restaurant and a really buzzy bar in the evening - met some really nice local people who use the bar as their local. Would be delighted to stay again the next time we're in NYC.

title: 座落在高級地段的酒店。
text: 座落在高級地段的酒店。如果以紐約來說，我會比較喜歡住在中城紐約半島酒店。地點非常方便。Mark整體而言是一重新裝璜後的精緻典雅的飯店。硬體設備很好，但是服務就差強人意。

title: Superbly friendly and helpful staff. Felt like they really knew us and cared about where we had been and were to do
text: Most hotels are impersonal but staff training here is exemplary, and all the staff were astonishingly pleasant and genuine. Very close to Central Park and Manhattan Upper East side, so less frantic than downtown NYC. Be warned that if you want the adrenaline rush of Meatpackers or Soho you will not like the sophisticated elegant, quieter Madison Avenue up on 77th street. We liked the fact that with a decent pair of trainers on, you could walk it down to the busy bits or stay out of it for a bit of a break. Taxi drivers seem to have their own rules of the road, and none seem to be the same as any others, so it was preferable to walk! Superb hotel

title: Excellent
text: Excellent stylish Boutique Hotel.Top Upper East side location between Madison and Central Park. Great for a run in the morning or a stroll in the afternoon. Easy to walk over to the West side. The rooms and bathrooms are designed beautifully and practical too. you will find all amenities you need. Delicious food, I love the shaved fennel salad with arugula and parmiggiano with lemon-oliveoil dressing. For breakfast I recommend the waffle rather than the french toast. Staff is so friendly that one easily feels at home.

title: One of New York's Best
text:
Service is fabulous.

Quality of food is extremely good.The only setback for me is lack of choice for lunch/dinner bread.  Only Italian?type of bread which is good but would appreciate a choice because I eat at  the hotel at least once a day one way or the other (I do not eat breakfast, just coffee)

Very fast room service with finest quality. Set back again is the bread. Reasonable price for the quality for NY definitely but not cheap.

Hotel car is very convenient.

Room I had was the most spacious in the regular room category and no complaints there. Everything was in working order.  B&O TV is nice, but a bit on a smallish side.  There is so much bass that I thought I would bother my neighbour!  Bath tub is the best.  So deep, so long. Beautiful bathroom.

Plenty of room amenities. Bath amenity is good.  However, it is probably a good idea though, to sort to branded ones when it is up for review or renewal.  There are plenty of "branded" choices from the same Italian hotel amenity company.  High quality nonetheless.

The hotel is in a beautiful most desirable residential neighbourhood but it could be inconvenient for tourists and business people on business for a night or two.

title: Good
text: A room at the Mark hotel for business trips in New York every few months. The prestigious hotel is located just a block away from Central Park.I loved the neighborhood feel and yet the elegant stores on Madison were only steps away. Everyone at the hotel was so nice and always welcomed us back each time we entered.  The Mark hotel exceeded our expectations. We usually stay mid town but thought we would try something new. I loved the neighborhood feel and yet the elegant stores on Madison were only steps away.

title: great Hotel, great staff
text:
A room at the Mark hotel for business trips in New York every few months. The prestigious hotel is located just a block away from Central Park.
