That lovely hotel is designed by world acclaimed interior designer Jacque Grange whose client list includes Karl Lagerfeld Valentino and Y.Saint Laurent to name a few  and is absolutely remarkable and offers modern convenience such as a world class fitness center, business center and 24- hour -room service who will provide anything your heart may desire. The rooms are simply wonderful and impeccable and on par with some of the highest hotels that I've stayed in. I have had always excellent service in this 5 star property which is executed sublimely by the staff.Bellmen always greet me with a big genuine smile and remember my name.
I would like to mention special warm thanks for the kindness and graciousness of Julita - the morning manager - at the reception desk. I am always greeted with a warm smile and feel all of my needs are not only met but are proactively thought of and made available to me before I even ask for them. This type of service is seldom and if ever achieved in any other high profile hotel isa constant reality thanks to Julita at the Mark. Julita learned quickly about my requests and preferences even before i stayed there for the first time. She will always go way and beyond to make sure my stay will be perfect. All my requests are always done prior to my arrival, especially my quiet room on the high floor. This is what I need when I come to New York: comfortable, first rate service, a hotel and a professional staff which will make my stays ones that I am more than happy to spend the money on.
I would recommend this hotel to the kind of traveler who wants the best service possible in New York City. Mark is the best, maybe the only place to be if you want to be treated like your the only person in the hotel. And especially Julita is the reason for me to book this hotel  when I am in New York, because the provides me with this 5 Star service.

title: Great Spring Weekend
text:
The Mark hotel exceeded our expectations.  We usually stay mid town but thought we would try something new.  I loved the neighborhood feel and yet the elegant stores on Madison were only steps away.  Everyone at the hotel was so nice and always welcomed us back each time we entered. 
The staff were more than accommodating.  Drinks in the bar and brunch in the restaurant are a must!  It's great people watching.
The rooms were extremely clean and perfect. 
I can't wait to go back.

title: Luxury and it still feels home
text: We live just 20 miles outside of New York City but we come into the city every month for a long weekend. We bring our two Golden Retrievers with us to our more than ample king sized room. Styled in French Chic boutique feel, the closets are plentiful (5 to be exact) and a full bar. The bathroom is the big surprise with an over scaled tub and a separate shower. They know the dogs names and they say hello every morning. On our way back from dinner the other night the doormen told me how many times my son took out the dog, it was great.  We truly feel it is an extension of our home. Love the staff, room, and amenities.

title: Design, Glamour and impeccable service at NYC
text:
Its a perfect combination of  luxury-hotel values on a boutique-hotel scale, with a unique design personality an attentive  and effective service and a extraordinary culinary experience .An unexpected delighting  experience in a business trip, indeed!

What’s special about The Mark  comes down largely to its location: the NYC upper east side at the core of  it famous shopping area where sophistication  and  luxury is  surrounded by about as much culture as one could reasonably be expected to take...and one block from the beautiful Central Park.
As expected, the Mark Hotel  comes with one of the  finest  restaurant serving cuisine, Jean George signature, currently even more very significative after the  closing of Adour famous  Alain Ducass restaurant.
The  bar is remarkable  .Imagine Manhattan cocktails at an exclusive  cozy  lounge, pampering oneself with delicatessen  and soaking  up the trendy , lively and cosmopolitan  atmosphere of the place.
The Mark is a wonderful context to enjoy life .

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
text: It's a great and quiet hotel stone throw away from Central Park.... Lovely!  It will be a great hotel to stay during spring summer...You will be able to see squirrels all around Central Park. There are quite a number of shopping are closeby (Madison Ave) ....

title: Почти отлично.
text: Отель расположен очень хорошо , около центрального парка. Классический американский отель , как мы его себе представляем ! Большие номера , удобные кровати , чистота . Хорошая сантехника , приветливый персонал.  Никаких проблем с сервисом. Достаточно высокие цены , но положение обязывает. Один минус - завтрак. Шведского стола нет , заказываешь по меню , маленький выбор , готовят не очень вкусно. Долго ждать. Вообщем для такого уровня отеля - такой завтрак не приемлем! А в остальном очень хорошее впечатление. Почти пять баллов.

title: delicieux stop au bar du Mark
text: pour ceux qui ne seraient pas très loin de cette adresse, je confirme que le barman du Mark est un vrai "chef"......essayez les margaritas au gingembre.....cette adresse nous a été recommandée par une new-yorkaise de Park Avenue.

title: no supero mis espectativas
text: Un hotel para mi gusto bastante frio y poca cosa, fui a The Mark pensando que iba a ser un hotel boutique bastante chic y calido, pero todo lo contrario, de partida nos dieron una habitacion que daba al lado de la central de aires acondicionados del hotel, el ruido en la noche era espantoso, no pudimos dormir nada, cuando llamamos a reclamar dijieron que no habia otra habitacion, y que no podian hacer nada, por supuesto al dia siguiente seguimos insistiendo con una habitacion mas silenciosa, y nos dieron una habitacion mas grande y esta daba a la calle, tambien se oia el trafico toda la noche, pero por lo menos no era tan insoportable como el ruido de la central de aires, en realidad una pesima experiencia, muy poco preocupado el personal de los huespedes, pocas ganas de ayudarte, en fin una pesima experiencia, no volveriamoss nunca mas a este hotel. Estoy seguro que por USD800 en el Four seasons hubiese tenido una excelente atencion y excelente habitacion. Definivamente The Mark fue una mala eleccion.

title: One night was not enough
text: The worst part was that I had only one night in NYC at the Mark. Luxurious accomodations with a wonderful staff to go with it. The room was very comfortable with nice furnishings. Loved the Sub Zer drawers and the tv embedded in the mirror of the bathroom. I really never needed to leave the hotal with the wonderful Jean George restaurant on site.

title: Just luxury
text: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel in March. Superb location minutes away from Central Park. All staff were extremely courteous, friendly & very helpfully. The rooms were spacious, kept immaculate and decorative with modern furnishings. The bathroom was pure luxury with a large separate shower and huge bath. The mirror had a tv in it which could be viewed whilst bathing. The walk to the busy area's of New York is a brisk 20 minutes through the park which was lovely. I would certainly recommend this hotel and our stay was so enjoyable it was a shame to leave the room

title: Never want to leave!
text:
We checked into the Mark after our first hotel disappointed us in a few ways. We both agreed that spending more on a room if it would bring us a fabulous experience was  worth it.
Our check in was smooth and welcoming and we were upgraded to a lovely suite. The furnishings were new and fresh and very appealing.  The space was great and we both loved the new bathrooms.
The Mark is a great hotel! Yes: it is very pricey but this is Manhattan and we figure life is short! The staff are amazing and really try to help you in any way they are able.
The food is absolutely delicious and the beds are very cozy!
We loved every minute we were here. As a matter of fact, we would move right in if we could!

title: genial
text:
Con mi familia decidimos pasar fin de año en new york, y nos alojamos en este extraordinario hotel.
el hotel es muy bueno, alta calidad de instalaciones y una atencion fenomenal- estan al cuidado permanente de los huespedes.
nosotros como somos una familia de 5, nos alojamos en una habitacion conectada, dos habitaciones, con dos baños para tres niños y dos adultos.
hay una estacion de subte a dos cuadras, el met a 1 cuadra .
el lugar muy tranquilo, poco ruido, se duerme muy bien.
el precio es alto, pero en nyc en fin de año todo es caro, la relacion calidad precio es exelente ya que por menos encontras cosas muy malas, y casi tan caras como este hotel.

lo recomiendo , volveria sin duda,

title: I loved it...
text: Stayed at The Mark for three nights in February and can only say that I loved it... Very friendly staff who effectively took care of complaints about high level of noise from neighboring room (party room for a group of young people..) Food is delicious, both breakfast and dinner. I love the fact that the hotel is somewhat out of the busy areas of New York as the walk from hotel in Central Park to shopping area is lovely.

title: Truly a great spot
text: Honestly speaking, I don't think I have ever stayed in a hotel which was such a friendly like this. The support staffs were really cool and homey. I had to stay there at night so I had the opportunity to have both dinner and the breakfast as well.  The dinner as well as the breakfast buffet was filling and fresh, lots of choices. The room was cool also. All-in-all, a great hotel!

title: Slipping quality...
text:
I am such a fan of this hotel and have stayed there countless times. Even though it costs more than the Surrey, it is usually worth the price.  not this time.
1) Concierge service was very ineffective.  I called the day before arriving to arrange a trainer in their Punch Gym.  Robert told me he would handle it and I would get a call the next day--nothing.  When i arrived at the hotel I was told nothing had been arranged. They then tried to arrange for the trainer but it was too late. the Concierge's answer was "i am sorry it didn't work out for you".  Furthermore, my executive assistant sent some documents for the Concierge to print and deliver them to my room--that was also never done.  
2)  the Room temperature is stifling hot.  no matter  what i did with controls or the windows, it would not go below 77 degrees.  it was very uncomfortable.

the Mark really needs to "up" its game to where it was a year ago.

title: Un Hotel spettacolare
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel a Gennaio, l'ho trovato quasi per caso invitata da una signora, a cui avevo richiesto informazioni a proposito proprio di un albergo. Siamo stati magnificamente, 4 giorni da non dimenticare. E' situato sulla Madison quindi anche la posizione è strategica a due passi dalla 5 strada. Il cibo ottimo a partire dal breakfast, a terminare con la cena, vasta scelta di cibi, e personale professionale  quanto basta. La SPA è semplicemente meravigliosa. Insomma il mio giudizio su questa struttura è veramente eccellente, lo consiglio vivamente a chi avrà la fortuna di fare un viaggio nella splendida megalipoli che è New York.

title: Excellent hotel dans l'upper east side
text:
Je suis récemment resté quelques jours au Mark avec ma femme.
Les chambres et le service sont impeccables.
La décoration de l'hôtel est moderne et agréable et le bar au rez de chaussée est très "trendy" et fréquenté par la belle société new yorkaise.

Un petit coup de coeur tout particulier pour le personnel de la réception et Daniel en particulier qui malgré le fait que j'étais parti de l'hôtel depuis plusieurs jours m'a aidé avec énormément de gentillesse à trouver un vol, le mien ayant été annulé !  Vraiment le genre de geste désintéressé que l'on trouve rarement.

title: Nice Uptown/Upscale Hotel
text: Stayed at The Mark just before Christmas to enjoy some NYC food and fun.  Hotel is beautiful and very friendly staff.  If you can, spend some time strolling along Madison Avenue and take in the Shops. The hotel is a bit out of the way but a nice oasis from the crush.  Hotel restaurant is a must.

title: Excellent boutique hotel Upper East side
text:
Très bon hôtel situé dans le chic Upper East Side dans le prolongement des boutiques de luxe de Madison.
La chambre est spacieuse et les équipements au top (TV B&O).
Wifi gratuit dans tout l'hôtel.
Pas mal de personnel français (réception, bar, concierge, directeur général)
Accueil très professionnel et sympatique.
Bar sympa et animé le soir.
Petit déjeuner sous la verrière agréable.

title: Classic Boutique Hotel
text: The Mark hit the mark!  This is a classy, classic boutique hotel on the upper East side.  Service is impeccable.  From the time you enter with the attentive doorman, to the black and white floor, you will love the hotel.  The rooms were large and the bathrooms sinfully large.  There is a tv in the bathroom mirror - soak in the huge tub and relax while watching tv.  Beds were heavenly.  Housekeeping spoiled you!  The location makes you feel like you are living in a vibrant neighborhood.  It is close to museums, upscale shopping, and the subway stop.  Loved everything about The Mark!

title: A jewel in the loveliest neighborhood
text: How grateful I am to the entire staff at The Mark for making my latest stay in NYC so magical.  Wonderful restaurant and bar.  Perfect rooms - gorgeous baths.  Very competent staff.  This is a five star experience and is never pretentious.

title: Great Hotel
text: I was traveling to New York for business, I glad that my secretary found this hotel for me. Hotel is in very good location, lobby looks outstanding, and staff is extremely helpful. I will visit it again,again and again. Thank You

title: A first for me
text:
The Mark Hotel on Madison Ave. at a great location, is now one of my favorite hotels. A first for me. Great lobby, the staff, the Bar on the lobby level and Jean Georges Restaurant with amazing food. Try the Dover Sole...fantastic as is the wine selection and service. Make your reservation early, this restaurant seeks out. We dined on Tuesday and the restaurant was full.
 Love the spacious guest room, a large bathroom, great minibar selection and a comfortable bed and overall a great run hotel.
Kudos to the staff and management of The Mark Hotel.
I look forward to my next trip to your hotel.

title: I don't want to tell you how much I like this hotel
text: I love this hotel because it is in the middle of a genuine New York City neighborhood. The Upper East Side can be snooty but it is also convenient to the major museums and you can just zip down Fifth Avenue to get to other parts of the city. I have stayed in the hotel during very high rates and low rates so be mindful that rates change at different times of the year. I like the room that I had facing the courtyard and other townhouses. I don't need a view of Madison Ave. This hotel is probably best for people who know NYC already and just want comfort. It is sophisticated but exceptionally comfortable and up to speed in terms of room goodies. The only downside is there really isn't a place in the lobby to chit chat if you are with others except for the bar which has a scene thing going on. Not for me. But you can just walk around the corner for a latte or other place if you are meeting someone. Yes there is a delish restaurant in the hotel but it is not too intimate but is convenient. I had an excellent chicken paillard salad with the best dressing that I have tasted in a long time. The bathrooms are large and up to date. Not sure I like the European toilet but other than that, I love this hotel and don't really want to share how good it is with you because I want to be able to keep it to myself!! It is professional to a T. Goldilocks would love the bed for sure.

title: Still Great
text: Well we returned to the Mark and as always the service was fantastic. the only disappointment was in the restaurant where the meal was not as superb as I have experienced previously. The Service was very attentive however which I always appreciate. Have the House Mimosa while there it's excellent!

title: самый лучший отель в мире!
text: Очень красивый отель,прекрасное обслуживание,особенная благодарность менеджеру Ирине,которая была очень любезна и профессиональна.Большие,светлые номера.Плюс прекрасное расположение!Все на  100 балов!В ресторане изведали прекрасный завтрак итальянской кухни.Можно повстречать  много мировых селебретис.

title: Fabulous
text: We stayed over the Christmas/New Year period and had a fabulous time. It is unusual that after seventeen nights, no problems emerged and our stay was consistently pleasant. Our room was extremely comfortable and felt like our own little home in NYC. Apart from a few small things, housekeeping did a wonderful job and it was always a pleasure to return "home" after exploring the city. On returning after evenings out, we often went to the lively bar for a nightcap or two which was a terrific way to end the day. Susie in the bar is a treasure. We love the location, a few steps to Central Park and great museums as well as wonderful shopping. It was never a problem to grab a cab to mid or downtown and the lovely guys on the door were always happy to help. Before our arrival from Australia, the Concierge desk assisted us with making restaurant bookings and secured some "very difficult to get" reservations. Jeanie was just great, so too was Jackie. We found the staff in every area to be charming and warm and they went out of their way to assist us and to make us feel welcome. We had the best city vacation ever and that was in a large part due to staying at The Mark. It was our third time here (second since the renovation), it won't be our last.

title: great location - rooms under what we expect
text:
the hotel has a great location (upper east), superior kind was much bellow our expectation specially if we consider the price. the hotel wasn't complete and they insisted in not offering an up grade (even being a member of I PREFER HOTELS)
when we decided to change the hotel they finally realized that they were charging much more than the other hotel in the some location and category and decided to solve the problem. It is a petty that they only do something when they realize that they will lose the guest.

title: Uno de los mas lindos hoteles en que nos hemos alojado
text: En una de las zonas mas agradables de NYC esta este hotel que no tiene casi ninguna falla, lo cual es dificil de hallar. Los cuartos son muy comodos en sus medidas para los standards de la ciudad, cuidados al detalle, un bar que no es 'minibar' porque es inmenso, todo impecable, las camas comodisimas y sabanas de sueño ! Ni hablar del baño, su amplitud luminosidad y la calidad de los artefactos. Diez puntos la habitacion. Lo mismo el lobby, el restaurante y la atencion del personal. Lo mejor: el diseño del hotel, su ubicacion y la comodidad de las habitaciones. Da gusto estar y dan ganas de quedarse por mas tiempo. El unico problema fue que no funcionaba la caja de seguridad de la habitacion, pero como excelente hotel que es, nos mudaron de cuarto con un upgrade. Perfecto! Olvidamos rapidamente el inconveniente

title: Nice cosy hotel great location
text: The Mark is nice because it doesn't feel like a big corporate hotel. The rooms bathrooms are nice and the rooms have been nicely refurbished. The service is good and the location is fantastic if you like the upper east. Great breakfast. We were upgraded to a 77 on the second floor above the front of the hotel entrance. It was generally quiet other than the sound of the garbage truck in the middle of the night. I would recommend staying higher up.

title: Amazing hotel, amazing service
text: Had an absolutely lovely time at The Mark for Thanksgiving 2012; the rooms are beautiful, the location perfect and the service excellent. Special thanks to Julita (front desk) for accommodating us and providing service beyond expectations, we will remember this hotel and trip for a very long time :)

title: One of my favourite hotels
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed at the Mark for a week in July. It was fantastic. The attention to detail, the exquisite finishings in the room and the brilliant service made the stay extra special. Located btwn Madison and 5th, its probably one of the best places to stay when in NYC being in such close proximity to most of the action (A 5 min walk away from Central Park, Museums, Shopping etc)
Overall, great hotel, and I would highly recommend it.

title: Sophisticated retreat with excellent restaurant in house
text: We stayed three nights in December.  Location!  Location!  Location!  From the doorman to the front desk to the housekeeping, the staff deserves a high rating!  They are friendly, respectful, responsive and unpretentious!  We felt the room was very spacious by New York standards and the bathroom was lovely with fabulous water pressure, heated towels and deep tub. Housekeeping keeps the rooms spotless.   Service and food in the restaurant was delightful at dinner, but service was spotty at breakfast (order room service the prior night if you are in a hurry!).  Room service did a nice job as well, on time and complete order the first time.  Two out of three concierge restaurant recommendations, we would not return so do your own research on restaurants and just let them make the reservations.  Very satisfied and will stay here again!

title: Great Hotel
text: Our stay at the Mark was simply fabulous! It is the best in town! It is located in a great location.. Just few steps away to Central Park, Medison and 5th. The room is quiet and spacious. Breakfast is simply great and the quality of food is very high. In the hotel there is also one of the best restaurant of NY. The staff is friendly and helpful. Room service is excellent. The only negative thing is that they wanted to charge 1.500 USD for guarantee (unacceptable!)

title: The Mark Hotel
text:
The Mark is an exquisite hotel located between Madison and Fifth Avenue on the Upper East Side of NYC. Beautifully appointed, lovely restaurant with a separate bustling and trendy bar scene. A place to see and to be seen.
The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly to my needs. I have stayed there several times and would highly recommend it.

title: fantastic hotel
text: Having stayed many times at the Four Seasons in recent years and been somewhat disappointed on our last visit, we decided to give The Mark a try and to our delight found the hotel to be first class in every way. If you are looking for a Corporate style/feel then go elsewhere but if you enjoy the feel of a smaller but first class hotel then this is the best we have found in New York by far. Great rooms, restaurant, gym and more importantly STAFF. This shall be our future home from home when in New York from now on.

title: Excellent in NY
text: Bit over priced.....but best location in the heart of NY....near by great shopping x, restaurants and energy..good services all around...make sure to go for breakfast at Saint. Ambroues....museums are all accessibile

title: An extremely pleasant  hotel
text: A very nice hotel in uptown n.y. The atmosphere  is very wellcoming. The Decoration is timeless and very contemporary .rooms are well equipped  cosy . The bathroom is very large the shower stream is great. In fact one the best hotel I have stayed in the world. The fitness offers  a variaty of equipment for a medium size hotel.

title: Incredible Hotel Experience
text: I have traveled extensively in London, England and across Canada (my hotel stays have always been 4 to 5 star accommodations) as well as the Caribbean and several states in the U.S.  I have never had the superlative service, atmosphere and the staff was friendly.  I never heard an outside sound.  The location is great.  It is a smaller hotel with big service.  Stayed in 5 star large hotels in New York before with small service and the staff were not as friendly or helpful, I was fortunate enough to stay one week at The Mark, quite frankly did not expect the service to last - it did.  I will return.

title: A wonderful experience
text: My family spent Thanksgiving in New York and enjoyed a couple of nights at the Mark.  The property is in an ideal location for enjoying Uptown Manhattan - close to the park, Madison Avenue shopping, museums, etc.  The staff was friendly and very helpful, our rooms were beutiful and quiet, and the little details (including milk and cookies for the kids) were spot on.  I've stayed at almost every high end hotel in Manhattan over the years, and I would be hard-pressed to name one that takes care of guests as well as The Mark.  Superb.

title: Nice stay, great location
text:
We stayed at The Mark over Thanksgiving weekend with our extended family and everyone agreed that it was a wonderful place to stay. The Upper East Side location can't be beat - so close to Central Park and the shops on Madison Avenue and the Met. The rooms are stylishly furnished with every amenity - great storage spaces - and the bathrooms are really lovely - marble, double sinks, heated towel rack - just beautiful. Beds were very comfortable.
The staff was terrific. 
The only downside was the restaurant. We had  a dinner at the Jean George restaurant which is part of the hotel and had a very bad experience there due to the poor service. It was so bad we did not return for breakfast the next day but went outside of the hotel to eat.
We did have a lovely lunch around the corner at Saint Ambrose, which has terrific gelato.
All in all, a nice stay.

title: Great stay during a tough week
text:
I stayed at The Mark for 5 nights the week after Sandy.  I'm sure many of the staff travel in from outside of the city, but never did I feel a lack in service.  Everyone was friendly and accommodating.
I checked in ahead of the check in time and pleased to find out I was upgraded to one of the king rooms.  Check-in was quick and easy.
My room was large with lots of closet space, space to sit and relax and a large bathroom.  I usually stay across the street at the Carlyle and in comparison this is a more Contemporary style hotel.  Both are as good as each other, it just depends one what you want.  I think you probably have more of a homey feel in the Carlyle.  
The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. 
There was a turn down service as you would expect.
The lights and other features such as the window blinds, tv, air com  were controlled via one handset which was a nice feature. Some lights were dimmers which was a great touch.  Talking of lights, the bathroom lights were a little too much for me, but of the three different sets, you can easily switch off some.  The bathroom was large, spacious and I had a shower and bathtub, helpful for a to soak after a snow storm.  There is also a tv in the mirror.

There was a snow storm while I was there and as most people know getting a cab in bad weather in ny is hard.  The door man was kind enough to wait a long time in the snow for me.  Just shows how accommodating they were.
Free wifi is a major plus.

I had a very good stay and I'm debating on which one i would choose from the Mark and Carlyle for my next business trip.... Leaning towards the Mark.

title: bitter-sweet suite
text:
we had our experience in suite. 

approximately 160 square metre of american style

but worst quality of suit and service! suite has musty smelled and absolute not ready for guests, 

even no small drink or fruits welcome in suite!

staff on reception makes slow-paced service. 

I said to them make bill 3 hours before check out. finally no bill and they tells me wait in queue...   

can you imagine - spend thousands dollars for one night and receive bed only.

kitchen without home appliances, even no chance to make hot water and so on.

title: Book it already!
text:
My husband and I stayed at The Mark for 5 nights in October.  I can easily say it is one of the most comfortable and beautiful luxury boutique hotels we have stayed at, hands down.  

The lobby is quirky chic and impeccably clean.  There are couches that provide a very comfortable place to wait or just people watch given there are always people milling about.

The rooms are very large by NYC standards and impeccably clean.  I found the room to be beautifully furnished and incredibly comfortable and lush...it is clear a lot of thought and care has gone into the decor and furnishings of the room.  The bathroom was magnificent.  Looking at pictures on tripadvisor it looks chintzy retro, not glamorous retro...but I assure you that in person, it is quite luxurious in a very art deco type of way.   Our room also had a kitchenette, which was a fantastic touch.  The room has plenty of closet and drawer space which is quite helpful for longer stays.  

We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and it was only just mediocre.  New York is a haven of restaurants, so venture out for your morning meal, better value and will be tastier. 

The one downside of this fabulous hotel is the slight snobiness of the staff.  Luckily I am secure enough in myself, that it didn't really bother me that I was often overlooked so that extra special attention could be showered on the patrons flashing their money around their necks and fingers.  In this way, it was a bit disappointing.

It is not to say that staff didn't go out of the way to help or that the service was bad...it just seemed that you had to be someone special they either knew or someone in the know to be looked after in a friendly manner.  If you were anyone else, you were assisted but with a snooty demeanor.  I witnessed this first hand and not just vis-a-vis myself, but in relation to various hotel guests.  This is the only aspect of this hotel that would downgrade it from a true luxury hotel.  True luxury hotels provide solid service and solid service is consistent, not selective.

There was also an incident where the hotel manager dressed down the doorman for not wearing the proper pants.  This type of behavior is unbecoming of a hotel as beautiful and luxurious as The Mark...I'm sure issues with the staff could be handled somewhere other than in the hotel lobby.  It's unnecessarily embarrassing to the staff member and uncomfortable for the guests.

That being said, the concierge was very helpful and the doormen were exceptionally nice.   And if you get stuck for a cab, ask for the house car.

Having lived in the Upper East Side, where the hotel is located, I am partial to to the area.  It definitely has more of a residential feel than downtown, but it's quiet which makes for a good night's sleep.  There is also fabulous shops and cafes and it's only a short walk to Central Park.

Last tip, if you're flying out of Newark, take the train.  Instead of a 35 minute train ride we took a 3 hour car ride because of traffic.  Not worth it.

Overall, The Mark is a beautiful, comfortable and luxurious hotel and I would gladly stay there again.

title: Despite hurricane Sandy.... We had a dinner to remember
text: Despite the recent hurricane I had the great pleasure to dine at The Mark 4 days after the storm. The food was impeccable, the Pino Noir was fabulous and the service was superb. The bar was standing room only when we arrived 10:45 PM and was still was going going strong when we left around 12:30.

title: Exceptional stay at the Mark
text: I have finally found the perfect place to stay in NY. Exceeded expectations in every area.  Well trained, friendly and ehtusiastic staff from the front desk to the concierge to the house keeping and beyond.  Handled challenging reqests with effeciency and results.  The room was well appointed, spacious and comfortable.  It had the most up to date electronics and a great view.  It was a peaceful stay in a hectic city.  I can recommend the Mark without hesitation.

title: Nailed It!
text:
I loved this hotel, it's very trendy, has amazing fixtures in the rooms and around the hotel and the staff were outstanding.

It's a fantastic location, ideally suited to a second time New York Visitor or those wanting to be away from the craziness of Times Square and other tourist hotspots.

The shower at this hotel was the best one I've had at any hotel anywhere (and I've been lucky enough to stay in some amazing properties).

Olivier, Ernesto and all of the staff at The Mark deserve to be extremely proud of the product offering they have and the level of personable, professional service they provide.

Don't forget to book with a Virtuoso Advisor as you'll receive some fantastic upgrades and amenities FOC.

title: Unfortunate Experience at the Mark Bar
text: Last night, my friends and I decided to go to the bar at the Mark for coffee before continuing elsewhere. I live two minutes walk from the Mark and often go there. We sat down and were given a menu by the insipid waitress. Within a few minutes, the bartender strode over to our table and, in a rather aggressive and unnecessarily loud voice, demanded to see our IDs. Before we could even reach for our wallets, he continued and said that even if we had IDs he was sure they were fake since we did not look 21. This was all before we had even ordered anything, alcoholic or not. The bartender spoke so loudly that everyone in the bar heard him. My friends felt like we were being publicly admonished for sitting in the bar and wanting coffee. This bartender, and the manager who he was allegedly on behalf of, presupposed that we were underage and there to break the law. Furthermore, he thoroughly embarrassed me and my friends in front of important people, some of whom I knew and recognized. I go to the Mark because it has a reputation for impeccable service and hospitality, so I was shocked when I was confronted with this situation. Needless to say, I will never be returning to the Mark and encourage anyone looking for a nice experience to join me at the Carlyle.

title: Fabulous 40 at the Mark!
text:
Just returned from a special 40th birthday treat to New York and stayed at the Mark Hotel. A great quiet location in New York but really close to central park. On arrival we were informed of breakfast being included in our room rate :-) . Our room was spacious and the bathroom was luxurious. The staff were quite friendly and chatted and being a smaller hotel had that more personal feel. As we had a late evening flight the hotel let us use a room in the afternoon to freshen up and change before we left for the airport.

The only downside was the extortionate price for room service which we got on our first night as we arrived quite late.

Would certainly return if I went to New York again...

title: The Mark left a mark in our hearts
text:
We have just spent our wedding weekend at The Mark and the whole experience could not have been better. The hotel is perfectly located to enjoy the beauty of Central Park, major museums, galleries and shops in the upper east side. The Hotel is impeccably designed with a perfect mixture of contemporary and modern french design. We loved the room which was very spacious, well appointed  and had very impressive technology to control it (from your remote you could pretty much do everything, from shades to temperature to TV).  The interior design of the hotel really shines in the rooms, the couch and chairs, artwork and lamps were beautiful and very unique. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the linens made it even better. We took advantage of the complimentary bicycles and toured central park in style, the concierge provided not only information about the bikes but also gave us a map of Central Park and offered to pack a picnic from the restaurant. The service was outstanding and they accommodated all our needs.
We are so lucky to have started our married life here. We will always remember the corner of 77 and Madison fondly and think of the incredible experience we had during our stay at The Mark.

title: A wonderful experience-not one minus
text:
Staying at the Mark was a delight. Everything hit the mark. First of all, we were upgraded to amazing accommodations. The view was lovely. The bed and the linens on it were most comfortable. We always look for good lighting as we are avid readers.The lighting was perfect.The suite was a joy to return to after a busy day. Breakfast was good and the bar a lively place in the evening.What a great pineapple mojito I had!The service at the Mark was exemplary:the housekeepers, the doormen,etc-truely professional. We would like to single out and give special thanks to the concierge Jeannie Voltsines who so kindly helped us with some thorny problems. This was our first time at the Mark and certainly, it will not be our last.
Highly recommended.

title: Our NYC favourite
text:
My husband and I have travelled to NYC with work quite a bit and stayed in quite a few of the large 'big name' hotels such as the palace and the Waldorf, we have generally been underwhelmed by these experiences. 
The Mark was refreshingly different, modern, clean and stylish. The room was decorated in an art deco style similar to Claridges in London with elegant lines and a lot of beautiful white marble in the bathroom. The bath was massive and the amenities were of a great quality. 
Downstairs there was a lively bar and although we didn't eat there the restaurant looked extremely popular. 
We did eat at the boulud restaurant round the corner which was great. I note this because the location is a little residential which is something you should be aware of from a restaurant and nightlife perspective but brilliantly located for the Guggenheim and the Frick collection, it's also surrounded by great shops, and bikes are available at your disposal.
Service throughout was excellent. We really loved our experience and will now treat it as our base whenever we stay in manhatten.

title: Mostly on the Mark
text:
My wife and I spent a quick weekend at the Mark with another couple.  The service is gracious with European touches and the Mark’s rooms were generously sized, especially for NY standards.

Liked: Free wifi (rarity at this price point); location well suited for boutique shopping along Madison Ave; Jean-Georges restaurant was excellent; vibrant bar scene; well done room Crestron room controls; plenty of closet space; most comfortable beds ever!

Anomalies: Extreme room service pricing and delayed well beyond quoted time (as in 20 mins turned into >1 hour; questionable room servicing/cleaning

title: The right choice
text:
The Mark is one the new york classics.
The location is nice in the exclusive madison avenue, close to the shops and museums, next to central park.
The rooms are well decorated, maybe not too big, but an attentive service+good restaurant and a fekkai hair saloon make it a good competitor of the carlyle and the other luxury hotels in town.
New york is a noisy town and as per many other hotels the rooms are not sound proof. Something to keep in mind if you want to sleep here

title: The Mark has Got it Right
text:
This was a very fortunate experience.  I had a leading hotels of the world voucher which was due to expire and chose to apply it (on a just-in-time basis) to The Mark. So I was given what was probably a run of the house roon, facing the street, low floor.  It was splendid.

The service level from start-to-finish was remarkable.  Every detail was performed with élan, and even though the service touch was so high, it wasn’t unctuous.  It was a pleasure to see decent water and good internet access provided gratis.

The room layout was just right.  The bedding was quite comfortable, and the bathroom was a tiled treat.  All in all, only kudos for my experience with the hotel.  It might not be everyone’s cup of tea to be situated so relatively high on the east side, adjacent to the park, but it was a nice quiet retreat with a more neighborly feel than one might otherwise get.  I would imagine that going rates are steep for such a quality experience.

title: What a Night !
text:
The Mark is a very nice modern hotel. Rooms are large and beautiful, bathrooms are also big and very functional.The service is very kind and people are willing to help.
We had a wonderful night in the Upper East Side, very close to Central Park and park Avenue
A perfect stay at the perfect place

title: Great neighborhood hotel
text: I just spent the last weekend (September 14th to the 17th) at The Mark with my husband and two children (ages 5 and 8).  The hotel is in a great neighborhood especially when you are with young kids. Central Park is one block away.  The area is not loud, crowded or dirty.  It is also not very touristy on the upper east side in comparison to other areas.  It seems like the Jean Georges restaurant and Frederick Fekkai hair salon are busy with local residents.   The shopping surrounding the hotel is incredible and in my opinion the best shopping neighborhood in Manhattan.  Now onto the actual hotel.  The lobby is gorgeous, the staff are very friendly and accommodating, the gym is great, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the food in the restaurant is incredible.  The room was not the nicest I have ever been in but it was good enough and the location made up for it.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Watch out for the 4 rooms with AWFUL bathrooms
text: We just stayed at The Mark.  For the most part, it's a lovely facility, but they have 4 rooms with unacceptable bathrooms.  What a disappointment that they would let any guest stay in these rooms.  When we checked in, we were asked whether we minded a bathroom with a walk-in shower rather than a tub.  I actually prefer stalls to tubs so I don't have to shower in a tub full of water, so I was pleased to accept the room.  What they didn't tell me was that the shower is completely ill-designed in a quest to be ADA compliant.  The stall is extremely narrow, has no barrier between the shower and the rest of the bathroom, and has a disgusting shower curtain that blows into the shower space so you have to fight not to have the curtain stick to your body while the water's on. Also, because the stall floor is flat with the bathroom, the water flows out to the rest of the bathroom so the marble floor gets incredibly slippery.  Topping it all off, ithere's no fan in the bathroom so it's a steamed up mess by the end of it.  When I complained at check-out, they admitted that they know these ADA bathrooms are a problem.  Do NOT let them trick you into taking one of these substandard rooms!!!

title: Five Star Staff - Room TBD...
text:
The lobby is lovely, the welcome was warm and inviting.  The room was spotless and the high tech gadgetry is right up my alley.  Drinks at the bar were wonderful.   A bit downhill from there...
Being on the 2nd floor (and a long time New Yorker) I expected some noise, but the racket that began at 2:30 and continued through the night until 6am was beyond belief.  To their credit, a call to the front desk resulted in an immediate move to a smaller but equally appointed room.  Apologies were appreciated.  Dinner and breakfast at Jean Georges was as one would expect from a chef of his reputation.  Upon check out, a personal farewell and apology for the inconvenience has put The Mark on our list for a return visit when in NYC.

title: Great
text:
My husband planned a long weekend for my birthday.  When we registered they wished me a Happy Birthday.  It was a great Location & very clean.  The staff was always greeting and they were very helpful selecting restaurants.
I would definitely stay here again.

title: Eccellente!
text: Hotel in posizione sublime, a due passi da Central Park. Staff competente, cordiale e disponibile al 200% per ogni esigenza. Camere magnifiche, spaziose, dotate di ogni comfort e tecnologia. Letto ottimo e bagno con vasca + doccia in marmo bianco e televisore nello specchio (!). Palestra completa. Comodo il piccolo business center. Albergo di lusso che lascia completamente soddisfatti. Da consigliare senza indugi. Chicca: vengono fatte le camere due volte al giorno, quando si torna la sera si trova il letto pronto e un gustoso regalino. Unico neo: se si vuole uscire per colazione la zona adiacente all'hotel scarseggia di cafè che non siano boutique per i residenti della zona (coi relativi prezzi elevati).

title: Fabulous hotel in a wonderful setting
text: The Mark hits the mark when it comes to its service, setting and overall ambience. We stayed for 3 nights in a lovely king with the most comfortable bed ever. The service was warm and genuine but not over bearing and the hotel itself was everything it advertises but completely unpretentious. Its a block from Central Park so brunch was in the Boathouse looking over the lake. Locally there are several great restaurants and its only a short taxi to other areas. We will be back!

title: The Mark: a gem, still a few improvements
text:
i just spend 2 days staying at the Mark and every moment was delight.
The location is perfect in the UES, word famous Madison, next to MET, FRICK and off course Central Park. Needless to say perfect for shopping, dining and hanging out.
After a short wait  to check  in, i was taken to my room ( Madison king who was supposed to be 500 sqft but i think was rather 400 sqf ..).
The room is quite immaculate and polish with high tech ( BO tv, Creston for lights shades..), the bathroom was great but the bath products ( no name)  were absolutly not up to the standard of this hotel and i told the reception manager that they should rapidly improve that ( specially, when a few blocks away in Madison, you have Asprey...). The gym is good.
The Bar is also fancy and nicely decorated ( Jacques Grange) but they need there improvements in the cocktails....
I was really impressed by the concierge Gilles who was amazing, very helpful ,patient,booking several restaurants and always giving a good advice.
Over all impression; near perfect .

title: I love The Mark!
text:
Estuve 8 noches en este Hotel y és absolutamente recomendable.
Todo és 5 estrellas.
Las habitaciones son amplias, muy bien decoradas y silenciosas.
El restaurant és muy bueno ( se nota la mano de Jean Georges ) y se puede almorzar y comer hasta bien tarde a la noche.
El bar és muy movido y con chicas guapísimas.
La ubicación excelente, a una cuadra del Central Park, a media de la mejor zona de Madison y solo a 2 cuadras del subte.
Pero quizás lo mejor sea su staff y los distintos servicios que brinda.
La gente que trabaja en este hotel és divina y lo hacen sentir a uno un rey.
Posiblemente el Hotel precio/calidad mejor de New York con amplia ventaja.
Genial!

title: Great, Great, Great!
text: Great location, great service, great staff. Our whole experience with this hotel was fantastic. It's one block from central park, so walking is very easy and it's relatively close to restaurants and cafes.

title: A great experience.
text:
My wife and I stayed for five nights at the end of May. Our stay formed part of a six week journey around the southern states of the USA, and partly the base for a larger family celebration.
We choose 'The Mark' for its location and reputation. It did not disappoint on the former. The location is fantastic for exploring the art galleries and museums on the east side and Central Park. Just walk out the hotel and turn right.
With regard to the hotel itself we had a courtyard room on the 8th floor. It was excellent; quiet;large comfortable bed, lots of wardrobe storage and an absolutely stunning bathroom. The only downside for us was the 'Creston' room control system. We had a number of issues during our stay relating to the air-conditioning and television controls. Although we had a couple of visits by maintenance the system was still giving problems when we left.
The quality of service we received during our stay was very mixed. Breakfast was excellent but the service haphazard, and painfully slow on a number of mornings. The doormen were very polite, friendly and helpful with a plentiful supply of umbrellas when the rain arrived on a couple of afternoons. This contrasted with the concierge service which we found extremely unhelpful, even arrogant. Requests for assistance in sorting out some issues relating to a brief visit to Washington during our stay were answered with a 'can't  do' rather than 'can do' attitude. Even a request for assistance booking a local restaurant for lunch became a major issue. In the end we made our own arrangements; it was easier.
We will definitely stay when we next visit New York. Will we recommend 'The Mark'? Definitely yes, but it comes at a price.

title: Great Place, First Class Service
text:
We had a very pleasant stay at the Mark Hotel. Wonderful and competent reception staff (particularly many thanks to Julita Kropiwnicki) made us feel as at home, once we could enjoy all hotel awesome facilities and perfect location next to Central Park. An attention to details that you can only see in top notch hotels (cleanliness, politeness and timing response of staff, decor, facilities). No issue with the early check after long haul flight was a relief! The next few days of our stay there remained in the same style of friendly service and understated elegance.
The Mark is for meaningful memories and a place to call home when you are in NYC. We will be definitely back there.

The family living in Dubai.

title: Just fell short...
text:
We did a lot of research for our trip to new york having planned it for years. To summarise the hotel we felt the room was amazing as was the housekeeping!!! Cleaning and nighttime treatment were amazing. reception were friendly and helpful, even when it was something they hadn:t handled before eg kareoke. gym was fantastic, our only letdown was the restaurant, My husband is a chef with high expectations and was so excited to eat in a 2 michelin star place. so i agreed for our final day, service was exceptional, food not so, starters were great bains not so, he had veal which  looked like kfc  my pizza was burnt to a crisp. i actually left the burnt base for 
the waiters to find but hey ho anyway here wwe go......

title: Perfect location, average hotel. Unfortunately.
text:
Both me and my husband admire Upper East Side and on each our trip back to New York City we try to stick to that disctrict specifically. This time we have chosen The Mark because of all glorious reviews, its location and its Leading Hotel of the World status (my husband has a membership with LHW.com).
However, when we arrived to the hotel the staff by some reason did not even know (neither they bother to double check) that the reservation has been made through LHW.com website. It is not fatal of course, but on the other hand explaining the hotel staff how and by which resourse the reservation was made and what is our membership number etc. is not what you expect to get from a Leading Hotel of the World after a 10-hours flight.  When things had been resolved several minutes later, we were accompanied to our room which was spacious, bright and had a view on the Madison Avenue. Here comes the room tip: I would not advice you booking a Madison Avenue rooms at this hotel as all of them look at a strange high white building located on the other side of the Madison Avenue, so if you do not want to end up with someone starring in your windows from across the street, book a courtyard or 77th Street rooms.
Coming back to the room itself, I would add that the bathroom seemed a bit dated and equipment rusty in some places; bathroom amenities not of the best quality at all which made me go to the closest 24-hour pharmacy at 5 a.m. to get some decent shampoo and wash gel.
The breakfasts are ok - not of the widest variety we had in some other places, but rather well prepared at least.
All in all the place has left us with a bitter taste of frustration - it's all about "a bit": beautifully decorated rooms, but a bit dated bathrooms, lots of staff, but a bit slow and not really caring service, famous Jean George's on site, but a bit poor breakfasts. And it is your right to decide whether the glass is half full or half empty. We thought latter.

title: Great Place, First Class Service
text: The Mark is first Class Hotel, First Class Location and First Class Service. The room are awesome. The location is close to Central Park (Walking distance). The best part, it is very quite. Love this hotel. We will go there gain for sure. It worth every penny and more.

title: A Perfect Weekend!
text: This past weekend my sister and I took our "20 something" daughters to NYC to shop and be together. We stayed at the Mark because in the past I stayed there with my sons and had an amazing and restorative experience. There is something magical about The Mark... the combination of comfort, under-stated elegance, quiet location and the remarkable and attractive staff that allows both me and my busy young adult children to relax and enjoy our time together. This hotel is only special because of the staff. We felt cared for and comfortable with everyone.  Tipping is usually a pain for me but I would have given everyone from the front desk, doormen and housekeeper $500 because they smiled, made eye contact and genuinely seemed to appreciate me as a guest. The Mark is not for a gang looking to party, (although the bar hops at night) The Mark is for meaningful memories and a place to call home when you are in NYC.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
I stayed here for 4 days/3 nights in February as a mini-break and shopping trip. Though I'm a big fan of the UES, this was my first time staying there (I've stayed in Midtown, Soho and Brooklyn on previous trips). The hotel was very easy to get to; the 6 train is about two/three blocks away. Check-in was quite easy, though since I was there early, they held my bags for me. When I returned the keys were waiting and they had already taken up my bags. 

The room itself was lovely, everything was clean. There was quite a bit of closet space which was handy, though not that many hangers. It was fine since I was the only one using them, and I would hope in a place of this standard more would have been brought had I requested them. The wifi was always quick and complimentary, which was nice to see. Though I had reserved a courtyard room, I was given one facing Madison Ave, a slight upgrade but still appreciated. Even though it faced the street there was very little noise. The bathroom was fantastic; the tub was just about the biggest one I've ever seen! Tons of towels and a fluffy robe. The room was fairly large for a single traveler, and even when my friend came up a day later and was staying with me, it was still comfortable.

One of the nights my friend and I had a drink at the bar downstairs. I had a cocktail and my friend had a mixed drink (it's been a while so I don't remember exactly what they were). They were both pretty good, nothing mind-blowing, but at the level you'd expect. We stood at the bar as it didn't seem there were any tables available, though since we were only have one drink it didn't bother us. It seemed like there was a good mix of guests and locals, which was nice. 

I would say the location is great if you're interested in seeing the museums or serious (window)shopping. At night the area is pretty quiet and residential, so those looking to party may want to stay closer to the action. For me it was perfect. 

For the most part service was nice, but not overly warm. For $400 (which is on the low end for the hotel, in the summer rates start at about $600), I expect something a little more friendly; maybe a smile. I would stay here again if I could get a rate like I did this time. I don't know if it would be worth $600/night.

title: Maybe I was wrong....
text: Last December my visit to the Mark was marked by a few service slips that seemed inappropriate for a hotel of this caliber, and I downgraded my review on tripadvisor accordingly. The Mark's management invited me to contact them and when I did so, I found the manager to be very interested in my experience and eager to improve their product. When I revisited the hotel a couple of months later, my partner and I were upgraded to magnificent suite, which I believe was a sincere gesture on the part of the hotel, not a bow to the pressure of the social media and tripadvisor. Needless to say our experience was perfect, as have been two subsequent visits. So after these several stays I can only conclude that my first impressions may have been unfortunate but overall the Mark is a wonderful combination of great location, perfect facilities, good systems, and a caring staff. Highly recommended.

title: Above and Beyond!
text:
It is truly a pleasure to be a guest at the Mark.  I have stayed at the Mark a few times and each time I go I realize there is no hotel in NY like it - it is not only luxurious, clean, and beyond comfortable, the staff is attentive in a genuine way.  
I have stayed all over NY and rarely have I found a hotel that is so consistently outstanding.  I also like the quiet neighborhood it is in - without being far from where I need to be.  The rooms are beautifully decorated - quietly elegant.
I have stayed there alone on business and with my family on vacation.  The staff makes you feel at home no matter what purpose you are there for.
The hotel is also part of the Leading Hotels of the World properties so as a member, you are entitled to the numerous benefits. In my experience, it is the best property of LHW.
I look forward to my next trip to NY which will include the Mark.

ER

title: Home from Home
text:
We have stayed at the Mark Hotel since its opening, apart from being very comfortable and its surroundings being extremely pleasing the staff at The Mark get out of their way to be friendly, courteous and helpful at all time, especially one lady who we found to be outstanding is the receptionist Julita Kropiwnicki.  She could not be more helpful and charming and after a long transatlantic flight a pleasure to deal with.  We will continue to stay at The Mark as it is unparallel in New York.

Anna Sosnowska & Tony Buckingham

title: Where my family always goes
text: My father was vice president of a major five star hotel chain before he retired, but when he went to their central US offices in New York the company didn't have a hotel there!  Since we couldn't stay at one of my father's hotels, my father would choose his favorite hotel in New York, and being a HUGE hotel buff (and extremely picky) we ALWAYS stayed at this hotel.  Now that I have been to some others since then on my own...he was completely right.  This hotel really is the sweetest hotel of New York.  I recommend it above any other.

title: A Charming and Graceful Hotel
text: The Mark is a large hotel but has all the charm, friendliness and warmth of what one expects in a small boutique hotel. The renovation done about four years ago has transformed it into a high-end modern hotel. Its location in a quiet neighborhood close to Central Park, Madison Ave., and the  Museum Mile makes it an even more attractive place to stay in.The efficient staff, without being pretentious, all genuinely desire that guests enjoy their stay. One of the many other amenities of this hotel is the famed chef Vongerichten's eponymous restaurant: "Jean-Georges."

title: The Mark, an A+ on All Marks!!
text: Just back from an amazing experience at the Mark in New York’s upper East Side, my second stay there since they reopened and thrilled to see how much better it has gotten.  It is amazing how this little gem captures the new and the old allure of this fabulous neighborhood on New York.  Between the high-end shops of Madison Avenue and Central Park, the Mark has an exciting bar which always attracts a chic, who’s-who crowd.    The lobby is small but chic and the staff there couldn’t be warmer.  The Jean George restaurant is a destination in itself.    Upstairs, room are just beautiful.  You really feel like you are in your own [million dollar] apartment. Its the refined details and touches that will make you fall in love with this place, not to mention the BEST shower I have ever had in my life.  Careful… set aside at least 20 minutes for every shower you take there.

title: Best hotel  in New  York City
text: We stayed for 3 days in July.  This hotel exceeded our expectations in every category imaginable.  The room was elegant. The entire  staff from front desk to housekeeping was professional  and extremely friendly.  The hotel was far enough away from the noise of Times Square but close enough for us to enjoy everything that you want to see in New York City.  It is very close to  all the major museums.  When we visit again, The Mark will be the only hotel  we will consider.

title: Superb in every way
text: Stayed here together with a friend for a weekend of fun and shopping. What a wonderful hotel! We were lucky enough to be upgraded to their largest suite. Two bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms, a large livingroom, a diningtable and a full Boffi Kitchen. The suite even had its own laundryroom. The design is extremely elegant in a classic Art Deco meets Chanel way and everything is kept in top condition. The level of detail put in to the design in everything from the stationary to the bed linen is amazing. Top notch service from the entire staff and the perfect level of courtesy combined with a personal touch. I honestly can not find a single thing that I would change and that is rare. If you are looking for an elegant but contemporary hotel on Upper East Side this is the one. This will definitely be my hotel of choice when in New York.

title: Awesome hotel!
text: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews.  I booked a courtyard view due to some of the comments about the noise from the busy streets nearby.  We were upgraded to a view of 77th, which turned out to be awesome!  I did not hear any noise from the streets below.  (We were on the 4th floor.)  The room was spacious & clean.  The bathroom had every ammenity, including a large bathtub and towel warmer.  The hair dryer in the room didn't work, so when we called to request a replacement, they brought one up within 5 minutes.  We received a turn-down service every night, which was nice.  The service all around was exceptional.  The hotel was located very close to Central Park.

title: Fantastic little hotel in Manhattan
text:
We just came back from a wonderful weekend in New York with our two small children. The Mark was perfect. It's small and comfortable, far enough from the touristy insanity of Times Square and Fifth Avenue/50's yet central enough to get anywhere within minutes. 
The rooms are beautiful, clean and very comfortable. The macarons at turn down service were a special treat!
The location can't be beat. Right on the corner of Madison Avenue, the hotel is walking distance from all the great boutiques. One block in the other direction is Central Park, close enough to walk to the zoo with the kids and a playground. Close to several museums and minutes by cab to Times Square, Bloomingdales, Empire State Building, Broadway theatres. 
We loved the Mark and would highly recommend it for people travelling with children of any age!

title: Best hotel in New York
text:
By far the best hotel in New York.
Forget everything else, Four seasons,
Peninsula,mandarin or Carlyle I stayed I all of them.The Mark miles ahead of all of them.
Amazing rooms and bathrooms,all categories, great location and great service. St George restaurant has a great scene and has amazing food.The bar is very trendy and concierge service is the best in the city.Simply the best.
A true home away from home!

title: La perfection New-Yorkaise existe
text:
Après avoir habité plus de 6 mois à New York si je ne devais choisir qu'un hôtel alliant luxe, modernité, et qualité de service, ce serait sans nul doute le Mark.

Un ami étant venu me rendre visite au mois d'aout 2011 et étant en panne de climatisation chez moi, je me suis installé chez lui une semaine durant.

Non loin du Carlyle (pour moi son seul concurrent valable), situé sur la 77ème et Madison, à 50 mètres de Central Park, proche de toutes les grands noms de la mode, son emplacement est génial!

Passé le portier au sourire sympathique vous arrivez dans hall aux tons très clairs, les réceptionnistes sont d'une efficacité redoutable

Une chambre sublime donnant sur Madison, un ensemble télévision B&O exceptionnel, une domotique sans faille, des tons clairs de très bon gout, une salle de bain immense avec là encore une télévision intégrée dans le miroir, et un mini bar digne d'une superette de quartier!

Quant à la literie, je pense que c'est la meilleure dans laquelle j'ai pu dormir. Il faut dire que pour cela les américains sont très forts.

Le Mark Bar est superbe bien qu'un peu trop petit à mon gout. Le barman est un chef est ses caipiroskas sont parfaites. Quant aux clients que dire, si ce n'est que les plus jolies new-yorkaises s'y retrouvent...

Alsacien de souche, mon opinion sur le restaurant du Mark par Jean George est plus contrastée, c'est bon, le tartare y est excellent, mais ca ne serait pas mon premier choix tant Manhattan regorge de restaurants exceptionnels (allez donc faire un tour dans Meatpacking ou Est Village!).

Malgré notre rythme de vie très festif le personnel s'est toujours montré d'une extreme amabilité avec nous et il apparait comme évident que le Mark sera à nouveau mon point de chute lors de mon prochain séjour new-yorkais.

title: A little gem in the city
text:
The best spot of the city, exactly the type of atmosphere you are looking for in NYC. (distinguished service, chic clientele, high end amenities and great location)
The Mark reflects the good mix of his elegant upper east side neighborhood with some lively,shopping and restaurants.

the Jean Georges Venue inside the Mark is fantastic, its a must do.

title: Exceptional five star boutique hotel Upper East Side NYC
text: I stay at this property every two weeks on business. The entire experience can be summed up as exceptional. The staff, rooms, dining, and value are all five stars. The Upper East Side location is close to Central Park and the best shopping on Madison Avenue. This is a gem among NYC super premium hotels.

title: New Upscale Decor Astounds!
text: Everywhere I looked in the newly rennovated Mark was a amazing!  I've stayed at The Mark for years as it's location can't be beaten ,but the new Mark will hold my loyalty even more.  The rooms are great but the restaurant is wonderful morning, noon and night.  It's just a great place for business luncheons or an evening date.  Though there are lots of great restaurants closeby, why go out when you can just go downstairs?

title: Great Service
text: Stayed at the Mark on business.  The service was top notch.  Room service was fantastic.  Used the free shoe shine service and also used the on site professional shoe shine service.  The room was great and had HDTV to go along with the LCD TVs.  (Some places have LCD TVs and offer no HD channels...which looks horrible on HDTVs.) .  My main complaint was that the room was very hot and the AC didn't correct the situation.  We had the AC on the lowest setting but the temp never got below 80 degrees in the room.  In defense of the hotel the temp. outside was consistently in the high 90s throughout our stay, but still it made our stay less then fantastic.  Other then that the room service tended to forget one item every time we ordered something, which was alot since we were confined to the room much of he day.  The in house bar was a little expensive for my taste ...($15 for a top shelf vodka/soda...I guess its not too bad for the upper east side at a five star hotel.  It gets pretty busy on week nights.  Did not experience the restaurant.  Also used the dry cleaning service.  Suits came out nice and shirts came out crisp.  If it wasn't for the room temp stay would have been 5 star.

title: Always Excellent
text: This is my second time staying at the Mark and as always perfection is the only word for this place! From the moment you arrive to your departure, you are treated like royalty!

title: Hidden Gems Of The Upper East Side
text:
We had a very pleasant stay at the Mark Hotel. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a 77th Street one bedroom suite (we had book a courtyard one bedroom suite) to better suit the needs of our family (we came with a 3 years old toddler and a 9 months baby). 

Apparently 77th street one bedroom suite has a bigger bedroom and the hotel staff was able to get us a rollover bed for our son and a beautiful crib for our daughter without getting in the way of our King Bed or the table and chairs (plenty of space in this bedroom). The suite had a living room and one master bath (bathtub and shower) and one smaller bathroom with only shower.

The L shape suite made it easy for my husband to rest if when in the living room with kids. The suite did not have a mini kitchenette, but staff was very helpful in providing us a kettle, a mini microwave and utensils to heat baby food. (Suite has a mini fridge full of goodies but spacious enough to accommodate few of your own items as well).

Ample closet space, makes it easy for you to store all the suitcases so they are not in your way taking spaces (we came with large samsonites and a stroller). An attention to details that you can only see in top notch hotels (macaroons, turn down service, cleanliness, politeness and timing response of staff, decor, crib had embroided bumpers! Free Evian water everyday!)

I would just be careful if you have little ones who loves "touching buttons", this beautiful and modern hotel has a Keypad that controls everything in the room. We had no clues that our son programmed a wake up with TV at 5.am...(since he loved to play with it, we just let it discharged and we used the "regular" buttons). So the first thing when you come would be to check if your keypad might have something programmed by a previous guest ;-)

Wonderful and competent staff (even found us a babysitter only 3 hours in advance!). Clean and neat rooms. A very pleasant stay will definitely comeback again.

title: Amazing I will come back everytime in New York
text:
Since I arrived I have no words to say how wonderful is The Mark NY, the rooms are with decorated wtih exquisit taste, bathrooms sensational. 
The most important is the reception team Julita and Wheeler they are wonderful, make feel you at home with style. Always with a smile.

title: It's a great place.
text: I'm picky.  Most NY hotels have been a disappointment in years of travel, but this one is an exception.  The rooms I have stayed in are modern without trying too hard, and the general level of service is very high.  Only caution is that you have to commit to staying in the UES, which has pluses and minuses.  Otherwise, highly recommended.  I don't feel like a number when I stay here.

title: No coffee, no desk, no water, no flowers, no fruit, but...
text:
The wife and I stayed over for three nights on the 20% discount plan. The offered rate of $508 for the 77th Street deluxe room turned out to be more than fair. Pleasing features of this hotel include a perfect location for museums and the UES, Jean Georges restaurant and bar on ground floor, pleasing and spacious spa and workout areas, nice crisp lobby, generally friendly staff, relatively new rooms, towels, linens, and pillows (mattresses ready for replacement), generous room size, apparently new marble bathrooms, and dependable, nice maids.

The Mark may be best described as a botique 5 star. It's without the 5 star amenities at the top, the room technology is a bit dated (quite small flat screen, undependable older Crestron system), and the hallway doors close very, very loudly. But failings tend to be nits when run up against the benefits of The Mark

We would happily come back to The Mark again, especially if the 20% was on.

title: Loved It!
text: My wife and I have traveled the world staying in the finest hotels and resorts. We frequently come to NYC and have tried many hotels but never The Mark. We just finished a three night stay and we'll never have to search for another hotel in NYC again. The staff was beyond superb and the room was spotless with a marvelous decor. The JG restaurant was wonderful as well. Our thanks to the excellent staff including Julita and Lauren! A true 5 star hotel!

title: Disappointing
text:
After some serious research I decided to book The Mark Hotel for my sister's 30th birthday trip to NYC.  The website tells a good story, but the reality is quite different.  It's not a fun/lively hotel, more of a subdued/got no soul establishment.

We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite on arrival which was a nice touch, and one concierge (Isabelle) was extremely helpful with coordinating my sister's 2 best friends arriving as a surprise - I only wish we had moved hotel then as planned, rather than moving to a 2 bed suite within the hotel.  Isabelle is so lovely it seemed like a good idea at the time (I did make the final decision & they did give us a good rate on the room).  

GOOD POINTS: Rooms are spacious & clean.  The hotel is in a great location close to Central Park (and only 5 mins by cab to fifth avenue).

BAD POINTS: Room service prices are insane.  Staff (except Isabelle & the doormen) are quite arrogant (particularly another female concierge - when I asked re comedy nights & timings she responded 'I don't know, you'd have to look on line').  The bar is very small & packed with questionable female clientele.  There's no outdoor area at all.

I could go on.  In short we had a fabulous time in New York & will definitely return - just never to The Mark Hotel.  Next time we'd definitely book the Bryant Park Hotel - it's a better location uptown & I suspect it won't be as stuffy as The Mark.

title: Standard of excellence
text:
This is how 5 star hotels get to be 5 stars! We experienced friendly, gracious, helpful, and above and beyond the expected service  during our three day stay last week. Upon arrival at 8:30AM we were able to check into our room and we were also asked if we would like an upgrade, leaving the room was difficult as it was  so beautiful and comfortable.  
The bar is a very happening place with a good vibe. We did  not eat in the dining room, but it is beautiful and I am sure delicious also.
One day upon returning we were asked how our day was, my husband told someone it was a great day, it was my wife's birthday, five minutes later a beautiful cupcake and a bottle of water and San Pellegrino arrived to our room. 
We asked what time check-out was and were told it didn't matter we could stay until 2-3PM if we needed. Wow! How often does that happen!
Upon leaving I told the concierge that they must hire the nicest people in NY to work there, he addressed me by name and said thank you. I was under the radar during my stay, how did he know my name?  
I would love to stay here again.

title: muy buen hotel, buena ubicación buena atencion
text:
Lindisimo hotel, hecho a nuevo, súper moderno,
los cuartos son lindos , simples, muy limpios.
Esta muy bien ubicado, en una de las zonas mas 
lindas de new york. 
Tienen hasta bicicletas para que los huéspedes
puedan andar por la ciudad. 
La comida riquísima, el resto del hotel esta súper
de moda en este momento.
Y sino una buena alternativa es st ambreus a media
cuadra sobre madison se come excelente desayuno
cafe o comida a la noche.

muy recomendable

title: Worth It
text: I've stayed at the Mark twice....alone on business in the Spring and then with the family for pleasure in mid-June. It is a great hotel....superb service, beautifully appointed and spacious rooms, and excellent food. At first I was a little worried that it was too far North (East 77th Street) compared to those hotels I usually stay in in the 50s, but that proved to be an asset, as it was quieter, a few minutes walk from Central Park, the Met and subway, as well as more residential, which was nice. The service rocks! The doormen were attentive at all hours...opening car doors, giving directions, hailing cabs and loading lots of bags. The front desk folks were welcoming and attentive. They got us into a better room before official check-in to accommodate an early afternoon engagement. Within a day one gentleman greeted us by name. They even retrieved theater tix from our valeted car to save a us a trip to the garage. A plate of cookies, chocolate milk and champagne greeted us in our room, as well as fresh cut roses. The room was awesome. Not a spec of dust, comfy beds, clean/fresh smell, and amazing bathrooms. House-keeping came immediately one night to set up the pull-out bed and brought in a roll-away for the kids. When I asked to get a cup of coffee, they didn't hard-sell me on the hotel coffee ($12/small pot), instead directing me to a bakery down the block. The concierge was quick with good restaurant recommendations. The hotel restaurant was excellent as well. All this comes at a steep price, but it was worth it.

title: A little disappointed
text: With all the hype of this hotel I quite expected it to meet the standards that we are use to but we're disappointed with it. I booked" The Madison" one bedroom suite which was large but unfortunately was missing a beat to it. I had reserved it for several days as I was in for business with my husband. To begin with from the front doorman, except for one, we had to open the door even though they would be right there. Not that I have a problem with that but given we had to hail a cab with no offers from them for this service. Actually, they would just be talking to the other gentlemen outside the door of the bar.  There was no door service from them at all not even welcome back or enjoy your day! The restaurant which we dined at for breakfast daily and lunch had a wonderful menu and was delicious but the wait staff was more in tuned with what was going on in the kitchen or talking about an inspector that was there for one of the days. We had a horrible strong smell of some kind of paint or something that was coming from a store the borders the hotel. After being seated there and asking to be moved to another location as the restaurant was empty at this time I wondered why the hostess would even seat anyone at this location. The waiter was more than gracious to relocate us inside closer to their bar, as the horrible odor wasn't present there. As I mentioned the food was delicious and we did have a fabulous waiter that day. Back to our suite, I found that the cleaning service wasn't up to our standards as the floors were a little dirty, dirty dishes left on our table in the living room for two days,  as well as in the bathroom wasn't that cleaned well. The suite was very uninviting "cold" such as no magazines or books to offer it's guest to look at,  which I find strange??? The bed wasn't that comfortable and we ended up leaving earlier than expected. I really wanted to like this hotel but probably wouldn't return. Rather go to The Surrey one block over as from the moment you enter it's lobby to every staff member and suite we have stayed in there we have never been disappointed. The bar is over the top compared to the bar they have here! Also, love the rooftop bar there. Sorry, The Mark we tried.

title: Great potential - but a few significant issues
text:
A mixed bag, mostly good with a couple of issues.  My partner and I recently stayed at the Mark for three nights.  We usually stay at the Pierre or Gramercy Park but had heard good things about the Mark and thought we’d give it a shot.
